  2153                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  2154                                  
  2155                                  ; GetFatSector
  2156                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  2157                                  ;function: find and read the corresponding fat sector into ES:0
  2158                                  ;
  2159                                  ;in). SI = offset value (starting from fat entry 0) of fat entry to find.
  2160                                  ;     ES = fat sector segment
  2161                                  ;     CS:BytesPerSec
  2162                                  ;
  2163                                  ;out). corresponding fat sector read in.
  2164                                  ;      BX = offset value of the corresponding fat entry in the fat sector.
  2165                                  ;      CX destroyed.
  2166                                  ;      zero flag set if the fat entry is splitted, i.e. when 12 bit fat entry
  2167                                  ;      starts at the last byte of the fat sector. in this case, the caller
  2168                                  ;      should save this byte, and read the next fat sector to get the rest
  2169                                  ;      of the fat entry value. (this will only happen with the 12 bit fat).
  2170                                  ;
  2171                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  2172                                  
  2173                                  ; 09/12/2023
  2174                                  ; 06/10/2023 - Retro DOS v5.0 IBMBIO.COM (Modified PCDOS 7.1)
  2175                                  ; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - MSLOAD:054Ch)
  2176                                  
  2177                                  		; 24/12/2022
  2178                                  		; 22/12/2022
  2179                                  GetFatSector:
  2180                                  		;push	ax	; 06/10/2023
  2181 000003D4 56                      		push	si
  2182 000003D5 57                      		push	di		; di:si = byte offset in (entire) FAT
  2183                                  		;;;
  2184                                  		; 06/10/2023
  2185 000003D6 89F8                    		mov	ax, di		; 32 bit division (dx:ax/512)
  2186 000003D8 8B0E[1700]              		mov     cx, [BytesPerSec]
  2187 000003DC 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
  2188 000003DE F7F1                    		div	cx
  2189 000003E0 89C3                    		mov	bx, ax
  2190                                  		;;;
  2191 000003E2 89F0                    		mov	ax, si
  2192                                  		; 24/12/2022
  2193                                  		; ds = cs
  2194                                  		;mov	cx, [cs:BytesPerSec]
  2195                                  		; 06/10/2023
  2196 000003E4 F7F1                    		div	cx			; AX = Sector number, DX = Offset
  2197                                  		;div	word [BytesPerSec]
  2198                                  			; dx = byte offset in the FAT sector
  2199                                  			; ax = low word of the FAT sector number
  2200                                  			; bx = high word of the FAT sector number  
  2201                                  		; 06/10/2023
  2202 000003E6 3B1E[0F00]              		cmp	bx, [LastFatSectorH]  ; FAT32 (32 bit cluster numbers)
  2203 000003EA 7506                    		jne	short not_same_fat_sector
  2204 000003EC 3B06[0D00]              		cmp	ax, [LastFatSectorL]
  2205                                  		;cmp	ax, [LastFatSector]
  2206                                  		;;cmp	ax, [cs:LastFatSector]	; The same fat sector?
  2207 000003F0 742D                    		je	short SplitChk		; Don't need to read it again.
  2208                                  not_same_fat_sector:
  2209                                  		; 06/10/2023
  2210 000003F2 A3[0D00]                		mov	[LastFatSectorL], ax
  2211 000003F5 891E[0F00]              		mov	[LastFatSectorH], bx
  2212                                  		;
  2213                                  		;mov	[LastFatSector], ax
  2214                                  		;;mov	[cs:LastFatSector], ax
  2215                                  		; 06/10/2023
  2216 000003F9 51                      		push	cx ; ** ; bytes per sector
  2217                                  		;
  2218 000003FA 52                      		push	dx ; *
  2219                                  		; 24/12/2022
  2220                                  		;xor	dx, dx
  2221                                  		; 06/10/2023
  2222 000003FB 89DA                    		mov	dx, bx
  2223                                  		;
  2224                                  		;add	ax, [cs:HiddenSectorsL]
  2225                                  		;adc	dx, [cs:HiddenSectorsH]
  2226                                  		;add	ax, [cs:ReservSectors]
  2227                                  		;adc	dx, 0
  2228                                  		; 24/12/2022
  2229                                  		; ds = cs
  2230                                  		; 06/10/2023 - Retro DOS v5.0 (PCDOS 7.1 IBVBIO.COM)
  2231                                  		;add	ax, [FatStartSecL]
  2232                                  		;adc	dx, [FatStartSecH]
  2233                                  		; 09/12/2023
  2234 000003FD 31FF                    		xor	di, di ; 0
  2235 000003FF 0306[2500]              		add     ax, [HiddenSectorsL]
  2236 00000403 1316[2700]              		adc	dx, [HiddenSectorsH]
  2237 00000407 0306[1B00]              		add	ax, [ReservSectors]
  2238                                  		;adc	dx, 0
  2239                                  		; 09/12/2023
  2240 0000040B 11FA                    		adc	dx, di ; 0
  2241                                  
  2242 0000040D A3[0700]                		mov	[StartSecL], ax
  2243 00000410 8916[0900]              		mov	[StartSecH], dx		; Set up for ReadSectors
  2244                                  		;mov	[cs:StartSecL], ax
  2245                                  		;mov	[cs:StartSecH], dx	; Set up for ReadSectors
  2246                                  		
  2247 00000414 C706[1100]0100          		mov	word [SectorCount], 1 ; 1 sector			
  2248                                  		;mov	word [cs:SectorCount], 1 ; 1 sector
  2249                                  		; 06/10/2023
  2250                                  		; di = 0
  2251                                  		;xor	di, di ; 0
  2252                                  		; es:di = FATSEGMENT:0000h
  2253 0000041A E829FE                  		call	ReadSectors
  2254 0000041D 5A                      		pop	dx ; *
  2255                                  		; 06/10/2023
  2256                                  		;mov	cx, [BytesPerSec]
  2257 0000041E 59                      		pop	cx ; **
  2258                                  		; 24/12/2022
  2259                                  		;mov	cx, [cs:BytesPerSec]
  2260                                  SplitChk:
  2261                                  		; 06/10/2023
  2262                                  		; cx = bytes per sector
  2263                                  		; 24/12/2022
  2264                                  		;mov	cx, [BytesPerSec]				
  2265 0000041F 49                      		dec	cx			; CX = SECTOR SIZE - 1
  2266 00000420 39CA                    		cmp	dx, cx			; If last byte of sector, splitted entry.
  2267 00000422 89D3                    		mov	bx, dx			; set bx to dx
  2268 00000424 5F                      		pop	di
  2269 00000425 5E                      		pop	si
  2270                                  		;pop	ax	; 06/10/2023
  2271                                  EndWrite:		; 10/12/2022
  2272 00000426 C3                      		retn
  2273                                  
  2274                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  2275                                  
  2276                                  ; 05/10/2023 - Retro DOS v5.0 IBMBIO.COM (Modified PCDOS 7.1)
  2277                                  %if 0
  2278                                  
  2279                                  ErrorOut:
  2280                                  		; 24/12/2022
  2281                                  		; ds = cs
  2282                                  		;push	cs
  2283                                  		;pop	ds
  2284                                  		
  2285                                  		mov	si, NonSystemDiskMsg ; "\r\nNon-System disk or disk error\r\nRe"...
  2286                                  		call	WriteTTY
  2287                                  
  2288                                  		; Wait for a keypress on the keyboard.
  2289                                  		; Use the bios keyboard interrupt.
  2290                                  
  2291                                  		xor	ah, ah
  2292                                  		int	16h		; KEYBOARD - READ CHAR FROM BUFFER, WAIT IF EMPTY
  2293                                  					; Return: AH = scan code, AL = character
  2294                                  
  2295                                  		; We have to restore the address of the original rom disk
  2296                                  		; parameter table to the location at [0:DskAddr]. The address
  2297                                  		; of this original table has been saved previously in
  2298                                  		; 0:OrgDasdPtr and 0:OrgDasdPtr+2. After this table address
  2299                                  		; has been restored we can reboot by invoking the bootstrap
  2300                                  		; loader bios interrupt.
  2301                                  
  2302                                  		; 23/12/2022
  2303                                  		;xor	bx, bx

  2564 00000119 [5203]                  start_bds:	dw bds1			; Start	of linked list of BDS's
  2565 0000011B 7000                    		dw 70h			; KERNEL_SEGMENT
  2566                                  
  2567                                  ; (MSDOS 3.3) NOTE:
  2568                                  ; Some floppy drives do not have changeline support. The result is a
  2569                                  ; large amount of inefficiency in the code. A media-check always returns
  2570                                  ; "I don`t know". This cause DOS to reread the FAT on every access and
  2571                                  ; always discard any cached data.
  2572                                  ;    We get around this inefficiency by implementing a "Logical Door Latch".
  2573                                  ; The following three items are used to do this. The logical door latch is
  2574                                  ; based on the premise that it is not physically possible to change floppy
  2575                                  ; disks in a drive in under two seconds (most people take about 10). The
  2576                                  ; logical door latch is implemented by saving the time of the last successful
  2577                                  ; disk operation (in the value TIM_DRV). When a new request is made the
  2578                                  ; current time is compared to the saved time. If less than two seconds have
  2579                                  ; passed then the value "No Change" is returned. If more than two seconds
  2580                                  ; have passed the value "Don't Know" is returned.
  2581                                  ;    There is one complecation to this algorithm. Some programs change the
  2582                                  ; value of the timer. In this unfortunate case we have an invalid timer.
  2583                                  ; This possibility is detected by counting the number of disk operations
  2584                                  ; which occur without any time passing. If this count exceeds the value of
  2585                                  ; "AccessMax" we assume the counter is invalid and always return "Don't
  2586                                  ; Know". The variable "AccessCount" is used to keep track of the number
  2587                                  ; of disk operation which occur without the time changing.
  2588                                  
  2589 0000011D 00                      accesscount:	db 0			
  2590 0000011E FF                      tim_drv:	db 0FFh			
  2591 0000011F 00                      medbyt:		db 0
  2592                                  wrtverify:	; 15/10/2022			
  2593 00000120 02                      rflag:		db 2			; 2 for	read, 3	for write
  2594 00000121 00                      verify:		db 0			; 1 if verify after write
  2595 00000122 0000                    seccnt:		dw 0			
  2596 00000124 00                      		db 0			; -- pad where hardnum was
  2597 00000125 01                      dsktnum:	db 1			; number of diskette drives			
  2598                                  
  2599                                  ; (MSDOS 3.3) NOTE:
  2600                                  ; Some of the older versions of the IBM rom-bios always assumed a seek would
  2601                                  ; have to be made to read the diskette. Consequently a large head settle
  2602                                  ; time was always used in the I/O operations. To get around this problem
  2603                                  ; we need to continually adjust the head settle time. The following
  2604                                  ; algorithm is used:
  2605                                  ;
  2606                                  ;   Get the current head settle value.
  2607                                  ;   If it is 1, then
  2608                                  ;	set slow = 15
  2609                                  ;   else
  2610                                  ;	set slow = value
  2611                                  ;   ...
  2612                                  ;   if we are seeking and writing then
  2613                                  ;	use slow
  2614                                  ;   else
  2615                                  ;	use fast
  2616                                  ;   ...
  2617                                  ;   restore current head settle value
  2618                                  
  2619 00000126 00                      motorstartup:	db 0			; value from table
  2620 00000127 00                      settlecurrent:	db 0			; value from table
  2621 00000128 00                      settleslow:	db 0			; slow settle value
  2622 00000129 00                      nextspeed:	db 0			; value	of speed to be used
  2623 0000012A 00                      save_head_sttl:	db 0			; used by read_sector routine
  2624 0000012B 00                      save_eot:	db 0			; saved	eot from the default DPT
  2625 0000012C 09                      eot:		db 9			
  2626 0000012D 00000000                dpt:		dd 0			; pointer to Disk Parameter Table
  2627 00000131 00                      cursec:		db 0			; current sector
  2628 00000132 00                      curhd:		db 0			; current head
  2629 00000133 0000                    curtrk:		dw 0			; current track
  2630 00000135 0000                    spsav:		dw 0			; save the stack pointer
  2631 00000137 08                      formt_eot:	db 8			; eot used for format
  2632 00000138 00                      hdnum:		db 0			; head number
  2633 00000139 0000                    trknum:		dw 0			; track	being manipulated
  2634 0000013B 50                      gap_patch:	db 50h			; format gap patched into dpt
  2635                                  
  2636                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  2637

  2639

  2693                                  ; read in boot sector here, read done in readboot.
  2694                                  ; also read sector for dma check for hard disk.
  2695                                  ;
  2696                                  ; This buffer is word aligned because certain AMI BIOSs have a bug
  2697                                  ; in them which causes the byte after the buffer to be trashed
  2698                                  ; on floppy reads to odd-byte boundaries. Although no general effort 
  2699                                  ; is made to enforce this in the bigger picture, this one small sacrifice
  2700                                  ; makes that system more-or-less work.
  2701                                  
  2702                                  ; 02/10/2023
  2703                                  %if 0
  2704                                  
  2705                                  disksector:	;db 512 dup(0)		; read in boot sector here
  2706                                  		; 19/10/2022

  2714                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  2715                                  ; 25/05/2018 (04/04/2018)
  2716                                  ;*****************************************************************************
  2717                                  ;	"bds" contains information for each drive in the system.
  2718                                  ;	various values are patched whenever actions are performed.
  2719                                  ;	sectors/alloc. unit in bpb initially set to -1 to signify that
  2720                                  ;	the bpb has not been filled. link also set to -1 to signify end
  2721                                  ;	of list. # of cylinders in maxparms initialized to -1 to indicate
  2722                                  ;	that the parameters have not been set.
  2723

  3200                                  ;************************************************************************
  3201                                  ;*									*
  3202                                  ;*	strategy - store es:bx (device driver request packet)		*
  3203                                  ;*		     away at [ptrsav] for next driver function call	*
  3204                                  ;*									*
  3205                                  ;************************************************************************
  3206                                  
  3207                                  strategy:	; proc far		
  3208 0000063C 2E891E[1200]            		mov	[cs:ptrsav], bx ; store es:bx (device driver request packet)
  3209                                  					; away at [ptrsav] for next driver function call
  3210 00000641 2E8C06[1400]            		mov	[cs:ptrsav+2], es
  3211 00000646 CB                      		retf

  3214                                  
  3215                                  ;************************************************************************
  3216                                  ;*									*
  3217                                  ;*	device driver entry points. these are the initial		*
  3218                                  ;*	  'interrupt' hooks out of the device driver chain.		*
  3219                                  ;*	  in the case of our resident drivers, they'll just		*
  3220                                  ;*	  stick a fake return address on the stack which		*
  3221                                  ;*	  points to dispatch tables and possibly some unit		*
  3222                                  ;*	  numbers, and then call through a common entry point		*
  3223                                  ;*	  which can take care of a20 switching				*
  3224                                  ;*									*
  3225                                  ;************************************************************************
  3226                                  
  3227                                  ; 01/10/2022 - Erdogan Tan
  3228                                  ; (disassembled MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS code here with fixed table
  3229                                  ;  addresses, they will be changed to table labels later)
  3230                                  
  3231                                  ; 09/12/2022
  3232                                  
  3233                                  ; 02/10/2023 - Retro DOS v5.0
  3234                                  ; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - BIOSDATA:0620h, BIOSCODE = 0364h)
  3235                                  
  3236                                  con_entry:				
  3237 00000647 E84000                  		call	cdev_entry
  3238                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  3239                                  		;dw 0E4h		; con_table
  3240 0000064A [E700]                  		dw con_table		; 364h:0E4h (PCDOS 7.1)
  3241                                  					; 2C7h:0E4h = 70h:2654h
  3242                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  3243                                  
  3244                                  prn0_entry:				
  3245 0000064C E83B00                  		call	cdev_entry
  3246                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  3247                                  		;dw 0FBh		; prn_table
  3248 0000064F [FE00]                  		dw prn_table
  3249                                  					; 2C7h:0FBh = 70h:266Bh
  3250 00000651 0000                    		db 0, 0
  3251                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  3252                                  
  3253                                  prn1_entry:				
  3254 00000653 E83400                  		call	cdev_entry
  3255                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  3256                                  		;dw 0FBh		; prn_table
  3257 00000656 [FE00]                  		dw prn_table
  3258                                  					; 2C7h:0FBh = 70h:266Bh
  3259 00000658 0001                    		db 0, 1
  3260                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  3261

  3264                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------

  3268 0000065F 0102                    		db 1, 2

  3276                                  					; 2C7h:0FBh = 70h:266Bh
  3277 00000666 0203                    		db 2, 3
  3278                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  3279                                  
  3280                                  aux0_entry:				
  3281 00000668 E81F00                  		call	cdev_entry
  3282                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  3283                                  		;dw 130h		; aux_table
  3284 0000066B [3301]                  		dw aux_table
  3285                                  					; 2C7h:130h = 70h:26A0h
  3286 0000066D 00                      		db 0

  3295 00000673 01                      		db 1

  3303                                  					; 2C7h:130h = 70h:26A0h
  3304 00000679 02                      		db 2

  3340                                  ;************************************************************************
  3341                                  ;*									*
  3342                                  ;*	Ensure A20 is enabled before jumping into code in HMA.		*
  3343                                  ;*	This code assumes that if Segment of Device request packet is	*
  3344                                  ;*	DOS DATA segment then the Device request came from DOS & that	*
  3345                                  ;*	A20 is already on.						*

  3349                                  cdev_entry:	; proc near		
  3350 0000068A 2E803E[0D00]00          		cmp	byte [cs:inHMA],0
  3351 00000690 740D                    		jz	short ce_enter_codeseg
  3352                                  				; optimized for DOS in HMA
  3353 00000692 50                      		push	ax
  3354 00000693 2EA1[0300]              		mov	ax,[cs:DosDataSg]
  3355 00000697 2E3906[1400]            		cmp	[cs:ptrsav+2],ax
  3356 0000069C 58                      		pop	ax
  3357 0000069D 7505                    		jnz	short not_from_dos
  3358                                  				; jump is coded this way to fall thru
  3359                                  				; in 99.99% of the cases
  3360                                  ce_enter_codeseg:
  3361 0000069F 2EFF2E[2906]            		jmp	far [cs:cdev]			
  3362                                  		;jmp	dword ptr cs:cdev

  3364                                  
  3365                                  not_from_dos:				
  3366 000006A4 E8AA00                  		call	EnsureA20On
  3367 000006A7 EBF6                    		jmp	short ce_enter_codeseg

  3369                                  ;************************************************************************
  3370                                  ;*									*
  3371                                  ;*	outchr - this is our int 29h handler. it writes the		*

  3373                                  ;*									*

  3375

  3404 000006C4 1F                      		pop	ds ; *

  3410                                  		;;;

  3437 000006DB 2EFF2E[D206]            		jmp	far [cs:Orig1A]

  3507                                  
  3508                                  ; the int13 hook calls back here to call-through to the ROM
  3509                                  ; this is necessary because some people have extended their
  3510                                  ; ROM BIOSs to use ds as a parameter/result register and

  3922                                  ;SR; WIN386 support
  3923                                  
  3924                                  ; WIN386 instance data structure
  3925                                  ;
  3926                                  ; Here is a Win386 startup info structure which we set up and to which
  3927                                  ; we return a pointer when Win386 initializes.
  3928                                  
  3929 00000805 0300                    Win386_SI:	db 3,0			; SI_Version
  3930                                  					; Startup Info for Win386
  3931 00000807 00000000                SI_Next:	dd 0			; pointer to next info structure
  3932 0000080B 00000000                		dd 0			; a field we don't need
  3933 0000080F 00000000                		dd 0			; another field	we don't need
  3934 00000813 [1708]                  SI_Instance:	dw Instance_Table
  3935 00000815 7000                    		dw 70h	; Bios_Data	; far pointer to instance table
  3936                                  
  3937                                  ; This table gives Win386 the instance data in the BIOS and ROM-BIOS data
  3938                                  ; areas. Note that the address and size of the hardware stacks must
  3939                                  ; be calculated and inserted at boot time.
  3940                                  
  3941 00000817 00005000                Instance_Table:	dw 0,50h		; print	screen status...
  3942 0000081B 0200                    		dw 2			; ... 2	bytes
  3943 0000081D 0E005000                		dw 0Eh,50h		; ROM Basic data...
  3944 00000821 1400                    		dw 14h			; ... 14H bytes
  3945 00000823 [0C00]                  		dw altah		; a con	device buffer...
  3946 00000825 7000                    		dw 70h			; Bios_Data segment
  3947 00000827 0100                    		dw 1			; ... 1 byte
  3948                                  
  3949                                  NextStack:
  3950                                  
  3951                                  ; NOTE:  If stacks are disabled by STACKS=0,0, the following
  3952                                  ;	instance items WILL NOT be filled in by SYSINIT.
  3953                                  ;	That's just fine as long as these are the last items
  3954                                  ;	in the instance list since the first item is initialized
  3955                                  ;	to 0000 at load time.
  3956                                  
  3957 00000829 00000000                		dw 0,0			; pointer to next stack	to be used...
  3958 0000082D 0200                    		dw 2			; ... 2 bytes
  3959 0000082F 00000000                IT_StackLoc:	dd 0			; location of hardware stacks
  3960 00000833 0000                    IT_StackSize:	dw 0			; size of hardware stacks
  3961 00000835 00000000                		dd 0			; terminate the	instance table
  3962                                  
  3963                                  					;SR;
  3964 00000839 00                      IsWin386:	db 0			; Flag to indicate whether
  3965                                  					; Win386 is running or not
  3966                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  3967                                  
  3968                                  ;This routine was originally in BIOS_CODE but this causes a lot of problems
  3969                                  ;when we call it including checking of A20. The code being only about 
  3970                                  ;30 bytes, we might as well put it in BIOS_DATA
  3971                                  
  3972                                  V86_Crit_SetFocus:			
  3973 0000083A 57                      		push	di
  3974 0000083B 06                      		push	es
  3975 0000083C 53                      		push	bx
  3976 0000083D 50                      		push	ax
  3977 0000083E 31FF                    		xor	di,di
  3978 00000840 8EC7                    		mov	es,di
  3979 00000842 BB1500                  		mov	bx,15h		; Device ID of DOSMGR device
  3980 00000845 B88416                  		mov	ax,1684h	; Get API entry	point
  3981 00000848 CD2F                    		int	2Fh		; - Multiplex -	MS WINDOWS - GET DEVICE	API ENTRY POINT
  3982                                  					; BX = virtual device (VxD) ID,	ES:DI =	0000h:0000h
  3983                                  					; Return: ES:DI	-> VxD API entry point,	or 0:0 if the VxD does not support an API
  3984 0000084A 8CC0                    		mov	ax, es
  3985 0000084C 09F8                    		or	ax, di

  3987                                  					; Set up stack frame to	simulate a call.
  3988 00000850 0E                      		push	cs
  3989                                  		;;mov	ax,offset Skip
  3990                                  		;mov	ax,Skip
  3991                                  		;push	ax
  3992                                  		; 03/10/2023 - Retro DOS v5.0
  3993 00000851 68[5A08]                		push	Skip
  3994 00000854 06                      		push	es
  3995 00000855 57                      		push	di		; API far call address
  3996 00000856 B80100                  		mov	ax,1		; SetFocus function number
  3997 00000859 CB                      		retf			; do the call

  4285                                  
  4286                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4287                                  ; Possibly disposable data, goes at end of data group
  4288                                  ;***************************************************************************
  4289                                  
  4290                                  ; Possibly disposable data, goes at end of data group
  4291                                  
  4292                                  ;***	ibm_disk_io - main routine, fixes at rom bug
  4293                                  ;
  4294                                  ;	entry:	(ah) = function, 02 or 0a for read.
  4295                                  ;		(dl) = drive number (80h or 81h).
  4296                                  ;		(dh) = head number.
  4297                                  ;		(ch) = cylinder number.
  4298                                  ;		(cl) = sector number (high 2 bits has cylinder number).
  4299                                  ;		(al) = number of sectors.
  4300                                  ;		(es:bx) = address of read buffer.
  4301                                  ;		for more on register contents see rom bios listing.
  4302                                  ;		stack set up for return by an iret.
  4303                                  ;
  4304                                  ;	exit:	(ah) = status of current operation.
  4305                                  ;		(cy) = 1 if failed, 0 if successful.
  4306                                  ;		for other register contents see rom bios listing.
  4307                                  ;
  4308                                  ;	uses:	
  4309                                  ;
  4310                                  ;
  4311                                  ;	warning: uses old13 vector for non-read calls.
  4312                                  ;		does direct calls to the at rom.
  4313                                  ;		does segment arithmatic.
  4314                                  ;
  4315                                  ;	effects: performs disk i/o operation.
  4316                                  
  4317                                  ; 16/10/2022
  4318                                  ; 28/05/2019
  4319                                  cmd_block equ 42h ; ROMBIOS DATA segment (40h) offset 42h ; 13/12/2022
  4320                                  
  4321                                  ;* offsets into cmd_block for registers
  4322                                  
  4323                                  pre_comp equ 0	;write pre-compensation
  4324                                  sec_cnt	 equ 1	;sector count
  4325                                  sec_num	 equ 2	;sector number
  4326                                  cyl_low	 equ 3	;cylinder number, low part
  4327                                  cyl_high equ 4	;cylinder number, high part
  4328                                  drv_head equ 5	;drive/head (bit 7 = ecc mode, bit 5 = 512 byte sectors, 
  4329                                  		;            bit 4 = drive number, bits 3-0 have head number)
  4330                                  cmd_reg  equ 6	;command register
  4331                                  
  4332                                  ; 01/10/2022
  4333                                  disk_status1	equ 74h
  4334                                  hf_num		equ 75h
  4335                                  control_byte	equ 76h
  4336                                  
  4337                                  ibm_disk_io:				
  4338 0000123D 80FA80                  		cmp	dl, 80h		; main routine,	fixes at rom bug
  4339 00001240 720A                    		jb	short atd1	; pass through floppy disk calls. 
  4340 00001242 80FC02                  		cmp	ah, 2
  4341 00001245 740A                    		jz	short atd2	; intercept call 02 (read sectors).
  4342 00001247 80FC0A                  		cmp	ah, 0Ah
  4343 0000124A 7405                    		jz	short atd2	; and call 0Ah (read long).
  4344                                  atd1:
  4345 0000124C 2EFF2E[0601]            		jmp	far [cs:Old13]					
  4346                                  		;jmp	cs:Old13	; use rom int 13h handler
  4347                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4348                                  
  4349                                  atd2:					
  4350 00001251 53                      		push	bx
  4351 00001252 51                      		push	cx
  4352 00001253 52                      		push	dx
  4353 00001254 57                      		push	di
  4354 00001255 1E                      		push	ds
  4355 00001256 06                      		push	es
  4356 00001257 50                      		push	ax
  4357 00001258 B84000                  		mov	ax, 40h		; bioseg (rombios data segment)
  4358                                  					; establish bios segment addressing
  4359 0000125B 8ED8                    		mov	ds, ax
  4360                                  		; 16/10/2022
  4361 0000125D C606740000              		mov	byte [disk_status1], 0
  4362                                  		;mov	byte ptr ds:74h, 0 ; [disk_status1]
  4363                                  					; initially no error code.
  4364 00001262 80E27F                  		and	dl, 7Fh		; mask to hard disk number
  4365 00001265 3A167500                		cmp	dl, [hf_num]
  4366                                  		;cmp	dl, ds:75h	; [hf_num] ; 40h:75h
  4367 00001269 7207                    		jb	short atd3	; disk number in range
  4368                                  		;mov	byte ptr ds:74h, 1 ; bad_disk
  4369 0000126B C606740001              		mov	byte [disk_status1], 1
  4370 00001270 EB20                    		jmp	short atd4	; disk number out of range error,
  4371                                  					; return
  4372                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4373                                  
  4374                                  atd3:					
  4375 00001272 53                      		push	bx
  4376 00001273 8CC0                    		mov	ax, es
  4377 00001275 C1EB04                  		shr	bx, 4		; make es:bx to seg:000x form.
  4378 00001278 01D8                    		add	ax, bx
  4379 0000127A 8EC0                    		mov	es, ax
  4380 0000127C 5B                      		pop	bx
  4381 0000127D 83E30F                  		and	bx, 0Fh
  4382 00001280 0E                      		push	cs
  4383 00001281 E8DF00                  		call	check_dma
  4384 00001284 720C                    		jb	short atd4	; abort if dma across segment boundary
  4385 00001286 58                      		pop	ax
  4386 00001287 50                      		push	ax
  4387 00001288 E81A00                  		call	setcmd		; set up command block for disk op
  4388 0000128B BAF603                  		mov	dx, 3F6h	; hf_reg_port 
  4389 0000128E EE                      		out	dx, al		; write out command modifier
  4390 0000128F E86B00                  		call	docmd		; carry out command
  4391                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4392                                  
  4393                                  atd4:	
  4394                                  
  4395                                  ;  new code - let logical or clear carry and then set carry if ah!=0
  4396                                  ;	      and save a couple bytes while were at it.
  4397                                  				
  4398 00001292 58                      		pop	ax
  4399                                  		;mov	ah, ds:74h	; [disk_status1]
  4400 00001293 8A267400                		mov	ah, [disk_status1]
  4401 00001297 08E4                    		or	ah, ah
  4402 00001299 7401                    		jz	short atd5
  4403 0000129B F9                      		stc
  4404                                  atd5:					
  4405 0000129C 07                      		pop	es
  4406 0000129D 1F                      		pop	ds
  4407 0000129E 5F                      		pop	di
  4408 0000129F 5A                      		pop	dx
  4409 000012A0 59                      		pop	cx
  4410 000012A1 5B                      		pop	bx
  4411 000012A2 CA0200                  		retf	2		; far return, dropping flags
  4412                                  
  4413                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E ========================================
  4414                                  
  4415                                  ;***	setcmd - set up cmd_block for the disk operation
  4416                                  ;
  4417                                  ;	entry:	(ds) = bios data segment.
  4418                                  ;		(es:bx) in seg:000x form.
  4419                                  ;		other registers as in int 13h call
  4420                                  ;	
  4421                                  ;	exit:	cmd_block set up for disk read call.
  4422                                  ;		control_byte set up for disk operation.
  4423                                  ;		(al) = control byte modifier
  4424                                  ;
  4425                                  ;	sets the fields of cmd_block using the register contents
  4426                                  ;	and the contents of the disk parameter block for the given drive.
  4427                                  ;
  4428                                  ;	warning: (ax) destroyed.
  4429                                  ;		does direct calls to the at rom.
  4430                                  
  4431                                  setcmd:		; proc near		
  4432                                  		;mov	ds:43h,	al	; [cmd_block+sec_cnt]
  4433                                  		; 16/10/2022
  4434 000012A5 A24300                  		mov	[cmd_block+sec_cnt], al
  4435                                  		;mov	byte ptr ds:48h, 20h ; [cmd_block+cmd_reg]
  4436 000012A8 C606480020              		mov	byte [cmd_block+cmd_reg], 20h ; assume function 02h (read)
  4437 000012AD 80FC02                  		cmp	ah, 2
  4438 000012B0 7405                    		jz	short setc1	; cmd_reg = 20h	if function 02h	(read)
  4439 000012B2 C606480022              		mov	byte [cmd_block+cmd_reg], 22h
  4440                                  		;mov	byte ptr ds:48h, 22h ; [cmd_block+cmd_reg]
  4441                                  					; cmd_reg = 22h	if function 0Ah	(read long)
  4442                                  setc1:					
  4443 000012B7 88C8                    		mov	al, cl
  4444 000012B9 243F                    		and	al, 3Fh		; mask sector number
  4445                                  		;mov	ds:44h,	al	; [cmd_block+sec_num]
  4446                                  		;mov	ds:45h,	ch	; [cmd_block+cyl_low]
  4447 000012BB A24400                  		mov	[cmd_block+sec_num], al ; mov [44h],al
  4448 000012BE 882E4500                		mov	[cmd_block+cyl_low], ch ; mov [45h],ch
  4449 000012C2 88C8                    		mov	al, cl
  4450 000012C4 C0E806                  		shr	al, 6		; get two high bits of cylinder	number
  4451                                  		;mov	ds:46h,	al	; [cmd_block+cyl_high]
  4452 000012C7 A24600                  		mov	[cmd_block+cyl_high], al ; mov [46h],al
  4453 000012CA 89D0                    		mov	ax, dx
  4454 000012CC C0E004                  		shl	al, 4		; drive	number
  4455 000012CF 80E40F                  		and	ah, 0Fh
  4456 000012D2 08E0                    		or	al, ah		; head number
  4457 000012D4 0CA0                    		or	al, 0A0h	; set ecc and 512 bytes	per sector
  4458                                  		;mov	ds:47h,	al	; [cmd_block+drv_head]
  4459 000012D6 A24700                  		mov	[cmd_block+drv_head], al  ; mov [47h],al 
  4460 000012D9 06                      		push	es
  4461 000012DA 53                      		push	bx
  4462 000012DB 0E                      		push	cs
  4463 000012DC E85C00                  		call	get_vec
  4464 000012DF 268B4705                		mov	ax, [es:bx+5]	; [es:bx+fdp_precomp]
  4465                                  			 		; write pre-comp from disk parameters
  4466 000012E3 C1E802                  		shr	ax, 2
  4467                                  		;mov	ds:42h,	al	; [cmd_block+pre_comp]
  4468 000012E6 A24200                  		mov	[cmd_block+pre_comp], al ; mov [42h],al
  4469                                  					; only use low part
  4470 000012E9 268A4708                		mov	al, [es:bx+8]	; [es:bx+fdp_control]
  4471                                  					; control byte modifier
  4472 000012ED 5B                      		pop	bx
  4473 000012EE 07                      		pop	es
  4474                                  		;mov	ah, ds:76h	; [control_byte]
  4475 000012EF 8A267600                		mov	ah, [control_byte] ; mov ah,[76h]
  4476 000012F3 80E4C0                  		and	ah, 0C0h	; keep disable retry bits	
  4477 000012F6 08C4                    		or	ah, al
  4478                                  		;mov	ds:76h,	ah
  4479 000012F8 88267600                		mov	[control_byte], ah ; mov [76h],al
  4480 000012FC C3                      		retn
  4481                                  
  4482                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E ========================================
  4483                                  
  4484                                  ;***	docmd - carry out read operation to at hard disk
  4485                                  ;
  4486                                  ;	entry:	(es:bx) = address for read in data.
  4487                                  ;		cmd_block set up for disk read.
  4488                                  ;
  4489                                  ;	exit:	buffer at (es:bx) contains data read.
  4490                                  ;		disk_status1 set to error code (0 if success).
  4491                                  ;
  4492                                  ;	
  4493                                  ;
  4494                                  ;	warning: (ax), (bl), (cx), (dx), (di) destroyed.
  4495                                  ;		no check is made for dma boundary overrun.
  4496                                  ;
  4497                                  ;	effects: programs disk controller.
  4498                                  ;		performs disk input.
  4499                                  
  4500                                  docmd:		; proc near		
  4501 000012FD 89DF                    		mov	di, bx
  4502 000012FF 0E                      		push	cs
  4503 00001300 E84000                  		call	command
  4504 00001303 7535                    		jnz	short doc3
  4505                                  doc1:					
  4506 00001305 0E                      		push	cs
  4507 00001306 E84200                  		call	waitt		; wait for controller to complete read
  4508 00001309 752F                    		jnz	short doc3
  4509 0000130B B90001                  		mov	cx, 256		; 256 words per sector
  4510 0000130E BAF001                  		mov	dx, 1F0h	; hf_port
  4511 00001311 FC                      		cld			; string op goes up
  4512 00001312 FA                      		cli			; disable interrupts
  4513                                  					; (bug was forgetting this)
  4514                                  
  4515                                  ;	M062 -- some of these old machines have intermittent failures
  4516                                  ;		when the read is done at full speed. Instead of using
  4517                                  ;		a string rep instruction, we'll use a loop. There is
  4518                                  ;		a slight performance hit, but it only affects these
  4519                                  ;		very old machines with an exact date code match, and
  4520                                  ;		it makes said machines more reliable
  4521                                  ;
  4522                                  ;M062	repz	insw		;read in sector
  4523                                  
  4524                                  rsct_loop:				
  4525 00001313 6D                      		insw
  4526 00001314 E2FD                    		loop	rsct_loop
  4527 00001316 FB                      		sti
  4528                                  		; 16/10/2022
  4529 00001317 F606480002              		test	byte [cmd_block+cmd_reg], 02h
  4530                                  		;test	byte ptr ds:48h, 2 ; [cmd_block+cmd_reg]
  4531                                  					; (ds =	40h)
  4532 0000131C 7410                    		jz	short doc2	; no ecc bytes to read.
  4533 0000131E 0E                      		push	cs
  4534 0000131F E83100                  		call	wait_drq	; wait for controller to complete read
  4535 00001322 7216                    		jb	short doc3
  4536 00001324 B90400                  		mov	cx, 4		; 4 bytes of ecc
  4537 00001327 BAF001                  		mov	dx, 1F0h	; hf_port
  4538 0000132A FA                      		cli
  4539 0000132B F36C                    		rep insb		; read in ecc
  4540 0000132D FB                      		sti
  4541                                  doc2:					
  4542 0000132E 0E                      		push	cs
  4543 0000132F E82900                  		call	check_status
  4544 00001332 7506                    		jnz	short doc3	; operation failed
  4545                                  		;dec	byte ptr ds:43h	; [cmd_block+sec_cnt]
  4546 00001334 FE0E4300                		dec	byte [cmd_block+sec_cnt]
  4547 00001338 75CB                    		jnz	short doc1	; loop while more sectors to read
  4548                                  doc3:					
  4549 0000133A C3                      		retn
  4550                                  
  4551                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E ========================================
  4552                                  
  4553                                  ;***	define where the rom routines are actually located
  4554                                  ;	   in the buggy old AT BIOS that we might need to
  4555                                  ;	   install a special level of int13 handler for
  4556                                  
  4557                                  ; 16/10/2022
  4558                                  
  4559                                  romsegment 	equ 0F000h  ; segment
  4560                                  romcommand 	equ 2E1Eh   ; offset in romsegment
  4561                                  romwait		equ 2E7Fh   ; offset in romsegment
  4562                                  romwait_drq 	equ 2EE2h   ; offset in romsegment
  4563                                  romcheck_status equ 2EF8h   ; offset in romsegment
  4564                                  romcheck_dma 	equ 2F69h   ; offset in romsegment	
  4565                                  romget_vec	equ 2F8Eh   ; offset in romsegment
  4566                                  romfret		equ 0FF65h  ; far return in rom	
  4567                                  
  4568                                  ;***	get_vec - get pointer to hard disk parameters.
  4569                                  ;
  4570                                  ;	entry:	(dl) = low bit has hard disk number (0 or 1).
  4571                                  ;
  4572                                  ;	exit:	(es:bx) = address of disk parameters table.
  4573                                  ;
  4574                                  ;	uses:	ax for segment computation.
  4575                                  ;
  4576                                  ;	loads es:bx from interrupt table in low memory, vector 46h (disk 0)
  4577                                  ;	or 70h (disk 1).
  4578                                  ;	
  4579                                  ;	warning: (ax) destroyed.
  4580                                  ;		this does a direct call to the at rom.
  4581                                  
  4582                                  get_vec:	; proc near		
  4583                                  		;push	0FF65h		; romfret ; far	return in rom
  4584                                  		;jmp	far ptr	0F000h:2F8Eh
  4585                                  		; 16/10/2022
  4586 0000133B 6865FF                  		push	romfret		; far return in rom
  4587 0000133E EA8E2F00F0              		jmp	romsegment:romget_vec
  4588                                  
  4589                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E ========================================
  4590                                  
  4591                                  ;***	command - send contents of cmd_block to disk controller.
  4592                                  ;
  4593                                  ;	entry:	control_byte 
  4594                                  ;		cmd_block - set up with values for hard disk controller.
  4595                                  ;
  4596                                  ;	exit:	disk_status1 = error code.
  4597                                  ;		nz if error, zr for no error.
  4598                                  ;
  4599                                  ;
  4600                                  ;	warning: (ax), (cx), (dx) destroyed.
  4601                                  ;		does a direct call to the at rom.
  4602                                  ;
  4603                                  ;	effects: programs disk controller.
  4604                                  
  4605                                  command:	; proc near		
  4606                                  		;push	0FF65h		; romfret ; far	return in rom
  4607                                  		;jmp	far ptr	0F000h:2E1Eh
  4608                                  		; 16/10/2022
  4609 00001343 6865FF                  		push	romfret		; far return in rom
  4610 00001346 EA1E2E00F0              		jmp	romsegment:romcommand
  4611                                  
  4612                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E ========================================
  4613                                  
  4614                                  ;***	waitt - wait for disk interrupt
  4615                                  ;
  4616                                  ;	entry:	nothing.
  4617                                  ;
  4618                                  ;	exit:	disk_status1 = error code.
  4619                                  ;		nz if error, zr if no error.
  4620                                  ;
  4621                                  ;
  4622                                  ;	warning: (ax), (bl), (cx) destroyed.
  4623                                  ;		does a direct call to the at rom.
  4624                                  ;		
  4625                                  ;	effects: calls int 15h, function 9000h.
  4626                                  
  4627                                  waitt:		; proc near		
  4628                                  		;push	0FF65h		; romfret ; far	return in rom
  4629                                  		;jmp	far ptr	0F000h:2E7Fh
  4630                                  		; 16/10/2022
  4631 0000134B 6865FF                  		push	romfret		; far return in rom
  4632 0000134E EA7F2E00F0              		jmp	romsegment:romwait
  4633                                  
  4634                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E ========================================
  4635                                  
  4636                                  ;***	wait_drq - wait for data request.
  4637                                  ;
  4638                                  ;	entry:	nothing.
  4639                                  ;
  4640                                  ;	exit:	disk_status1 = error code.
  4641                                  ;		cy if error, nc if no error.
  4642                                  ;
  4643                                  ;	warning: (al), (cx), (dx) destroyed.
  4644                                  ;		does a direct call to the at rom.
  4645                                  
  4646                                  wait_drq:	; proc near		
  4647                                  		;push	0FF65h		; romfret ; far	return in rom
  4648                                  		;jmp	far ptr	0F000h:2EE2h
  4649                                  		; 16/10/2022
  4650 00001353 6865FF                  		push	romfret		; far return in rom
  4651 00001356 EAE22E00F0              		jmp	romsegment:romwait_drq
  4652                                  
  4653                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E ========================================
  4654                                  
  4655                                  ;***	check_status - check hard disk status.
  4656                                  ;
  4657                                  ;	entry:	nothing.
  4658                                  ;
  4659                                  ;	exit:	disk_status1 = error code.
  4660                                  ;		nz if error, zr if no error.
  4661                                  ;
  4662                                  ;	warning: (ax), (cx), (dx) destroyed.
  4663                                  ;		does a direct call to the at rom.
  4664                                  
  4665                                  check_status:	; proc near		
  4666                                  		;push	0FF65h		; romfret ; far	return in rom
  4667                                  		;jmp	far ptr	0F000h:2EF8h
  4668                                  		; 16/10/2022
  4669 0000135B 6865FF                  		push	romfret		; far return in rom
  4670 0000135E EAF82E00F0              		jmp	romsegment:romcheck_status
  4671                                  
  4672                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E ========================================
  4673                                  
  4674                                  ;***	check_dma - check for dma overrun 64k segment.
  4675                                  ;
  4676                                  ;	entry:	(es:bx) = addr. of memory buffer in seg:000x form.
  4677                                  ;		cmd_block set up for operation.
  4678                                  ;
  4679                                  ;	exit:	disk_status1 - error code.
  4680                                  ;		cy if error, nc if no error.
  4681                                  ;
  4682                                  ;	warning: does a direct call to the at rom.
  4683                                  
  4684                                  check_dma:	; proc near		
  4685                                  		;push	0FF65h		; romfret ; far	return in rom
  4686                                  		;jmp	far ptr	0F000h:2F69h
  4687                                  		; 16/10/2022
  4688 00001363 6865FF                  		push	romfret		; far return in rom
  4689 00001366 EA692F00F0              		jmp	romsegment:romcheck_dma
  4690                                  
  4691                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4692                                  
  4693                                  endatrom:
  4694                                  
  4695                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4696                                  
  4697                                  ;; M015 -- begin changes
  4698                                  ;;
  4699                                  ;; Certain old COMPAQ '286 machines have a bug in their ROM BIOS.
  4700                                  ;; When Int13 is done with AH > 15h and DL >= 80h, they trash
  4701                                  ;; the byte at DS:74h, assuming that DS points to ROM_DATA.
  4702                                  ;; If our init code detects this error, it will install this
  4703                                  ;; special Int13 hook through the same mechanism that was set
  4704                                  ;; up for the IBM patch above. This code is also dynamically
  4705                                  ;; relocated by MSINIT.
  4706                                  
  4707                                  compaq_disk_io:
  4708 0000136B 80FC15                  		cmp	ah, 15h		; compaq_disk_io proc far
  4709                                  					;
  4710                                  					; the following	label defines the end of the at	rom patch.
  4711                                  					; this is used at configuration	time.
  4712                                  					;
  4713                                  					; warning!!!
  4714                                  					; this code will be dynamically	relocated by msinit
  4715 0000136E 7705                    		ja	short mebbe_hookit ; only deal with functions > 15h
  4716                                  no_hookit:				
  4717                                  		;jmp	cs:Old13
  4718                                  		; 16/10/2022
  4719 00001370 2EFF2E[0601]            		jmp	far [cs:Old13]
  4720                                  
  4721                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4722                                  
  4723                                  mebbe_hookit:
  4724 00001375 80FA80                  		cmp	dl, 80h
  4725 00001378 72F6                    		jb	short no_hookit
  4726 0000137A 1E                      		push	ds
  4727                                  		
  4728                                  		; 07/08/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
  4729                                  		; PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - BIOSDATA:1830h
  4730                                  		;push	ax
  4731                                  		;mov	ax, 40h
  4732                                  		;mov	ds, ax
  4733                                  		;pop	ax
  4734 0000137B 6A40                    		push	40h
  4735 0000137D 1F                      		pop	ds
  4736                                  
  4737 0000137E 9C                      		pushf
  4738                                  		;call	cs:Old13
  4739                                  		; 16/10/2022
  4740 0000137F 2EFF1E[0601]            		call	far [cs:Old13]
  4741 00001384 1F                      		pop	ds
  4742 00001385 CA0200                  		retf	2
  4743                                  
  4744                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4745                                  
  4746 00001388 00                      end_compaq_i13hook: db 0			
  4747                                  
  4748                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E ========================================
  4749                                  
  4750                                  ; 08/08/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
  4751                                  %if 0  
  4752                                  
  4753                                  ; CMOS Clock setting support routines used by MSCLOCK.		
  4754                                  ; Warning!!! This code will be dynamically relocated by MSINIT.
  4755                                  
  4756                                  daycnt_to_day:	; proc far
  4757                                  
  4758                                  ; entry: [daycnt] = number of days since 1-1-80
  4759                                  ;
  4760                                  ; return: ch - century in bcd
  4761                                  ;	  cl - year in bcd
  4762                                  ;	  dh - month in bcd
  4763                                  ;	  dl - day in bcd
  4764                                  
  4765                                  		; 16/10/2022		
  4766                                  		push	word [cs:daycnt] ; save daycnt
  4767                                  		cmp	word [cs:daycnt], 7305	; (365*20+(20/4))
  4768                                  					; # days from 1-1-1980 to 1-1-2000
  4769                                  		jnb	short century20
  4770                                  		mov	byte [cs:base_century], 19
  4771                                  		mov	byte [cs:base_year], 80
  4772                                  		jmp	short years
  4773                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4774                                  		
  4775                                  century20:				
  4776                                  		mov	byte [cs:base_century], 20
  4777                                  		mov	byte [cs:base_year], 0
  4778                                  		sub	word [cs:daycnt], 7305	; (365*20+(20/4))
  4779                                  					; adjust daycnt
  4780                                  years:					
  4781                                  		xor	dx, dx
  4782                                  		mov	ax, [cs:daycnt]
  4783                                  		mov	bx, 1461	; (366+365*3)
  4784                                  					; # of days in a Leap year block
  4785                                  		div	bx		; AX = # of leap block,	DX = daycnt
  4786                                  		mov	[cs:daycnt], dx	; save daycnt left
  4787                                  		mov	bl, 4
  4788                                  		mul	bl		; AX = # of years. Less	than 100
  4789                                  		add	[cs:base_year], al ; So, ah = 0. Adjust year
  4790                                  		inc	word [cs:daycnt]	; set daycnt to	1 base
  4791                                  		cmp	word [cs:daycnt], 366	; daycnt=remainder of leap year	bk
  4792                                  		jbe	short leapyear	; within 366+355+355+355 days.
  4793                                  		inc	byte [cs:base_year]	; if daycnt <= 366, then leap year
  4794                                  		sub	word [cs:daycnt], 366	; else daycnt--, base_year++ ;
  4795                                  		mov	cx, 3		; And next three years are normal
  4796                                  regularyear:				
  4797                                  		cmp	word [cs:daycnt], 365	; for(i=1; i>3 or daycnt <=365;	i++)
  4798                                  		jbe	short yeardone	; {if (daycnt >	365)
  4799                                  		inc	byte [cs:base_year]	;   { daycnt -=	365
  4800                                  		sub	word [cs:daycnt], 365	;   }
  4801                                  		loop	regularyear	; }
  4802                                  					;
  4803                                  					; should never fall through loop
  4804                                  leapyear:				
  4805                                  		mov	byte [cs:month_tab+1], 29 ; leap year.
  4806                                  					; change month table.
  4807                                  yeardone:				
  4808                                  		xor	bx, bx
  4809                                  		xor	dx, dx
  4810                                  		mov	ax, [cs:daycnt]
  4811                                  		;mov	si, offset month_tab
  4812                                  		mov	si, month_tab	; 19/10/2022
  4813                                  		mov	cx, 12
  4814                                  months:					
  4815                                  		inc	bl
  4816                                  
  4817                                  		; !!! -- 16/10/2022 -- (if DS=CS, what for CS: prefixes are used !?)
  4818                                  		;mov	dl, [cs:si]
  4819                                  		; !!! -- 16/10/2022 -- (may be to keep code addrs as unchanged/fix!?)
  4820                                  		; ds = cs !? ((ofcourse ds must be same with cs here))
  4821                                  		;mov	dl, [si] ; 20/03/2019 (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, BIOSDATA:14C0h)
  4822                                  		;mov	dl, [si] ; 16/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, BIOSDATA:14C0h)
  4823                                  		
  4824                                  		mov	dl, [si] ; ?	; mov dl, [cs:si]
  4825                                  		cmp	ax, dx		; cmp daycnt for each month till fit
  4826                                  					; dh=0
  4827                                  		jbe	short month_done
  4828                                  		inc	si		; next month
  4829                                  		sub	ax, dx		; adjust daycnt
  4830                                  		loop	months		;
  4831                                  					; should never fall through loop
  4832                                  month_done:				
  4833                                  		mov	byte [cs:month_tab+1], 28
  4834                                  					; restore month table value
  4835                                  		mov	dl, bl
  4836                                  		mov	dh, [cs:base_year]
  4837                                  		mov	cl, [cs:base_century] ; al=day,dl=month,dh=year,cl=cntry
  4838                                  		call	far [cs:bintobcd]
  4839                                  		;call	cs:bintobcd	; convert "day"	to bcd
  4840                                  					; dl = bcd day,	al = month
  4841                                  		xchg	dl, al
  4842                                  		call	far [cs:bintobcd]
  4843                                  		;call	cs:bintobcd	; dh = bcd month, al = year
  4844                                  		xchg	dh, al
  4845                                  		call	far [cs:bintobcd]
  4846                                  		;call	cs:bintobcd	; cl = bcd year, al = century
  4847                                  		xchg	cl, al
  4848                                  		call	far [cs:bintobcd]
  4849                                  		;call	cs:bintobcd	; ch = bcd century
  4850                                  		mov	ch, al
  4851                                  		pop	word [cs:daycnt] ; restore original value
  4852                                  		retf
  4853                                  
  4854                                  enddaycnttoday:	
  4855                                  
  4856                                  %endif
  4857                                  
  4858                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E ========================================
  4859                                  
  4860                                  ; 08/08/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
  4861                                  %if 0  
  4862                                  
  4863                                  bin_to_bcd:	; proc far		; real time clock support
  4864                                  
  4865                                  ;convert a binary input in al (less than 63h or 99 decimal)
  4866                                  ;into a bcd value in al. ah destroyed.	
  4867                                  		
  4868                                  		push	cx		
  4869                                  		aam			; al=high digit	bcd, ah=low digit bcd
  4870                                  		mov	cl, 4
  4871                                  		shl	ah, cl		; mov the high digit to	high nibble
  4872                                  		or	al, ah
  4873                                  		pop	cx
  4874                                  		retf
  4875                                  %endif
  4876                                  
  4877                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4878                                  
  4879                                  ; the k09 requires the routines for reading the clock because of the suspend/
  4880                                  ; resume facility. the system clock needs to be reset after resume.
  4881                                  
  4882                                  ; the following routine is executed at resume time when the system
  4883                                  ; powered on after suspension. it reads the real time clock and
  4884                                  ; resets the system time and date, and then irets.
  4885                                  
  4886                                  ; warning!!! this code will be dynamically relocated by msinit.
  4887                                  
  4888                                  	; 08/08/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
  4889                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - BIOSDATA:183Eh
  4890                                  int_6Ch:
  4891 00001389 0E                      		push	cs
  4892 0000138A 1F                      		pop	ds
  4893                                  		;cmp	byte [cs:inHMA], 0  
  4894 0000138B 803E[0D00]00            		cmp	byte [inHMA], 0
  4895 00001390 7405                    		jz      short int6c
  4896 00001392 BB[5107]                		mov     bx, EnsureA20On
  4897 00001395 FFD3                    		call    bx
  4898                                  int6c:					
  4899                                  		;push	cs
  4900                                  		;pop	ds
  4901 00001397 8F06[1F06]              		pop	word [int6c_ret_addr]	; pop off return address
  4902 0000139B 8F06[2106]              		pop	word [int6c_ret_addr+2]
  4903 0000139F 9D                      		popf
  4904 000013A0 E81300                  		call	read_real_date	; get the date from the clock
  4905 000013A3 FA                      		cli
  4906 000013A4 8936[9004]              		mov	[daycnt], si	; update dos copy of date
  4907 000013A8 FB                      		sti
  4908 000013A9 E8B900                  		call	read_real_time	; get the time from the	rtc
  4909 000013AC FA                      		cli
  4910 000013AD B401                    		mov	ah, 1
  4911 000013AF CD1A                    		int	1Ah		; CLOCK	- SET TIME OF DAY
  4912                                  					; CX:DX	= clock	count
  4913                                  					; Return: time of day set
  4914 000013B1 FB                      		sti
  4915                                  		;jmp	int6c_ret_addr	; long jump
  4916                                  		; 16/10/2022
  4917 000013B2 FF2E[1F06]              		jmp	far [int6c_ret_addr] ; long jump
  4918                                  
  4919                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E ========================================
  4920                                  
  4921                                  ;   read_real_date reads real-time clock for date and returns the number
  4922                                  ;   of days elapsed since 1-1-80 in si
  4923                                  
  4924                                  read_real_date:	; proc near		
  4925 000013B6 50                      		push	ax
  4926 000013B7 51                      		push	cx
  4927 000013B8 52                      		push	dx
  4928 000013B9 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah		; throw	away clock roll	over
  4929 000013BB CD1A                    		int	1Ah		; CLOCK	- GET TIME OF DAY
  4930                                  					; Return: CX:DX	= clock	count
  4931                                  					; AL = 00h if clock was	read or	written	(via AH=0,1) since the previous
  4932                                  					; midnight
  4933                                  					; Otherwise, AL	> 0
  4934 000013BD 5A                      		pop	dx
  4935 000013BE 59                      		pop	cx
  4936 000013BF 58                      		pop	ax
  4937 000013C0 50                      		push	ax
  4938 000013C1 53                      		push	bx
  4939 000013C2 51                      		push	cx
  4940 000013C3 52                      		push	dx
  4941                                  		;mov	word [cs:daycnt2], 1
  4942                                  		; 08/08/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
  4943                                  		; PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - BIOSDATA:187Ah
  4944 000013C4 C706[2706]0100          		mov	word [daycnt2], 1
  4945                                  					; REAL TIME CLOCK ERROR	FLAG (+1 DAY)
  4946 000013CA B404                    		mov	ah, 4
  4947 000013CC CD1A                    		int	1Ah		; CLOCK	- READ DATE FROM REAL TIME CLOCK (AT,XT286,CONV,PS)
  4948                                  					; Return: DL = day in BCD
  4949                                  					; DH = month in	BCD

  4951                                  					; CH = century (19h or 20h)

  4953 000013D0 E98300                  		jmp	r_d_ret

  4955                                  
  4956                                  read_ok:
  4957 000013D3 882E[2306]              		mov	[bin_date_time], ch
  4958 000013D7 880E[2406]              		mov	[bin_date_time+1], cl
  4959 000013DB 8836[2506]              		mov	[bin_date_time+2], dh
  4960 000013DF 8816[2606]              		mov	[bin_date_time+3], dl
  4961                                  		;mov	word [cs:daycnt2], 2 ; READ OF R-T CLOCK SUCCESSFUL

  4965 000013E7 E83401                  		call	bcd_verify	; verify bcd values in range
  4966 000013EA 726A                    		jb	short r_d_ret	; some value out of range
  4967                                  		;mov	word [cs:daycnt2], 3
  4968                                  		; 08/08/2023
  4969                                  		;mov	byte [daycnt2], 3
  4970 000013EC FE06[2706]              		inc	byte [daycnt2] ; 3
  4971 000013F0 E8DB00                  		call	date_verify
  4972 000013F3 7261                    		jb	short r_d_ret
  4973                                  		;mov	word [cs:daycnt2], 0
  4974                                  		; 08/08/2023
