  4976 000013FA E8A100                  		call	in_bin
  4977 000013FD A0[2406]                		mov	al, [bin_date_time+1]
  4978 00001400 98                      		cbw
  4979 00001401 803E[2306]14            		cmp	byte [bin_date_time], 20 ; 20th century?
  4980 00001406 7503                    		jnz	short century_19 ; no
  4981 00001408 83C064                  		add	ax, 100		; add in a century
  4982                                  century_19:				
  4983 0000140B 83E850                  		sub	ax, 80		; subtract off 1-1-80
  4984 0000140E B104                    		mov	cl, 4		; leap year every 4
  4985 00001410 F6F1                    		div	cl		; al= #	leap year blocks, ah= remainder
  4986 00001412 88E3                    		mov	bl, ah		; save odd years
  4987 00001414 98                      		cbw			; zero ah
  4988 00001415 B9B505                  		mov	cx, 1461	; 366+(3*365)
  4989                                  					; # of days in leap year blocks
  4990 00001418 F7E1                    		mul	cx
  4991                                  		;mov	[cs:daycnt2], ax ; SAVE COUNT OF DAYS
  4992                                  		; 08/08/2023
  4993 0000141A A3[2706]                		mov	[daycnt2], ax

  4995 0000141F 98                      		cbw
  4996 00001420 09C0                    		or	ax, ax
  4997 00001422 740B                    		jz	short leap_year
  4998 00001424 B96D01                  		mov	cx, 365		; days in year
  4999 00001427 F7E1                    		mul	cx
  5000                                  		;add	[cs:daycnt2], ax ; ADD ON DAYS IN ODD YEARS
  5001                                  		; 08/08/2023
  5002 00001429 0106[2706]              		add	[daycnt2], ax
  5003 0000142D EB07                    		jmp	short leap_adjustment ;	account	for leap year
  5004                                  					; possibly account for a leap day
  5005                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  5006                                  
  5007                                  leap_year:

  5009 00001434 7604                    		jbe	short no_leap_adjustment ; jan or feb. no leap day yet.
  5010                                  leap_adjustment:
  5011                                  		;inc	word [cs:daycnt2] ; account for leap day
  5012                                  		; 08/08/2023
  5013 00001436 FF06[2706]              		inc	word [daycnt2]
  5014                                  no_leap_adjustment:			
  5015 0000143A 8A0E[2606]              		mov	cl, [bin_date_time+3] ; get days of month
  5016 0000143E 30ED                    		xor	ch, ch
  5017 00001440 49                      		dec	cx		; because of offset from day 1,	not day	0
  5018                                  		;add	[cs:daycnt2], cx ; GET DAYS IN MONTHS PRECEEDING
  5019                                  		; 08/08/2023

  5021 00001445 8A0E[2506]              		mov	cl, [bin_date_time+2] ; get month
  5022                                  		; 08/08/2023

  5028                                  		;;mov	si, month_table

  5041 0000144A B400                    		mov	ah, 0
  5042 0000144C BE[9604]                		mov	si, month_tab
  5043                                  r_d_sum_loop:

  5045 00001450 0106[2706]              		add	[daycnt2], ax

  5052 0000145B 59                      		pop	cx
  5053 0000145C 5B                      		pop	bx
  5054 0000145D 58                      		pop	ax
  5055 0000145E C3                      		retn
  5056                                  
  5057                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  5058                                  
  5059                                  r_t_retj:				
  5060 0000145F 31C9                    		xor	cx, cx
  5061 00001461 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
  5062 00001463 EB38                    		jmp	short r_t_ret
  5063                                  
  5064                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E ========================================
  5065                                  
  5066                                  ; read_real_time reads the time from the rtc. on exit, it has the number of
  5067                                  ; ticks (at 18.2 ticks per sec.) in cx:dx.
  5068                                  
  5069                                  read_real_time:	; proc near		
  5070 00001465 B402                    		mov	ah, 2
  5071 00001467 CD1A                    		int	1Ah		; CLOCK	- READ REAL TIME CLOCK (AT,XT286,CONV,PS)
  5072                                  					; Return: CH = hours in	BCD
  5073                                  					; CL = minutes in BCD
  5074                                  					; DH = seconds in BCD
  5075 00001469 72F4                    		jb	short r_t_retj
  5076 0000146B 882E[2306]              		mov	[bin_date_time], ch ; hours
  5077 0000146F 880E[2406]              		mov	[bin_date_time+1], cl ; minutes
  5078 00001473 8836[2506]              		mov	[bin_date_time+2], dh ; seconds
  5079 00001477 C606[2606]00            		mov	byte [bin_date_time+3], 0 ; unused for time
  5080 0000147C E89F00                  		call	bcd_verify
  5081 0000147F 72DE                    		jb	short r_t_retj
  5082 00001481 E88500                  		call	time_verify
  5083 00001484 72D9                    		jb	short r_t_retj
  5084 00001486 E81500                  		call	in_bin		; from bcd to bin
  5085 00001489 8A2E[2306]              		mov	ch, [bin_date_time]
  5086 0000148D 8A0E[2406]              		mov	cl, [bin_date_time+1]
  5087 00001491 8A36[2506]              		mov	dh, [bin_date_time+2]
  5088 00001495 8A16[2606]              		mov	dl, [bin_date_time+3]
  5089                                  		; 16/10/2022
  5090                                  		; 17/09/2022
  5091                                  		; 31/05/2019
  5092 00001499 FF1E[2D06]              		call	far [ttticks] 
  5093                                  		;call	dword ptr ttticks ; note: indirect far call
  5094                                  					; cx:dx	= number of ticks
  5095                                  					; (at 18.2 ticks per sec.)
  5096                                  r_t_ret:				
  5097 0000149D C3                      		retn
  5098                                  
  5099                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  5100                                  
  5101                                  ;   in_bin converts bin_date_time values from bcd to bin
  5102                                  
  5103                                  in_bin:		; proc near
  5104 0000149E A0[2306]                		mov	al, [bin_date_time] ; century or hours
  5105 000014A1 E81F00                  		call	bcd_to_bin
  5106 000014A4 A2[2306]                		mov	[bin_date_time], al
  5107 000014A7 A0[2406]                		mov	al, [bin_date_time+1] ; years or minutes
  5108 000014AA E81600                  		call	bcd_to_bin
  5109 000014AD A2[2406]                		mov	[bin_date_time+1], al
  5110 000014B0 A0[2506]                		mov	al, [bin_date_time+2] ; months or seconds
  5111 000014B3 E80D00                  		call	bcd_to_bin
  5112 000014B6 A2[2506]                		mov	[bin_date_time+2], al
  5113 000014B9 A0[2606]                		mov	al, [bin_date_time+3] ; days (not used for time)
  5114 000014BC E80400                  		call	bcd_to_bin
  5115 000014BF A2[2606]                		mov	[bin_date_time+3], al
  5116 000014C2 C3                      		retn
  5117                                  
  5118                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  5119                                  
  5120                                  ;   bcd_to_bin converts two bcd nibbles in al (value <= 99.) to
  5121                                  ;   a binary representation in al
  5122                                  ;   ah is destroyed
  5123                                  
  5124                                  bcd_to_bin:	; proc near
  5125 000014C3 88C4                    		mov	ah, al
  5126 000014C5 240F                    		and	al, 0Fh
  5127 000014C7 B104                    		mov	cl, 4
  5128 000014C9 D2EC                    		shr	ah, cl
  5129 000014CB D50A                    		aad
  5130 000014CD C3                      		retn
  5131                                  
  5132                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E ========================================
  5133                                  
  5134                                  ;   date_verify loosely checks bcd date values to be in range
  5135                                  ;   in bin_date_time
  5136                                  
  5137                                  date_verify:	; proc near
  5138 000014CE 803E[2306]20            		cmp	byte [bin_date_time], 20h ; century check
  5139 000014D3 7732                    		ja	short date_error
  5140 000014D5 740E                    		jz	short century_20 ; jmp in 21th century
  5141 000014D7 803E[2306]19            		cmp	byte [bin_date_time], 19h ; century check
  5142                                  		;jb	short date_error
  5143                                  		; 12/12/2022
  5144 000014DC 722A                    		jb	short date_err2
  5145 000014DE 803E[2406]80            		cmp	byte [bin_date_time+1], 80h ; year check
  5146                                  		;jb	short date_error
  5147                                  		; 12/12/2022
  5148 000014E3 7223                    		jb	short date_err2
  5149                                  century_20:
  5150 000014E5 803E[2406]99            		cmp	byte [bin_date_time+1], 99h ; year check
  5151 000014EA 771B                    		ja	short date_error
  5152 000014EC 803E[2506]12            		cmp	byte [bin_date_time+2], 12h ; month check
  5153 000014F1 7714                    		ja	short date_error
  5154 000014F3 803E[2506]00            		cmp	byte [bin_date_time+2], 0
  5155                                  		;jbe	short date_error
  5156 000014F8 760D                    		jna	short date_error
  5157 000014FA 803E[2606]31            		cmp	byte [bin_date_time+3], 31h ; day check
  5158 000014FF 7706                    		ja	short date_error
  5159                                  		;cmp	byte [bin_date_time+3], 0 ; day check
  5160                                  		;;jbe	short date_error
  5161                                  		;jna	short date_error
  5162                                  		; 12/12/2022
  5163                                  		; cf=0
  5164                                  		;clc
  5165                                  		; 12/12/2022
  5166 00001501 803E[2606]01            		cmp	byte [bin_date_time+3], 1 ; day check
  5167 00001506 C3                      		retn
  5168                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  5169                                  
  5170                                  date_error:
  5171 00001507 F9                      		stc
  5172                                  date_err2:
  5173 00001508 C3                      		retn
  5174                                  
  5175                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E ========================================
  5176                                  
  5177                                  ; time_verify very loosely checks bcd date values to be in range
  5178                                  ; in bin_date_time
  5179                                  
  5180                                  time_verify:	; proc near
  5181 00001509 803E[2306]24            		cmp	byte [bin_date_time], 24h ; hour check
  5182 0000150E 770C                    		ja	short time_error
  5183 00001510 803E[2406]59            		cmp	byte [bin_date_time+1], 59h ; minute check
  5184 00001515 7705                    		ja	short time_error
  5185                                  		; 12/12/2022h
  5186                                  		;cmp	byte [bin_date_time+2], 59h ; second check
  5187                                  		;ja	short time_error
  5188                                  		;clc
  5189                                  		;retn
  5190                                  		; 12/12/2022
  5191 00001517 803E[2506]5A            		cmp	byte  [bin_date_time+2], 5Ah	
  5192                                  time_error:
  5193                                  bv_error:
  5194 0000151C F5                      		cmc	; cf=0 -> cf=1, cf=1 -> cf=0
  5195 0000151D C3                      		retn
  5196                                  
  5197                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  5198                                  
  5199                                  ;time_error:				
  5200                                  		;stc
  5201                                  		;retn
  5202                                  
  5203                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E ========================================
  5204                                  
  5205                                  ;   bcd_verify checks values in bin_date_time to be valid
  5206                                  ;   bcd numerals.  carry set if any nibble out of range
  5207                                  
  5208                                  bcd_verify:	; proc near
  5209 0000151E B90400                  		mov	cx, 4		; 4 bytes to check
  5210 00001521 BB[2306]                		mov	bx, bin_date_time
  5211                                  bv_loop:
  5212 00001524 8A07                    		mov	al, [bx]	; get a	bcd number (0..99)
  5213 00001526 88C4                    		mov	ah, al
  5214 00001528 250FF0                  		and	ax, 0F00Fh	; 10's place in high ah, 1's in al
  5215                                  					; is 1's place in range?
  5216 0000152B 3C0A                    		cmp	al, 10
  5217 0000152D 77ED                    		ja	short bv_error	; jmp out of range
  5218 0000152F D0EC                    		shr	ah, 1
  5219 00001531 D0EC                    		shr	ah, 1
  5220 00001533 D0EC                    		shr	ah, 1
  5221 00001535 D0EC                    		shr	ah, 1
  5222 00001537 80E40F                  		and	ah, 0Fh		; get rid of any erroneous bits
  5223 0000153A 80FC0A                  		cmp	ah, 10		; is 10's place in range
  5224 0000153D 77DD                    		ja	short bv_error	; jmp out of range
  5225 0000153F 43                      		inc	bx		; next byte
  5226 00001540 49                      		dec	cx
  5227 00001541 75E1                    		jnz	short bv_loop
  5228 00001543 F8                      		clc			; set success flag
  5229 00001544 C3                      		retn
  5230                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  5231                                  
  5232                                  		; 12/12/2022
  5233                                  ;bv_error:
  5234                                  		;stc			; set error flag
  5235                                  		;retn
  5236                                  
  5237                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  5238                                  
  5239                                  endk09:

  5242                                  
  5243                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------
  5244                                  ;									:
  5245                                  ;	System initialization						:
  5246                                  ;									:
  5247                                  ;	The entry conditions are established by the bootstrap		:
  5248                                  ;	loader and are considered unknown. The following jobs		:
  5249                                  ;	will be performed by this module:				:
  5250                                  ;									:
  5251                                  ;	1.	All device initialization is performed			:
  5252                                  ;	2.	A local stack is set up and DS:SI are set		:
  5253                                  ;		to point to an initialization table. Then		:
  5254                                  ;		an inter-segment call is made to the first		:
  5255                                  ;		byte of the dos 					:
  5256                                  ;	3.	Once the dos returns from this call the ds		:
  5257                                  ;		register has been set up to point to the start		:
  5258                                  ;		of free memory. The initialization will then		:
  5259                                  ;		load the command program into this area 		:
  5260                                  ;		beginning at 100 hex and transfer control to		:
  5261                                  ;		this program.						:
  5262                                  ;									:
  5263                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------
  5264                                  
  5265                                  ; 01/10/2022
  5266                                  ; 08/01/2018 - Retro DOS v4.0
  5267                                  
  5268                                  ; drvfat must be the first location of freeable space!
  5269                                  
  5270 00001545 90                      align 2
  5271                                  		;db 90h
  5272                                  
  5273                                  ; 09/12/2023 - Retro DOS v5.0 IO.SYS (IBMBIO.COM 7.1)
  5274                                  
  5275                                  ; 30/12/2022
  5276                                  ; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, BIOSDATA:16D6h)
  5277                                  	
  5278 00001546 0000                    drvfat:		dw 0			; drive	and fat	id of dos
  5279 00001548 0000                    bios_l:		dw 0			; first	sector of data (low word)
  5280 0000154A 0000                    bios_h:		dw 0			; first	sector of data (high word)
  5281 0000154C 0000                    doscnt:		dw 0			; how many sectors to read
  5282 0000154E 00                      fbigfat:	db 0			; flags	for drive
  5283 0000154F 0000                    fatloc:		dw 0			; seg addr of fat sector
  5284 00001551 0000                    init_bootseg:	dw 0			; seg addr of buffer for reading boot record
  5285 00001553 80                      rom_drv_num:	db 80h			; rom drive number
  5286 00001554 0002                    md_sectorsize:	dw 200h			; used by get_fat_sector proc.
  5287 00001556 0000                    temp_cluster:	dw 0			; used by get_fat_sector proc.
  5288 00001558 FFFF                    last_fat_sec_num: dw 0FFFFh		; used by get_fat_sector proc.
  5289                                  
  5290                                  ; the following two bytes are used to save the info returned by int 13, ah = 8
  5291                                  ; call to determine drive parameters.
  5292                                  
  5293 0000155A 02                      num_heads:	db 2			; number of heads returned by rom
  5294                                  		;db 0	; 08/08/2023
  5295 0000155B 09                      sec_trk:	db 9			; sec/trk returned by rom
  5296 0000155C 28                      num_cyln:	db 40			; number of cylinders returned by rom
  5297                                  		;db 0	; 08/08/2023
  5298 0000155D 00                      fakefloppydrv:	db 0			; if 1,	then no	diskette drives	in the system.
  5299                                  
  5300                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  5301                                  
  5302 0000155E 0002000140000000        disktable:	dw 512,	0100h, 64, 0	; warning !!! old values
  5303 00001566 0008010270000000        		dw 2048, 0201h, 112, 0
  5304 0000156E 0020020400010000        		dw 8192, 0402h, 256, 0
  5305 00001576 A87F030800020000        		dw 32680, 0803h, 512, 0	; warning !!! old values
  5306 0000157E FFFF041000040000        		dw 65535, 1004h, 1024, 0
  5307                                  					; default disktable under
  5308                                  					; the assumption of total fat size <= 128 kb,
  5309                                  					; and the maximum size of fat entry = 16 bit.
  5310                                  		; 08/08/2023
  5311                                  		; disktable.totalsectors: resd 1

  5320 0000159A 080000000308000240-     		dw 8, 0, 0803h, 512, 40h   ; upto 268 mb ; (80000h sectors = 256 MB)
  5320 000015A3 00

  5525                                  ;	entry point to call utility functions in Bios_Code. At this time,
  5526                                  ;	  we aren't doing any A20 switching. During MSINIT time Bios_Code
  5527                                  ;	  will not yet be moved to its final resting place, so we know
  5528                                  ;	  it'll be low.
  5529                                  ;
  5530                                  ;	to use this function, do a "push cs" and load bp with the offset of
  5531                                  ;	  the function you want to call in Bios_Code. This routine will
  5532                                  ;	  push the address of a retf in Bios_Code onto the stack which
  5533                                  ;	  will get executed when the utility function finishes. It will
  5534                                  ;	  then transfer control to Bios_Code:bp using a couple of pushes
  5535                                  ;	  and a retf
  5536                                  
  5537                                  ; 16/10/2022
  5538                                  ;BC_RETF equ bc_retf - DOSBIOSEG_2C7h
  5539                                  ; 09/12/2022
  5540                                  BC_RETF equ bc_retf
  5541                                  
  5542                                  addr_of_bcretf:	;dw 0C8h		; dw bc_retf
  5543                                  					; 2C7h:0C8h = 70h:2638h
  5544 000015DF [CC00]                  		dw BC_RETF
  5545                                  
  5546                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  5547                                  
  5548                                  call_bios_code:	; proc far			
  5549 000015E1 2EFF36[DF15]            		push	word [cs:addr_of_bcretf] 
  5550                                  					; set up near return to far return
  5551 000015E6 2EFF36[2B06]            		push	word [cs:cdev+2] ; push Bios_Code segment
  5552 000015EB 55                      		push	bp		; save offset of utility function
  5553 000015EC CB                      		retf			; far jump to (DOS)BIOS code

  5563                                  ; 01/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 5.0)

  5565                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  5566                                  ; entry point from boot sector
  5567                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  5568                                  
  5569                                  init:		; 27/12/2018
  5570                                  		; MSDOS 6.0 (MSINIT.ASM)
  5571                                  		;=============================================================
  5572                                  		;
  5573                                  		; entry from boot sector. the register contents are:
  5574                                  		;
  5575                                  		;   dl = int 13 drive number we booted from
  5576                                  		;   ch = media byte
  5577                                  		;   bx = first data sector on disk.
  5578                                  		;   ax = first data sector (high)
  5579                                  		;   di = sectors/fat for the boot media.
  5580                                  
  5581                                  		; 07/04/2018
  5582                                  		;=============================================================
  5583                                  		; Retro DOS v2.0 - registers from FD Boot Sector 
  5584                                                  ; DL = [bsDriveNumber]
  5585                                  		; DH = [bsMedia]
  5586                                  		; AX = [bsSectors] ; Total sectors
  5587                                  		; DS = 0, SS = 0
  5588                                  		; BP = 7C00h
  5589                                  		
  5590 000015EE FA                      		cli
  5591                                  
  5592                                  		; 21/12/2022
  5593                                  		; ds = 0 (?)
  5594                                  		;push	ax
  5595                                  		;xor	ax, ax
  5596                                  		;mov	ds, ax
  5597                                  		;pop	ax
  5598                                  	
  5599                                  ; 02/10/2022
  5600                                  ; ------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  5601                                  ; Note: Retro DOS v4.0 Kernel does not use/contain MSLOAD part of IO.SYS (5.0)
  5602                                  ; 	Because, Retro DOS v2 boot sector loads complete/entire MSDOS.SYS
  5603                                  ;	(RETRODOS.SYS) Kernel file (IO.SYS & MSDOS.SYS together).
  5604                                  ;	As result of boot sector ve init differences, Retro DOS init code (here)
  5605                                  ;	moves kernel to segment 070h at first, then sets diskette parameters
  5606                                  ;	at segment 50h (while MSDOS 5.0 boot sector sets this).
  5607                                  ; ------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  5608                                  
  5609                                  ; msload will check the extended boot record and set ax, bx accordingly.
  5610                                  
  5611                                  ;	msload passes a 32 bit sector number hi word in ax and low in bx
  5612                                  ;	save this in cs:bios_h and cs:bios_l. this is for the start of
  5613                                  ;	data sector of the bios.
  5614                                  
  5615 000015EF 2EA3[4A15]              		mov	[cs:bios_h], ax	; (start of) dos bios (IO.SYS) data sector
  5616 000015F3 2E891E[4815]            		mov	[cs:bios_l], bx
  5617                                  
  5618                                  ; with the following information from msload, we don't need the
  5619                                  ;     boot sector any more.-> this will solve the problem of 29 kb size
  5620                                  ;     limitation of msbio.com file.
  5621                                  
  5622 000015F8 0E                      		push	cs		; Save a peck of interrupt vectors...
  5623 000015F9 07                      		pop	es
  5624 000015FA 51                      		push	cx
  5625 000015FB 57                      		push	di
  5626                                  
  5627                                  		; 21/12/2022
  5628                                  		; ds = 0 (?)
  5629                                  		; 24/12/2022
  5630                                  		; ds = cs
  5631 000015FC 31C9                    		xor	cx, cx
  5632 000015FE 8ED9                    		mov	ds, cx
  5633                                  		; ds = 0
  5634                                  
  5635 00001600 B105                    		mov	cl, 5
  5636                                  		;mov	cx, 5		; NUMROMVECTORS
  5637                                  					; no. of rom vectors to	be saved
  5638                                  		;mov	si, offset RomVectors ; point to list of int vectors
  5639 00001602 BE[0001]                		mov	si, RomVectors
  5640                                  next_int_:		
  5641 00001605 2E                      		cs	; 16/10/2022
  5642 00001606 AC                      		lodsb		
  5643                                  		;lods	byte ptr cs:[si] ; cs lodsb
  5644 00001607 98                      		cbw			; ax = interrupt number
  5645 00001608 D1E0                    		shl	ax, 1
  5646 0000160A D1E0                    		shl	ax, 1		; int no * 4
  5647 0000160C 89C7                    		mov	di, ax		; interrupt vector address
  5648 0000160E 87F7                    		xchg	si, di		; rombios interrupt vector address in si
  5649                                  					; saving address in di
  5650 00001610 AD                      		lodsw			; movsw
  5651 00001611 AB                      		stosw
  5652 00001612 AD                      		lodsw			; movsw
  5653 00001613 AB                      		stosw			; save the vector
  5654 00001614 87F7                    		xchg	si, di
  5655 00001616 E2ED                    		loop	next_int_
  5656 00001618 5F                      		pop	di
  5657 00001619 59                      		pop	cx
  5658                                  
  5659                                  ; we need to save int13 in two places in case we are running on an at.
  5660                                  ; on ats we install the ibm supplied rom_bios patch which hooks
  5661                                  ; int13 ahead of orig13. since int19 must unhook int13 to point to the
  5662                                  ; rom int13 routine, we must have that rom address also stored away.
  5663                                  
  5664                                  		; 21/12/2022
  5665                                  		;mov	ax, [cs:Old13]	; save old13 in orig13 also
  5666                                  		;mov	[cs:Orig13], ax
  5667                                  		;mov	ax, [cs:Old13+2]
  5668                                  		;mov	[cs:Orig13+2], ax
  5669                                  
  5670                                  		; 16/10/2022
  5671 0000161A C7064C00[1407]          		mov	word [13h*4], block13
  5672                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:4Ch, offset	block13	; 13h*4
  5673                                  					; set up int 13	for new	action
  5674 00001620 8C0E4E00                		mov	[13h*4+2], cs
  5675                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:4Eh, cs ; 13h*4+2
  5676 00001624 C7065400[C007]          		mov	word [15h*4], Int15
  5677                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:54h, offset	Int15 ;	15h*4
  5678                                  					; set up int 15	for new	action
  5679 0000162A 8C0E5600                		mov	[15h*4+2], cs
  5680                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:56h, cs ; 15h*4+2
  5681 0000162E C7066400[8007]          		mov	word [19h*4], int19
  5682                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:64h, offset	int19 ;	19h*4
  5683                                  					; set up int 19	for new	action
  5684 00001634 8C0E6600                		mov	[19h*4+2], cs
  5685                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:66h, cs ; 19h*4+2
  5686                                  
  5687                                  		; 21/12/2022
  5688 00001638 0E                      		push	cs
  5689 00001639 1F                      		pop	ds
  5690                                  		
  5691 0000163A A1[0601]                		mov	ax, [Old13]	; save old13 in orig13 also
  5692 0000163D A3[B400]                		mov	[Orig13], ax
  5693 00001640 A1[0801]                		mov	ax, [Old13+2]
  5694 00001643 A3[B600]                		mov	[Orig13+2], ax
  5695                                  					; ;
  5696 00001646 FB                      		sti
  5697 00001647 CD11                    		int	11h		; EQUIPMENT DETERMINATION
  5698                                  					; Return: AX = equipment flag bits
  5699                                  
  5700                                  ; we have to support a system that does not have any diskette
  5701                                  ; drives but only hardfiles. this system will ipl from the hardfile.
  5702                                  ; if the equipment flag bit 0 is 1, then the system has diskette drive(s).
  5703                                  ; otherwise, the system has only hardfiles.
  5704                                  ;
  5705                                  ; important thing is that still, for compatibility reason, the drive letter
  5706                                  ; for the hardfiles start from "c".  so, we still need to allocate dummy bds
  5707                                  ; drive a and drive b. at sysinit time, we are going to set cds table entry
  5708                                  ; of dpb pointer for these drives to 0, so any user attempt to access this
  5709                                  ; drives will get "invalid drive letter ..." message. we are going to
  5710                                  ; establish "fakefloppydrv" flag. ***sysinit module should call int 11h to
  5711                                  ; determine whether there are any diskette drivers in the system or not.!!!***
  5712                                  
  5713                                  ; check the register returned by the equipment determination interrupt
  5714                                  ; we have to handle the case of no diskettes in the system by faking
  5715                                  ; two dummy drives.
  5716                                  ;
  5717                                  ; if the register indicates that we do have floppy drives we don't need
  5718                                  ; to do anything special.
  5719                                  ;
  5720                                  ; if the register indicates that we don't have any floppy drives then
  5721                                  ; what we need to do is set the fakefloppydrv variable, change the
  5722                                  ; register to say that we do have floppy drives and then go to execute
  5723                                  ; the code which starts at notsingle. this is because we can skip the
  5724                                  ; code given below which tries to find if there are one or two drives
  5725                                  ; since we already know about this.
  5726                                  
  5727                                  		; 12/12/2022
  5728 00001649 A801                    		test	al, 1
  5729                                  		;test	ax, 1		; floppy drives	present	?
  5730 0000164B 752C                    		jnz	short normalfloppydrv ;	yes.
  5731                                  
  5732                                  ; Some ROM BIOSs lie that there are no floppy drives. Lets find out
  5733                                  ; whether it is an old ROM BIOS or a new one
  5734                                  ;
  5735                                  ; WARNING !!!
  5736                                  ;
  5737                                  ; This sequence of code is present in SYSINIT1.ASM also. Any modification
  5738                                  ; here will require an equivalent modification in SYSINIT1.ASM also
  5739                                  
  5740 0000164D 50                      		push	ax
  5741 0000164E 53                      		push	bx
  5742 0000164F 51                      		push	cx
  5743 00001650 52                      		push	dx
  5744 00001651 57                      		push	di
  5745 00001652 06                      		push	es
  5746 00001653 B408                    		mov	ah, 8
  5747 00001655 B200                    		mov	dl, 0
  5748 00001657 CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - DISK -	GET CURRENT DRIVE PARAMETERS (XT,AT,XT286,CONV,PS)
  5749                                  					; DL = drive number
  5750                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status code, BL	= drive	type
  5751                                  					; DL = number of consecutive drives
  5752                                  					; DH = maximum value for head number, ES:DI -> drive parameter
  5753 00001659 7204                    		jb	short _gdskp_error
  5754                                  		;mov	[cs:flp_drvs], dl
  5755                                  		; 21/12/2022
  5756                                  		; ds = cs
  5757 0000165B 8816[ED15]              		mov	[flp_drvs], dl
  5758                                  _gdskp_error:				
  5759 0000165F 07                      		pop	es
  5760 00001660 5F                      		pop	di
  5761 00001661 5A                      		pop	dx
  5762 00001662 59                      		pop	cx
  5763 00001663 5B                      		pop	bx
  5764 00001664 58                      		pop	ax
  5765 00001665 7212                    		jb	short normalfloppydrv
  5766                                  					; if error it is an old ROM BIOS
  5767                                  					; so, lets assume that ROM BIOS lied
  5768                                  
  5769                                  		; 21/12/2022
  5770                                  		;cmp	byte [cs:flp_drvs], 0 ; number of drvs == 0?
  5771                                  		;jz	short _set_fake_flpdrv
  5772                                  		;mov	al, [cs:flp_drvs]
  5773 00001667 A0[ED15]                		mov	al, [flp_drvs]
  5774 0000166A 08C0                    		or	al, al		; number of drvs == 0?
  5775 0000166C 7403                    		jz	short _set_fake_flpdrv
  5776                                  
  5777                                  		;dec	al		; make it zero based
  5778                                  		; 18/12/2022
  5779 0000166E 48                      		dec	ax
  5780 0000166F EB0C                    		jmp	short got_num_flp_drvs
  5781                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  5782                                  
  5783                                  _set_fake_flpdrv:
  5784                                  		; 21/12/2022
  5785 00001671 B80100                  		mov	ax, 1			
  5786 00001674 A2[5D15]                		mov	[fakefloppydrv], al ; 1
  5787                                  		;mov	byte [cs:fakefloppydrv], 1
  5788                                  		;			; we don't have any floppy drives.
  5789                                  		;mov	ax, 1
  5790 00001677 EB09                    		jmp	short settwodrive ; well then set it for two drives!
  5791                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  5792                                  
  5793                                  normalfloppydrv:			; yes, bit 0 is 1.

  6125                                  ; 02/06/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
  6126                                  
  6127                                  ;**************************************************************
  6128                                  ;	will initialize the number of drives
  6129                                  ;	after the equipment call (int 11h) bits 6&7 will tell
  6130                                  ;	the indications are as follows:
  6131                                  ;
  6132                                  ;	bits	7	6	drives
  6133                                  ;		0	0	1
  6134                                  ;		0	1	2
  6135                                  ;		1	0	3

  6173 00001809 0E                      		push	cs

  6175                                  
  6176                                  ; scan the list of drives to determine their type. we have three flavors of
  6177                                  ; diskette drives:
  6178                                  ;
  6179                                  ;   48tpi drives    we do nothing special for them
  6180                                  ;   96tpi drives    mark the fact that they have changeline support.
  6181                                  ;   3.5"  drives    mark changeline support and small.
  6182                                  ;
  6183                                  ; the following code uses registers for certain values:
  6184                                  ;
  6185                                  ;   dl - physical drive
  6186                                  ;   ds:di - points to current bds
  6187                                  ;   cx - flag bits for bds

  6528                                  ;we now decide, based on the configurations available so far, what
  6529                                  ;code or data we need to keep as a stay resident code. the following table

  6531                                  ;of their current position memory.

  6533                                  ;configuration will be done in two ways:
  6534                                  ;
  6535                                  ;first, we are going to set "static configuration". static configuration will
  6536                                  ;consider from basic configuration to endof96tpi configuration. the result
  6537                                  ;of static configuration will be the address the dynamic configuration will
  6538                                  ;use to start with.

  6543                                  ;code individually. after these operation, [dosdatasg] will be set.
  6544                                  ;this will be the place sysinit routine will relocate msdos module for good.

  6617                                  ; On certain systems with Western Digital disk controllers, the
  6618                                  ; following detection scheme caused an unpredictable and serious
  6619                                  ; failure. In particular, they've implemented a nonstandard
  6620                                  ; Int13(ah=16h) which reconfigures the hard drive, depending on
  6621                                  ; what happens to be at es:[bx] and other memory locations indexed
  6622                                  ; off of it.
  6623                                  ;
  6624                                  ; Compaq was unable to tell us exactly which kind of systems have
  6625                                  ; the bug, except that they guarantee that the bug was fixed in
  6626                                  ; ROM BIOSs dated 08/04/86 and later. We'll check for the COMPAQ
  6627                                  ; string, and then look for date codes before 08/04/86 to decide
  6628                                  ; when to install the hook.

  6919                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E ========================================
  6920                                  
  6921                                  ; Following are subroutines to support resident device driver initialization
  6922                                  ;
  6923                                  ;M011 -- note:  deleted setup_bdsms and reset_bdsms here
  6924                                  
  6925                                  ;	M035 -- begin changed section
  6926                                  
  6927                                  ;******************************************************************************
  6928                                  ; module name: remap
  6929                                  ;
  6930                                  ; descriptive name: all the code for himem that could be separated from msbio
  6931                                  ;
  6932                                  ; function:  remap the bds chain to adjusted logical drive numbers (drive
  6933                                  ;	     letters) if more than two diskette drives on the system.
  6934                                  ;
  6935                                  ;     scheme:  if more than 2 diskette drives, first map the bds structure
  6936                                  ;	       as usual and then rescan the bds chain to adjust the drive
  6937                                  ;	       letters. to do this, scan for disk drives and assign logical
  6938                                  ;	       drive number starting from 2 and then rescan diskette drives
  6939                                  ;	       and assign next to the last logical drive number of last disk
  6940                                  ;	       drive to the 3rd and 4th diskette drives.
  6941                                  
  6942                                  ; input:       none
  6943                                  ; exit:	drive letters have been remapped in bds chain
  6944                                  ; exit error:  none
  6945                                  ; called from: msinit
  6946                                  ;
  6947                                  ; notes:  this function  will be called only if more than 2 diskettes are
  6948                                  ;	  found in the system
  6949                                  ;	  this function assumes that there are no more than 26 drives assigned
  6950                                  ;	    this is guaranteed by the code that creates bdss for partitions
  6951                                  ;	  this function assumes that the first entries in the chain are
  6952                                  ;	   floppy drives, and all the rest are hard drives
  6953                                  ;	  will alter the boot drive if necessary to reflect remapping
  6954                                  ;
  6955                                  ;******************************************************************************
  6956                                  
  6957                                  ; 17/10/2022
  6958                                  ; 02/10/2022
  6959                                  
  6960                                  remap:		; proc near		
  6961 00001AD4 2E8B3E[1901]            		mov	di, [cs:start_bds] ; get first bds
  6962                                  
  6963                                  ; search for 1st fixed disk physical drive num
  6964                                  
  6965                                  drive_loop:				
  6966 00001AD9 807D0480                		cmp	byte [di+4], 80h ; [di+BDS.drivenum]
  6967                                  					; first	hard disk??
  6968 00001ADD 7409                    		jz	short fdrv_found ; yes,	continue
  6969 00001ADF 8B3D                    		mov	di, [di]	; [di+BDS.link]
  6970                                  					; get next bds,	assume segment
  6971 00001AE1 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, -1		; last bds?
  6972 00001AE4 75F3                    		jnz	short drive_loop ; loop	if not
  6973 00001AE6 EB4F                    		jmp	short rmap_exit	; yes, no hard drive on	system
  6974                                  
  6975                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6976                                  ;first disk drive bds, now change the logical drive num to 2 and the subsequent
  6977                                  ;logical drive nums to 3, 4, 5 etc.
  6978                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6979                                  
  6980                                  fdrv_found:				
  6981 00001AE8 B002                    		mov	al, 2		; start	with logical drv num=2
  6982                                  fdrv_loop:				
  6983 00001AEA 884505                  		mov	[di+5],	al	; [di+BDS.drivelet]
  6984                                  					; found	??
  6985 00001AED 8B3D                    		mov	di, [di]	; [di+BDS.link]
  6986                                  					; ds:di--> next	bds
  6987                                  		;inc	al		; set num for next drive
  6988                                  		; 18/12/2022
  6989 00001AEF 40                      		inc	ax
  6990 00001AF0 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh	; last hard drive ??
  6991 00001AF3 75F5                    		jnz	short fdrv_loop	; no - assign more disk	drives
  6992                                  
  6993                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6994                                  ; now, rescan and find bds of 3rd floppy drive and assign next drive letter
  6995                                  ; in al to 3rd. if the current drive letter is past z, then do not allocate
  6996                                  ; any more.
  6997                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6998                                  
  6999 00001AF5 2E8B3E[1901]            		mov	di, [cs:start_bds] ; [start_bds]
  7000                                  					; get first bds
  7001 00001AFA 8B3D                    		mov	di, [di]	; [di+BDS.link]
  7002                                  					; ds:di-->bds2
  7003 00001AFC 2E8A26[2501]            		mov	ah, [cs:dsktnum] ; get number of floppies to remap
  7004 00001B01 80EC02                  		sub	ah, 2		; adjust for a:	& b:
  7005                                  remap_loop1:				
  7006 00001B04 8B3D                    		mov	di, [di]	; [di+BDS.link]
  7007                                  					; set new num to next floppy
  7008 00001B06 884505                  		mov	[di+5],	al	; [di+BDS.drivelet]
  7009 00001B09 FEC0                    		inc	al		; new number for next floppy
  7010 00001B0B FECC                    		dec	ah		; count	down extra floppies
  7011 00001B0D 75F5                    		jnz	short remap_loop1
  7012                                  
  7013                                  ; now we've got to adjust the boot drive if we reassigned it
  7014                                  
  7015 00001B0F 2EA0[4615]              		mov	al, [cs:drvfat]
  7016 00001B13 3C02                    		cmp	al, 2		; is it	a: or b: ?
  7017 00001B15 7220                    		jb	short rmap_exit
  7018 00001B17 2E2A06[2501]            		sub	al, [cs:dsktnum] ; is it one of the other floppies?
  7019 00001B1C 7204                    		jb	short remap_boot_flop ;	brif so
  7020                                  
  7021                                  ; we've got to remap the boot hard drive
  7022                                  ; subtract the number of EXTRA floppies from it
  7023                                  
  7024 00001B1E 0402                    		add	al, 2		; bootdrv -= (dsktnum-2)
  7025 00001B20 EB05                    		jmp	short remap_change_boot_drv
  7026                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7027                                  
  7028                                  ; we've got to remap the boot floppy.
  7029                                  ; add the number of hard drive partitions to it
  7030                                  
  7031                                  remap_boot_flop:			
  7032 00001B22 2E0206[7500]            		add	al, [cs:drvmax]	; bootdrv += (drvmax-dsktnum)
  7033                                  remap_change_boot_drv:			
  7034 00001B27 2EA2[4615]              		mov	[cs:drvfat], al ; alter msdos.sys load drive
  7035 00001B2B FEC0                    		inc	al
  7036 00001B2D 1E                      		push	ds
  7037 00001B2E BF4104                  		mov	di, SYSINITSEG	; 46Dh
  7038                                  		;mov	di, 46Dh	; SYSINIT segment
  7039 00001B31 8EDF                    		mov	ds, di
  7040 00001B33 A2[9802]                		mov	[DEFAULTDRIVE], al
  7041                                  		;mov	ds:296h, al	; [SYSINIT+DEFAULT_DRIVE]
  7042                                  					; pass it to sysinit as	well
  7043 00001B36 1F                      		pop	ds
  7044                                  rmap_exit:				
  7045 00001B37 C3                      		retn
  7046                                  
  7047                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  7048                                  
  7049                                  ; 17/10/2022
  7050                                  ; 02/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 5.0 -actual-)
  7051                                  ; 28/12/2018 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.21 -draft-)
  7052                                  ; 02/06/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0 (MSDOS 3.3)	
  7053                                  ; 19/03/2018 - Retro DOS v2.0 (MSDOS 2.11)
  7054                                  ;**************************************************
  7055                                  ; getboot - get the boot sector for a hard disk
  7056                                  ;
  7057                                  ; Reads the boot sector from a specified drive into
  7058                                  ; a buffer at the top of memory.
  7059                                  ;
  7060                                  ; dl = int13 drive number to read boot sector for
  7061                                  ;**************************************************
  7062                                  
  7063                                  ; 17/10/2022
  7064                                  bootbias equ 200h
  7065                                  
  7066                                  getboot:	; proc near		
  7067                                  		
  7068                                  		; 08/04/2018
  7069                                  		; Retro DOS v2.0 (IBMBIO.COM, IBMDOS 2.1)
  7070                                  		; 28/03/2018 - MSDOS 6.0 - MSINIT.ASM, 1991
  7071                                  		; 02/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0
  7072                                  		;	      (disassembled IO.SYS code of MSDOS 5.0)
  7073                                  
  7074 00001B38 2EA1[5115]              		mov	ax, [cs:init_bootseg] ; 17/10/2022
  7075 00001B3C 8EC0                    		mov	es, ax
  7076                                  		; 17/10/2022
  7077 00001B3E BB0002                  		mov	bx, bootbias ; 200h
  7078                                  		;mov	bx, 200h	; bootbias
  7079                                  					; load BX, ES:BX is where sector goes
  7080 00001B41 B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h
  7081 00001B44 30F6                    		xor	dh, dh
  7082 00001B46 B90100                  		mov	cx, 1
  7083 00001B49 CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - READ SECTORS INTO MEMORY
  7084                                  					; AL = number of sectors to read, CH = track, CL = sector
  7085                                  					; DH = head, DL	= drive, ES:BX -> buffer to fill
  7086                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status,	AL = number of sectors read
  7087 00001B4B 7209                    		jb	short erret
  7088                                  		; 17/10/2022
  7089 00001B4D 26813EFE0355AA          		cmp	word [es:bootbias+1FEh], 0AA55h
  7090                                  		;cmp	word ptr es:3FEh, 0AA55h ; [es:bootbias+1FEh]
  7091                                  					; Dave Litton magic word?
  7092 00001B54 7401                    		jz	short norm_ret	; yes
  7093                                  erret:					
  7094 00001B56 F9                      		stc
  7095                                  norm_ret:				
  7096 00001B57 C3                      		retn
  7097                                  
  7098                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  7099                                  
  7100                                  ; 28/12/2018 - Retro DOS v4.0 
  7101                                  
  7102                                  ;***************************************************************************
  7103                                  ;   sethard - generate bpb for a variable sized hard file. ibm has a
  7104                                  ;   partitioned hard file; we must read physical sector 0 to determine where
  7105                                  ;   our own logical sectors start. we also read in our boot sector to
  7106                                  ;   determine version number
  7107                                  ;
  7108                                  ;   inputs:	dl is rom drive number (80...)
  7109                                  ;		bh is partition number (0....) 
  7110                                  ;		ds:di points to bds
  7111                                  ;   outputs:	carry clear -> bpb is filled in
  7112                                  ;		carry set   -> bpb is left uninitialized due to error
  7113                                  ;	trashes (at least) si, cx
  7114                                  ;	MUST PRESERVE ES:!!!!
  7115                                  ;***************************************************************************
  7116                                  
  7117                                  sethard:	; proc near
  7118                                  		; 12/08/2023
  7119                                  		; ds = cs = BIOSDATA
  7120 00001B58 57                      		push	di
  7121 00001B59 53                      		push	bx
  7122                                  		;push	ds  ; ds = cs = BIOSDATA ; 12/08/2023
  7123 00001B5A 06                      		push	es
  7124 00001B5B 885D05                  		mov	[di+5],	bl	; [di+BDS.drivelet]
  7125 00001B5E 885504                  		mov	[di+4],	dl	; [di+BDS.drivenum]
  7126 00001B61 804D2301                		or	byte [di+23h], 1 ; [di+BDS.flags]
  7127                                  					; fnon_removable
  7128 00001B65 C6452205                		mov	byte [di+22h], 5 ; [di+BDS.formfactor]
  7129                                  					; ffHardFile
  7130 00001B69 C606[4E15]00            		mov	byte [fbigfat], 0 ; assume 12 bit FAT
  7131 00001B6E 88FE                    		mov	dh, bh		; partition number
  7132 00001B70 52                      		push	dx
  7133 00001B71 B408                    		mov	ah, 8
  7134 00001B73 CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - DISK -	GET CURRENT DRIVE PARAMETERS (XT,AT,XT286,CONV,PS)
  7135                                  					; DL = drive number
  7136                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status code, BL	= drive	type
  7137                                  					; DL = number of consecutive drives
  7138                                  					; DH = maximum value for head number, ES:DI -> drive parameter
  7139 00001B75 FEC6                    		inc	dh
  7140 00001B77 887515                  		mov	[di+15h], dh	; [di+BDS.heads] ; get number of heads
  7141 00001B7A 5A                      		pop	dx
  7142 00001B7B 7263                    		jb	short setret	; error	if no hard disk
  7143 00001B7D 80E13F                  		and	cl, 3Fh
  7144 00001B80 884D13                  		mov	[di+13h], cl	; [di+BDS.secpertrack]
  7145 00001B83 52                      		push	dx		; save partition number
  7146 00001B84 E8B1FF                  		call	getboot
  7147 00001B87 5A                      		pop	dx		; restore partition number
  7148 00001B88 7256                    		jb	short setret
  7149 00001B8A BBC203                  		mov	bx, 3C2h	; 1C2h+bootbias
  7150                                  
  7151                                  ; The first 'active' partition is 00, the second is 01....
  7152                                  ;   then the remainder of the 'primary' but non-active partitions
  7153                                  
  7154                                  act_part:
  7155 00001B8D 26F647FC80              		test	byte [es:bx-4], 80h ; is the partition active?
  7156 00001B92 7418                    		jz	short no_act	; no
  7157 00001B94 26803F01                		cmp	byte [es:bx], 1 ; reject if partitiontype != 1, 4 or 6
  7158 00001B98 740C                    		jz	short got_good_act
  7159 00001B9A 26803F04                		cmp	byte [es:bx], 4
  7160 00001B9E 7406                    		jz	short got_good_act
  7161 00001BA0 26803F06                		cmp	byte [es:bx], 6
  7162 00001BA4 7506                    		jnz	short no_act
  7163                                  got_good_act:				; 11/08/2023
  7164 00001BA6 08F6                    		or	dh, dh		; is this our target partition #?
  7165                                  					; (0 = first primary dos or active partition)
  7166 00001BA8 743A                    		jz	short set2	; WE GOT THE ONE WANTED!!
  7167 00001BAA FECE                    		dec	dh		; count	down
  7168                                  no_act:					
  7169 00001BAC 83C310                  		add	bx, 16
  7170 00001BAF 81FB0204                		cmp	bx, 402h	; 202h+bootbias
  7171                                  					; last entry done?
  7172 00001BB3 75D8                    		jnz	short act_part	; no, process next entry
  7173 00001BB5 BBC203                  		mov	bx, 3C2h	; 1C2h+bootbias
  7174                                  					; restore original value of bx
  7175                                  
  7176                                  ; Now scan the non-active partitions
  7177                                  
  7178                                  get_primary:
  7179 00001BB8 26F647FC80              		test	byte [es:bx-4], 80h
  7180 00001BBD 7518                    		jnz	short not_prim	; we've already scanned
  7181                                  					; the ACTIVE ones
  7182 00001BBF 26803F01                		cmp	byte [es:bx], 1 ; see if partitiontype == 1, 4 or 6
  7183 00001BC3 740C                    		jz	short got_prim
  7184 00001BC5 26803F04                		cmp	byte [es:bx], 4
  7185 00001BC9 7406                    		jz	short got_prim
  7186 00001BCB 26803F06                		cmp	byte [es:bx], 6
  7187 00001BCF 7506                    		jnz	short not_prim
  7188                                  got_prim:
  7189 00001BD1 08F6                    		or	dh, dh		; is this our target partition?
  7190 00001BD3 740F                    		jz	short set2
  7191 00001BD5 FECE                    		dec	dh
  7192                                  not_prim:
  7193 00001BD7 83C310                  		add	bx, 16
  7194 00001BDA 81FB0204                		cmp	bx, 402h	; 202h+bootbias
  7195 00001BDE 75D8                    		jnz	short get_primary ; loop till we've gone through table
  7196                                  setret:					
  7197 00001BE0 F9                      		stc			; error	return
  7198 00001BE1 E99A02                  		jmp	ret_hard_err
  7199                                  
  7200                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7201                                  
  7202                                  ;  until we get the real logical boot record and get the bpb,
  7203                                  ;  BDS_BPB.BPB_BIGTOTALSECTORS will be used instead of BDS_BPB.BPB_TOTALSECTORS
  7204                                  ;  for the convenience of the computation.
  7205                                  ;
  7206                                  ;  at the end of this procedure, if a bpb information is gotten from
  7207                                  ;  the valid boot record, then we are going to use those bpb information
  7208                                  ;  without change.
  7209                                  ;
  7210                                  ;  otherwise, if (hidden sectors + total sectors) <= a word, then we will move
  7211                                  ;  BDS_BPB.BPB_BIGTOTALSECTORS (low) to BDS_BPB.BPB_TOTALSECTORS and zero out
  7212                                  ;  BDS_BPB.BPB_BIGTOTALSECTORS entry to make it a conventional bpb format.
  7213                                  
  7214                                  set2:		
  7215                                  		; 12/08/2023
  7216                                  		; ds = cs = BIOSDATA segment (0070h)
  7217 00001BE4 8816[5315]              		mov	[rom_drv_num], dl
  7218                                  		;mov	[cs:rom_drv_num], dl
  7219                                  			; save the rom bios drive number we are handling now.
  7220 00001BE8 268B4704                		mov	ax, [es:bx+4]	; hidden sectors (start	sector)
  7221 00001BEC 268B5706                		mov	dx, [es:bx+6]
  7222                                  
  7223                                  ; decrement the sector count by 1 to make it zero based. exactly 64k
  7224                                  ; sectors should be allowed	
  7225                                  
  7226 00001BF0 83E801                  		sub	ax, 1
  7227 00001BF3 83DA00                  		sbb	dx, 0
  7228 00001BF6 26034708                		add	ax, [es:bx+8]	; sectors in partition
  7229 00001BFA 2613570A                		adc	dx, [es:bx+10]
  7230 00001BFE 7305                    		jnb	short okdrive
  7231 00001C00 800E[4E15]80            		or	byte [fbigfat], 80h ; ftoobig
  7232                                  okdrive:
  7233 00001C05 268B4704                		mov	ax, [es:bx+4]
  7234 00001C09 894517                  		mov	[di+17h], ax	; [di+BDS.hiddensecs]
  7235                                  					; BPB_HIDDENSECTORS = p->partitionbegin
  7236 00001C0C 268B4706                		mov	ax, [es:bx+6]
  7237 00001C10 894519                  		mov	[di+19h], ax	; [di+BDS.hiddensecs+2]
  7238 00001C13 268B570A                		mov	dx, [es:bx+10]	; # of sectors (high)
  7239 00001C17 268B4708                		mov	ax, [es:bx+8]	; # of sectors (low)
  7240 00001C1B 89551D                  		mov	[di+1Dh], dx	; [di+BDS.totalsecs32+2]
  7241 00001C1E 89451B                  		mov	[di+1Bh], ax	; [di+BDS.totalsecs32]
  7242                                  					; bpb->maxsec =	p->partitionlength
  7243 00001C21 83FA00                  		cmp	dx, 0
  7244 00001C24 7705                    		ja	short okdrive_1
  7245 00001C26 83F840                  		cmp	ax, 64		; if (p->partitionlength < 64)
  7246 00001C29 72B5                    		jb	short setret	; return -1;
  7247                                  okdrive_1:
  7248 00001C2B 8B5519                  		mov	dx, [di+19h]	; [di+BDS.hiddensecs+2]
  7249 00001C2E 8B4517                  		mov	ax, [di+17h]	; [di+BDS.hiddensecs]
  7250 00001C31 31DB                    		xor	bx, bx		; boot sector number - for mini	disk
  7251                                  					; usually equal	to the # of sec/trk.
  7252 00001C33 8A5D13                  		mov	bl, [di+13h]	; [di+BDS.secpertrack]
  7253 00001C36 50                      		push	ax
  7254 00001C37 89D0                    		mov	ax, dx
  7255 00001C39 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
  7256 00001C3B F7F3                    		div	bx		; (sectors)dx:ax / (BDS.secpertrack)bx =
  7257                                  					; (track)temp_h:ax + (sector)dx
  7258                                  		; 17/10/2022
  7259                                  		;mov	[cs:temp_h], ax
  7260                                  		; 12/08/2023 (ds=cs)
  7261 00001C3D A3[C104]                		mov	[temp_h], ax
  7262 00001C40 58                      		pop	ax
  7263 00001C41 F7F3                    		div	bx
  7264 00001C43 88D1                    		mov	cl, dl
  7265 00001C45 FEC1                    		inc	cl
  7266 00001C47 31DB                    		xor	bx, bx
  7267 00001C49 8A5D15                  		mov	bl, [di+15h]	; [di+BDS.heads]
  7268 00001C4C 50                      		push	ax
  7269 00001C4D 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
  7270                                  		;mov	ax, [cs:temp_h]
  7271 00001C4F A1[C104]                		mov	ax, [temp_h] ; 12/08/2023
  7272 00001C52 F7F3                    		div	bx
  7273                                  		;mov	[cs:temp_h], ax
  7274 00001C54 A3[C104]                		mov	[temp_h], ax ; 12/08/2023
  7275 00001C57 58                      		pop	ax
  7276 00001C58 F7F3                    		div	bx		; dl is head, ax is cylinder
  7277                                  		; 12/08/2023 (ds=cs)
  7278 00001C5A 833E[C104]00            		cmp	word [temp_h], 0
  7279                                  		;cmp	word [cs:temp_h], 0
  7280 00001C5F 775F                    		ja	short setret_brdg ; exceeds the	limit of int 13h
  7281 00001C61 3D0004                  		cmp	ax, 1024
  7282 00001C64 775A                    		ja	short setret_brdg ; exceeds the	limit of int 13h
  7283                                  			; Retro DOS v3.2 note by Erdogan Tan - 28/07/2019
  7284                                  			; **MSDOS code accepts if ax = 1024 but it is nonsense here
  7285                                  			; ('ja' must be 'jnb')
  7286                                  okdrive_2:
  7287                                   		; 28/07/2019
  7288                                  ; dl is head.
  7289                                  ; ax is cylinder
  7290                                  ; cl is sector number (assume less than 2**6 = 64 for int 13h)
  7291                                  
  7292                                  ;*** for mini disks ***
  7293                                  
  7294 00001C66 837D4701                		cmp	word [di+47h], 1 ; [di+BDS.bdsm_ismini]
  7295                                  					; check for mini disk
  7296 00001C6A 7503                    		jnz	short oknotmini	; not mini disk.
  7297 00001C6C 034549                  		add	ax, [di+49h]	; [di+BDS.bdsm_hidden_trks]
  7298                                  					; set the physical track number
  7299                                  oknotmini:
  7300                                  ;*** end of added logic for mini disk
  7301                                  				
  7302 00001C6F D0CC                    		ror	ah, 1		; move high two bits of cyl to high
  7303 00001C71 D0CC                    		ror	ah, 1		; two bits of upper byte
  7304 00001C73 80E4C0                  		and	ah, 0C0h	; turn off remainder of bits
  7305 00001C76 08E1                    		or	cl, ah		; move two bits to correct spot
  7306 00001C78 88C5                    		mov	ch, al		; ch iscylinder (low 8 bits)
  7307                                  					; cl is sector + 2 high bits of cylinder
  7308 00001C7A 88D6                    		mov	dh, dl		; dh is	head
  7309                                  		
  7310                                  		; 12/08/2023 (ds=cs)
  7311 00001C7C 8A16[5315]              		mov	dl, [rom_drv_num]
  7312                                  		;mov	dl, [cs:rom_drv_num] ; dl is drive number
  7313                                  
  7314                                  ; cl is sector + 2 high bits of cylinder
  7315                                  ; ch is low 8 bits of cylinder
  7316                                  ; dh is head
  7317                                  ; dl is drive
  7318                                  
  7319                                  ; for convenience, we are going to read the logical boot sector
  7320                                  ; into cs:disksector area.
  7321                                  
  7322                                  ; read in boot sector using bios disk interrupt. the buffer where it
  7323                                  ; is to be read in is cs:disksector.
  7324                                  
  7325 00001C80 0E                      		push	cs
  7326 00001C81 07                      		pop	es
  7327 00001C82 BB[5201]                		mov	bx, disksector	; for convenience,
  7328                                  					; we are going to read the logical boot sector
  7329                                  					; into cs:disksector area.
  7330 00001C85 B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h
  7331 00001C88 CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - READ SECTORS INTO MEMORY
  7332                                  					; AL = number of sectors to read, CH = track, CL = sector
  7333                                  					; DH = head, DL	= drive, ES:BX -> buffer to fill
  7334                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status,	AL = number of sectors read
  7335                                  
  7336                                  ; cs:disksec contains the boot sector. in theory, (ha ha) the bpb in this thing
  7337                                  ; is correct. we can, therefore, suck out all the relevant statistics on the
  7338                                  ; media if we recognize the version number.
  7339                                  
  7340                                  		; 11/08/2023
  7341                                  		;mov	bx, disksector	; BIOSDATA:014Eh ; MSDOS 6.21 ; 11/08/2023
  7342                                  					; BIOSDATA:0152h ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM
  7343 00001C8A 53                      		push	bx
  7344 00001C8B 50                      		push	ax
  7345                                  		; 12/08/2023
  7346                                  		; ds = cs = BIOSDATA segment ('disksector:' is in BIOSDATA) 
  7347 00001C8C 803FE9                  		cmp	byte [bx], 0E9h
  7348                                  		;cmp	byte [cs:bx], 0E9h ; is it a near jump?
  7349 00001C8F 740B                    		jz	short check_1_ok ; yes
  7350 00001C91 803FEB                  		cmp	byte [bx], 0EBh
  7351                                  		;cmp	byte [cs:bx], 0EBh ; is it a short jump?
  7352 00001C94 7525                    		jnz	short invalid_boot_record ; no
  7353 00001C96 807F0290                		cmp	byte [bx+2], 90h
  7354                                  		;cmp	byte [cs:bx+2], 90h ; yes, is the next one a nop?
  7355 00001C9A 751F                    		jnz	short invalid_boot_record ; no, invalid bs ; 11/08/2023
  7356                                  check_1_ok:
  7357                                  		; 14/08/2023
  7358 00001C9C BB[5D01]                		mov	bx, disksector+11 ; disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB
  7359                                  		;mov	bx, 159h	; disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB
  7360                                  					; point to the bpb in the boot record
  7361                                  		;mov	al, [cs:bx+10]	; [bx+EBPB.MEDIADESCRIPTOR]
  7362 00001C9F 8A470A                  		mov	al, [bx+10] ; 12/08/2023 
  7363                                  					; get the mediadescriptor byte
  7364 00001CA2 24F0                    		and	al, 0F0h	; mask off low nibble
  7365 00001CA4 3CF0                    		cmp	al, 0F0h	; is high nibble = 0Fh?
  7366 00001CA6 7513                    		jnz	short invalid_boot_record ; no, invalid boot record
  7367                                  		;cmp	word [cs:bx], 512 ; [bx+EBPB.BYTESPERSECTOR]
  7368 00001CA8 813F0002                		cmp	word [bx], 512 ; 12/08/2023
  7369 00001CAC 750D                    		jnz	short invalid_boot_record ; invalidate non 512 byte sectors
  7370                                  
  7371                                  check2_ok:				; yes, mediadescriptor ok.
  7372 00001CAE 8A4702                  		mov	al, [bx+2] ; 12/08/2023
  7373                                  		;mov	al, [cs:bx+2]	; now make sure that
  7374                                  					; the sectorspercluster is
  7375                                  					; a power of 2
  7376                                  					;
  7377                                  					; [bx+EBPB.SECTORSPERCLUSTER]

  7382                                  ck_power_of_two:
  7383 00001CB5 D0E8                    		shr	al, 1		; shift until first bit emerges

  7385 00001CB9 740B                    		jz	short valid_boot_record

  7471                                  
  7472                                  ; 03/10/2022
  7473                                  
  7474                                  ; we have a valid boot sector. use the bpb in it to build the
  7475                                  ; bpb in bios. it is assumed that only
  7476                                  ;	BDS_BPB.BPB_SECTORSPERCLUSTER
  7477                                  ;	BDS_BPB.BPB_ROOTENTRIES, and

  7480

  7482                                  ; into the bpb in bds table, and also set the boot serial number, volume id,
  7483                                  ; and system id according to the boot record.
  7484                                  ; for the non_fat system, don't need to set the other value. so just do goodret.

  7902                                  		; FATsz	= (TmpVal1+(TmpVal2-1))/TmpVal2
  7903                                  		; 8/8/2023 (Retro DOS v5.0)
  7904                                  		; If(FATType == FAT32) {
  7905                                  		;   BPB_FATSz16 = 0;
  7906                                  		;   BPB_FATSz32 = FATSz;
  7907                                  		;} else {

  7910                                  		;}

  7913 00001E3F 83D200                  		adc	dx, 0		; dx:ax = TmpVal1+TmpVal2

  7916

  7920                                  					; ceil((total-dir-res)/(256*BDS.secperclus+2))
