  8279                                  
  8280                                  ; 15/10/2022 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
  8281                                  ; 30/12/2018 - Retro DOS v4.0
  8282                                  ; 03/06/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
  8283                                  ; (19/03/2018 - Retro DOS v2.0)
  8284                                  
  8285                                  ; domini **********************************************************************
  8286                                  ;
  8287                                  ;mini disk initialization routine. called right after dohard
  8288                                  ;modified for >2 hardfile support
  8289                                  ;
  8290                                  ; **cs=ds=es=datagrp
  8291                                  ;
  8292                                  ; **domini will search for every extended partition in the system, and
  8293                                  ;   initialize it.
  8294                                  ;
  8295                                  ; **bdsm stands for bds table for mini disk and located right after the label
  8296                                  ;   end96tpi. end_of_bdsm will have the offset value of the ending
  8297                                  ;   address of bdsm table.
  8298                                  ;
  8299                                  ; **bdsm is the same as usual bds structure except that tim_lo, tim_hi entries
  8300                                  ;   are overlapped and used to identify mini disk and the number of hidden_trks.
  8301                                  ;   right now, they are called as ismini, hidden_trks respectively.
  8302                                  ;
  8303                                  ; **domini will use the same routine in sethard routine after label set2 to
  8304                                  ;   save coding.
  8305                                  ;
  8306                                  ; **drvmax determined in dohard routine will be used for the next
  8307                                  ;   available logical mini disk drive number.
  8308                                  ;
  8309                                  ; input: drvmax, dskdrvs
  8310                                  ;
  8311                                  ; output: minidisk installed. bdsm table established and installed to bds.
  8312                                  ;	  end_of_bdsm - ending offset address of bdsm.
  8313                                  ;
  8314                                  ; called modules:
  8315                                  ;		  getboot
  8316                                  ;		  find_mini_partition (new), xinstall_bds (new), M038
  8317                                  ;
  8318                                  ;		  setmini (new, it will use set2 routine)
  8319                                  ;
  8320                                  ; variables used: end_of_bdsm
  8321                                  ;		  rom_minidisk_num
  8322                                  ;		  mini_hdlim, mini_seclim
  8323                                  ;		  BDS_STRUC, start_bds
  8324                                  ;
  8325                                  ;******************************************************************************
  8326                                  
  8327                                  		; 19/10/2022
  8328                                  domini:	
  8329 00001F8B 8A36[CD15]              		mov	dh, [hnum]	; get number of hardfiles
  8330                                  		; 10/12/2022
  8331 00001F8F 20F6                    		and	dh, dh
  8332                                  		;cmp	dh, 0
  8333 00001F91 7430                    		jz	short dominiret	; no hard file?	then exit.
  8334 00001F93 B280                    		mov	dl, 80h		; start	with hardfile 80h
  8335                                  domini_loop:				
  8336 00001F95 52                      		push	dx
  8337 00001F96 8816[CC15]              		mov	[rom_minidisk_num], dl
  8338 00001F9A B408                    		mov	ah, 8
  8339 00001F9C CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - DISK -	GET CURRENT DRIVE PARAMETERS (XT,AT,XT286,CONV,PS)
  8340                                  					; DL = drive number
  8341                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status code, BL	= drive	type
  8342                                  					; DL = number of consecutive drives
  8343                                  					; DH = maximum value for head number, ES:DI -> drive parameter
  8344                                  		
  8345                                  		; 08/08/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
  8346                                  		; PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - BIOSDATA:2B36h
  8347                                  		;inc	dh
  8348                                  		;xor	ax, ax
  8349                                  		;mov	al, dh
  8350 00001F9E 31C0                    		xor	ax, ax
  8351 00001FA0 88F0                    		mov	al, dh	; <= 255
  8352 00001FA2 40                      		inc	ax	; (0FFh -> 100h)
  8353 00001FA3 A3[D215]                		mov	[mini_hdlim], ax ; # of heads
  8354                                  		;and	cl, 3Fh
  8355                                  		;mov	al, cl
  8356                                  		; 08/08/2023
  8357 00001FA6 88C8                    		mov	al, cl
  8358 00001FA8 83E03F                  		and	ax, 3Fh
  8359 00001FAB A3[D415]                		mov	[mini_seclim], ax ; # of sectors/track
  8360 00001FAE 06                      		push	es
  8361 00001FAF 8A16[CC15]              		mov	dl, [rom_minidisk_num]
  8362 00001FB3 E882FB                  		call	getboot		; read master boot record into
  8363                                  					; initbootsegment:bootbias
  8364 00001FB6 7203                    		jb	short domininext
  8365 00001FB8 E80900                  		call	find_mini_partition
  8366                                  domininext:				
  8367 00001FBB 07                      		pop	es
  8368 00001FBC 5A                      		pop	dx
  8369 00001FBD FEC2                    		inc	dl		; next hard file
  8370 00001FBF FECE                    		dec	dh
  8371 00001FC1 75D2                    		jnz	short domini_loop
  8372                                  dominiret:				
  8373 00001FC3 C3                      		retn
  8374                                  
  8375                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  8376                                  
  8377                                  ; 15/10/2022 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
  8378                                  ; 30/12/2018 - Retro DOS v4.0
  8379                                  
  8380                                  ;find_mini_partition tries to find every extended partition on a disk.
  8381                                  ;at entry:	di -> bdsm entry
  8382                                  ;		es:bx -> 07c0:bootbias - master boot record
  8383                                  ;		rom_minidisk_num - rom drive number
  8384                                  ;		drvmax - logical drive number
  8385                                  ;		mini_hdlim, mini_seclim
  8386                                  ;
  8387                                  ;called routine: setmini which uses set2 (in sethard routine)
  8388                                  ;variables & equates used from original bios - flags, fnon_removable, fbigfat
  8389                                  
  8390                                  
  8391                                  find_mini_partition:	
  8392 00001FC4 81C3C201                		add	bx, 1C2h	; bx ->	file system id
  8393                                  fmpnext:				
  8394 00001FC8 26803F05                		cmp	byte [es:bx], 5 ; 5 = extended partition id.
  8395 00001FCC 740A                    		jz	short fmpgot
  8396 00001FCE 83C310                  		add	bx, 16
  8397 00001FD1 81FB0204                		cmp	bx, 402h	; 202h+bootbias
  8398 00001FD5 75F1                    		jnz	short fmpnext
  8399                                  		;jmp	short fmpnextfound ; extended partition	not found
  8400                                  		; 18/12/2022
  8401                                  fmpnextfound:
  8402 00001FD7 C3                      		retn
  8403                                  
  8404                                  ;		; 30/07/2019 - Retro DOS v3.2
  8405                                  ;		jb	short fmpnext
  8406                                  ;fmpret:
  8407                                  ;		retn	; 29/05/2019
  8408                                  
  8409                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8410                                  
  8411                                  		; 19/10/2022
  8412                                  fmpgot:					; found my partition.				
  8413 00001FD8 E8A500                  		call	dmax_check	; check	for drvmax already 26
  8414 00001FDB 73FA                    		jnb	short fmpnextfound ; done if too many
  8415 00001FDD 8B3E[D015]              		mov	di, [end_of_bdss] ; get next free	bds
  8416 00001FE1 C745470100              		mov	word [di+47h], 1 ; [di+BDS.bdsm_ismini]
  8417                                  		; 10/12/2022
  8418 00001FE6 804D2301                		or	byte [di+23h], 1
  8419                                  		;or	word [di+23h], 1 ; [di+BDS.flags]
  8420                                  					; fNon_Removable
  8421 00001FEA C6452205                		mov	byte [di+22h], 5 ; [di+BDS.formfactor]
  8422                                  					; ffHardFile
  8423 00001FEE C606[4E15]00            		mov	byte [fbigfat], 0 ; assume 12 bit fat.
  8424 00001FF3 A1[D215]                		mov	ax, [mini_hdlim]
  8425 00001FF6 894515                  		mov	[di+15h], ax	; [di+BDS.heads]
  8426 00001FF9 A1[D415]                		mov	ax, [mini_seclim]
  8427 00001FFC 894513                  		mov	[di+13h], ax	; [di+BDS.secpertrack]
  8428 00001FFF A0[CC15]                		mov	al, [rom_minidisk_num]
  8429 00002002 884504                  		mov	[di+4],	al	; [di+BDS.drivenum]
  8430                                  					; set physical number
  8431 00002005 A0[7500]                		mov	al, [drvmax]
  8432 00002008 884505                  		mov	[di+5],	al	; [di+BDS.drivelet]
  8433                                  					; set logical number
  8434 0000200B 26837F0A00              		cmp	word [es:bx+10], 0
  8435 00002010 7707                    		ja	short fmpgot_cont
  8436 00002012 26837F0840              		cmp	word [es:bx+8], 64 ; with current bpb,
  8437                                  					; only lower word is meaningful.
  8438 00002017 72BE                    		jb	short fmpnextfound
  8439                                  					; should be bigger than 64 sectors at least
  8440                                  fmpgot_cont:				
  8441 00002019 83EB04                  		sub	bx, 4		; let bx point to the start of the entry
  8442 0000201C 268A7702                		mov	dh, [es:bx+2]	; cylinder
  8443 00002020 80E6C0                  		and	dh, 0C0h	; get higher bits of cyl
  8444 00002023 D0C6                    		rol	dh, 1
  8445 00002025 D0C6                    		rol	dh, 1
  8446 00002027 268A5703                		mov	dl, [es:bx+3]	; cyl byte
  8447 0000202B 895549                  		mov	[di+49h], dx	; [di+BDS.bdsm_hidden_trks]
  8448                                  					; set hidden trks
  8449 0000202E 268B4F02                		mov	cx, [es:bx+2]	; cylinder,cylinder/sector
  8450 00002032 268A7701                		mov	dh, [es:bx+1]	; head
  8451 00002036 8A16[CC15]              		mov	dl, [rom_minidisk_num]
  8452 0000203A BB0002                  		mov	bx, 200h	; bootbias
  8453 0000203D B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h
  8454 00002040 CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - READ SECTORS INTO MEMORY
  8455                                  					; AL = number of sectors to read, CH = track, CL = sector
  8456                                  					; DH = head, DL	= drive, ES:BX -> buffer to fill
  8457                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status,	AL = number of sectors read
  8458 00002042 7293                    		jb	short fmpnextfound
  8459 00002044 BBC203                  		mov	bx, 3C2h	; 1C2h+bootbias
  8460                                  
  8461                                  		; 08/08/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
  8462                                  		; PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - BIOSDATA:2C7Ch
  8463 00002047 26817F3C55AA            		cmp	word [es:bx+3Ch], 0AA55h ; 03C2h+03Ch = 3FEh
  8464 0000204D 7588                    		jne	short fmpnextfound ; not a valid boot sector !
  8465                                  
  8466                                  		; 13/08/2023
  8467                                  		;push	es
  8468 0000204F E80800                  		call	setmini		; install a mini disk.
  8469                                  					; bx value saved.
  8470                                  		;pop	es  ; 13/08/2023
  8471 00002052 7203                    		jc	short fmpnextchain
  8472 00002054 E83E00                  		call	xinstall_bds	; -- install the bdsm into table
  8473                                  fmpnextchain:
  8474 00002057 E96EFF                  		jmp	fmpnext		; let's find out
  8475                                  					; if we	have any chained partition
  8476                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8477                                  
  8478                                  		; 18/12/2022
  8479                                  ;fmpnextfound:				
  8480                                  		;retn
  8481                                  
  8482                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  8483                                  
  8484                                  ; 15/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
  8485                                  ; 28/12/2018 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.21)
  8486                                  
  8487                                  setmini:	; 'setmini' is called from 'find_mini_partition' procedure
  8488                                  	
  8489 0000205A 57                      		push	di
  8490 0000205B 53                      		push	bx
  8491                                  		; 12/08/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
  8492                                  		; ds = cs = BIOSDATA segment
  8493                                  		;push	ds
  8494 0000205C 06                      		push	es
  8495                                  setmini_1:				
  8496 0000205D 26803F01                		cmp	byte [es:bx], 1 ; FAT12 partition
  8497 00002061 741A                    		jz	short setmini_2
  8498 00002063 26803F04                		cmp	byte [es:bx], 4 ; FAT16 partition
  8499 00002067 7414                    		jz	short setmini_2
  8500 00002069 26803F06                		cmp	byte [es:bx], 6 ; FAT16 BIG partition
  8501 0000206D 740E                    		jz	short setmini_2
  8502 0000206F 83C310                  		add	bx, 16
  8503 00002072 81FB0204                		cmp	bx, 402h	; 202h+bootbias
  8504 00002076 75E5                    		jnz	short setmini_1
  8505 00002078 F9                      		stc
  8506 00002079 07                      		pop	es
  8507                                  		; 12/08/2023
  8508                                  		;pop	ds
  8509 0000207A 5B                      		pop	bx
  8510 0000207B 5F                      		pop	di
  8511 0000207C C3                      		retn
  8512                                  
  8513                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8514                                  setmini_2:
  8515 0000207D E964FB                  		jmp	set2		; branch into middle of sethard
  8516                                  
  8517                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  8518                                  
  8519                                  ; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2
  8520                                  ; (SYSINITSEG is 473h for MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS) 
  8521                                  
  8522                                  ; 15/10/2022
  8523                                  ; 28/12/2018 - Retro DOS v4.0
  8524                                  ;
  8525                                  ; dmax_check --- call this when we want to install a new drive.
  8526                                  ;		it checks for drvmax < 26 to see if there is
  8527                                  ;		a drive letter left.
  8528                                  ;
  8529                                  ;	drvmax < 26 : carry SET!
  8530                                  ;	drvmax >=26 : carry RESET!, error flag set for message later
  8531                                  ;			trash ax
  8532                                  
  8533                                  dmax_check:
  8534 00002080 803E[7500]1A            		cmp	byte [drvmax], 26 ; checks for drvmax < 26
  8535 00002085 720D                    		jb	short dmax_ok	; return with carry if okay
  8536 00002087 06                      		push	es
  8537                                  		;mov	ax, 46Dh	; SYSINIT_SEG (SYSINIT segment)
  8538 00002088 B84104                  		mov	ax, SYSINITSEG	; 17/10/2022	
  8539 0000208B 8EC0                    		mov	es, ax
  8540                                  		; 18/10/2022
  8541 0000208D 26C606[8303]01          		mov	byte [es:TOOMANYDRIVESFLAG], 1 ; 09/12/2022 
  8542                                  		;mov	byte ptr es:3FFh, 1 ; [es:toomanydrivesflag]
  8543                                  					; set message flag
  8544                                  					; [SYSINIT+toomanydrivesflag]
  8545 00002093 07                      		pop	es
  8546                                  
  8547                                  		;;push	es
  8548                                  		;;mov	ax,SYSINIT_SEG
  8549                                  		;;mov	es,ax
  8550                                  		;;mov	byte [es:toomanydrivesflag],1
  8551                                  					; set message flag
  8552                                  		;;pop	es
  8553                                  		;
  8554                                  		;mov	byte [SYSINIT+toomanydrivesflag],1
  8555                                  dmax_ok:
  8556 00002094 C3                      		retn
  8557                                  
  8558                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  8559                                  
  8560                                  ; 18/10/2022
  8561                                  ; 15/10/2022
  8562                                  ; 28/12/2018 - Retro DOS v4.0						
  8563                                  ;								 
  8564                                  ;	link next bds (at ds:di) into the chain. assume that the
  8565                                  ;	  chain is entirely within ds == datagrp. also update drvmax,
  8566                                  ;	  dskdrv_table, and end_of_bdss.	
  8567                                  
  8568                                  xinstall_bds:		
  8569 00002095 56                      		push	si
  8570 00002096 53                      		push	bx
  8571 00002097 8B36[1901]              		mov	si, [start_bds]	; get first bds
  8572                                  xinstall_bds_1:				
  8573 0000209B 833CFF                  		cmp	word [si], 0FFFFh ; is this the last one?
  8574 0000209E 7404                    		jz	short xinstall_bds_2 ;	skip ahead if so
  8575                                  		;mov	si, [si+BDS.link]
  8576 000020A0 8B34                    		mov	si, [si]	; chain	through	list
  8577 000020A2 EBF7                    		jmp	short xinstall_bds_1
  8578                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8579                                  
  8580                                  xinstall_bds_2:				
  8581                                  		;mov	[si+BDS.link], di
  8582 000020A4 893C                    		mov	[si], di
  8583                                  		;mov	[si+BDS.link+2], ds
  8584 000020A6 8C5C02                  		mov	[si+2], ds
  8585                                  		;mov	word [di+BDS.link], -1
  8586 000020A9 C705FFFF                		mov	word [di], 0FFFFh ; make sure it is a null ptr.
  8587                                  		;mov	[di+BDS.link+2], ds
  8588 000020AD 8C5D02                  		mov	[di+2], ds ; might as well plug segment
  8589                                  		; 20/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
  8590                                  		;lea	bx, [di+BDS.BPB]
  8591 000020B0 8D5D06                  		lea	bx, [di+6]
  8592 000020B3 8B36[CE15]              		mov	si, [last_dskdrv_table]
  8593 000020B7 891C                    		mov	[si], bx
  8594 000020B9 8306[CE15]02            		add	word [last_dskdrv_table], 2
  8595 000020BE FE06[7500]              		inc	byte [drvmax]
  8596 000020C2 8306[D015]64            		add	word [end_of_bdss], 100 ; BDS.size = 100
  8597 000020C7 5B                      		pop	bx
  8598 000020C8 5E                      		pop	si
  8599 000020C9 C3                      		retn
  8600                                  
  8601                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  8602                                  
  8603                                  ; 17/10/2022
  8604                                  ; 15/10/2022
  8605                                  ; 28/12/2018 - Retro DOS v4.0
  8606                                  ; 03/06/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
  8607                                  
  8608                                  cmos_clock_read:	
  8609 000020CA 50                      		push	ax
  8610 000020CB 51                      		push	cx
  8611 000020CC 52                      		push	dx
  8612 000020CD 55                      		push	bp
  8613 000020CE 31ED                    		xor	bp, bp
  8614                                  loop_clock:				
  8615 000020D0 31C9                    		xor	cx, cx
  8616 000020D2 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
  8617 000020D4 B402                    		mov	ah, 2
  8618 000020D6 CD1A                    		int	1Ah		; CLOCK	- READ REAL TIME CLOCK (AT,XT286,CONV,PS)
  8619                                  					; Return: CH = hours in	BCD
  8620                                  					; CL = minutes in BCD
  8621                                  					; DH = seconds in BCD
  8622 000020D8 83F900                  		cmp	cx, 0
  8623 000020DB 7512                    		jnz	short clock_present
  8624 000020DD 83FA00                  		cmp	dx, 0
  8625 000020E0 750D                    		jnz	short clock_present
  8626 000020E2 83FD01                  		cmp	bp, 1		; read again after a slight delay, in case clock
  8627 000020E5 741C                    		jz	short no_readdate ; was	at zero	setting.
  8628 000020E7 45                      		inc	bp		; only perform delay once.
  8629 000020E8 B90040                  		mov	cx, 4000h	; 16384
  8630                                  delay:					
  8631 000020EB E2FE                    		loop	delay
  8632 000020ED EBE1                    		jmp	short loop_clock
  8633                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8634                                  
  8635                                  clock_present:				
  8636 000020EF 2EC606[9304]01          		mov	byte [cs:havecmosclock], 1 ; set the flag for cmos clock
  8637 000020F5 E81000                  		call	cmosck		; reset	cmos clock rate	that may be
  8638                                  					; possibly destroyed by	cp dos and
  8639                                  					; post routine did not restore that.
  8640 000020F8 56                      		push	si
  8641 000020F9 E8BAF2                  		call	read_real_date	; read real-time clock for date
  8642 000020FC FA                      		cli
  8643                                  		;mov	ds:daycnt, si	; set system date
  8644 000020FD 8936[9004]              		mov	[daycnt], si
  8645 00002101 FB                      		sti
  8646 00002102 5E                      		pop	si
  8647                                  
  8648                                  no_readdate:				
  8649 00002103 5D                      		pop	bp
  8650 00002104 5A                      		pop	dx
  8651 00002105 59                      		pop	cx
  8652 00002106 58                      		pop	ax
  8653 00002107 C3                      		retn
  8654                                  
  8655                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8656                                  
  8657                                  ; the following code is written by jack gulley in engineering group.
  8658                                  ; cp dos (CP/DOS, OS/2) is changing cmos clock rate for its own purposes
  8659                                  ; and if the use cold boot the system to use pc dos while running cp dos,
  8660                                  ; the cmos clock rate are still slow which slow down disk operations
  8661                                  ; of pc dos which uses cmos clock. pc dos is put this code in msinit
  8662                                  ; to fix this problem at the request of cp dos.
  8663                                  ;
  8664                                  ; the program is modified to be run on msinit. equates are defined
  8665                                  ; in cmosequ.inc. this program will be called by cmos_clock_read procedure.
  8666                                  ;
  8667                                  ;  the following code cmosck is used to insure that the cmos has not
  8668                                  ;	had its rate controls left in an invalid state on older at's.
  8669                                  ;
  8670                                  ;	it checks for an at model byte "fc" with a submodel type of
  8671                                  ;	00, 01, 02, 03 or 06 and resets the periodic interrupt rate
  8672                                  ;	bits in case post has not done it. this initilization routine
  8673                                  ;	is only needed once when dos loads. it should be run as soon
  8674                                  ;	as possible to prevent slow diskette access.
  8675                                  ;
  8676                                  ;	this code exposes one to dos clearing cmos setup done by a
  8677                                  ;	resident program that hides and re-boots the system.
  8678                                  
  8679                                  cmosck:					; check and reset rtc rate bits	
  8680                                  
  8681                                  ;model byte and submodel byte were already determined in msinit.
  8682                                  
  8683                                  	; 16/06/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
  8684                                  	; 19/03/2018 (Model: 0FCh, Sub Model: 01h, REF: AMIBIOS Prog. Guide)
  8685                                  			
  8686 00002108 50                      		push	ax
  8687 00002109 2E803E[D605]FC          		cmp	byte [cs:model_byte], 0FCh
  8688 0000210F 7525                    		jnz	short cmosck9	; Exit if not an AT model
  8689 00002111 2E803E[D705]06          		cmp	byte [cs:secondary_model_byte], 6
  8690                                  					; Is it 06 for the industral AT ?
  8691 00002117 7408                    		jz	short cmosck4	; Go reset CMOS	periodic rate if 06
  8692 00002119 2E803E[D705]04          		cmp	byte [cs:secondary_model_byte], 4
  8693                                  					; Is it 00, 01, 02, or 03 ?
  8694 0000211F 7315                    		jnb	short cmosck9	; EXIT if problem fixed by POST  
  8695                                  					; Also,Secondary_model_byte = 0 
  8696                                  					;   when AH=0C0h, int 15h failed.
  8697                                  					;	RESET THE CMOS PERIODIC RATE 
  8698                                  					;  Model=FC submodel=00,01,02,03 or 06 
  8699                                  cmosck4:				
  8700 00002121 B08A                    		mov	al, 8Ah		; cmos_reg_a|nmi
  8701                                  					; NMI disabled on return
  8702 00002123 B426                    		mov	ah, 26h		; 00100110b
  8703                                  					; Set divider &	rate selection
  8704 00002125 E83000                  		call	cmos_write
  8705 00002128 B08B                    		mov	al, 8Bh		; cmos_reg_b|nmi
  8706                                  					; NMI disabled on return
  8707 0000212A E80B00                  		call	cmos_read
  8708 0000212D 2407                    		and	al, 7		; 00000111b
  8709                                  					; clear	SET,PIE,AIE,UIE,SQWE
  8710 0000212F 88C4                    		mov	ah, al
  8711 00002131 B00B                    		mov	al, 0Bh		; cmos_reg_b
  8712                                  					; NMI enabled on return
  8713 00002133 E82200                  		call	cmos_write
  8714                                  cmosck9:				
  8715 00002136 58                      		pop	ax
  8716 00002137 C3                      		retn
  8717                                  
  8718                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  8719                                  
  8720                                  ;--- CMOS_READ -----------------------------------------------------------------
  8721                                  ;		read byte from cmos system clock configuration table	       :
  8722                                  ;									       :
  8723                                  ; input: (al)=	cmos table address to be read				       :
  8724                                  ;		bit    7 = 0 for nmi enabled and 1 for nmi disabled on exit    :
  8725                                  ;		bits 6-0 = address of table location to read		       :
  8726                                  ;									       :
  8727                                  ; output: (al)	value at location (al) moved into (al). if bit 7 of (al) was   :
  8728                                  ;		on then nmi left disabled.  during the cmos read both nmi and  :
  8729                                  ;		normal interrupts are disabled to protect cmos data integrity. :
  8730                                  ;		the cmos address register is pointed to a default value and    :
  8731                                  ;		the interrupt flag restored to the entry state on return.      :
  8732                                  ;		only the (al) register and the nmi state is changed.	       :
  8733                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8734                                  
  8735                                  cmos_read:				; read location (al) into (al)	
  8736 00002138 9C                      		pushf
  8737 00002139 FA                      		cli
  8738 0000213A 53                      		push	bx
  8739 0000213B 50                      		push	ax		; AL = cmos table address to be	read
  8740 0000213C 0C80                    		or	al, 80h
  8741 0000213E E670                    		out	70h, al		; CMOS Memory/RTC Index	Register:
  8742                                  					; RTC Seconds
  8743 00002140 90                      		nop			; (undocumented	delay needed)
  8744 00002141 E471                    		in	al, 71h		; CMOS Memory/RTC Data Register
  8745 00002143 89C3                    		mov	bx, ax
  8746 00002145 58                      		pop	ax
  8747 00002146 2480                    		and	al, 80h
  8748 00002148 0C0F                    		or	al, 0Fh
  8749 0000214A E670                    		out	70h, al		; CMOS Memory/RTC Index	Register:
  8750                                  					; RTC Seconds
  8751 0000214C 90                      		nop
  8752 0000214D E471                    		in	al, 71h		; CMOS Memory/RTC Data Register
  8753 0000214F 89D8                    		mov	ax, bx
  8754 00002151 5B                      		pop	bx
  8755 00002152 0E                      		push	cs		; *place code segment in stack and
  8756 00002153 E80100                  		call	cmos_popf	; *handle popf for b- level 80286
  8757 00002156 C3                      		retn			; return with flags restored
  8758                                  
  8759                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8760                                  
  8761                                  cmos_popf:				
  8762 00002157 CF                      		iret			; popf for level b- parts
  8763                                  					; return far and restore flags
  8764                                  
  8765                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  8766                                  
  8767                                  ;--- cmos_write ----------------------------------------------------------------
  8768                                  ;		write byte to cmos system clock configuration table	       :
  8769                                  ;									       :
  8770                                  ; input: (al)=	cmos table address to be written to			       :
  8771                                  ;		bit    7 = 0 for nmi enabled and 1 for nmi disabled on exit    :
  8772                                  ;		bits 6-0 = address of table location to write		       :
  8773                                  ;	 (ah)=	new value to be placed in the addressed table location	       :
  8774                                  ;									       :
  8775                                  ; output:	value in (ah) placed in location (al) with nmi left disabled   :
  8776                                  ;		if bit 7 of (al) is on. during the cmos update both nmi and    :
  8777                                  ;		normal interrupts are disabled to protect cmos data integrity. :
  8778                                  ;		the cmos address register is pointed to a default value and    :
  8779                                  ;		the interrupt flag restored to the entry state on return.      :
  8780                                  ;		only the cmos location and the nmi state is changed.	       :
  8781                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8782                                  
  8783                                  cmos_write:				; write (ah) to location (al)	
  8784 00002158 9C                      		pushf			; write (ah) to location (al)
  8785 00002159 50                      		push	ax		; save work register values
  8786 0000215A FA                      		cli
  8787 0000215B 50                      		push	ax		; save user nmi	state
  8788 0000215C 0C80                    		or	al, 80h		; disable nmi for us
  8789 0000215E E670                    		out	70h, al		; CMOS Memory/RTC Index	Register:
  8790                                  					; RTC Seconds
  8791 00002160 90                      		nop
  8792 00002161 88E0                    		mov	al, ah
  8793 00002163 E671                    		out	71h, al		; CMOS Memory/RTC Data Register
  8794 00002165 58                      		pop	ax		; get user nmi
  8795 00002166 2480                    		and	al, 80h
  8796 00002168 0C0F                    		or	al, 0Fh
  8797 0000216A E670                    		out	70h, al		; CMOS Memory/RTC Index	Register:
  8798                                  					; RTC Seconds
  8799 0000216C 90                      		nop
  8800 0000216D E471                    		in	al, 71h		; CMOS Memory/RTC Data Register
  8801 0000216F 58                      		pop	ax		; restore work registers
  8802 00002170 0E                      		push	cs		; *place code segment in stack and
  8803 00002171 E8E3FF                  		call	cmos_popf	; *handle popf for b- level 80286
  8804 00002174 C3                      		retn
  8805                                  
  8806                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8807                                  ; MSINIT.ASM (MSDOS 6.0, 1991)
  8808                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8809                                  ; The following routines provide support for reading in the file MSDOS.SYS.
  8810                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8811                                  
  8812                                  ; 15/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
  8813                                  ;
  8814                                  ; (For Retro DOS, 'IO.SYS' and 'MSDOS.SYS' are already loaded together
  8815                                  ;  at once -as single kernel file- by the Retro DOS boot sector code.
  8816                                  ;  So, following disk reads -MSDOS.SYS loading- is not needed!
  8817                                  ;  Only needing is to move MSDOS Kernel to it's final memory location.) 
  8818                                  
  8819                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  8820                                  
  8821                                  ; GetClus, read in a cluster at a specified address
  8822                                  ;
  8823                                  ;  bx = cluster to read
  8824                                  ;  cx = sectors per cluster
  8825                                  ;  es:di = load location
  8826                                  
  8827                                  ; 17/10/2022
  8828                                  ;DISKRD equ diskrd - DOSBIOSEG_2C7h	; (8E5h for MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
  8829                                  ; 09/12/2022
  8830                                  DISKRD equ diskrd
  8831                                  
  8832                                  		; 17/10/2022
  8833                                  getclus:				
  8834 00002175 51                      		push	cx
  8835 00002176 57                      		push	di
  8836 00002177 2E890E[4C15]            		mov	[cs:doscnt], cx
  8837 0000217C 89D8                    		mov	ax, bx
  8838 0000217E 48                      		dec	ax
  8839 0000217F 48                      		dec	ax
  8840 00002180 F7E1                    		mul	cx		; convert to logical sector
  8841                                  					; dx:ax	= matching logical sector number
  8842                                  					;	  starting from the data sector
  8843 00002182 2E0306[4815]            		add	ax, [cs:bios_l]
  8844 00002187 2E1316[4A15]            		adc	dx, [cs:bios_h]	; dx:ax	= first	logical	sector to read
  8845                                  unpack:					
  8846 0000218C 1E                      		push	ds
  8847 0000218D 50                      		push	ax
  8848 0000218E 53                      		push	bx
  8849 0000218F 2E8B36[4F15]            		mov	si, [cs:fatloc]
  8850 00002194 8EDE                    		mov	ds, si
  8851 00002196 89DE                    		mov	si, bx		; next cluster
  8852 00002198 2EF606[4E15]40          		test	byte [cs:fbigfat], 40h	; fbig
  8853                                  					; 16 bit fat?
  8854 0000219E 753C                    		jnz	short unpack16	; yes
  8855 000021A0 D1EE                    		shr	si, 1		; 12 bit fat. si=si/2
  8856                                  					; si = clus + clus/2
  8857 000021A2 01DE                    		add	si, bx		;
  8858                                  					; (si =	byte offset of the cluster in the FAT)
  8859 000021A4 52                      		push	dx
  8860 000021A5 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
  8861 000021A7 E87C00                  		call	get_fat_sector
  8862 000021AA 5A                      		pop	dx
  8863 000021AB 8B07                    		mov	ax, [bx]	; save it into ax
  8864 000021AD 7517                    		jnz	short even_odd	; if not a splitted fat, check even-odd.
  8865                                  		; 25/06/2023
  8866                                  		;mov	al, [bx]	; splitted fat
  8867 000021AF 2EA2[5615]              		mov	[cs:temp_cluster], al
  8868 000021B3 46                      		inc	si		; (next	byte)
  8869 000021B4 52                      		push	dx
  8870 000021B5 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
  8871 000021B7 E86C00                  		call	get_fat_sector
  8872 000021BA 5A                      		pop	dx
  8873                                  		;mov	al, ds:0
  8874 000021BB A00000                  		mov	al, [0] ; 19/10/2022
  8875 000021BE 2EA2[5715]              		mov	[cs:temp_cluster+1], al
  8876 000021C2 2EA1[5615]              		mov	ax, [cs:temp_cluster]
  8877                                  even_odd:				
  8878 000021C6 5B                      		pop	bx		; restore old fat entry	value
  8879 000021C7 53                      		push	bx		; save it right	away.
  8880 000021C8 D1EB                    		shr	bx, 1		; was it even or odd?
  8881 000021CA 7308                    		jnb	short havclus	; it was even.
  8882 000021CC D1E8                    		shr	ax, 1		; odd. massage fat value and keep
  8883                                  					; the highest 12 bits.
  8884 000021CE D1E8                    		shr	ax, 1
  8885 000021D0 D1E8                    		shr	ax, 1
  8886 000021D2 D1E8                    		shr	ax, 1
  8887                                  havclus:				
  8888 000021D4 89C3                    		mov	bx, ax		; now bx = new fat entry.
  8889 000021D6 81E3FF0F                		and	bx, 0FFFh	; keep low 12 bits.
  8890 000021DA EB0E                    		jmp	short unpackx
  8891                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8892                                  
  8893                                  unpack16:				
  8894 000021DC 52                      		push	dx
  8895 000021DD 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
  8896 000021DF D1E6                    		shl	si, 1		; extend to 32 bit offset
  8897 000021E1 83D200                  		adc	dx, 0
  8898 000021E4 E83F00                  		call	get_fat_sector
  8899 000021E7 5A                      		pop	dx
  8900 000021E8 8B1F                    		mov	bx, [bx]	;
  8901                                  					; bx = new fat entry.
  8902                                  unpackx:				
  8903 000021EA 5E                      		pop	si		; restore old bx value into si
  8904 000021EB 58                      		pop	ax		; restore logical sector (low)
  8905 000021EC 1F                      		pop	ds
  8906 000021ED 29DE                    		sub	si, bx
  8907 000021EF 83FEFF                  		cmp	si, -1		; one apart?
  8908 000021F2 7507                    		jnz	short getcl2
  8909 000021F4 2E010E[4C15]            		add	[cs:doscnt], cx
  8910 000021F9 EB91                    		jmp	short unpack
  8911                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8912                                  
  8913                                  getcl2:					
  8914 000021FB 53                      		push	bx
  8915 000021FC 52                      		push	dx		; sector to read (high)
  8916 000021FD 50                      		push	ax		; sector to read (low)
  8917 000021FE 2EA1[4615]              		mov	ax, [cs:drvfat]	; get drive and	fat spec
  8918 00002202 2E8B0E[4C15]            		mov	cx, [cs:doscnt]
  8919 00002207 5A                      		pop	dx		; sector to read for diskrd (low)
  8920 00002208 2E8F06[C304]            		pop	word [cs:start_sec_h]
  8921                                  					; sector to read for diskrd (high)
  8922 0000220D 1E                      		push	ds
  8923 0000220E 0E                      		push	cs
  8924 0000220F 1F                      		pop	ds
  8925 00002210 0E                      		push	cs		; simulate far call
  8926                                  		; 17/10/2022
  8927 00002211 BD[6109]                		mov	bp, DISKRD	; 8E5h
  8928                                  		;mov	bp, 8E5h	; offset diskrd
  8929                                  					; 2C7h:8E5h = 70h:2E55h
  8930 00002214 E8CAF3                  		call	call_bios_code	; read the clusters
  8931 00002217 1F                      		pop	ds
  8932 00002218 5B                      		pop	bx
  8933 00002219 5F                      		pop	di
  8934 0000221A 2EA1[4C15]              		mov	ax, [cs:doscnt]	; get number of	sectors	read
  8935 0000221E 86E0                    		xchg	ah, al		; multiply by 256
  8936 00002220 D1E0                    		shl	ax, 1		; times	2 equal	512
  8937 00002222 01C7                    		add	di, ax		; update load location
  8938 00002224 59                      		pop	cx		; restore sectors/cluster
  8939 00002225 C3                      		retn
  8940                                  
  8941                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  8942                                  
  8943                                  
  8944                                  ;function: find and read the corresponding fat sector into ds:0
  8945                                  ;
  8946                                  ;in). dx:si - offset value (starting from fat entry 0) of fat entry to find. M054
  8947                                  ;     ds - fatloc segment
  8948                                  ;     cs:drvfat - logical drive number, fat id
  8949                                  ;     cs:md_sectorsize
  8950                                  ;     cs:last_fat_secnum - last fat sector number read in.
  8951                                  ;
  8952                                  ;out). corresponding fat sector read in.
  8953                                  ;      bx = offset value from fatlog segment.
  8954                                  ;      other registera saved.
  8955                                  ;      zero flag set if the fat entry is splitted, i.e., when 12 bit fat entry
  8956                                  ;      starts at the last byte of the fat sector. in this case, the caller
  8957                                  ;      should save this byte, and read the next fat sector to get the rest
  8958                                  ;      of the fat entry value. (this will only happen with the 12 bit fat.)
  8959                                  
  8960                                  		; 17/10/2022
  8961                                  get_fat_sector:	
  8962 00002226 50                      		push	ax
  8963 00002227 51                      		push	cx
  8964 00002228 57                      		push	di
  8965 00002229 56                      		push	si
  8966 0000222A 06                      		push	es
  8967 0000222B 1E                      		push	ds
  8968 0000222C 89F0                    		mov	ax, si
  8969 0000222E 2E8B0E[5415]            		mov	cx, [cs:md_sectorsize] ; 512
  8970 00002233 F7F1                    		div	cx		; ax = sector number, dx = offset
  8971 00002235 90                      		nop
  8972                                  
  8973                                  		; Get rid of the assumption that
  8974                                  		; there	is only	one reserved sector
  8975                                  
  8976 00002236 06                      		push	es
  8977 00002237 1E                      		push	ds
  8978 00002238 57                      		push	di
  8979 00002239 50                      		push	ax
  8980 0000223A 0E                      		push	cs
  8981 0000223B 1F                      		pop	ds
  8982                                  
  8983 0000223C 2EA1[4615]              		mov	ax, [cs:drvfat]	; get drive # and FAT id
  8984 00002240 BD[7005]                		mov	bp, SETDRIVE
  8985                                  		;mov	bp, 4D7h	; setdrive
  8986                                  					; at 2C7h:4D7h = 70h:2A47h
  8987 00002243 0E                      		push	cs		; simulate far call
  8988 00002244 E89AF3                  		call	call_bios_code	; get bds for drive
  8989 00002247 58                      		pop	ax		; (sector number -without reserved and hidden sectors-)
  8990 00002248 26034509                		add	ax, [es:di+9]	; [es:di+BDS.resectors]
  8991                                  					; add #reserved_sectors
  8992 0000224C 5F                      		pop	di
  8993 0000224D 1F                      		pop	ds
  8994 0000224E 07                      		pop	es
  8995 0000224F 2E3B06[5815]            		cmp	ax, [cs:last_fat_sec_num]
  8996 00002254 742A                    		jz	short gfs_split_chk ; don't need to read it again.
  8997 00002256 2EA3[5815]              		mov	[cs:last_fat_sec_num], ax 
  8998                                  					; sector number
  8999                                  					; (in the partition, without hidden sectors)
  9000 0000225A 52                      		push	dx
  9001 0000225B 2EC706[C304]0000        		mov	word [cs:start_sec_h], 0 
  9002                                  					; prepare to read the fat sector
  9003                                  					; start_sec_h is always	0 for fat sector.
  9004 00002262 89C2                    		mov	dx, ax
  9005 00002264 B90100                  		mov	cx, 1		; 1 sector read
  9006 00002267 2EA1[4615]              		mov	ax, [cs:drvfat]
  9007 0000226B 1E                      		push	ds
  9008 0000226C 07                      		pop	es
  9009 0000226D 31FF                    		xor	di, di		; es:di	-> fatloc segment:0
  9010 0000226F 1E                      		push	ds
  9011 00002270 0E                      		push	cs
  9012 00002271 1F                      		pop	ds
  9013 00002272 0E                      		push	cs		; simulate far call
  9014 00002273 BD[6109]                		mov	bp, DISKRD	; 8E5h
  9015                                  		;mov	bp, 8E5h	; offset diskrd
  9016                                  					; 2C7h:8E5h = 70h:2E55h
  9017 00002276 E868F3                  		call	call_bios_code
  9018 00002279 1F                      		pop	ds
  9019 0000227A 5A                      		pop	dx
  9020 0000227B 2E8B0E[5415]            		mov	cx, [cs:md_sectorsize] ; 512
  9021                                  
  9022                                  gfs_split_chk:				
  9023 00002280 49                      		dec	cx		; 511
  9024 00002281 39CA                    		cmp	dx, cx		; if offset points to the
  9025                                  					; last byte of this sector,
  9026                                  					; then splitted	entry.
  9027 00002283 89D3                    		mov	bx, dx		; set bx to dx
  9028 00002285 1F                      		pop	ds
  9029 00002286 07                      		pop	es
  9030 00002287 5E                      		pop	si
  9031 00002288 5F                      		pop	di
  9032 00002289 59                      		pop	cx
  9033 0000228A 58                      		pop	ax
  9034 0000228B C3                      		retn
  9035                                  
  9036                                  ; 15/10/2022
  9037                                  ;Bios_Data_Init	ends
  9038                                  
  9039                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9040                                  
  9041                                  		; 09/12/2022
  9042                                  		;db 0
  9043                                  
  9044                                  numbertodiv	equ ($-BData_start)
  9045                                  numbertomod	equ (numbertodiv % 16)
  9046                                  
  9047                                  %if numbertomod>0 & numbertomod<16
  9048 0000228C 00<rep 4h>              		times (16-numbertomod) db 0
  9049                                  %endif
  9050                                  
  9051                                  ;align 16
  9052                                  
  9053                                  ; 09/12/2022
  9054                                  IOSYSCODESEGOFF	equ $ - BData_start
  9055                                  IOSYSCODESEG	equ (IOSYSCODESEGOFF>>4)+(700h>>4)
  9056                                  
  9057                                  ;--- End of DOSBIOS data segment --------------------------------------------
  9058                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9059                                  		;db 4 dup(0)
  9060                                  ; 09/12/2022		
  9061                                  ;		times 4 db 0	; 19/10/2022
  9062                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9063                                  
  9064                                  ;============================================================================
  9065                                  ; DOS BIOS (IO.SYS) CODE SEGMENT 
  9066                                  ;============================================================================
  9067                                  ; 09/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
  9068                                  ; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
  9069                                  
  9070                                  section .BIOSCODE vstart=0 
  9071                                  
  9072                                  ; 30/12/2022
  9073                                  ; (BIOSCODE SEGMENT is 2CCh for MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)  -- ((25C0h+700h)>>4) --
  9074                                  
  9075                                  BCode_start:	 ; 09/12/2022
  9076                                   
  9077                                  ; 02/10/2022
  9078                                  
  9079                                  ;--- DOSBIOS code segment ---------------------------------------------------
  9080                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9081                                  ; MSBIO1.ASM (MSDOS 6.0, 1991)
  9082                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9083                                  
  9084                                  DOSBIOSEG_2C7h:	;db 30h dup(0)		; SEGMENT 2C7h (2C70h-700h=2570h)
  9085 00000000 00<rep 30h>             		times 48 db 0		; 19/10/2022	
  9086 00000030 7000                    BiosDataWord:	dw 70h
  9087                                  
  9088                                  ; 15/10/2022
  9089                                  ;BIOSDATAWORD	equ BiosDataWord - DOSBIOSEG_2C7h
  9090                                  ; 09/12/2022
  9091                                  BIOSDATAWORD	equ BiosDataWord
  9092                                  
  9093                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9094                                  
  9095                                  ; 15/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS) 
  9096                                  
  9097                                  ;************************************************************************
  9098                                  ;*									*
  9099                                  ;*	seg_reinit is called with ax = our new code segment value,	*
  9100                                  ;*	  trashes di, cx, es						*
  9101                                  ;*									*
  9102                                  ;*	cas -- should be made disposable!				*
  9103                                  ;*									*
  9104                                  ;************************************************************************
  9105                                  
  9106                                  	; 10/08/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
  9107                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - BIOSCODE:0032h 
  9108                                  
  9109                                  _seg_reinit:
  9110 00000032 2E8E06[3000]            		mov	es, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD]
  9111                                  					; at 2C7h:30h or 70h:25A0h
  9112                                  		;mov	di, (offset cdev+2)
  9113 00000037 BF[2B06]                		mov	di, cdev+2	; 19/10/2022
  9114                                  		;mov	cx, 4		; (end_BC_entries - cdev)/4
  9115                                  		; 10/08/2023
  9116 0000003A B90300                  		mov	cx, 3 ; (PCDOS 7.1)
  9117                                  _seg_reinit_1:
  9118 0000003D AB                      		stosw			; modify Bios_Code entry points
  9119 0000003E 47                      		inc	di
  9120 0000003F 47                      		inc	di
  9121 00000040 E2FB                    		loop	_seg_reinit_1
  9122                                  		; 10/08/2023 (PCDOS 7.1)
  9123                                  		; (direct jump to i2f_handler from BIOSDATA:bios_i2f)
  9124                                  		; (instead of 'bcode_i2f: dw i2f_handler, IOSYSCODESEG')
  9125 00000042 26A3[0800]              		mov     [es:bios_i2f_seg], ax ; actual BIOSCODE segment
  9126 00000046 CB                      		retf
  9127                                  
  9128                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9129                                  
  9130                                  ; 15/10/2022
  9131                                  
  9132                                  ;************************************************************************
  9133                                  ;*									*
  9134                                  ;*	chardev_entry - main device driver dispatch routine		*
  9135                                  ;*	   called with a dummy parameter block on the stack		*
  9136                                  ;*	   dw dispatch_table, dw prn/aux numbers (optional)		*
  9137                                  ;*									*
  9138                                  ;*	will eventually take care of doing the transitions in		*
  9139                                  ;*	   out of Bios_Code						*
  9140                                  ;*									*
  9141                                  ;************************************************************************
  9142                                  
  9143                                  chardev_entry:				; 0070h:25B3h =	02C7h:0043h
  9144 00000047 56                      		push	si
  9145 00000048 50                      		push	ax
  9146 00000049 51                      		push	cx
  9147 0000004A 52                      		push	dx
  9148 0000004B 57                      		push	di
  9149 0000004C 55                      		push	bp
  9150 0000004D 1E                      		push	ds
  9151 0000004E 06                      		push	es
  9152 0000004F 53                      		push	bx
  9153 00000050 89E5                    		mov	bp, sp
  9154 00000052 8B7612                  		mov	si, [bp+18]	; get return address (dispatch table)
  9155                                  		;;mov	ds, word [cs:0030h]
  9156                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:0030h]
  9157 00000055 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD] ; 17/10/2022
  9158 0000005A 8B4402                  		mov	ax, [si+2]	; get the device number	if present
  9159 0000005D A2[2100]                		mov	[auxnum], al
  9160 00000060 8826[8704]              		mov	[printdev], ah
  9161 00000064 8B34                    		mov	si, [si]	; point	to the device dispatch table
  9162 00000066 C41E[1200]              		les	bx, [ptrsav]	; get pointer to i/o packet
  9163 0000006A 268A4701                		mov	al, [es:bx+1]	; [es:bx+unit]	; al = unit code
  9164 0000006E 268A670D                		mov	ah, [es:bx+13]	; [es:bx+media]	; ah = media descrip
  9165 00000072 268B4F12                		mov	cx, [es:bx+18]	; [es:bx+count]	; cx = count
  9166 00000076 268B5714                		mov	dx, [es:bx+20]	; [es:bx+start]	; dx = start sector
  9167                                  		; 17/10/2022
  9168 0000007A 81FE[3B05]              		cmp	si, DSKTBL
  9169                                  		;cmp	si, 4A2h	; dsktbl
  9170                                  					; at 2C7h:4A2h = 70h:2A12h
  9171 0000007E 7517                    		jnz	short no_sector32_mapping
  9172                                  
  9173                                  ; Special case for 32-bit start sector number:
  9174                                  ;   if (si==dsktbl) /* if this is a disk device call */
  9175                                  ;      set high 16 bits of secnum to 0
  9176                                  ;      if (secnum == 0xffff) fetch 32 bit sector number
  9177                                  ;
  9178                                  ; pass high word of sector number in start_sec_h, low word in dx
  9179                                  ;
  9180                                  ; note: start_l and start_h are the offsets within the io_request packet
  9181                                  ;	  which contain the low and hi words of the 32 bit start sector if
  9182                                  ;	  it has been used.
  9183                                  ;
  9184                                  ; note: remember not to destroy the registers which have been set up before
  9185                                  
  9186                                  		;mov	ds:start_sec_h,	0 ; initialize to 0
  9187 00000080 C706[C304]0000          		mov	word [start_sec_h], 0
  9188 00000086 83FAFF                  		cmp	dx, 0FFFFh
  9189 00000089 750C                    		jnz	short no_sector32_mapping
  9190 0000008B 268B571C                		mov	dx, [es:bx+28]	; [es:bx+start_h]
  9191                                  					; 32 bits dsk req
  9192                                  		;mov	ds:start_sec_h,	dx ; start_sec_h = packet.start_h
  9193 0000008F 8916[C304]              		mov	[start_sec_h], dx
  9194 00000093 268B571A                		mov	dx, [es:bx+26]	; [es:bx+start_l]
  9195                                  					; dx = packet.start_l
  9196                                  no_sector32_mapping:			
  9197 00000097 97                      		xchg	ax, di
  9198 00000098 268A4702                		mov	al, [es:bx+2]	; [es:bx+cmd]
  9199 0000009C 2E3A04                  		cmp	al, cs:[si]
  9200 0000009F 732C                    		jnb	short command_error
  9201 000000A1 98                      		cbw			; note that al <= 15 means ok
  9202 000000A2 D1E0                    		shl	ax, 1
  9203 000000A4 01C6                    		add	si, ax
  9204 000000A6 97                      		xchg	ax, di
  9205 000000A7 26C47F0E                		les	di, [es:bx+14]	; [es:bx+trans]
  9206 000000AB FC                      		cld
  9207                                  		; 17/10/2022
  9208 000000AC 2EFF5401                		call	near [cs:si+1]
  9209                                  		;call	word ptr cs:si+1
  9210 000000B0 7202                    		jb	short already_got_ah_status
  9211 000000B2 B401                    		mov	ah, 1
  9212                                  already_got_ah_status:
  9213                                  		;;mov	ds, [cs:0030h]	; 15/10/2022			
  9214                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:0030h]
  9215                                  					; cas note: shouldn't be needed!
  9216 000000B4 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD] ; 17/10/2022
  9217                                  		;lds	bx, ds:ptrsav
  9218 000000B9 C51E[1200]              		lds	bx, [ptrsav]
  9219 000000BD 894703                  		mov	[bx+3],	ax	; [bx+status]
  9220                                  					; mark operation complete
  9221 000000C0 5B                      		pop	bx
  9222 000000C1 07                      		pop	es
  9223 000000C2 1F                      		pop	ds
  9224 000000C3 5D                      		pop	bp
  9225 000000C4 5F                      		pop	di
  9226 000000C5 5A                      		pop	dx
  9227 000000C6 59                      		pop	cx
  9228 000000C7 58                      		pop	ax
  9229 000000C8 5E                      		pop	si
  9230 000000C9 83C402                  		add	sp, 2		; get rid of fake return address
  9231                                  	
  9232                                  		; fall through into bc_retf
  9233                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------	
  9234                                  bc_retf:
  9235 000000CC CB                      		retf
  9236                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9237                                  
  9238                                  command_error:				
  9239 000000CD E80900                  		call	bc_cmderr
  9240 000000D0 EBE2                    		jmp	short already_got_ah_status
  9241                                  ; 15/10/2022
  9242                                  ; 01/05/2019
  9243                                  
  9244                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9245                                  ; The following piece of hack is for supporting CP/M compatibility
  9246                                  ; Basically at offset 5 we have a far call into 0:c0. But this does not call
  9247                                  ; 0:c0 directly instead it call f01d:fef0, because it needs to support 'lhld 6'
  9248                                  ; The following hack has to reside at ffff:d0 (= f01d:fef0) if BIOS is loaded
  9249                                  ; high.
  9250                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9251                                  
  9252                                  		;db 7 dup(0)
  9253                                  
  9254                                  		; 15/10/2022
  9255                                  
  9256 000000D2 0000                    		dw 0		; pad to bring offset to 0D0h
  9257                                  
  9258 000000D4 00<rep 5h>              off_d0: 	times 5 db 0	; 5 bytes from 0:c0 will be copied onto here
  9259                                  				;  which is the CP/M call 5 entry point
  9260                                  		
  9261                                  
  9262                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9263                                  
  9264                                  ;	exit - all routines return through this path
  9265                                  
  9266                                  bc_cmderr:				
  9267 000000D9 B003                    		mov	al, 3		; 2C7h:D5h = 70h:2645h
  9268                                  					; unknown command error
  9269                                  
  9270                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  9271                                  
  9272                                  ;	now zero the count field by subtracting its current value,
  9273                                  ;	  which is still in cx, from itself.
  9274                                  
  9275                                  ;	subtract the number of i/o's NOT YET COMPLETED from total
  9276                                  ;	  in order to return the number actually complete
  9277                                  
  9278                                  bc_err_cnt:	
  9279                                  		;les	bx, ds:ptrsav
  9280                                  		; 19/10/2022
  9281 000000DB C41E[1200]              		les	bx, [ptrsav]
  9282 000000DF 26294F12                		sub	[es:bx+18], cx	; [es:bx+count]
  9283                                  					; # of successful i/o's
  9284 000000E3 B481                    		mov	ah, 81h		; mark error return
  9285 000000E5 F9                      		stc			; indicate abnormal end
  9286 000000E6 C3                      		retn
  9287                                  
  9288                                  ; 15/10/2022
  9289                                  
  9290                                  ;Bios_Code ends
  9291

  9293                                  ; MSCHAR.ASM - MSDOS 6.0 - 1991
  9294                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9295                                  ; 15/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
  9296                                  ; 10/01/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
  9297                                  
  9298                                  ; 30/04/2019
  9299                                  
  9300                                  ;title	mschar - character and clock devices
  9301                                  
  9302                                  ;MODE_CTRLBRK	equ	0FFh
  9303                                  
  9304                                  ; BIOSCODE:00E4h (MSDOS 6.21, IO.SYS)
  9305                                  
  9306                                  ;************************************************************************
  9307                                  ;*									*
  9308                                  ;*	device driver dispatch tables					*
  9309                                  ;*									*
  9310                                  ;*	each table starts with a byte which lists the number of		*
  9311                                  ;*	legal functions, followed by that number of words. Each		*
  9312                                  ;*	word represents an offset of a routine in Bios_Code which	*
  9313                                  ;*	handles the function. The functions are terminated with		*
  9314                                  ;*	a near return. If carry is reset, a 'done' code is returned	*
  9315                                  ;*	to the caller. If carry is set, the ah/al registers are		*
  9316                                  ;*	returned as abnormal completion status. Notice that ds		*
  9317                                  ;*	is assumed to point to the Bios_Data segment throughout.	*
  9318                                  ;*									*
  9319                                  ;************************************************************************
  9320                                  
  9321                                  		; 13/12/2022
  9322                                  		;db 0
  9323                                  
  9324                                  		; 13/12/202
  9325 000000E7 0B                      con_table:	db ((con_table_end - con_table)-1)/2 ; 11
  9326                                  					; 2C7h:0E4h = 70h:2654h
  9327 000000E8 [FD01]                  		dw bc_exvec  ; 1FBh	; bc_exvec at 2C7h:1FBh	= 70h:276Bh
  9328                                  					; 00 init
  9329 000000EA [FD01]                  		dw bc_exvec  ; 1FBh	; 01
  9330 000000EC [FD01]                  		dw bc_exvec  ; 1FBh	; 02
  9331 000000EE [D900]                  		dw bc_cmderr ; 0D5h	; bc_exvec at 2C7h:D5h = 70h:2645h
  9332                                  					; 03
  9333 000000F0 [5F01]                  		dw con_read  ; 15Ch	; con_read at 2C7h:15Ch	= 70h:26CCh
  9334                                  					; 04
  9335 000000F2 [A201]                  		dw con_rdnd  ; 19Fh	; con_rdnd at 2C7h:19Fh	= 70h:270Fh
  9336                                  					; 05
  9337 000000F4 [FD01]                  		dw bc_exvec  ; 1FBh	; 06
  9338 000000F6 [0B02]                  		dw con_flush ; 209h	; con_flush at 2C7h:209h = 70h:2779h
  9339                                  					; 07
  9340 000000F8 [FF01]                  		dw con_writ  ; 1FDh	; con_writ at 2C7h:1FDh	= 70h:276Dh
  9341                                  					; 08
  9342 000000FA [FF01]                  		dw con_writ  ; 1FDh	; 09
  9343 000000FC [FD01]                  		dw bc_exvec  ; 1FBh	; 0A
  9344                                  con_table_end:
  9345 000000FE 1A                      prn_table:	db ((prn_table_end - prn_table)-1)/2 ; 26			
  9346                                  					; 2C7h:0FBh = 70h:266Bh
  9347 000000FF [FD01]                  		dw bc_exvec   ; 1FBh	; bc_exvec
  9348 00000101 [FD01]                  		dw bc_exvec   ; 1FBh	; 01
  9349 00000103 [FD01]                  		dw bc_exvec   ; 1FBh	; 02
  9350 00000105 [D900]                  		dw bc_cmderr  ;	0D5h	; bc_cmderr
  9351 00000107 [1C02]                  		dw prn_input  ;	21Ah	; prn_input
  9352                                  					; 04 indicate zero chars read
  9353 00000109 [CA01]                  		dw z_bus_exit ; 1C8h	; z_bus_exit
  9354                                  					; 05 read non-destructive
  9355 0000010B [FD01]                  		dw bc_exvec   ; 1FBh	; 06
  9356 0000010D [FD01]                  		dw bc_exvec   ; 1FBh	; 07
  9357 0000010F [2102]                  		dw prn_writ   ;	21Fh	; prn_writ
  9358 00000111 [2102]                  		dw prn_writ   ; 21Fh	; 09
  9359 00000113 [5202]                  		dw prn_stat   ; 251h	; prn_stat
  9360 00000115 [FD01]                  		dw bc_exvec   ; 1FBh	; 0B
  9361 00000117 [FD01]                  		dw bc_exvec   ; 1FBh	; 0C
  9362 00000119 [FD01]                  		dw bc_exvec   ; 1FBh	; 0D
  9363 0000011B [FD01]                  		dw bc_exvec   ; 1FBh	; 0E
  9364 0000011D [FD01]                  		dw bc_exvec   ; 1FBh	; 0F
  9365 0000011F [8C02]                  		dw prn_tilbusy ; 28Bh	; prn_tilbusy
  9366 00000121 [FD01]                  		dw bc_exvec   ; 1FBh	; 11
  9367 00000123 [FD01]                  		dw bc_exvec   ; 1FBh	; 12
  9368 00000125 [BA02]                  		dw prn_genioctl ; 2BAh	; prn_genioctl
  9369 00000127 [FD01]                  		dw bc_exvec   ; 1FBh	; 14
  9370 00000129 [FD01]                  		dw bc_exvec   ; 1FBh	; 15
  9371 0000012B [FD01]                  		dw bc_exvec   ; 1FBh	; 16
  9372 0000012D [FD01]                  		dw bc_exvec   ; 1FBh	; 17
  9373 0000012F [FD01]                  		dw bc_exvec   ; 1FBh	; 18
  9374 00000131 [EF02]                  		dw prn_ioctl_query ; 2F0h ; prn_ioctl_query
  9375                                  prn_table_end:
  9376 00000133 0B                      aux_table:	db ((aux_table_end - aux_table)-1)/2 ; 11			
  9377                                  					; 2C7h:130h = 70h:26A0h
  9378 00000134 [FD01]                  		dw bc_exvec   ; 1FBh	; 00 - init
  9379 00000136 [FD01]                  		dw bc_exvec   ; 1FBh	; 01
  9380 00000138 [FD01]                  		dw bc_exvec   ; 1FBh	; 02
  9381 0000013A [D900]                  		dw bc_cmderr  ;	0D5h	; 03
  9382 0000013C [0A03]                  		dw aux_read   ; 30Dh	; aux_read ; 04	- read
  9383 0000013E [2F03]                  		dw aux_rdnd   ; 335h	; aux_rdnd - 05	- read non-destructive
  9384 00000140 [FD01]                  		dw bc_exvec   ; 1FBh	; 06
  9385 00000142 [6503]                  		dw aux_flsh   ;	36Ch	; aux_flsh
  9386 00000144 [6C03]                  		dw aux_writ   ;	374h	; aux_writ
  9387 00000146 [6C03]                  		dw aux_writ   ;	374h	; 09
  9388 00000148 [4F03]                  		dw aux_wrst   ;	355h	; aux_wrst

  9390 0000014A 0A                      tim_table	db ((tim_table_end - tim_table)-1)/2 ; 10
