 10678                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------
 10679                                  ;	disk interface routines
 10680                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------
 10681                                  
 10682                                  ; device attribute bits:
 10683                                  ;	bit 6 - get/set map for logical drives and generic ioctl.
 10684                                  
 10685                                  ;MAXERR		equ	5
 10686                                  ;MAX_HD_FMT_ERR	equ	2
 10687                                  
 10688                                  ;LSTDRV	equ 504h
 10689                                  
 10690                                  ; some floppies do not have changeline. as a result, media-check would
 10691                                  ; normally return i-don't-know, the dos would continually reread the fat and
 10692                                  ; discard cached data. we optimize this by implementing a logical door-latch:
 10693                                  ; it is physically impossible to change a disk in under 2 seconds. we retain
 10694                                  ; the time of the last successful disk operation and compare it with the current
 10695                                  ; time during media-check. if < 2 seconds and at least 1 timer tick has passed,
 10696                                  ; the we say no change. if > 2 seconds then we say i-don't-know. finally, 
 10697                                  ; since we cannot trust the timer to be always available, we record the number 
 10698                                  ; of media checks that have occurred when no apparent time has elapsed. while
 10699                                  ; this number is < a given threshold, we say no change. when it exceeds that
 10700                                  ; threshold, we say i-don't-know and reset the counter to 0. when we store 
 10701                                  ; the time of last successful access, if we see that time has passed too,
 10702                                  ; we reset the counter.
 10703                                  
 10704                                  accessmax	equ	5
 10705                                  
 10706                                  ; due to various bogosities, we need to continually adjust what the head
 10707                                  ; settle time is.  the following algorithm is used:
 10708                                  ;
 10709                                  ;   get the current head settle value.
 10710                                  ;   if it is 0, then
 10711                                  ;	set slow = 15
 10712                                  ;   else
 10713                                  ;	set slow = value
 10714                                  ;   ...
 10715                                  ;*********************************************
 10716                                  ;************ old algorithm ******************
 10717                                  ;*   if we are seeking and writing then
 10718                                  ;*	 use slow
 10719                                  ;*   else
 10720                                  ;*	 use fast
 10721                                  ;*********************************************
 10722                                  ;*********** ibm's requested logic ***********
 10723                                  ;   if we are seeking and writing and not on an at then
 10724                                  ;	use slow
 10725                                  ;   else
 10726                                  ;	use fast
 10727                                  ;   ...
 10728                                  ;   restore current head settle value
 10729                                  ;
 10730                                  ;
 10731                                  ;---------------------------------------
 10732                                  multrk_on	equ	10000000b	;user spcified mutitrack=on, or system turns
 10733                                  					; it on after handling config.sys file as a
 10734                                  					; default value, if multrk_flag = multrk_off1.
 10735                                  multrk_off1	equ	00000000b	;initial value. no "multitrack=" command entered.
 10736                                  multrk_off2	equ	00000001b	;user specified multitrack=off.
 10737                                  
 10738                                  ; close data segment, open Bios_Code segment
 10739                                  
 10740                                  ; 15/10/2022
 10741                                  
 10742                                  ; BIOSCODE:04A2h (MSDOS 6.21, IO.SYS)
 10743                                  
 10744                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------
 10745                                  ;	command jump table
 10746                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------
 10747                                  
 10748 0000053A 00                      		db 0

 10818                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10819                                  ; setdrive scans through the data structure of bdss, and returns a pointer to
 10820                                  ; the one that belongs to the drive specified. carry is set if none exists
 10821                                  ; for the drive. Pointer is returned in es:[di]
 10822                                  ;
 10823                                  ;  AL contains the logical drive number.

 10845                                  ; if bit 2 is 0 then media is not removable and could not have changed

 10880                                  		; If we have a floppy with changeline support, we ask the ROM
 10881                                  		; to determine if media has changed. We do not perform the

 10933                                  
 10934                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10935                                  ; perform a check on the time passed since the last access for this physical
 10936                                  ; drive.
 10937                                  ; we are accessing the same drive. if the time of last successful access was
 10938                                  ; less than 2 seconds ago, then we may presume that the disk was not changed.
 10939                                  ; returns in si:
 10940                                  ;	0 - if time of last access was >= 2 seconds
 10941                                  ;	1 - if time was < 2 seconds (i.e no media change assumed)
 10942                                  ; registers affected ax,cx,dx, flags.
 10943                                  ;
 10944                                  ;	assume es:di -> bds, ds->Bios_Data
 10945                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10946                                  
 10947                                  		; 19/10/2022
 10948                                  Check_Time_Of_Access:
 10949 000005F6 BE0100                  		mov	si, 1		; presume no change.
 10950 000005F9 E823FF                  		call	GetTickCnt	; cx:dx	is the elapsed time
 10951 000005FC 268B4547                		mov	ax, [es:di+47h]	; [es:di+BDS.tim_lo]
 10952                                  					; get stored time
 10953 00000600 29C2                    		sub	dx, ax
 10954 00000602 268B4549                		mov	ax, [es:di+49h]	; [es:di+BDS.tim_hi]
 10955 00000606 19C1                    		sbb	cx, ax
 10956                                  		; 11/08/2023
 10957                                  		; PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - BIOSCODE:0646h
 10958                                  		;mov	al, [accesscount]
 10959 00000608 7515                    		jnz	short timecheck_unk ; cx<>0 => >1 hour
 10960 0000060A 09D2                    		or	dx, dx		; time must pass
 10961 0000060C 750C                    		jnz	short timepassed ; yes, examine max value
 10962                                  		; 11/08/2023
 10963                                  		;inc	al
 10964                                  		;cmp	al, 5
 10965                                  		;;inc	byte [accesscount]
 10966                                  		;;cmp	byte [accesscount], 5 
 10967                                  		;			; if count is less than threshold, ok
 10968                                  		;jb	short timecheck_ret
 10969                                  		;;dec	byte [accesscount] ; don't let the count wrap
 10970                                  		; 11/08/2023
 10971                                  		;dec	al
 10972                                  		;jmp	short timecheck_unk ; "i don't know" if media changed
 10973                                  		; 11/08/2023
 10974 0000060E 803E[1D01]04            		cmp	byte [accesscount], 4
 10975 00000613 730A                    		jnb	short timecheck_unk
 10976 00000615 FE06[1D01]              		inc	byte [accesscount]
 10977 00000619 C3                      		retn
 10978                                  
 10979                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10980                                  
 10981                                  timepassed:
 10982 0000061A 83FA24                  		cmp	dx, 36		; 18*2 ; 18.2 tics per second.
 10983                                  					; min elapsed time? (2 seconds)
 10984 0000061D 7601                    		jbe	short timecheck_ret ; yes, presume no change
 10985                                  
 10986                                  		; everything indicates that we do not know what has happened.
 10987                                  timecheck_unk:				
 10988 0000061F 4E                      		dec	si		; presume i don't know
 10989                                  timecheck_ret:
 10990                                  		; 11/08/2023
 10991                                  		;mov	[accesscount], al
 10992 00000620 C3                      		retn

 11043                                  ; ==========================================================================
 11044                                  ;Setptrsav is also jumped to from dsk_init (msbio2.asm). In both cases, the
 11045                                  ;pointer to be returned is in es:di. We were incorrectly returning ds:di.
 11046                                  ;Note that this works in most cases because most pointers are in Bios_Data.
 11047                                  ;It fails, for instance, when we install an external drive using driver.sys
 11048                                  ;because then the BDS segment is no longer Bios_Data. 
 11049                                  ;NB: It is fine to corrupt cx because this is not a return value and anyway
 11050                                  ;this returns to Chardev_entry (msbio1.asm) where all registers are 
 11051                                  ;restored before returning to the caller.

 11067                                  ; 15/10/2022
 11068                                  
 11069                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------
 11070                                  ; clear ids in bds table. only applied for floppies.
 11071                                  ;input:  es:di -> bds table
 11072                                  ;	assumes ds: -> Bios_Data
 11073                                  ;output: volid set to "NO NAME    "
 11074                                  ;	 vol_serial set to 0.
 11075                                  ;	 filesys_id set to "FAT12   " or "FAT16   "
 11076                                  ;	   depending on the flag fatsize in bds.
 11077                                  ;
 11078                                  ;	trashes si, cx
 11079                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------
 11080                                  
 11081                                  ;size_of_EXT_BOOT_VOL_LABEL equ 11
 11082                                  ;size_of_EXT_SYSTEM_ID equ 8
 11083                                  
 11084                                  ; 11/09/2023
 11085                                  ; 14/08/2023
 11086                                  ;BDS.fatsiz equ 1Fh
 11087                                  
 11088                                  clear_ids:
 11089                                  		; 11/09/2023 - Retro DOS v4.1 IO.SYS (Optimization & BugFix)
 11090 0000066A 268A451F                		mov	al, [es:di+1Fh] ; mov al,[es:di+BDS.fatsiz]
 11091                                  clear_ids_x:	; 11/09/2023		
 11092                                   		; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:05D9h)
 11093 0000066E 57                      		push	di
 11094 0000066F 31C9                    		xor	cx, cx		; no serial number
 11095 00000671 26894D57                		mov	[es:di+57h], cx	; [es:di+BDS.vol_serial]
 11096 00000675 26894D59                		mov	[es:di+59h], cx	; [es:di+BDS.vol_serial+2]
 11097                                  
 11098                                  		; BUGBUG - there's a lot in common here and with
 11099                                  		; mov_media_ids.. see if we can save some space by
 11100                                  		; merging them... jgl
 11101                                  
 11102                                  		;mov	cx, 11		; size_of_EXT_BOOT_VOL_LABEL
 11103                                  		; 10/12/2022
 11104 00000679 B10B                    		mov	cl, 11 ; cx = 11		
 11105                                  
 11106                                  		;mov	si, offset vol_no_name ; "NO NAME    "
 11107 0000067B BE[B504]                		mov	si, vol_no_name	; 19/10/2022
 11108 0000067E 83C74B                  		add	di, 75		; BDS.volid
 11109 00000681 F3A4                    		rep movsb
 11110                                  		
 11111                                  		; 11/09/2023 (BugFix, DI is not start addr of BDS structure here)
 11112                                  		;;test	byte [es:di+BDS.fatsiz], fbig
 11113                                  		; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:05EFh)
 11114                                  		;test	byte [es:di+1Fh], 40h
 11115                                  
 11116                                  			; ! NOTE - 11/08/2023 - Erdogan Tan (Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS bugfix)
 11117                                  			; Microsoft/IBM code has a bug here because the BDS's
 11118                                  			; .volid and .filesys_id fields will be reset
 11119                                  			; (to their default text) according to 'BDS.fatsiz' flags
 11120                                  			; at the BDS offset 31 but current (this) code checks flags
 11121                                  			; at ES:DI+31 while DI points the BDS offset 86!?
 11122                                  			;
 11123                                  			; Correct Code:
 11124                                  			; ;test byte [ES:31],40h or [ES:BDS.fatsiz],fbig
 11125                                  			; 11/09/2023
 11126                                  			; (before 'rep movsb') 'mov al,[es:di+BDS.Fatsiz]' and then
 11127                                  			; (after 'rep movsb') 'test al,fbig' (AL is free/proper to use here)	
 11128                                  			;
 11129                                  			; Same BUG is existing in PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - BIOSCODE:06C3h
 11130                                  			; and in Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:0E1Ah as 'test byte [es:di+59],20h'
 11131                                  			; (PCDOS 7.1 BUG note: 26/06/2023)
 11132                                  			;
 11133                                  			; (Why this bug did not affect MSDOS and PCDOS 7.x applications:
 11134                                  			; 'clear_ids' is used for floppy disks only and the default
 11135                                  			; option of 'clear_ids' is FAT12 volid and filesys_id text
 11136                                  			; when the flag bit has wrong value for FAT16/40h or FAT32/20h.)
 11137                                  
 11138 00000683 A840                    		test	al, 40h ; * 
 11139                                  		
 11140                                  		;mov	si, offset fat_16_id ; "FAT16	"
 11141 00000685 BE[AC04]                		mov	si, fat_16_id	; 19/10/2022
 11142 00000688 7503                    		jnz	short ci_bigfat
 11143                                  		;mov	si, offset fat_12_id ; "FAT12	"
 11144 0000068A BE[A304]                		mov	si, fat_12_id	 ; 19/10/2022
 11145                                  ci_bigfat:				
 11146                                  		;mov	cx, 8		; size_of_EXT_SYSTEM_ID
 11147                                  		; 10/12/2022
 11148 0000068D B108                    		mov	cl, 8 ; cx = 8 
 11149 0000068F 83C705                  		add	di, 5		; (BDS.filesys_id-BDS.volid)-size_of_EXT_BOOT_VOL_LABEL
 11150                                  					; filesys_id field
 11151 00000692 F3A4                    		rep movsb
 11152 00000694 5F                      		pop	di		; restore bds pointer
 11153 00000695 C3                      		retn

 11155                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 11156                                  
 11157                                  ; 15/10/2022
 11158                                  
 11159                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 11160                                  ;	getbp - return bpb from the drive specified by the bds.
 11161                                  ;	    if the return_fake_bpb flag is set, then it does nothing.
 11162                                  ;	    note that we never come here for fixed disks.
 11163                                  ;	    for all other cases,
 11164                                  ;	      - it reads boot sector to pull out the bpb
 11165                                  ;	      - if no valid bpb is found, it then reads the fat sector,
 11166                                  ;		to get the fat id byte to build the bpb from there.
 11167                                  ;
 11168                                  ;   inputs:	es:di point to correct bds.
 11169                                  ;
 11170                                  ;   outputs:	fills in bpb in current bds if valid bpb or fat id on disk.
 11171                                  ;		carry set, and al=7 if invalid disk.
 11172                                  ;		carry set and error code in al if other error.
 11173                                  ;		if failed to recognize the boot record, then will set the
 11174                                  ;		set_id_flag to 0.

 11176                                  ;		     for a fixed disk, it will just return.

 11348                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 11349                                  
 11350                                  ; 15/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 11351                                  
 11352                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------
 11353                                  ; read in the boot sector. set carry if error in reading sector.
 11354                                  ; bx is set to 1 if the boot sector is invalid, otherwise it is 0.
 11355                                  ;
 11356                                  ;	assumes es:di -> bds, ds-> Bios_Data
 11357                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------
 11358                                  
 11359                                  ; 10/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 11360                                  
 11361                                  ; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2
 11362                                  ; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, BIOSCODE:06C3h)
 11363                                  
 11364                                  readbootsec:	
 11365 0000074F B600                    		mov	dh, 0		; head 0
 11366 00000751 B90100                  		mov	cx, 1		; cylinder 0, sector 1
 11367 00000754 E8BF00                  		call	read_sector
 11368 00000757 7243                    		jb	short err_ret
 11369 00000759 31DB                    		xor	bx, bx		; assume valid boot sector
 11370                                  
 11371                                  		; put a sanity check for the boot sector in here to detect
 11372                                  		; boot sectors that do not have valid bpbs. we examine the
 11373                                  		; first two bytes - they must contain a long jump (69h) or a
 11374                                  		; short jump (EBh) followed by a nop (90h), or a short jump
 11375                                  		; (E9h). if this test is passed, we further check by examining
 11376                                  		; the signature at the end of the boot sector for the word
 11377                                  		; AA55h. if the signature is not present, we examine the media
 11378                                  		; descriptor byte to see if it is valid. for dos 3.3, this
 11379                                  		; logic is modified a little bit. we are not going to check
 11380                                  		; signature. instead we are going to sanity check the media
 11381                                  		; byte in bpb regardless of the validity of signature. this is
 11382                                  		; to save the already developed commercial products that have
 11383                                  		; good jump instruction and signature but with the false bpb
 11384                                  		; informations
 11385                                  
 11386                                  ; that will crash the diskette drive operation. (for example, symphony diskette).
 11387                                  
 11388                                  		; 02/09/2023
 11389                                  		; 19/10/2022
 11390                                  		;cmp	byte [disksector], 69h ; is it a direct jump?
 11391                                  		;jz	short check_bpb_mediabyte ; don't need to find a nop
 11392                                  		;cmp	byte [disksector], 0E9h ; dos 2.0 jump?
 11393                                  		;jz	short check_bpb_mediabyte ; no need for	nop
 11394                                  		;cmp	byte [disksector], 0EBh ; how about a short jump?
 11395                                  		;jnz	short invalidbootsec
 11396                                  		;cmp	byte [disksector+2], 90h ; is next one a nop?
 11397                                  		;jnz	short invalidbootsec
 11398                                  
 11399                                  		; 02/09/2023 (PCDOS 7.1)
 11400 0000075B A0[5201]                		mov	al, [disksector]
 11401 0000075E 3C69                    		cmp	al, 69h		; is it a direct jump?
 11402 00000760 740F                    		je	short check_bpb_mediabyte
 11403                                  					; don't need to find a nop
 11404 00000762 3CE9                    		cmp	al, 0E9h	; dos 2.0 jump?
 11405 00000764 740B                    		je	short check_bpb_mediabyte
 11406                                  					; no need for nop
 11407 00000766 3CEB                    		cmp	al, 0EBh	; how about a short jump?
 11408 00000768 7530                    		jne	short invalidbootsec
 11409 0000076A 803E[5401]90            		cmp	byte [disksector+2], 90h ; is next one a nop?
 11410 0000076F 7529                    		jne	short invalidbootsec
 11411                                  
 11412                                  ; 15/10/5022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 11413                                  ;
 11414                                  ;; 10/03/2019
 11415                                  ;; (MSDOS 3.3, MSDISK.ASM, 1988)
 11416                                  ;;
 11417                                  ;; Don't have to perform the following signature check since
 11418                                  ;; we need to check the media byte even with the good signatured diskette.
 11419                                  ;;
 11420                                  ;;check_signature:
 11421                                  ;;		cmp	word [cs:disksector+1FEh],0AA55h ; see if non-ibm
 11422                                  ;;							 ; disk or 1.x media.
 11423                                  ;;		jz	short checksinglesided ; go see if singled sided medium.
 11424                                  ;;					       ; may need some special handling
 11425                                  
 11426                                  ; check for non-ibm disks which do not have the signature AA55h at the
 11427                                  ; end of the boot sector, but still have a valid boot sector. this is done
 11428                                  ; by examining the media descriptor in the boot sector.
 11429                                  
 11430                                  		; 19/10/2022
 11431                                  check_bpb_mediabyte:
 11432 00000771 A0[6701]                		mov	al, [disksector+15h]
 11433                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.MEDIADESCRIPTOR]
 11434 00000774 50                      		push	ax ; 02/09/2023
 11435 00000775 24F0                    		and	al, 0F0h
 11436 00000777 3CF0                    		cmp	al, 0F0h	; allow	for strange media
 11437 00000779 58                      		pop	ax ; 02/09/2023
 11438 0000077A 751E                    		jnz	short invalidbootsec
 11439                                  
 11440                                  ; there were some (apparently a lot of them) diskettes that had been formatted
 11441                                  ; under dos 3.1 and earlier versions which have invalid bpbs in their boot
 11442                                  ; sectors. these are specifically diskettes that were formatted in drives
 11443                                  ; with one head, or whose side 0 was bad. these contain bpbs in the boot
 11444                                  ; sector that have the sec/clus field set to 2 instead of 1, as is standard
 11445                                  ; in dos. in order to support them, we have to introduce a "hack" that will
 11446                                  ; help our build bpb routine to recognise these specific cases, and to
 11447                                  ; set up out copy of the bpb accordingly.
 11448                                  ; we do this by checking to see if the boot sector is off a diskette that
 11449                                  ; is single-sided and is a pre-dos 3.20 diskette. if it is, we set the
 11450                                  ; sec/clus field to 1. if not, we carry on as normal.
 11451                                  
 11452                                  checksinglesided:
 11453                                  		;mov	al, [disksector+15h]
 11454                                  		; 02/09/2023
 11455                                  		; al = [disksector+15h]
 11456 0000077C 3CF0                    		cmp	al, 0F0h
 11457 0000077E 741B                    		jz	short gooddsk
 11458 00000780 A801                    		test	al, 1
 11459 00000782 7517                    		jnz	short gooddsk
 11460 00000784 813E[5A01]332E          		cmp	word [disksector+8], 2E33h ; "3."
 11461 0000078A 7507                    		jnz	short mustbeearlier
 11462 0000078C 803E[5C01]32            		cmp	byte [disksector+0Ah], 32h ; "2"
 11463 00000791 7308                    		jnb	short gooddsk
 11464                                  
 11465                                  ; we must have a pre-3.20 diskette. set the sec/clus field to 1
 11466                                  
 11467                                  mustbeearlier:				
 11468 00000793 C606[5F01]01            		mov	byte [disksector+0Dh], 1
 11469                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.SECTORSPERCLUSTER]
 11470 00000798 EB01                    		jmp	short gooddsk
 11471                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 11472                                  
 11473                                  invalidbootsec:				
 11474 0000079A 43                      		inc	bx		; indicate that boot sector invalid
 11475                                  		; 10/12/2022
 11476                                  movbpb_ret:
 11477                                  gooddsk:				
 11478 0000079B F8                      		clc
 11479                                  err_ret:
 11480 0000079C C3                      		retn

 11482

 11487                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 11488                                  
 11489                                  ; 15/10/2022
 11490                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 11491                                  ; 'movbpb' moves the bpb read from the boot sector into registers for use by
 11492                                  ; getbp routine at has1
 11493                                  ;
 11494                                  ; if the set_id_flag is 1, and if an extended boot record, then set volume
 11495                                  ; serial number, volume label, file system id in bds according to
 11496                                  ; the boot record.  after that, this routine will set the set_id_flag to 2
 11497                                  ; to signal that volume label is set already from the extended boot record
 11498                                  ; (so, don't set it again by calling "set_volume_id" routine which uses
 11499                                  ; the volume label in the root directory.)
 11500                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 11501                                  
 11502                                  ; 10/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 11503                                  
 11504                                  		; 19/10/2022
 11505                                  movbpb:	
 11506 0000079D 8A36[5F01]              		mov	dh, [disksector+0Dh]
 11507                                  					; disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.SECTORSPERCLUSTER]
 11508                                  					; sectors per unit
 11509 000007A1 8A3E[6301]              		mov	bh, [disksector+11h]
 11510                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.ROOTENTRIES]
 11511                                  					; number of directory entries
 11512 000007A5 8B0E[6501]              		mov	cx, [disksector+13h]
 11513                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.TOTALSECTORS]
 11514                                  					; size of drive
 11515 000007A9 8A26[6701]              		mov	ah, [disksector+15h]
 11516                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.MEDIADESCRIPTOR]
 11517                                  					; media	descriptor
 11518 000007AD A0[6801]                		mov	al, [disksector+16h];
 11519                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.SECTORSPERFAT]
 11520                                  					; number of fat	sectors
 11521 000007B0 8A1E[6A01]              		mov	bl, [disksector+18h]
 11522                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.SECTORSPERTRACK]
 11523                                  					; sectors per track
 11524 000007B4 8A16[6C01]              		mov	dl, [disksector+1Ah]
 11525                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.HEADS]
 11526                                  					; number of heads
 11527 000007B8 803E[A204]01            		cmp	byte [set_id_flag], 1 ; called by get_bpb?
 11528 000007BD 75DC                    		jnz	short movbpb_ret
 11529 000007BF E81200                  		call	mov_media_ids
 11530 000007C2 7205                    		jb	short movbpb_conv ; conventional boot record?
 11531 000007C4 C606[A204]02            		mov	byte [set_id_flag], 2 ; signals that volume id is set
 11532                                  movbpb_conv:				
 11533 000007C9 803E[7700]01            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 1
 11534 000007CE 75CB                    		jnz	short movbpb_ret
 11535 000007D0 E8B511                  		call	resetchanged	; reset	flags in bds to	not fchanged.
 11536                                  		; 10/12/2022
 11537                                  		; cf = 0
 11538                                  ;movbpb_ret:				
 11539                                  		;clc
 11540 000007D3 C3                      		retn
 11541                                  
 11542                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 11543                                  
 11544                                  ;copy the boot_serial number, volume id, and filesystem id from the
 11545                                  ;***extended boot record*** in ds:disksector to the bds table pointed
 11546                                  ;by es:di.
 11547                                  
 11548                                  ;in.) es:di -> bds
 11549                                  ;     ds:disksector = valid extended boot record.
 11550                                  ;out.) vol_serial, bds_volid and bds_system_id in bds are set according to
 11551                                  ;      the boot record information.
 11552                                  ;     carry flag set if not an extended bpb.
 11553                                  ;     all registers saved except the flag.
 11554                                  
 11555                                  		; 19/10/2022
 11556                                  mov_media_ids:		
 11557 000007D4 803E[7801]29            		cmp	byte [disksector+26h], 29h
 11558                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.SIG],
 11559                                  					; EXT_BOOT_SIGNATURE
 11560 000007D9 752C                    		jnz	short mmi_not_ext
 11561 000007DB 51                      		push	cx
 11562 000007DC 8B0E[7901]              		mov	cx, [disksector+27h]
 11563                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.SERIAL]
 11564 000007E0 26894D57                		mov	[es:di+57h], cx	; [es:di+BDS.vol_serial]
 11565 000007E4 8B0E[7B01]              		mov	cx, [disksector+29h]
 11566                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.SERIAL+2]
 11567 000007E8 26894D59                		mov	[es:di+59h], cx	; [es:di+BDS.vol_serial+2]
 11568 000007EC 57                      		push	di
 11569 000007ED 56                      		push	si
 11570 000007EE B90B00                  		mov	cx, 11		; size_of_EXT_BOOT_VOL_LABEL
 11571 000007F1 BE[7D01]                		mov	si, disksector+2Bh
 11572                                  		;mov	si, (offset disksector+2Bh) ;

 11600                                  ; --------------------------------------------------------------
 11601                                  ; read in the fat sector and get the media byte from it.
 11602                                  ; input : es:di -> bds
 11603                                  ; output:
 11604                                  ;	  carry set if an error occurs, ax contains error code.
 11605                                  ;	  otherwise, ah contains media byte on exit

 11620                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 11621                                  
 11622                                  ; 15/10/2022
 11623                                  
 11624                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 11625                                  ; read a single sector into the temp buffer.
 11626                                  ; perform three retries in case of error.
 11627                                  ;   inputs:	es:[di].bds_drivenum has physical drive to use
 11628                                  ;		cx has sector and cylinder
 11629                                  ;		dh has head
 11630                                  ;		es:di has bds
 11631                                  ;		ds has Bios_Data
 11632                                  ;
 11633                                  ;   outputs:	carry clear
 11634                                  ;		    Bios_Data:bx point to sector
 11635                                  ;		       (note: some callers assume location of buffer)
 11636                                  ;
 11637                                  ;		carry set
 11638                                  ;		    ax has rom error code
 11639                                  ;
 11640                                  ; register bp is preserved.
 11641                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 11642                                  
 11643                                  ; 10/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 11644                                  
 11645                                  		; 19/10/2022
 11646                                  read_sector:	
 11647 00000816 55                      		push	bp
 11648 00000817 BD0300                  		mov	bp, 3		; make 3 attempts
 11649 0000081A 268A5504                		mov	dl, [es:di+4]	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 11650 0000081E BB[5201]                		mov	bx, disksector	; get es:bx to point to	buffer
 11651                                  rd_ret:					
 11652 00000821 06                      		push	es
 11653 00000822 1E                      		push	ds
 11654 00000823 07                      		pop	es
 11655 00000824 B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h
 11656 00000827 CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - READ SECTORS INTO MEMORY
 11657                                  					; AL = number of sectors to read, CH = track, CL = sector
 11658                                  					; DH = head, DL	= drive, ES:BX -> buffer to fill
 11659                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status,	AL = number of sectors read
 11660 00000829 07                      		pop	es
 11661 0000082A 734A                    		jnb	short okret2
 11662                                  rd_rty:					
 11663 0000082C E87404                  		call	again		; reset	disk, decrement	bp, preserve ax
 11664 0000082F 7442                    		jz	short err_rd_ret
 11665 00000831 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1
 11666                                  		;test	byte ptr [es:di+23h], 1	; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 11667                                  					; fnon_removable
 11668 00000836 75E9                    		jnz	short rd_ret
 11669 00000838 803E[D005]00            		cmp	byte [media_set_for_format], 0
 11670 0000083D 7510                    		jnz	short rd_skip1_dpt
 11671 0000083F 50                      		push	ax
 11672 00000840 1E                      		push	ds		; for retry, set the head settle time to 0Fh
 11673 00000841 C536[2D01]              		lds	si, [dpt]
 11674                                  		;mov	al, [si+9]	; [si+DISK_PARMS.DISK_HEAD_STTL]
 11675                                  		;mov	byte [si+9], 15 ; [si+DISK_PARMS.DISK_HEAD_STTL]
 11676                                  		;			; NORMSETTLE
 11677                                  		; 12/12/2022
 11678 00000845 B00F                    		mov	al, 15
 11679 00000847 864409                  		xchg	al, [si+9]
 11680                                  		; 
 11681 0000084A 1F                      		pop	ds
 11682 0000084B A2[2A01]                		mov	[save_head_sttl], al
 11683 0000084E 58                      		pop	ax
 11684                                  rd_skip1_dpt:				
 11685 0000084F 06                      		push	es
 11686 00000850 1E                      		push	ds
 11687 00000851 07                      		pop	es
 11688 00000852 B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h
 11689 00000855 CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - READ SECTORS INTO MEMORY
 11690                                  					; AL = number of sectors to read, CH = track, CL = sector
 11691                                  					; DH = head, DL	= drive, ES:BX -> buffer to fill
 11692                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status,	AL = number of sectors read
 11693 00000857 07                      		pop	es
 11694 00000858 9C                      		pushf
 11695 00000859 803E[D005]00            		cmp	byte [media_set_for_format], 0
 11696 0000085E 750E                    		jnz	short rd_skip2_dpt
 11697 00000860 50                      		push	ax
 11698 00000861 A0[2A01]                		mov	al, [save_head_sttl]
 11699 00000864 1E                      		push	ds
 11700 00000865 C536[2D01]              		lds	si, [dpt]
 11701 00000869 884409                  		mov	[si+9],	al	; [si+DISK_PARMS.DISK_HEAD_STTL]
 11702 0000086C 1F                      		pop	ds
 11703 0000086D 58                      		pop	ax
 11704                                  rd_skip2_dpt:				
 11705 0000086E 9D                      		popf
 11706 0000086F 7305                    		jnb	short okret2
 11707 00000871 EBB9                    		jmp	short rd_rty

 11709                                  
 11710                                  err_rd_ret:

 11713 00000875 F9                      		stc
 11714                                  
 11715                                  ; update information pertaining to last drive accessed, time of access, last
 11716                                  ; track accessed in that drive.

 11718                                  okret2:

 11823                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------
 11824                                  ; miscellaneous odd jump routines. 
 11825                                  ; moved out of mainline for speed.
 11826                                  
 11827                                  ; if we have a system where we have virtual drives, we need 
 11828                                  ; to prompt the user to place the correct disk in the drive.
 11829                                  ;
 11830                                  ;	assume es:di -> bds, ds:->Bios_Data
 11831                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------
 11832                                  
 11833                                  		; 19/10/2022
 11834                                  checksingle:		
 11835 000008D8 50                      		push	ax
 11836 000008D9 53                      		push	bx
 11837 000008DA 268B5D23                		mov	bx, [es:di+23h]	; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 11838                                  
 11839                                  ; if hard drive, cannot change disk.
 11840                                  ; if current owner of physical drive, no need to change diskette.
 11841                                  
 11842 000008DE F6C321                  		test	bl, 21h		; fnon_removable|fi_own_physical
 11843 000008E1 7573                    		jnz	short singleret
 11844 000008E3 F6C310                  		test	bl, 10h		; fi_am_mult
 11845                                  					; is there a drive sharing this	physical drive?
 11846 000008E6 746E                    		jz	short singleret
 11847                                  
 11848                                  
 11849                                  ; look for the previous owner of this physical drive
 11850                                  ; and reset its ownership flag.
 11851                                  
 11852 000008E8 268A4504                		mov	al, [es:di+4]	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 11853                                  					; get physical drive number
 11854 000008EC 06                      		push	es		; preserve pointer to current bds
 11855 000008ED 57                      		push	di
 11856 000008EE C43E[1901]              		les	di, [start_bds] ; get first bds
 11857                                  scan_list:				
 11858 000008F2 26384504                		cmp	[es:di+4], al
 11859 000008F6 7553                    		jnz	short scan_skip	; Not our drive. Try next bds.
 11860 000008F8 B320                    		mov	bl, 20h	; ' '   ; fi_own_physical ; test ownership flag
 11861 000008FA 26845D23                		test	[es:di+23h], bl
 11862 000008FE 744B                    		jz	short scan_skip	; he doesn't own it either. continue
 11863 00000900 26305D23                		xor	[es:di+23h], bl	; reset	ownership flag
 11864 00000904 5F                      		pop	di		; restore pointer to current bds
 11865 00000905 07                      		pop	es
 11866 00000906 26085D23                		or	[es:di+23h], bl	; ; set	ownership flag
 11867                                  
 11868                                  ; we examine the fsetowner flag. if it is set, then we are using the code in
 11869                                  ; checksingle to just set the owner of a drive. we must not issue the prompt
 11870                                  ; in this case.
 11871 0000090A 803E[7A00]01            		cmp	byte [fsetowner], 1
 11872 0000090F 7517                    		jnz	short not_fsetowner
 11873                                  		;cmp	byte ptr es:[di+4], 0 ;	are we handling	drive number 0 ?
 11874 00000911 26807D0400              		cmp	byte [es:di+4], 0
 11875 00000916 753E                    		jnz	short singleret
 11876 00000918 268A4505                		mov	al, [es:di+5]
 11877                                  		;mov	al, es:[di+5]	; [es:di+BDS.drivelet]
 11878                                  					; get the DOS drive letter
 11879 0000091C 06                      		push	es
 11880 0000091D 8E06[1A00]              		mov	es, [zeroseg]
 11881 00000921 26A20405                		mov	[es:LSTDRV], al

 11888                                  ; to support "backward" compatibility with ibm's "single drive status byte"
 11889                                  ; we now check to see if we are in a single drive system and the application

 11945                                  ; 15/10/52022
 11946                                  
 11947                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 11948                                  ;	disk i/o handler
 11949                                  ;
 11950                                  ;	al = drive number (0-6)
 11951                                  ;	ah = media descriptor
 11952                                  ;	cx = sector count
 11953                                  ;	dx = first sector (low)
 11954                                  ;	[start_sec_h] = first sector (high)  32 bit calculation.
 11955                                  ;	ds = cs
 11956                                  ;	es:di = transfer address
 11957                                  ;	[rflag]=operation (2=read, 3=write)
 11958                                  ;	[verify]=1 for verify after write
 11959                                  ;
 11960                                  ;	if successful carry flag = 0
 11961                                  ;	  else cf=1 and al contains error code
 11962                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 11963                                  
 11964                                  diskrd:	
 11965                                  		;mov	ds:rflag, 2	; romread
 11966                                  		; 19/10/2022
 11967 00000961 C606[2001]02            		mov	byte [rflag], 2 ; romread

 11969                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 11970                                  
 11971                                  		; 19/10/2022
 11972                                  diskio:
 11973 00000966 89FB                    		mov	bx, di		; es:bx	= transfer address
 11974 00000968 8C06[CF04]              		mov	[xfer_seg], es	; save transfer	segment
 11975 0000096C E801FC                  		call	SetDrive
 11976 0000096F 268A4510                		mov	al, [es:di+10h]	; [es:di+BDS.media]
 11977 00000973 A2[1F01]                		mov	[medbyt], al
 11978                                  		;jcxz	short ioret
 11979 00000976 E3E8                    		jcxz	ioret
 11980                                  
 11981                                  ; see if the media is formatted or not by checking the flags field in
 11982                                  ; in the bds. if it is unformatted we cannot allow i/o, so we should
 11983                                  ; go to the error exit at label unformatteddrive.
 11984                                  
 11985 00000978 26F6452402              		test	byte [es:di+24h], 2
 11986                                  		;test	byte ptr es:[di+24h], 2	; [es:di+BDS.flags+1]
 11987                                  					; unformatted_media
 11988 0000097D 75DE                    		jnz	short unformatteddrive
 11989 0000097F 890E[2201]              		mov	[seccnt], cx	; save sector count
 11990 00000983 8926[3501]              		mov	[spsav], sp	; save sp
 11991                                  
 11992                                  ; ensure that we are trying to access valid sectors on the drive
 11993                                  
 11994 00000987 89D0                    		mov	ax, dx
 11995 00000989 31F6                    		xor	si, si

 11997                                  		;adc	si, 0

 11999 0000098D D1D6                    		rcl	si, 1

 12001                                  					; 32 bit sector ?

 12003                                  		;cmp	si, 0
 12004                                  		; 02/09/2023
 12005 00000996 09F6                    		or	si, si

 12007 0000099A 263B550E                		cmp	dx, [es:di+0Eh]	; [es:di+BDS.totalsecs16]
 12008 0000099E 77B9                    		ja	short baddrive
 12009 000009A0 EB12                    		jmp	short sanityok

 12011                                  
 12012                                  sanity32:				
 12013 000009A2 0336[C304]              		add	si, [start_sec_h]
 12014 000009A6 263B751D                		cmp	si, [es:di+1Dh]	; [es:di+BDS.totalsecs32+2]
 12015 000009AA 7208                    		jb	short sanityok
 12016 000009AC 77AB                    		ja	short baddrive
 12017 000009AE 263B551B                		cmp	dx, [es:di+1Bh]	; [es:di+BDS.totalsecs32]

 12020                                  sanityok:

 12425                                  
 12426                                  ; check the error returned in ah to see if it is a soft ecc error.
 12427                                  ; if it is not we needn't do anything special. if it is a soft
 12428                                  ; ecc error then decrement the soft_ecc_cnt error retry count. if
 12429                                  ; this retry count becomes 0 then we just ignore the error and go to

 12449                                  ; if we get this, we need to return it.
 12450                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------
 12451                                  
 12452                                  dskerr:					
 12453 00000BDD 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0	; do we	have changeline	support?
 12454 00000BE2 7403                    		jz	short dskerr_nochangeline ; brif not
 12455 00000BE4 E80B0D                  		call	checkio
 12456                                  dskerr_nochangeline:			
 12457 00000BE7 803E[CE04]01            		cmp	byte [multitrk_format_flag], 1 ; multi trk format request?
 12458 00000BEC 7508                    		jnz	short dochkagain ; no more retry.
 12459 00000BEE BD0100                  		mov	bp, 1
 12460 00000BF1 C606[CE04]00            		mov	byte [multitrk_format_flag], 0 ; clear the flag.
 12461                                  dochkagain:				
 12462 00000BF6 E8AA00                  		call	again
 12463                                  dskerr0:				
 12464 00000BF9 7420                    		jz	short harderr
 12465 00000BFB 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 12466                                  					; fnon_removable
 12467 00000C00 7505                    		jnz	short skip_timeout_chk
 12468 00000C02 80FC80                  		cmp	ah, 80h		; timeout?
 12469 00000C05 7414                    		jz	short harderr
 12470                                  skip_timeout_chk:			
 12471 00000C07 80FCCC                  		cmp	ah, 0CCh	; write	fault error?
 12472 00000C0A 740A                    		jz	short write_fault_err ;	then, don't retry.
 12473 00000C0C C706[CC04]0500          		mov	word [soft_ecc_cnt], 5 ; MAXERR
 12474                                  					; set soft_ecc_cnt back	to maxerr
 12475                                  dskerr1:				
 12476 00000C12 58                      		pop	ax		; restore sector count
 12477                                  		;jmp	retry
 12478                                  		; 09/12/2022
 12479 00000C13 E9F9FE                  		jmp	_retry
 12480                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12481                                  
 12482                                  write_fault_err:			
 12483 00000C16 BD0100                  		mov	bp, 1		; just retry only once
 12484                                  					; for write fault error.
 12485 00000C19 EBF7                    		jmp	short dskerr1
 12486                                  
 12487                                  		; fall into harderr
 12488                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12489                                  
 12490                                  ; entry point for routines that call maperror themselves
 12491                                  
 12492                                  harderr:				
 12493 00000C1B E84D00                  		call	maperror
 12494                                  harderr2:				
 12495 00000C1E C606[1E01]FF            		mov	byte [tim_drv], 0FFh
 12496                                  					; force a media check through rom
 12497 00000C23 8B0E[2201]              		mov	cx, [seccnt]	; get count of sectors to go
 12498 00000C27 8B26[3501]              		mov	sp, [spsav]	; recover entry	stack pointer
 12499                                  
 12500                                  ; since we are performing a non-local goto, restore the disk parameters
 12501                                  
 12502                                  		;jmp	diddleback
 12503                                  		; 09/12/2022
 12504 00000C2B E958FE                  		jmp	diddle_back
 12505                                  
 12506                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 12507                                  
 12508                                  ; change settle value from settlecurrent to whatever is appropriate
 12509                                  ; note that this routine is never called for a fixed disk.
 12510                                  
 12511                                  		; 19/10/2022
 12512                                  normspeed:
 12513 00000C2E 803E[D005]00            		cmp	byte [media_set_for_format], 0
 12514 00000C33 751E                    		jnz	short fastspeed
 12515 00000C35 06                      		push	es
 12516 00000C36 50                      		push	ax
 12517 00000C37 A0[2801]                		mov	al, [settleslow]
 12518 00000C3A C436[2D01]              		les	si, [dpt]	; current disk parm table
 12519 00000C3E 26884409                		mov	[es:si+9], al	; [es:si+DISK_PARMS.DISK_HEAD_STTL]
 12520 00000C42 58                      		pop	ax
 12521 00000C43 07                      		pop	es
 12522 00000C44 E80C00                  		call	fastspeed
 12523 00000C47 06                      		push	es
 12524 00000C48 C436[2D01]              		les	si, [dpt]
 12525 00000C4C 26C6440901              		mov	byte [es:si+9], 1 ; [es:si+DISK_PARMS.DISK_HEAD_STTL]
 12526                                  					; 1 is fast settle value
 12527 00000C51 07                      		pop	es
 12528 00000C52 C3                      		retn
 12529                                  
 12530                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 12531                                  
 12532                                  ; if the drive has been marked as too big (i.e. starting sector of the
 12533                                  ; partition is > 16 bits, then always return drive not ready.
 12534                                  
 12535                                  fastspeed:		
 12536 00000C53 26F6451F80              		test	byte [es:di+1Fh], 80h ; [es:di+BDS.fatsiz]
 12537                                  					; ftoobig
 12538 00000C58 750D                    		jnz	short notready
 12539 00000C5A 06                      		push	es
 12540 00000C5B 8E06[CF04]              		mov	es, [xfer_seg]
 12541 00000C5F CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK -
 12542 00000C61 8C06[CF04]              		mov	[xfer_seg], es
 12543 00000C65 07                      		pop	es
 12544 00000C66 C3                      		retn
 12545                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12546                                  
 12547                                  notready:				
 12548 00000C67 F9                      		stc
 12549 00000C68 B480                    		mov	ah, 80h
 12550 00000C6A C3                      		retn
 12551                                  
 12552                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 12553                                  
 12554                                  ; map error returned by rom in ah into corresponding code to be returned to
 12555                                  ; dos in al. trashes di. guaranteed to set carry.
 12556                                  
 12557                                  maperror:	
 12558 00000C6B 51                      		push	cx
 12559 00000C6C 06                      		push	es
 12560 00000C6D 1E                      		push	ds		; set es=Bios_Data
 12561 00000C6E 07                      		pop	es
 12562 00000C6F 88E0                    		mov	al, ah		; put error code in al
 12563 00000C71 A2[4601]                		mov	[lsterr], al	; terminate list with error code
 12564                                  		;mov	cx, 11 ; PCDOS 7.1 ; 02/09/2023
 12565 00000C74 B90900                  		mov	cx, 9		; numerr (= errout-errin)
 12566                                  					; number of possible error conditions
 12567 00000C77 BF[3C01]                		mov	di, errin	; point to error conditions
 12568 00000C7A F2AE                    		repne scasb
 12569                                  		; 02/09/2023
 12570                                  		;mov	al, [di+10] ; PCDOS 7.1
 12571                                  		; 10/12/2022
 12572 00000C7C 8A4508                  		mov	al, [di+8]	; [di+numerr-1]
 12573                                  					; get translation
 12574                                  		; 19/10/2022 - Temporary ! 
 12575                                  		;db	8Ah, 85h, 8, 0	; mov al, [di+8]
 12576 00000C7F 07                      		pop	es
 12577 00000C80 59                      		pop	cx
 12578 00000C81 F9                      		stc			; flag error condition
 12579 00000C82 C3                      		retn
 12580                                  
 12581                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 12582                                  
 12583                                  ; set the time of last access for this drive.
 12584                                  ; this is done only for removable media. es:di -> bds
 12585                                  
 12586                                  set_tim:		
 12587 00000C83 50                      		push	ax
 12588 00000C84 E898F8                  		call	GetTickCnt	; Does INT 1A ah=0 & updates daycnt
 12589                                  
 12590                                  ; we have the new time. if we see that the time has passed,
 12591                                  ; then we reset the threshold counter...
 12592                                  
 12593 00000C87 263B5547                		cmp	dx, [es:di+47h]	; [es:di+BDS.tim_lo]
 12594 00000C8B 7506                    		jnz	short setaccess
 12595 00000C8D 263B4D49                		cmp	cx, [es:di+49h]	; [es:di+BDS.tim_hi]
 12596                                  		;jz	short done_set
 12597                                  		; 12/12/2022
 12598 00000C91 740E                    		je	short done_set2
 12599                                  setaccess:				
 12600 00000C93 C606[1D01]00            		mov	byte [accesscount], 0
 12601 00000C98 26895547                		mov	[es:di+47h], dx	; [es:di+BDS.tim_lo]
 12602 00000C9C 26894D49                		mov	[es:di+49h], cx	; [es:di+BDS.tim_hi]
 12603                                  done_set:				
 12604 00000CA0 F8                      		clc
 12605                                  done_set2:		; 12/12/2022
 12606 00000CA1 58                      		pop	ax
 12607 00000CA2 C3                      		retn
 12608                                  
 12609                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 12610                                  
 12611                                  ; this routine is called if an error occurs while formatting or verifying.
 12612                                  ; it resets the drive,and decrements the retry count.
 12613                                  ; on entry - ds:di - points to bds for the drive
 12614                                  ;	     bp    - contains retry count
 12615                                  ; on exit    flags indicate result of decrementing retry count
 12616                                  
 12617                                  again:	
 12618 00000CA3 E86304                  		call	ResetDisk
 12619 00000CA6 80FC06                  		cmp	ah, 6
 12620 00000CA9 7402                    		jz	short dont_dec_retry_count ; If	it is a	media change error
 12621                                  					; do not decrement retry count.
 12622 00000CAB 4D                      		dec	bp		; decrement retry count
 12623 00000CAC C3                      		retn
 12624                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12625                                  
 12626                                  dont_dec_retry_count:			
 12627 00000CAD 08E4                    		or	ah, ah
 12628 00000CAF C3                      		retn

 12641                                  ; NOTE: GetAccessFlag/SetAccessFlag is unpublished function.
 12642                                  ;
 12643                                  ;      This function is intended to give the user to control the
 12644                                  ;      bds table flags of unformatted_media bit.
 12645                                  ;      GetAccessFlag will show the status -
 12646                                  ;	 a_DiskAccess_Control.dac_access_flag = 0 disk i/o not allowed
 12647                                  ;						1 disk i/o allowed
 12648                                  ;      SetAccessFlag will set/reset the unformatted_media bit in flags -
 12649                                  ;	 a_DiskAccess_Control.dac_access_flag = 0 allow disk i/o
 12650                                  ;						1 disallow disk i/o

 12664                                  		dw 0CA7h	; 60h	; GetDeviceParameters
 12665                                  		dw 0EE8h	; 61h	;gh ReadTrack
 12666                                  		dw 0E86h	; 62h	; VerifyTrack

 12668                                  		dw 0CA3h		; Cmd_Error_Proc

 12676                                  		dw 0EEFh	; 41h	; WriteTrack
 12677                                  		dw 0DC1h	; 42h	; FormatTrack
 12678                                  		dw 0CA3h		; Cmd_Error_Proc
 12679                                  		dw 0CA3h		; Cmd_Error_Proc

 12682                                  		dw 1280h	; 47h	; SetAccessFlag ; unpublished function

 12711                                  ; This table contains all of the valid generic IOCtl Minor codes for

 12717 00000CD6 40                      		db 40h			; SET_DEVICE_PARAMETERS

 12719 00000CD8 41                      		db 41h			; WRITE_TRACK
 12720 00000CD9 62                      		db 62h			; VERIFY_TRACK

 12733                                  
 12734                                  ; ==========================================================================
 12735                                  ; Do_Generic_IOCtl: perform generic ioctl request
 12736                                  ;
 12737                                  ;    input: AL contains logical drive
 12738                                  ;
 12739                                  ;	functions are dispatched through a call. On return, carry indicates
 12740                                  ;	error code in al. Note::bES:b& ds undefined on return from
 12741                                  ;	subfunctions.
 12742                                  ;
 12743                                  ; ==========================================================================
 12744                                  
 12745                                  ; 11/03/2019
 12746                                  		; 19/10/2022
 12747                                  do_generic_ioctl:			; 2C7h:0C6Bh = 70h:31DBh
 12748 00000CE0 E88DF8                  		call	SetDrive	; ES:DI	Points to bds for drive
 12749 00000CE3 06                      		push	es
 12750 00000CE4 C41E[1200]              		les	bx, [ptrsav]	; ES:BX	Points to request header
 12751 00000CE8 26807F0D08              		cmp	byte [es:bx+0Dh], 8 ; [es:bx+IOCTL_REQ.MAJORFUNCTION]
 12752                                  					; RAWIO
 12753 00000CED 268A470E                		mov	al, [es:bx+0Eh]	; [es:bx+IOCTL_REQ.MINORFUNCTION]
 12754 00000CF1 07                      		pop	es
 12755 00000CF2 7525                    		jnz	short IoctlFuncErr
 12756                                  
 12757                                  		; cas note: Could do the above two blocks in reverse order.
 12758                                  		; Would have to preserve al for SetDrive
 12759                                  
 12760                                  		; 10/12/2022
 12761 00000CF4 BE[B10C]                		mov	si, IoReadJumpTable
 12762                                  		;mov	si, 0C3Ch	; IoReadJumpTable
 12763                                  					; at 2C7h:0C3Ch	= 70h:31ACh
 12764 00000CF7 A820                    		test	al, 20h		; GEN_IOCTL_FN_TST ; test of req. function
 12765 00000CF9 7503                    		jnz	short NotGenericWrite ; function is a read.
 12766                                  		; 10/12/2022
 12767 00000CFB BE[C40C]                		mov	si, IoWriteJumpTable
 12768                                  		;mov	si, 0C4Fh	; IoWriteJumpTable
 12769                                  					; at 2C7h:0C4Fh	= 70h:31BFh
 12770                                  NotGenericWrite:			
 12771 00000CFE 24DF                    		and	al, 0DFh	; ~GEN_IOCTL_FN_TST ; get rid of read/write bit
 12772 00000D00 2C40                    		sub	al, 40h		; offset for base function
 12773 00000D02 2E3A04                  		cmp	al, [cs:si]
 12774 00000D05 7712                    		ja	short IoctlFuncErr
 12775 00000D07 98                      		cbw
 12776 00000D08 D1E0                    		shl	ax, 1
 12777 00000D0A 46                      		inc	si
 12778 00000D0B 01C6                    		add	si, ax
 12779 00000D0D 2EFF14                  		call	near [cs:si]
 12780                                  		;call	word ptr cs:[si]
 12781 00000D10 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD]
 12782                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:Bios_Data_Word]
 12783                                  					; 2C7h:30h = 70h:25A0h
 12784 00000D15 B481                    		mov	ah, 81h		; Return this status in	case of	carry
 12785 00000D17 C3                      		retn			; Pass carry flag through to exit code
 12786                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12787                                  
 12788                                  		; Cmd_Error_Proc is called as a procedure and also use
 12789                                  		; as a fall through from above
 12790                                  Cmd_Error_Proc:				; 2C7h:0CA3h = 70h:3213h
 12791 00000D18 5A                      		pop	dx
 12792                                  
 12793                                  IoctlFuncErr:				
 12794 00000D19 E9BDF3                  		jmp	bc_cmderr
 12795                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12796                                  
 12797                                  ; 16/10/2022
 12798                                  
 12799                                  ; ==========================================================================
 12800                                  ;**	GetDeviceParameters:
 12801                                  ;
 12802                                  ;	GetDeviceParameters implements the generic ioctl function:
 12803                                  ;	majorcode=RAWIO, minorcode=GetDeviceParameters (60h)
 12804                                  ;
 12805                                  ;	ENTRY	(ES:di) = BDS for drive
 12806                                  ;		PtrSav = long pointer to request header
 12807                                  ;	EXIT	??? BUGBUG
 12808                                  ;	USES	??? BUGBUG
 12809                                  ; ==========================================================================
 12810                                  
 12811                                  		; 19/10/2022
 12812                                  GetDeviceParameters:
 12813                                  		; Copy info from bds to the device parameters packet
 12814                                  
 12815 00000D1C C51E[1200]              		lds	bx, [ptrsav]	; DS:BX	points to request header
 12816 00000D20 C55F13                  		lds	bx, [bx+19]	; [bx+IOCTL_REQ.GENERICIOCTL_PACKET]
 12817                                  					; (DS:BX) = return buffer
 12818 00000D23 268A4522                		mov	al, [es:di+34]	; [es:di+BDS.formfactor]
 12819 00000D27 884701                  		mov	[bx+1],	al	; [bx+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_DEVICETYPE]
 12820 00000D2A 268B4523                		mov	ax, [es:di+35]	; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 12821 00000D2E 83E003                  		and	ax, 3		; fnon_removable+fchangeline
 12822                                  					; Mask off other bits
 12823 00000D31 894702                  		mov	[bx+2],	ax	; [bx+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_DEVICEATTRIBUTES]
 12824 00000D34 268B4525                		mov	ax, [es:di+37]	; [es:di+BDS.cylinders]
 12825 00000D38 894704                  		mov	[bx+4],	ax	; [bx+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_CYLINDERS]
 12826 00000D3B 30C0                    		xor	al, al		; Set media type to default
 12827 00000D3D 884706                  		mov	[bx+6],	al	; [bx+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_MEDIATYPE]
 12828                                  					
 12829                                  		; copy recommended bpb
 12830 00000D40 8D7527                  		lea	si, [di+39]	; [di+BDS.rbytespersec]	= [di+BDS.R_BPB]
 12831 00000D43 F60701                  		test	byte [bx], 1	; [bx+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_SPECIALFUNCTIONS]
 12832                                  					; BUILD_DEVICE_BPB
 12833 00000D46 7412                    		jz	short UseBpbPresent
 12834 00000D48 1E                      		push	ds		; Save request packet segment
 12835 00000D49 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD]
 12836                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:Bios_Data_Word]
 12837                                  					; 2C7h:30h = 70h:25A0h
 12838                                  					; Point back to Bios_Data
 12839 00000D4E E887FB                  		call	checksingle
 12840 00000D51 E842F9                  		call	GetBp		; Build	the bpb	from scratch
 12841 00000D54 1F                      		pop	ds		; Restore request packet segment
 12842 00000D55 720F                    		jb	short GetParmRet
 12843 00000D57 8D7506                  		lea	si, [di+6]	; [di+BDS.bytespersec] = [di+BSD.DP_BPB]
 12844                                  					; Use this subfield of bds instead
 12845                                  UseBpbPresent:				
 12846 00000D5A 8D7F07                  		lea	di, [bx+7]	; [bx+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB]
 12847                                  					; This is where	the result goes
 12848 00000D5D B91900                  		mov	cx, 25		; A_BPB.size - 6
 12849                                  					; For now use 'small' bpb
 12850 00000D60 1E                      		push	ds		; reverse segments for copy
 12851 00000D61 06                      		push	es
 12852 00000D62 1F                      		pop	ds
 12853 00000D63 07                      		pop	es
 12854 00000D64 F3A4                    		rep movsb
 12855                                  		
 12856                                  		; 12/12/2022
 12857                                  		; cf=0 (test instruction -above- resets cf) 	
 12858                                  		;clc
 12859                                  GetParmRet:				
 12860 00000D66 C3                      		retn
 12861                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12862                                  
 12863                                  ; 17/10/2022
 12864                                  ; 16/10/2022
 12865                                  
 12866                                  ; ==========================================================================
 12867                                  ; SetDeviceParameters:
 12868                                  ;
 12869                                  ; input: ES:di points to bds for drive
 12870                                  ; ==========================================================================
 12871                                  
 12872                                  		; 19/10/2022
 12873                                  SetDeviceParameters:			; 2C7h:0CF3h = 70h:3263h
 12874 00000D67 C51E[1200]              		lds	bx, [ptrsav]	; DS:BX	points to request header
 12875 00000D6B C55F13                  		lds	bx, [bx+19]	; [bx+IOCTL_REQ.GENERICIOCTL_PACKET]

 13032                                  ; ==========================================================================
 13033                                  ; FormatTrack:
 13034                                  ; if specialfunction byte is 1,then this is a status call to see if there is
 13035                                  ; rom support for the combination of sec/trk and # of cyln,and if the
 13036                                  ; combination is legal. if specialfunction byte is 0,then format the track.
 13037                                  ;
 13038                                  ; input: ES:di points to bds for drive
 13039                                  ;
 13040                                  ; output:
 13041                                  ;	for status call:
 13042                                  ;	specialfunction byte set to:
 13043                                  ;		0 - rom support + legal combination
 13044                                  ;		1 - no rom support
 13045                                  ;		2 - illegal combination
 13046                                  ;		3 - no media present
 13047                                  ;	carry cleared.
 13048                                  ;
 13049                                  ;	for format track:
 13050                                  ;		carry set if error
 13051                                  ;
 13052                                  ; ==========================================================================
 13053                                  
 13054                                  ; 16/03/2019
 13055                                  
 13056                                  		; 19/10/2022

 13206                                  		; Check specialfunctions to see if DO_FAST_FORMAT has been

 13208                                  		; routine. If fast format has been specified we should get the
 13209                                  		; number of tracks to be verified and check it to see if it is
 13210                                  		; > 255. If it is then it is an error and we should go to
 13211                                  		; VerifyTrack_Err. If not multiply the number of tracks by the

 13213                                  		; verified. This should also be less than equal to 255
