 14788                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14789                                  
 14790                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14791                                  ;
 14792                                  ; procedure : HMAPtr
 14793                                  ;
 14794                                  ;		Gets the offset of the free HMA area ( with respect to
 14795                                  ;							seg ffff )
 14796                                  ;		If DOS has not moved high, tries to move DOS high.
 14797                                  ;		In the course of doing this, it will allocate all the HMA
 14798                                  ;		and set the FreeHMAPtr to past the end of the BIOS and 
 14799                                  ;		DOS code. The call to MoveDOSIntoHMA (which is a pointer)
 14800                                  ;		enters the routine in sysinit1 called FTryToMovDOSHi.
 14801                                  ;
 14802                                  ;	RETURNS : offset of free HMA in DI
 14803                                  ;		  BIOS_DATA, seg in DS
 14804                                  ;
 14805                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14806                                  
 14807                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14808                                  HMAPtr:
 14809 0000143E 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD]
 14810                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:Bios_Data_Word]
 14811 00001443 8B3E[FE07]              		mov	di, [FreeHMAPtr]
 14812                                  		;mov	di, ds:FreeHMAPtr
 14813 00001447 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh
 14814 0000144A 750F                    		jnz	short HMAPtr_retn
 14815 0000144C 803E[0408]00            		cmp	byte [SysinitPresent], 0
 14816                                  		;cmp	ds:SysinitPresent, 0
 14817 00001451 7408                    		jz	short HMAPtr_retn
 14818 00001453 FF1E[0008]              		call	far [MoveDOSIntoHMA]
 14819                                  		;call	ds:MoveDOSIntoHMA ; call far [MoveDOSIntoHMA]
 14820 00001457 8B3E[FE07]              		mov	di, [FreeHMAPtr]
 14821                                  		;mov	di, ds:FreeHMAPtr
 14822                                  HMAPtr_retn:				
 14823 0000145B C3                      		retn
 14824                                  
 14825                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 14826                                  
 14827                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14828                                  
 14829                                  ; move a 512 byte sector from ds:si to es:di, do not trash cx
 14830                                  ; but go ahead and update direction flag, si, & di
 14831                                  
 14832                                  move_sector:
 14833                                  
 14834                                  ; The 80386 microprocessor considers an access to WORD 0FFFFh in
 14835                                  ; any segment to be a fault. Theoretically, this could be handled
 14836                                  ; by the fault handler and the behavior of an 8086 could be emulated
 14837                                  ; by wrapping the high byte to offset 0000h. This would be a lot
 14838                                  ; of work and was, indeed, blown off by the Win386 guys. COMPAQ
 14839                                  ; also handles the fault incorrectly in their ROM BIOS for real
 14840                                  ; mode. Their fault handler was only designed to deal with one
 14841                                  ; special case which occurred in a magazine benchmark, but didn't
 14842                                  ; handle the general case worth beans.
 14843                                  ;
 14844                                  ; Simply changing this code to do a byte loop would work okay but
 14845                                  ; would involve a general case performance hit. Therefore, we'll
 14846                                  ; check for either source or destination offsets being within one
 14847                                  ; sector of the end of their segments and only in that case fall
 14848                                  ; back to a byte move.
 14849                                  
 14850 0000145C FC                      		cld
 14851 0000145D 51                      		push	cx
 14852 0000145E B90001                  		mov	cx, 256
 14853 00001461 81FE00FE                		cmp	si, 0FE00h
 14854 00001465 770A                    		ja	short movsec_bytes
 14855 00001467 81FF00FE                		cmp	di, 0FE00h
 14856 0000146B 7704                    		ja	short movsec_bytes
 14857 0000146D F3A5                    		rep movsw
 14858 0000146F 59                      		pop	cx
 14859 00001470 C3                      		retn
 14860                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14861                                  
 14862                                  movsec_bytes:				
 14863 00001471 D1E1                    		shl	cx, 1
 14864 00001473 F3A4                    		rep movsb
 14865 00001475 59                      		pop	cx
 14866 00001476 C3                      		retn
 14867                                  
 14868                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 14869                                  
 14870                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14871                                  
 14872                                  ; check_wrap is a routine that adjusts the starting sector, starting head
 14873                                  ; and starting cylinder for an int 13 request that requests i/o of a lot
 14874                                  ; of sectors. it only does this for fixed disks. it is used in the sections
 14875                                  ; of code that handle ecc errors and dma errors. it is necessary, because
 14876                                  ; ordinarily the rom would take care of wraps around heads and cylinders,
 14877                                  ; but we break down a request when we get an ecc or dma error into several
 14878                                  ; i/o of one or more sectors. in this case, we may already be beyond the
 14879                                  ; number of sectors on a track on the medium, and the request would fail.
 14880                                  ;
 14881                                  ; input conditions:
 14882                                  ;	all registers set up for an int 13 request.
 14883                                  ;
 14884                                  ; output:
 14885                                  ;	dh - contains starting head number for request
 14886                                  ;	cx - contains starting sector and cylinder numbers
 14887                                  ;	(the above may or may not have been changed, and are 0-based)
 14888                                  ;	all other registers preserved.
 14889                                  
 14890                                  check_wrap:	
 14891 00001477 50                      		push	ax
 14892 00001478 53                      		push	bx
 14893 00001479 06                      		push	es
 14894 0000147A 57                      		push	di
 14895 0000147B E86C00                  		call	find_bds	; get pointer to bds for drive in dl
 14896 0000147E 725E                    		jb	short no_wrap	; finished if DOS doesn't use it
 14897                                  		; 12/12/2022
 14898 00001480 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1
 14899                                  		;test	word [es:di+23h], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags],fnon_removable
 14900 00001485 7457                    		jz	short no_wrap	; no wrapping for removable media
 14901 00001487 268B5D13                		mov	bx, [es:di+13h]	; [es:di+BDS.secpertrack]
 14902 0000148B 89C8                    		mov	ax, cx
 14903 0000148D 83E03F                  		and	ax, 3Fh		; extract sector number
 14904 00001490 39D8                    		cmp	ax, bx		; are we going to wrap?
 14905 00001492 764A                    		jbe	short no_wrap
 14906 00001494 F6F3                    		div	bl		; ah=new sector	#, al=#	of head	wraps
 14907                                  
 14908                                  ; we need to be careful here. if the new sector # is 0, then we are on the
 14909                                  ; last sector on that track.
 14910                                  
 14911 00001496 08E4                    		or	ah, ah
 14912 00001498 7503                    		jnz	short not_on_bound
 14913                                  		; 18/12/2022
 14914 0000149A 48                      		dec	ax ; *
 14915 0000149B 88DC                    		mov	ah, bl		; set sector=BDS_BPB.BPB_SECTORSPERTRACK
 14916                                  					; if on	boundary
 14917                                  		;dec	al ; *		; also decrement # of head wraps
 14918                                  not_on_bound:
 14919 0000149D 80E1C0                  		and	cl, 0C0h	; zero out sector #
 14920 000014A0 08E1                    		or	cl, ah		; or in	new sector #
 14921 000014A2 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah		; ax = # of head wraps
 14922 000014A4 40                      		inc	ax
 14923 000014A5 00F0                    		add	al, dh		; add in starting head #
 14924 000014A7 80D400                  		adc	ah, 0		; catch	any carry
 14925                                  		; 02/09/2023
 14926 000014AA 268B5D15                		mov	bx, [es:di+15h]	; [es:di+BDS.heads]
 14927 000014AE 39D8                    		cmp	ax, bx
 14928                                  		;cmp	ax, [es:di+15h]	; [es:di+BDS.heads]
 14929                                  					; are we going to wrap around a	head?
 14930 000014B0 7632                    		jbe	short no_wrap_head ; do	not lose new head number!!
 14931 000014B2 52                      		push	dx		; preserve drive number and head number
 14932 000014B3 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
 14933                                  		;mov	bx, [es:di+15h]	; [es:di+BDS.heads]
 14934 000014B5 F7F3                    		div	bx		; dx=new head #, ax=# of cylinder wraps
 14935                                  
 14936                                  ; careful here! if new head # is 0, then we are on the last head.
 14937                                  
 14938 000014B7 09D2                    		or	dx, dx
 14939 000014B9 7507                    		jnz	short no_head_bound
 14940 000014BB 89DA                    		mov	dx, bx		; on boundary. set to BDS_BPB.BPB_HEADS
 14941                                  
 14942                                  ; if we had some cylinder wraps, we need to reduce them by one!!
 14943                                  
 14944 000014BD 09C0                    		or	ax, ax
 14945 000014BF 7401                    		jz	short no_head_bound
 14946 000014C1 48                      		dec	ax		; reduce number	of cylinder wraps
 14947                                  no_head_bound:				
 14948 000014C2 88D7                    		mov	bh, dl		; bh has new head number
 14949 000014C4 5A                      		pop	dx		; restore drive number and head number
 14950 000014C5 FECF                    		dec	bh		; get it 0-based
 14951 000014C7 88FE                    		mov	dh, bh		; set up new head number in dh
 14952 000014C9 88CF                    		mov	bh, cl
 14953 000014CB 80E73F                  		and	bh, 3Fh		; preserve sector number
 14954 000014CE B306                    		mov	bl, 6
 14955 000014D0 86CB                    		xchg	cl, bl
 14956 000014D2 D2EB                    		shr	bl, cl		; get ms cylinder bits to ls end
 14957 000014D4 00C5                    		add	ch, al		; add in cylinder wrap
 14958 000014D6 10E3                    		adc	bl, ah		; add in high byte
 14959 000014D8 D2E3                    		shl	bl, cl		; move up to ms	end
 14960 000014DA 86D9                    		xchg	bl, cl		; restore cylinder bits	into cl
 14961 000014DC 08F9                    		or	cl, bh		; or in	sector number
 14962                                  no_wrap:				
 14963 000014DE F8                      		clc
 14964 000014DF 5F                      		pop	di
 14965 000014E0 07                      		pop	es
 14966 000014E1 5B                      		pop	bx
 14967 000014E2 58                      		pop	ax
 14968 000014E3 C3                      		retn
 14969                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14970                                  
 14971                                  no_wrap_head:				
 14972 000014E4 88C6                    		mov	dh, al		; do not lose new head number
 14973 000014E6 FECE                    		dec	dh		; get it 0-based
 14974 000014E8 EBF4                    		jmp	short no_wrap
 14975                                  
 14976                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 14977                                  
 14978                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14979                                  
 14980                                  ; this is a special version of the bds lookup code which is
 14981                                  ; based on physical drives rather than the usual logical drives
 14982                                  ; carry is set if the physical drive in dl is found, es:di -> its bds
 14983                                  ; otherwise carry is clear
 14984                                  ;
 14985                                  ; guaranteed to trash no registers except es:di
 14986                                  
 14987                                  		; 19/10/2022
 14988                                  find_bds:	
 14989 000014EA C43E[1901]              		les	di, [start_bds]	; point es:di to first bds
 14990                                  fbds_1:					
 14991 000014EE 26385504                		cmp	[es:di+4], dl	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 14992 000014F2 7409                    		jz	short fdbs_2
 14993 000014F4 26C43D                  		les	di, [es:di]	; [es:di+BDS.link]
 14994                                  					; go to next bds
 14995 000014F7 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh
 14996 000014FA 75F2                    		jnz	short fbds_1
 14997 000014FC F9                      		stc
 14998                                  fdbs_2:					
 14999 000014FD C3                      		retn
 15000                                  
 15001                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 15002                                  
 15003                                  ; 16/10/2022
 15004                                  		; 17/10/2022
 15005                                  doint:
 15006                                  		; 10/12/2022
 15007 000014FE 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 15008                                  					; get physical drive number
 15009                                  		; 19/10/2022 - Temporary !
 15010                                  		;db	8Ah, 96h, 8, 0	; mov dl, [bp+8]	
 15011                                  		
 15012 00001501 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
 15013 00001503 08C0                    		or	al, al
 15014 00001505 7410                    		jz	short dointdone	; if zero sectors, return ax=0
 15015                                  		; 10/12/2022
 15016 00001507 8A6603                  		mov	ah, [bp+3]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax+1]
 15017                                  					; get request code
 15018                                  		;db	8Ah, 0A6h, 3, 0	; mov ah, [bp+3]
 15019 0000150A FF7610                  		push	word [bp+10h]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldf]
 15020                                  		;db	0FFh, 0B6h, 10h, 0 ; push word [bp+10h]
 15021 0000150D 9D                      		popf
 15022                                  		;call	far 70h:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:14EAh
 15023                                  		; 17/10/2022
 15024 0000150E 9A[3207]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 15025                                  		;;call	call_orig13	; call far 70h:797h
 15026                                  					; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 15027 00001513 9C                      		pushf
 15028                                  		; 10/12/2022
 15029 00001514 8F4610                  		pop	word [bp+10h]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldf]
 15030                                  		;db	8Fh, 86h, 10h, 0 ; pop word [bp+10h]
 15031                                  dointdone:				
 15032 00001517 C3                      		retn
 15033                                  
 15034                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15035                                  
 15036                                  ; 16/10/2022
 15037                                  
 15038                                  ; this is the true int 13 handler. we parse the request to see if there is
 15039                                  ; a dma violation. if so, depending on the function, we:
 15040                                  ;   read/write break the request into three pieces and move the middle one
 15041                                  ;	       into our internal buffer.
 15042                                  ;
 15043                                  ;   format     copy the format table into the buffer
 15044                                  ;   verify     point the transfer address into the buffer
 15045                                  ;
 15046                                  ; this is the biggest bogosity of all. the ibm controller does not handle
 15047                                  ; operations that cross physical 64k boundaries. in these cases, we copy
 15048                                  ; the offending sector into the buffer below and do the i/o from there.
 15049                                  
 15050                                  ;struc INT13FRAME
 15051                                  ;.oldbp: resw
 15052                                  ;.oldax: resw 
 15053                                  ;.oldbx: resw
 15054                                  ;.oldcx: resw
 15055                                  ;.olddx: resw
 15056                                  ;.oldds: resw	; now we save caller's ds, too
 15057                                  ;.olddd: resd
 15058                                  ;.oldf:	resw
 15059                                  ;end struc
 15060                                  
 15061                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15062                                  
 15063                                  ;   entry conditions:
 15064                                  ;	ah = function
 15065                                  ;	al = number of sectors
 15066                                  ;	es:bx = dma address
 15067                                  ;	cx = packed track and sector
 15068                                  ;	dx = head and drive
 15069                                  ;   output conditions:
 15070                                  ;	no dma violation.
 15071                                  
 15072                                  ;	use extreme caution when working with this code. In general,
 15073                                  ;	  all registers are hot at all times.
 15074                                  ;
 15075                                  ;	question:  does this code handle cases where dma errors
 15076                                  ;	  occur during ecc retries, and where ecc errors occur during
 15077                                  ;	  dma breakdowns???? Hmmmmm.
 15078                                  
 15079                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15080                                  
 15081                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15082                                  
 15083 00001518 90004000                dtype_array:	dd 400090h		; 40:90	is drive type array
 15084                                  
 15085                                  ; 17/10/2022
 15086                                  ;DTYPEARRAY equ dtype_array - DOSBIOSEG_2C7h ; (14F5h for MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 15087                                  ; 09/12/2022
 15088                                  DTYPEARRAY equ dtype_array
 15089                                  
 15090                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15091                                  
 15092                                  ; stick some special stuff out of mainline
 15093                                  
 15094                                  ; we know we're doing a format command. if we have changeline
 15095                                  ; support, then flag some special changed stuff and set changed
 15096                                  ; by format bit for all logical drives using this physical drive
 15097                                  
 15098                                  format_special_stuff:			
 15099 0000151C 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0	; do we have changeline support?
 15100 00001521 7459                    		jz	short format_special_stuff_done ; brif not
 15101 00001523 53                      		push	bx
 15102 00001524 BB4001                  		mov	bx, 140h	; fchanged_by_format+fchanged
 15103 00001527 E83D04                  		call	set_changed_dl	; indicate that media changed by format
 15104 0000152A 5B                      		pop	bx
 15105 0000152B EB4F                    		jmp	short format_special_stuff_done
 15106                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15107                                  
 15108                                  ; 16/10/2022
 15109                                  
 15110                                  ; we know we've got ec35's on the system. Now see if we're doing
 15111                                  ; a floppy. If so, create a mask and see if this particular
 15112                                  ; drive is an ec35. If so, set dtype_array[drive]=93h
 15113                                  
 15114                                  		; 19/10/2022
 15115                                  ec35_special_stuff:			
 15116 0000152D 84D2                    		test	dl, dl		; floppy or hard disk?
 15117 0000152F 7852                    		js	short ec35_special_stuff_done ;	if hard	drive, we're done
 15118 00001531 50                      		push	ax		; see if this PARTICULAR drive is ec35
 15119 00001532 51                      		push	cx
 15120 00001533 88D1                    		mov	cl, dl		; turn drive number into bit map
 15121 00001535 B001                    		mov	al, 1		; assume drive 0
 15122 00001537 D2E0                    		shl	al, cl		; shift	over correct number of times
 15123 00001539 8406[C904]              		test	[ec35flag], al	; electrically compatible 3.5 incher?
 15124 0000153D 59                      		pop	cx
 15125 0000153E 58                      		pop	ax
 15126 0000153F 7442                    		jz	short ec35_special_stuff_done
 15127                                  					; done if this floppy is not an	ec35
 15128 00001541 53                      		push	bx		; free up a far	pointer	(es:bx)
 15129 00001542 06                      		push	es
 15130                                  		; 17/10/2022
 15131 00001543 2EC41E[1815]            		les	bx, [cs:DTYPEARRAY]
 15132                                  		;les	bx, dword ptr cs:DTYPEARRAY ; [cs:dtype_array]
 15133                                  					; 0070h:3A65h =	2C7h:14F5h

 15135 0000154A 80D700                  		adc	bh, 0		; find entry for this drive
 15136 0000154D 26C60793                		mov	byte [es:bx], 93h ; establish drive type as:
 15137                                  					; (360k	disk in	360k drive,
 15138                                  					; no double-stepping, 250 kbs transfer rate)
 15139 00001551 07                      		pop	es
 15140 00001552 5B                      		pop	bx
 15141 00001553 EB2E                    		jmp	short ec35_special_stuff_done
 15142                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15143                                  
 15144                                  ; 16/10/2022
 15145                                  
 15146                                  ; ps2_30 machine has some problem with ah=8h (read drive parm), int 13h.
 15147                                  ; this function does not reset the common buses after the execution.
 15148                                  ; to solve this problem, when we detect ah=8h, then we will save the result and
 15149                                  ; will issue ah=1 (read status) call to reset the buses.
 15150                                  
 15151                                  ps2_special_stuff:			
 15152 00001555 803E[1E00]08            		cmp	byte [prevoper], 8 ; (ps2_30)
 15153                                  					; read driver parm ?
 15154 0000155A 7407                    		jz	short ps2_30_problem
 15155 0000155C 803E[1E00]15            		cmp	byte [prevoper], 15h
 15156                                  					; apparently function 15h fails, too
 15157 00001561 752D                    		jnz	short ps2_special_stuff_done
 15158                                  ps2_30_problem:				
 15159 00001563 50                      		push	ax
 15160 00001564 B401                    		mov	ah, 1
 15161                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1543h
 15162                                  		; 17/10/2022
 15163 00001566 9A[3207]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 15164                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far 70:797h
 15165                                  					; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 15166 0000156B 58                      		pop	ax
 15167 0000156C EB22                    		jmp	short ps2_special_stuff_done
 15168                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15169                                  
 15170                                  ; 17/10/2022
 15171                                  ; 16/10/2022
 15172                                  
 15173                                  ; here is the actual int13 handler
 15174                                  
 15175                                  i13z:					; 0070h:3ABBh =	02C7h:154Bh
 15176                                  
 15177                                  ; cas -- inefficient! could push ds and load ds-> Bios_Data before
 15178                                  ; vectoring up here from Bios_Data
 15179                                  
 15180                                  		; 19/10/2022
 15181 0000156E 1E                      		push	ds		; save caller's ds register first thing
 15182                                  		;;mov	ds, word [cs:0030h]
 15183                                  					; and set up our own ds -> Bios_Data
 15184 0000156F 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD]
 15185                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:0030h]
 15186                                  					; = [02C7h:0030h] = [0070h:25A0h]
 15187                                  
 15188                                  ; let the operation proceed. if there is a dma violation, then we do things
 15189                                  
 15190 00001574 A3[1E00]                		mov	[prevoper], ax	; save request
 15191 00001577 80FC05                  		cmp	ah, 5		; romformat
 15192 0000157A 74A0                    		jz	short format_special_stuff
 15193                                  					; go do special stuff for format
 15194                                   format_special_stuff_done:		
 15195 0000157C 803E[C904]00            		cmp	byte [ec35flag], 0 ; any electrically compat 3.5 inchers?
 15196 00001581 75AA                    		jnz	short ec35_special_stuff
 15197                                  					; go handle it out of line if so
 15198                                  ec35_special_stuff_done:
 15199                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1560h		
 15200 00001583 9A[3207]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 15201                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 15202                                  		
 15203 00001588 9C                      		pushf			; save result flags
 15204                                  		
 15205 00001589 803E[D605]FA            		cmp	byte [model_byte], 0FAh ; is this a ps2/30?
 15206                                  					; mdl_ps2_30
 15207 0000158E 74C5                    		jz	short ps2_special_stuff
 15208                                  					; exit mainline to address special
 15209                                  ps2_special_stuff_done:			; ps2/30 problem if so		
 15210 00001590 9D                      		popf
 15211 00001591 7221                    		jb	short goterr13	; error	on original orig13 call-thru?
 15212                                  ret_from_i13:				
 15213 00001593 1F                      		pop	ds
 15214 00001594 CA0200                  		retf	2		; restore ds &	iret w/flags
 15215                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15216                                  
 15217                                  ; most of our code exits through here. If carry isn't set, then
 15218                                  ; just do a simple exit. Else doublecheck that we aren't getting
 15219                                  ; a changeline error.
 15220                                  
 15221                                  i13ret_ck_chglinerr:			
 15222 00001597 73FA                    		jnb	short ret_from_i13 ; done if not an error termination
 15223                                  i13_ret_error:				
 15224 00001599 80FC06                  		cmp	ah, 6		; did i	see a change event?
 15225 0000159C 7513                    		jnz	short int13b	; skip if wrong	error
 15226 0000159E 08D2                    		or	dl, dl		; is this for the hard disk?
 15227 000015A0 780F                    		js	short int13b	; yes, ignore
 15228 000015A2 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0
 15229 000015A7 7408                    		jz	short int13b	; just in case ROM returned this
 15230                                  					; error	even though it told us it
 15231                                  					; never	would
 15232 000015A9 53                      		push	bx
 15233 000015AA BB4000                  		mov	bx, 40h		; fchanged
 15234 000015AD E8B703                  		call	set_changed_dl
 15235 000015B0 5B                      		pop	bx
 15236                                  int13b:					
 15237 000015B1 F9                      		stc			; now return the error
 15238 000015B2 EBDF                    		jmp	short ret_from_i13
 15239                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15240                                  
 15241                                  ; some kind of error occurred. see if it is dma violation
 15242                                  
 15243                                  goterr13:				
 15244 000015B4 80FC09                  		cmp	ah, 9		; dma error?
 15245 000015B7 747C                    		jz	short gotdmaerr
 15246                                  goterr13_xxxx:				
 15247 000015B9 80FC11                  		cmp	ah, 11h		; ecc error?
 15248 000015BC 75DB                    		jnz	short i13_ret_error ; other error. just	return back.
 15249 000015BE 803E[D005]01            		cmp	byte [media_set_for_format], 1 ; formatting?
 15250 000015C3 74D4                    		jz	short i13_ret_error
 15251                                  
 15252 000015C5 803E[1F00]02            		cmp	byte [prevoper+1], 2
 15253                                  		;cmp	byte ptr ds:prevoper+1,	2 ; ecc-corrected error
 15254                                  					; (2 = romread)
 15255                                  					; ECC correction only applies to reads
 15256 000015CA 75CD                    		jnz	short i13_ret_error
 15257                                  
 15258 000015CC 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
 15259                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:15ABh
 15260                                  		; 17/10/2022
 15261 000015CE 9A[3207]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 15262                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 15263                                  					; call far 70:797h
 15264 000015D3 A1[1E00]                		mov	ax, [prevoper]
 15265 000015D6 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah		; return code =	no error
 15266 000015D8 3C01                    		cmp	al, 1		; if request for one sector, assume ok
 15267 000015DA 74B7                    		jz	short ret_from_i13 ; return with carry clear
 15268 000015DC 53                      		push	bx
 15269 000015DD 51                      		push	cx
 15270 000015DE 52                      		push	dx
 15271 000015DF A2[2000]                		mov	[number_of_sec], al
 15272                                  loop_ecc:				
 15273 000015E2 B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h	; read one sector
 15274                                  
 15275                                  ; we do reads one sector at a time. this ensures that we will eventually
 15276                                  ; finish the request since ecc errors on one sector do read in that sector.
 15277                                  ;
 15278                                  ; we need to put in some "intelligence" into the ecc handler to handle reads
 15279                                  ; that attempt to read more sectors than are available on a particular
 15280                                  ; track.
 15281                                  ;
 15282                                  ; we call check_wrap to set up the sector #, head # and cylinder # for
 15283                                  ; this request.
 15284                                  ;
 15285                                  ; at this point, all registers are set up for the call to orig13, except
 15286                                  ; that there may be a starting sector number that is bigger than the number
 15287                                  ; of sectors on a track.
 15288                                  ;
 15289 000015E5 E88FFE                  		call	check_wrap	; get correct parameters for int 13
 15290                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:15C5h
 15291                                  		; 17/10/2022
 15292 000015E8 9A[3207]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 15293                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 15294 000015ED 730C                    		jnb	short ok11_op
 15295 000015EF 80FC09                  		cmp	ah, 9		; DMA error during ECC read?
 15296 000015F2 741B                    		jz	short handle_dma_during_ecc
 15297 000015F4 80FC11                  		cmp	ah, 11h		; only allow ecc errors
 15298 000015F7 7510                    		jnz	short ok11_exit_err
 15299                                  		; 10/12/2022
 15300                                  		; xor ax ax -> ah = 0
 15301                                  		;mov	ah, 0		; ecc error. reset the system again.
 15302 000015F9 31C0                    		xor	ax, ax		; clear	the error code so that if this
 15303                                  					; was the last sector, no error	code
 15304                                  					; will be returned for the corrected
 15305                                  					; read.	(clear carry too.)
 15306                                  ok11_op:				
 15307 000015FB FE0E[2000]              		dec	byte [number_of_sec]
 15308 000015FF 7409                    		jz	short ok11_exit	; all done?
 15309 00001601 FEC1                    		inc	cl		; advance sector number
 15310                                  					; add 200h to address
 15311 00001603 FEC7                    		inc	bh
 15312 00001605 FEC7                    		inc	bh
 15313 00001607 EBD9                    		jmp	short loop_ecc
 15314                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15315                                  
 15316                                  ; locate error returns centrally
 15317                                  
 15318                                  ok11_exit_err:				
 15319 00001609 F9                      		stc			; set carry bit again.
 15320                                  ok11_exit:				
 15321 0000160A 5A                      		pop	dx
 15322 0000160B 59                      		pop	cx
 15323 0000160C 5B                      		pop	bx
 15324 0000160D EB88                    		jmp	short i13ret_ck_chglinerr
 15325                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15326                                  
 15327                                  ; do the single sector read again, this time into our temporary
 15328                                  ; buffer, which is guaranteed not to have a DMA error, then
 15329                                  ; move the data to its proper location and proceed
 15330                                  
 15331                                  handle_dma_during_ecc:			
 15332 0000160F 06                      		push	es
 15333 00001610 53                      		push	bx
 15334 00001611 BB[5201]                		mov	bx, disksector
 15335 00001614 1E                      		push	ds
 15336 00001615 07                      		pop	es		; point es:bx to buffer
 15337 00001616 B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h	; read one sector
 15338                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:15F8h
 15339                                  		; 17/10/2022
 15340 00001619 9A[3207]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 15341                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 15342 0000161E 5B                      		pop	bx
 15343 0000161F 07                      		pop	es
 15344 00001620 7305                    		jnb	short handle_dma_during_ecc_noerr
 15345 00001622 80FC11                  		cmp	ah, 11h
 15346 00001625 75E2                    		jnz	short ok11_exit_err ; if anything but ecc error, bomb out
 15347                                  
 15348                                  ; now we're kosher. Copy the data to where it belongs and resume
 15349                                  ; the ECC looping code.
 15350                                  
 15351                                  handle_dma_during_ecc_noerr:		
 15352 00001627 56                      		push	si
 15353 00001628 57                      		push	di
 15354 00001629 89DF                    		mov	di, bx
 15355 0000162B BE[5201]                		mov	si, disksector
 15356 0000162E E82BFE                  		call	move_sector
 15357 00001631 5F                      		pop	di
 15358 00001632 5E                      		pop	si
 15359 00001633 EBC6                    		jmp	short ok11_op
 15360                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15361                                  
 15362                                  ; we truly have a dma violation. restore register ax and retry the
 15363                                  ; operation as best we can.
 15364                                  
 15365                                  gotdmaerr:				
 15366 00001635 A1[1E00]                		mov	ax, [prevoper]	; 19/10/2022
 15367 00001638 FB                      		sti
 15368 00001639 80FC02                  		cmp	ah, 2		; romread
 15369 0000163C 723B                    		jb	short i13_done_dmaerr
 15370                                  					; just pass dma error thru for
 15371                                  					; functions we don't handle
 15372 0000163E 80FC04                  		cmp	ah, 4		; romverify
 15373 00001641 743C                    		jz	short intverify
 15374 00001643 80FC05                  		cmp	ah, 5		; romformat
 15375 00001646 7448                    		jz	short intformat
 15376 00001648 772F                    		ja	short i13_done_dmaerr
 15377                                  
 15378                                  ; we are doing a read/write call. check for dma problems
 15379                                  
 15380                                  ;	******** set up stack frame here!!! ********
 15381                                  
 15382 0000164A 52                      		push	dx
 15383 0000164B 51                      		push	cx
 15384 0000164C 53                      		push	bx
 15385 0000164D 50                      		push	ax
 15386 0000164E 55                      		push	bp
 15387 0000164F 89E5                    		mov	bp, sp
 15388 00001651 8CC2                    		mov	dx, es		; check	for 64k	boundary error
 15389 00001653 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 15390 00001655 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 15391 00001657 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 15392 00001659 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1		; segment converted to absolute	address
 15393 0000165B 01DA                    		add	dx, bx		; combine with offset
 15394 0000165D 81C2FF01                		add	dx, 511		; simulate a transfer
 15395                                  
 15396                                  ; if carry is set, then we are within 512 bytes of the end of the segment.
 15397                                  ; we skip the first transfer and perform the remaining buffering and transfer
 15398                                  
 15399 00001661 7303                    		jnb	short no_skip_first
 15400 00001663 E98300                  		jmp	bufferx		; restore dh=head & do buffer
 15401                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15402                                  
 15403                                  no_skip_first:				
 15404 00001666 D0EE                    		shr	dh, 1		; dh = number of sectors before	address
 15405 00001668 B480                    		mov	ah, 128		; ah = max number of sectors in	segment
 15406 0000166A 28F4                    		sub	ah, dh
 15407                                  
 15408                                  ; ah is now the number of sectors that we can successfully write in this
 15409                                  ; segment. if this number is above or equal to the requested number, then we
 15410                                  ; continue the operation as normal. otherwise, we break it into pieces.
 15411                                  ;
 15412                                  ; wait a sec. this is goofy. the whole reason we got here in the
 15413                                  ; first place is because we got a dma error. so it's impossible
 15414                                  ; for the whole block to fit, unless the dma error was returned
 15415                                  ; in error.
 15416                                  
 15417 0000166C 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; can we fit it	in?
 15418 0000166E 7236                    		jb	short doblock	; no, perform blocking.
 15419                                  
 15420                                  ; yes, the request fits. let it happen.
 15421                                  
 15422 00001670 8A7609                  		mov	dh, [bp+9]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx+1]
 15423                                  					; set up head number
 15424 00001673 E888FE                  		call	doint
 15425 00001676 E9D900                  		jmp	bad13		; and return from this place
 15426                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15427                                  
 15428                                  i13_done_dmaerr:			
 15429 00001679 B409                    		mov	ah, 9		; pass dma error thru to caller
 15430 0000167B F9                      		stc
 15431 0000167C E914FF                  		jmp	ret_from_i13	; return with error,
 15432                                  					; we know it's not a changeline error
 15433                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15434                                  
 15435                                  ; verify the given sectors. place the buffer pointer into our space.
 15436                                  
 15437                                  intverify:				
 15438 0000167F 06                      		push	es		; save caller's dma address
 15439 00001680 53                      		push	bx
 15440 00001681 1E                      		push	ds		; es:bx	-> Bios_Data:disksector
 15441 00001682 07                      		pop	es
 15442                                  dosimple:				
 15443 00001683 BB[5201]                		mov	bx, disksector
 15444                                  					; do the i/o from Bios_Data:disksector
 15445                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1665h
 15446                                  		; 17/10/2022
 15447 00001686 9A[3207]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 15448                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 15449 0000168B 5B                      		pop	bx
 15450 0000168C 07                      		pop	es
 15451 0000168D E907FF                  		jmp	i13ret_ck_chglinerr
 15452                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15453                                  
 15454                                  ; format operation. copy the parameter table into Bios_Data:disksector
 15455                                  
 15456                                  intformat:				
 15457 00001690 06                      		push	es
 15458 00001691 53                      		push	bx
 15459 00001692 56                      		push	si
 15460 00001693 57                      		push	di
 15461 00001694 1E                      		push	ds
 15462                                  
 15463                                  ; point ds to the caller's dma buffer, es to Bios_Data
 15464                                  ; in other words, swap (ds, es)
 15465                                  
 15466 00001695 06                      		push	es
 15467 00001696 1E                      		push	ds
 15468 00001697 07                      		pop	es
 15469 00001698 1F                      		pop	ds
 15470 00001699 89DE                    		mov	si, bx
 15471 0000169B BF[5201]                		mov	di, disksector
 15472 0000169E E8BBFD                  		call	move_sector	; user's data into Bios_Data:disksector
 15473 000016A1 1F                      		pop	ds
 15474 000016A2 5F                      		pop	di
 15475 000016A3 5E                      		pop	si		; do the i/o from
 15476 000016A4 EBDD                    		jmp	short dosimple	; Bios_Data:disksector
 15477                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15478                                  
 15479                                  ; we can't fit the request into the entire block. perform the operation on
 15480                                  ; the first block.
 15481                                  ;
 15482                                  ; doblock is modified to correctly handle multi-sector disk i/o.
 15483                                  ; old doblock had added the number of sectors i/oed (ah in old doblock) after
 15484                                  ; the doint call to cl. observing only the lower 6 bits of cl(=max. 64) can
 15485                                  ; represent a starting sector, if ah was big, then cl would be clobbered.
 15486                                  ; by the way, we still are going to use cl for this purpose since checkwrap
 15487                                  ; routine will use it as an input. to prevent cl from being clobbered, a
 15488                                  ; safe number of sectors should be calculated like "63 - # of sectors/track".
 15489                                  ; doblock will handle the first block of requested sectors within the
 15490                                  ; boundary of this safe value.
 15491                                  
 15492                                  doblock:
 15493                                  
 15494                                  ; try to get the # of sectors/track from bds via rom drive number.
 15495                                  ; for any mini disks installed, here we have to pray that they have the
 15496                                  ; same # of sector/track as the main dos partition disk drive.
 15497                                  				
 15498 000016A6 8B5608                  		mov	dx, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 15499                                  					; get head #, drive #
 15500 000016A9 51                      		push	cx
 15501 000016AA 06                      		push	es
 15502 000016AB 57                      		push	di		; ah - # of sectors before dma boundary
 15503                                  					; al - requested # of sectors for i/o.
 15504 000016AC E83BFE                  		call	find_bds
 15505 000016AF 268B4D13                		mov	cx, [es:di+13h]	; [es:di+BDS.secpertrack]
 15506                                  		; 12/12/2022
 15507 000016B3 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1
 15508                                  		;test	word [es:di+23h], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags],fnon_removable
 15509 000016B8 5F                      		pop	di
 15510 000016B9 07                      		pop	es
 15511 000016BA 88E0                    		mov	al, ah		; set al=ah for	floppies
 15512 000016BC 7404                    		jz	short doblockflop ; they are track by track operation
 15513 000016BE B43F                    		mov	ah, 63		; ah = 63-secpt	(# safe	sectors??)
 15514 000016C0 28CC                    		sub	ah, cl		; al - # of sectors before dma boundary
 15515                                  doblockflop:				
 15516 000016C2 59                      		pop	cx
 15517                                  doblockcontinue:			
 15518 000016C3 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; if safe_# >= #_of_sectors_to_go_before dma,
 15519 000016C5 7305                    		jnb	short doblocklast ; then #_of_sectors_to_go as it is for doint.
 15520 000016C7 50                      		push	ax
 15521 000016C8 88E0                    		mov	al, ah		; otherwise, set al to ah to operate.
 15522 000016CA EB03                    		jmp	short doblockdoint
 15523                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15524                                  
 15525                                  doblocklast:				
 15526 000016CC 88C4                    		mov	ah, al
 15527 000016CE 50                      		push	ax
 15528                                  doblockdoint:				; let ah = al =	# of sectors for this shot	
 15529 000016CF E82CFE                  		call	doint
 15530 000016D2 727E                    		jb	short bad13	; something happened, bye!
 15531 000016D4 58                      		pop	ax
 15532 000016D5 286602                  		sub	[bp+2],	ah	; sub [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax], ah
 15533                                  					; decrement by the successful operation
 15534 000016D8 00E1                    		add	cl, ah		; advance sector #. safety gauranteed.
 15535 000016DA 00E7                    		add	bh, ah		; advance dma addres
 15536 000016DC 00E7                    		add	bh, ah		; twice	for 512	byte sectors
 15537 000016DE 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; check	the previous value
 15538 000016E0 740A                    		jz	short buffer	; if #_of_sectors_to_go	< safe_#,
 15539                                  					; then we are done already.
 15540 000016E2 28E0                    		sub	al, ah		; otherwise,
 15541                                  					; #_sector_to_go = #_of_sector_to_go - safe_#
 15542 000016E4 E890FD                  		call	check_wrap	; get new cx, dh for the next operation.
 15543 000016E7 EBDA                    		jmp	short doblockcontinue ;	handles	next sectors left.
 15544                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15545                                  
 15546                                  bufferx:				
 15547 000016E9 8A7609                  		mov	dh, [bp+9]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx+1]
 15548                                  					; set up head number
 15549                                  buffer:					
 15550 000016EC 53                      		push	bx
 15551 000016ED 8A6603                  		mov	ah, [bp+3]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax+1]
 15552 000016F0 80FC03                  		cmp	ah, 3		; romwrite
 15553 000016F3 7525                    		jnz	short doread	;
 15554                                  					
 15555                                  ; copy the offending sector into local buffer
 15556                                  
 15557 000016F5 06                      		push	es
 15558 000016F6 1E                      		push	ds
 15559 000016F7 56                      		push	si
 15560 000016F8 57                      		push	di
 15561 000016F9 1E                      		push	ds		; exchange segment registers
 15562 000016FA 06                      		push	es
 15563 000016FB 1F                      		pop	ds
 15564 000016FC 07                      		pop	es
 15565 000016FD BF[5201]                		mov	di, disksector	; where to move
 15566 00001700 57                      		push	di		; save it
 15567 00001701 89DE                    		mov	si, bx		; source
 15568 00001703 E856FD                  		call	move_sector	; move sector into local buffer
 15569 00001706 5B                      		pop	bx		; new transfer address
 15570                                  					; (es:bx = Bios_Data:diskbuffer)
 15571 00001707 5F                      		pop	di		; restore caller's di & si
 15572 00001708 5E                      		pop	si
 15573 00001709 1F                      		pop	ds		; restore Bios_Data
 15574                                  
 15575                                  ; see if we are wrapping around a track or head
 15576                                  
 15577 0000170A B001                    		mov	al, 1		; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 15578                                  					; get drive number
 15579 0000170C 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]
 15580 0000170F E865FD                  		call	check_wrap	; sets up registers if wrap-around
 15581                                  					;
 15582                                  					; ah is	function
 15583                                  					; al is	1 for single sector transfer
 15584                                  					; es:bx	is local transfer addres
 15585                                  					; cx is	track/sector number
 15586                                  					; dx is	head/drive number
 15587                                  					; si,di	unchanged
 15588 00001712 E8E9FD                  		call	doint
 15589 00001715 07                      		pop	es		; restore caller's dma segment
 15590 00001716 723A                    		jb	short bad13	; go clean up
 15591 00001718 EB22                    		jmp	short dotail
 15592                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15593                                  
 15594                                  ; reading a sector. do int first, then move things around
 15595                                  
 15596                                  doread:					
 15597 0000171A 06                      		push	es
 15598 0000171B 53                      		push	bx
 15599 0000171C 1E                      		push	ds		; es = Bios_Code
 15600 0000171D 07                      		pop	es
 15601 0000171E BB[5201]                		mov	bx, disksector
 15602 00001721 B001                    		mov	al, 1
 15603 00001723 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 15604                                  					; get drive number
 15605 00001726 E84EFD                  		call	check_wrap	;
 15606                                  					; ah = function
 15607                                  					; al = 1 for single sector
 15608                                  					; es:bx	points to local	buffer
 15609                                  					; cx, dx are track/sector, head/drive
 15610 00001729 E8D2FD                  		call	doint
 15611 0000172C 5B                      		pop	bx
 15612 0000172D 07                      		pop	es
 15613 0000172E 7222                    		jb	short bad13
 15614 00001730 56                      		push	si
 15615 00001731 57                      		push	di
 15616 00001732 89DF                    		mov	di, bx
 15617 00001734 BE[5201]                		mov	si, disksector
 15618 00001737 E822FD                  		call	move_sector
 15619 0000173A 5F                      		pop	di
 15620 0000173B 5E                      		pop	si
 15621                                  
 15622                                  ; note the fact that we've done 1 more sector
 15623                                  
 15624                                  dotail:					
 15625 0000173C 5B                      		pop	bx		; retrieve new dma area
 15626 0000173D 80C702                  		add	bh, 2		; advance over sector
 15627 00001740 41                      		inc	cx
 15628 00001741 8A4602                  		mov	al, [bp+2]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax]
 15629 00001744 F8                      		clc
 15630 00001745 FEC8                    		dec	al
 15631 00001747 7409                    		jz	short bad13	; no more i/o
 15632                                  
 15633                                  ; see if we wrap around a track or head boundary with starting sector
 15634                                  ; we already have the correct head number to pass to check_wrap
 15635                                  
 15636 00001749 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 15637 0000174C E828FD                  		call	check_wrap
 15638 0000174F E8ACFD                  		call	doint
 15639                                  
 15640                                  ; we are done. ax has the final code; we throw away what we got before
 15641                                  
 15642                                  ; M046  -- okay gang. Now we've either terminated our DMA loop,
 15643                                  ;	   or we've finished. If carry is set now, our only
 15644                                  ;	   hope for salvation is that it was a read operation
 15645                                  ;	   and the error code is ECC error. In that case, we'll
 15646                                  ;	   just pop the registers and go do the old ECC thing.
 15647                                  ;	   When the DMA error that got us here in the first
 15648                                  ;	   place occurs, it'll handle it.
 15649                                  
 15650                                  bad13:					
 15651 00001752 89EC                    		mov	sp, bp
 15652 00001754 5D                      		pop	bp
 15653 00001755 5B                      		pop	bx
 15654 00001756 5B                      		pop	bx
 15655 00001757 59                      		pop	cx
 15656 00001758 5A                      		pop	dx
 15657 00001759 7203                    		jb	short xgoterr13_xxxx ; go handle ECC errors
 15658 0000175B E935FE                  		jmp	ret_from_i13	; non-error exit
 15659                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15660                                  
 15661                                  xgoterr13_xxxx:				
 15662 0000175E E958FE                  		jmp	goterr13_xxxx
 15663                                  
 15664                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15665                                  		; 10/12/2022
 15666                                  		;db 	0
 15667                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15668                                  
 15669                                  ;Bios_Code ends

 15686                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 15687                                  
 15688                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15689                                  ; install_bds installs a bds at location es:di into the current linked list of
 15690                                  ; bds maintained by this device driver. it places the bds at the end of the
 15691                                  ; list. Trashes (at least) ax, bx, di, si
 15692                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15693                                  
 15694                                  install_bds:
 15695 0000176D 1E                      		push	ds		; save Bios_Data segment
 15696 0000176E BE[1901]                		mov	si, start_bds	; beginning of chain
 15697                                  
 15698                                  		; ds:si now points to link to first bds
 15699                                  		; assume bds list is non-empty
 15700                                  loop_next_bds:
 15701 00001771 C534                    		lds	si, [si]	; [si+BDS.link]
 15702                                  					; fetch	next bds
 15703 00001773 268A4504                		mov	al, [es:di+4]	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 15704 00001777 384404                  		cmp	[si+4],	al	; does this one	share a	physical
 15705                                  					; drive	with new one?
 15706 0000177A 7518                    		jnz	short next_bds
 15707 0000177C B310                    		mov	bl, 10h		; fi_am_mult
 15708 0000177E 26085D23                		or	[es:di+23h], bl	; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 15709                                  					; set both of them to i_am_mult	if so
 15710 00001782 085C23                  		or	[si+23h], bl	; [si+BDS.flags]
 15711 00001785 26806523DF              		and	byte [es:di+23h], 0DFh ; [es:di+BDS.flags],~fi_own_physical
 15712                                  					; we don't own it
 15713 0000178A 8A5C23                  		mov	bl, [si+23h]	; [si+BDS.flags]
 15714                                  					; determine if changeline available
 15715 0000178D 80E302                  		and	bl, 2		; fchangeline
 15716 00001790 26085D23                		or	[es:di+23h], bl	; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 15717                                  next_bds:
 15718                                  		; 02/09/2023 (PCDOS 7.1)
 15719 00001794 B8FFFF                  		mov	ax, 0FFFFh	; -1
 15720 00001797 3904                    		cmp	[si], ax	; [si+BDS.link],-1
 15721                                  		;cmp	word [si], 0FFFFh ; [si+BDS.link],-1
 15722                                  					; are we at end	of list?
 15723 00001799 75D6                    		jnz	short loop_next_bds
 15724 0000179B 8C4402                  		mov	[si+2], es	; [si+BDS.link+2],es
 15725                                  					; install bds
 15726 0000179E 893C                    		mov	[si], di
 15727 000017A0 268905                  		mov	[es:di], ax	; [es:di+BDS.link],-1
 15728                                  		;mov	word [es:di], 0FFFFh ; [es:di+BDS.link],-1
 15729                                  					; set next pointer to null
 15730 000017A3 1F                      		pop	ds
 15731
