 16725                                  ; ****************************************************************************
 16726                                  ; SYSINIT.BIN (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS) - RETRO DOS v4.0 by ERDOGAN TAN - 21/10/2022
 16727                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 16728                                  ; Last Update: 04/01/2023 (Modified IO.SYS)  ((Previous: 30/12/2022))
 16729                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 16730                                  ; Beginning: 03/06/2018 (Retro DOS 3.0), 21/03/2019 (Retro DOS 4.0)
 16731                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 16732                                  ; Assembler: NASM version 2.15
 16733                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 16734                                  ;	   ((nasm sysinit6.s -l sysinit6.lst -o SYSINIT6.BIN -Z error.txt)) 	
 16735                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 16736                                  ; Modified from 'sysinit2.s' (SYSINIT2.BIN) file of Retro DOS v3.0 (6/7/2018)
 16737                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 16738                                  ; Derived from 'SYSINIT1.ASM' and 'SYSINIT2.ASM' files of MSDOS 6.0
 16739                                  ; source code by Microsoft, 1991 
 16740                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 16741                                  ; Derived from 'SYSINIT.ASM' file of MSDOS 2.0 (IBM PCDOS v2.0) source code
 16742                                  ; by Microsoft, 12/10/1983
 16743                                  ; ****************************************************************************
 16744                                  ; main file: 'retrodos4.s'
 16745                                  ; incbin 'SYSINIT3.BIN' ; (SYINITSEG)
 16746                                  
 16747                                  ; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 
 16748                                  ; Retro DOS v4.0 - 2019
 16749                                  ; SYSINIT (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS) draft: 'sysinit3.s' (01/07/2019)
 16750                                   
 16751                                  ; 21/10/2022
 16752                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 16753                                  ; This source code (version) is based on SYSINIT source code of disassembled
 16754                                  ; MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS file (SYSINIT.BIN) 
 16755                                  ; Dissassembler: Hex-Rays Interactive Disassembler (IDA)
 16756                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 16757                                  ; Binary file splitter & joiner: FFSJ v3.3
 16758                                  
 16759                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------
 16760                                  ; SYSINIT.TXT (27/01/1983)
 16761                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------
 16762                                  ;    SYSINIT is  a module linked behind the OEM bios.  It takes
 16763                                  ;over  the  system  initialization  after  the  OEM  bios   has
 16764                                  ;performed any  initialization  it  needs  to  do.   Control is
 16765                                  ;transfered with a long jump to the external  variable  SYSINIT
 16766                                  ;
 16767                                  ;
 16768                                  ;   The OEM  has  the  following  variables declared external:
 16769                                  ;
 16770                                  ;   CURRENT_DOS_LOCATION    WORD
 16771                                  ;
 16772                                  ;This word  contains  the  segment  number of the DOS before it
 16773                                  ;is relocated.  The OEM bios must set this value.
 16774                                  ;
 16775                                  ;   FINAL_DOS_LOCATION      WORD
 16776                                  ;
 16777                                  ;This word contains the segment number of the DOS after SYSINIT
 16778                                  ;moves it.  The OEM bios must set this value.
 16779                                  ;
 16780                                  ;   DEVICE_LIST             DWORD
 16781                                  ;
 16782                                  ;This  double  word  pointer  points  to  the  linked  list  of
 16783                                  ;character and block device drivers.  The  OEM  must  set  this
 16784                                  ;value.
 16785                                  ;
 16786                                  ;   MEMORY_SIZE             WORD
 16787                                  ;
 16788                                  ;This word  contains  the  number  of  RAM  paragraphs.  If the
 16789                                  ;bios doesn't set  this  variable  SYSINIT  will  automatically
 16790                                  ;calculate it.   NOTE:  systems with PARITY checked memory must
 16791                                  ;size memory in the BIOS.  SYSINITs method is to  write  memory
 16792                                  ;and read it back until it gets a mismatch.
 16793                                  ;
 16794                                  ;   DEFAULT_DRIVE           BYTE
 16795                                  ;
 16796                                  ;This is  the initial default drive when the system first comes
 16797                                  ;up.  drive a=0, drive b=1,  etc.   If  the  bios  doesn't  set
 16798                                  ;it then drive a is assumed.
 16799                                  ;
 16800                                  ;   BUFFERS                 BYTE
 16801                                  ;
 16802                                  ;This is  the  default  number of buffers for the system.  This
 16803                                  ;value may be overridden by the user in  the  CONFIG.SYS  file.
 16804                                  ;It is DBed to 2 in SYSINIT it should be greater than 1.
 16805                                  ;
 16806                                  ;   FILES                   BYTE
 16807                                  ;
 16808                                  ;This is  the  default  number  of  files for the system.  This
 16809                                  ;value may be overridden by the user in  the  CONFIG.SYS  file.
 16810                                  ;It is  DBed  to  8 in SYSINIT, values less than 5 are ignored.
 16811                                  ;
 16812                                  ;   SYSINIT                 FAR
 16813                                  ;
 16814                                  ;The entry  point  of  the  SYSINIT  module.  OEM BIOS jumps to
 16815                                  ;this label at the end of its INIT code.
 16816                                  ;
 16817                                  ;   The OEM  has  the  following  variables declared public:
 16818                                  ;
 16819                                  ;   RE_INIT                 FAR
 16820                                  ;
 16821                                  ;This is an entry point which allows the BIOS to do some INIT
 16822                                  ;work  after  the  DOS is initialized.  ALL REGISTERS MUST BE
 16823                                  ;PRESERVED.  On entry DS points to the first available memory
 16824                                  ;(after  the DOS).  DS:0 points to a 100H byte program header
 16825                                  ;prefix which represents  the  "program"  currently  running.
 16826                                  ;This  program  should  be  thought  of  as  the OEM BIOS and
 16827                                  ;SYSINIT taken together.  This is not  a  normal  program  in
 16828                                  ;that  no  memory  is  allocated to it, it is running in free
 16829                                  ;memory.
 16830                                  ;NOTES:
 16831                                  ;     At the time this routine is called SYSINIT occupies the
 16832                                  ;highest 10K of memory ("highest" is determined by the  value
 16833                                  ;of the MEMORY_SIZE variable), DO NOT DO WRITES THERE.
 16834                                  ;     Since this is called AFTER DOS is initialized, you can
 16835                                  ;make system calls.  This also implies that the code for this
 16836                                  ;routine    CANNOT   be   thrown   away   by   use   of   the
 16837                                  ;FINAL_DOS_LOCATION since the DOS has already been moved.
 16838                                  ;     If you don't want  anything done just set this to point
 16839                                  ;at a FAR RET instruction.
 16840                                  
 16841                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16842                                  ; TITLE   BIOS SYSTEM INITIALIZATION
 16843                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16844                                  
 16845                                  ;include version.inc
 16846                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16847                                  
 16848                                  ;FALSE   EQU     0
 16849                                  ;TRUE    EQU     0FFFFh
 16850                                  
 16851                                  ;IBMVER	    EQU     TRUE
 16852                                  ;IBMCOPYRIGHT EQU   FALSE
 16853                                  ;STACKSW    EQU	    TRUE		;Include Switchable Hardware Stacks
 16854                                  ;IBMJAPVER  EQU     FALSE		; If TRUE set KANJI true also
 16855                                  ;MSVER      EQU     FALSE
 16856                                  ;ALTVECT    EQU     FALSE		; Switch to build ALTVECT version
 16857                                  ;KANJI      EQU     FALSE
 16858                                  
 16859                                  ;(MSDOS 6.0, versiona.inc, 1991)
 16860                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16861                                  ;MAJOR_VERSION  EQU	6
 16862                                  ;;MINOR_VERSION	EQU	0	;6.00
 16863                                  ;MINOR_VERSION  EQU	21	;6.21  ; 21/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 16864                                  
 16865                                  ; 22/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0)
 16866                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16867                                  ;MAJOR_VERSION   EQU	5
 16868                                  ;MINOR_VERSION   EQU	0
 16869                                  
 16870                                  ; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21)
 16871                                  MAJOR_VERSION   EQU	6
 16872                                  MINOR_VERSION   EQU	22
 16873                                  
 16874                                  expected_version equ	(MINOR_VERSION<<8)+MAJOR_VERSION
 16875                                  
 16876                                  ;DOSREVNM equ	00000000b       ; m037 - bits 0-2 = revision number of DOS
 16877                                  				; currently 0.
 16878                                  DOSREVNM equ	00000111b	; [[[ 7 for Retro DOS v4.0 ]]] (21/03/2019)	
 16879                                  DOSINROM equ	00001000B       ; bit 3 of ver flags returned in BH
 16880                                  DOSINHMA equ	00010000B       ; bit 4 of ver flags 
 16881                                  
 16882                                  ;      if1
 16883                                  ;      %OUT  ... for DOS Version 5.00 ...
 16884                                  ;      endif
 16885                                  
 16886                                         ;******************************
 16887                                         ;Each assembler program should:
 16888                                         ;  mov ah,030h                   ;DOS Get Version function
 16889                                         ;  int 021h                      ;Version ret. in AX,minor version first
 16890                                         ;  cmp ax,expected_version       ;ALL utilities should check for an
 16891                                         ;  jne error_handler             ; EXACT version match.
 16892                                         ;******************************
 16893                                  
 16894                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16895                                  ; device definitions
 16896                                  
 16897                                  ;Attribute bit masks
 16898                                  DEVTYP  EQU     8000h           ;Bit 15 - 1  if Char, 0 if block
 16899                                  DEVIOCTL EQU    4000h           ;Bit 14 - CONTROL mode bit
 16900                                  ISFATBYDEV EQU  2000h           ;Bit 13 - Device uses FAT ID bytes, comp media.
 16901                                  ISCIN   EQU     0001h           ;Bit 0 - This device is the console input.
 16902                                  ISCOUT  EQU     0002h           ;Bit 1 - This device is the console output.
 16903                                  ISNULL  EQU     0004h           ;Bit 2 - This device is the null device.
 16904                                  ISCLOCK EQU     0008h           ;Bit 3 - This device is the clock device.
 16905                                  ISIBM   EQU     0010h           ;Bit 4 - This device is special
 16906                                  
 16907                                  ; The device table list has the form:
 16908                                  struc	SYSDEV
 16909 00000000 ????????                .NEXT:		resd 1		;Pointer to next device header
 16910 00000004 ????                    .ATT:		resw 1		;Attributes of the device
 16911 00000006 ????                    .STRAT:		resw 1		;Strategy entry point
 16912 00000008 ????                    .INT:		resw 1		;Interrupt entry point
 16913 0000000A ????????????????        .NAME:		resb 8		;Name of device (only first byte used for block)
 16914                                  .size:
 16915                                  endstruc
 16916                                  
 16917                                  ;Static Reguest Header
 16918                                  struc	SRHEAD
 16919 00000000 ??                      .REQLEN:	resb 1		;Length in bytes of request block
 16920 00000001 ??                      .REQUNIT:	resb 1		;Device unit number
 16921 00000002 ??                      .REQFUNC:	resb 1		;Type of request
 16922 00000003 ????                    .REQSTAT:	resw 1		;Status Word
 16923 00000005 ????????????????                	resb 8		;Reserved for queue links
 16924                                  .size:
 16925                                  endstruc
 16926                                  
 16927                                  ;Status word masks
 16928                                  STERR   EQU     8000H           ;Bit 15 - Error
 16929                                  STBUI   EQU     0200H           ;Bit 9 - Buisy
 16930                                  STDON   EQU     0100H           ;Bit 8 - Done
 16931                                  STECODE EQU     00FFH           ;Error code
 16932                                  WRECODE EQU     0
 16933                                  
 16934                                  ;Function codes
 16935                                  DEVINIT EQU     0               ;Initialization
 16936                                  DINITHL EQU     26              ;Size of init header
 16937                                  DEVMDCH EQU     1               ;Media check
 16938                                  DMEDHL  EQU     15              ;Size of media check header
 16939                                  DEVBPB  EQU     2               ;Get BPB
 16940                                  DEVRDIOCTL EQU  3               ;IOCTL read
 16941                                  DBPBHL  EQU     22              ;Size of Get BPB header
 16942                                  DEVRD   EQU     4               ;Read
 16943                                  DRDWRHL EQU     22              ;Size of RD/WR header
 16944                                  DEVRDND EQU     5               ;Non destructive read no wait (character devs)
 16945                                  DRDNDHL EQU     14              ;Size of non destructive read header
 16946                                  DEVIST  EQU     6               ;Input status
 16947                                  DSTATHL EQU     13              ;Size of status header
 16948                                  DEVIFL  EQU     7               ;Input flush
 16949                                  DFLSHL  EQU     15              ;Size of flush header
 16950                                  DEVWRT  EQU     8               ;Write
 16951                                  DEVWRTV EQU     9               ;Write with verify
 16952                                  DEVOST  EQU     10              ;Output status
 16953                                  DEVOFL  EQU     11              ;Output flush
 16954                                  DEVWRIOCTL EQU  12              ;IOCTL write
 16955                                  
 16956                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16957                                  struc	SYS_FCB
 16958 00000000 ??                      .fcb_drive:	resb 1
 16959 00000001 ????????????????        .fcb_name:	resb 8
 16960 00000009 ??????                  .fcb_ext:	resb 3
 16961 0000000C ????                    .fcb_EXTENT:	resw 1
 16962 0000000E ????                    .fcb_RECSIZ:	resw 1	; Size of record (user settable)
 16963 00000010 ????                    .fcb_FILSIZ:	resw 1	; Size of file in bytes; used with the following
 16964                                                          ; word
 16965 00000012 ????                    .fcb_DRVBP:	resw 1	; BP for SEARCH FIRST and SEARCH NEXT
 16966 00000014 ????                    .fcb_FDATE:	resw 1	; Date of last writing
 16967 00000016 ????                    .fcb_FTIME:	resw 1	; Time of last writing
 16968 00000018 ??                      .fcb_DEVID:	resb 1	; Device ID number, bits 0-5 if file.
 16969                                                          ; bit 7=0 for file, bit 7=1 for I/O device
 16970                                                          ; If file, bit 6=0 if dirty
 16971                                                          ; If I/O device, bit 6=0 if EOF (input)
 16972                                                          ;               Bit 5=1 if Raw mode
 16973                                                          ;               Bit 0=1 if console input device
 16974                                                          ;               Bit 1=1 if console output device
 16975                                                          ;               Bit 2=1 if null device
 16976                                                          ;               Bit 3=1 if clock device
 16977 00000019 ????                    .fcb_FIRCLUS:	resw 1	; First cluster of file
 16978 0000001B ????                    .fcb_CLUSPOS:	resw 1	; Position of last cluster accessed
 16979 0000001D ????                    .fcb_LSTCLUS:	resw 1	; Last cluster accessed and directory
 16980 0000001F ??                                   	resb 1	; pack 2 12 bit numbers into 24 bits...
 16981 00000020 ??                      .fcb_NR:	resb 1	; Next record
 16982 00000021 ????????                .fcb_RR:	resb 4	; Random record
 16983                                  .size:
 16984                                  endstruc
 16985                                  
 16986                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16987                                  ; Field definition for I/O buffer information
 16988                                  
 16989                                  ; 22/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.0, BUFFER.INC, 1991)
 16990                                  
 16991                                  struc buffinfo
 16992 00000000 ????                    .buf_next:	resw 1	; Pointer to next buffer in list
 16993 00000002 ????                    .buf_prev:	resw 1	; Pointer to previous buffer in list
 16994 00000004 ??                      .buf_ID:	resb 1	; Drive of buffer (bit 7 = 0)
 16995                                  			; SFT table index (bit 7 = 1)
 16996                                  			; = FFh if buffer free
 16997 00000005 ??                      .buf_flags:	resb 1	; Bit 7 = 1 if Remote file buffer
 16998                                  			;	= 0 if Local device buffer
 16999                                  			; Bit 6 = 1 if buffer dirty
 17000                                  			; Bit 5 = Reserved
 17001                                  			; Bit 4 = Search bit (bit 7 = 1)
 17002                                  			; Bit 3 = 1 if buffer is DATA
 17003                                  			; Bit 2 = 1 if buffer is DIR
 17004                                  			; Bit 1 = 1 if buffer is FAT
 17005                                  			; Bit 0 = Reserved
 17006 00000006 ????????                .buf_sector:	resd 1	; Sector number of buffer (bit 7 = 0)
 17007                                  ; The next two items are often refed as a word (bit 7 = 0)
 17008 0000000A ??                      .buf_wrtcnt:	resb 1	; For FAT sectors, # times sector written out
 17009 0000000B ????                    .buf_wrtcntinc:	resw 1	; "   "     "   , # sectors between each write
 17010 0000000D ????????                .buf_DPB :	resd 1	; Pointer to drive parameters
 17011 00000011 ????                    .buf_fill:	resw 1	; How full buffer is (bit 7 = 1)
 17012 00000013 ??                      .buf_reserved:	resb 1	; make DWORD boundary for 386
 17013                                  .size:
 17014                                  endstruc
 17015                                  
 17016                                  %define buf_offset	dword [buf_sector]
 17017                                  			;For bit 7 = 1, this is the byte
 17018                                  			;offset of the start of the buffer in
 17019                                  			;the file pointed to by buf_ID.  Thus
 17020                                  			;the buffer starts at location
 17021                                  			;buf_offset in the file and contains
 17022                                  			;buf_fill bytes.
 17023                                  
 17024                                  bufinsiz	equ	buffinfo.size ; ; Size of structure in bytes
 17025                                  
 17026                                  
 17027                                  buf_Free	equ	0FFh		; buf_id of free buffer
 17028                                  
 17029                                  ;Flag byte masks
 17030                                  buf_isnet	EQU	10000000B
 17031                                  buf_dirty	EQU	01000000B
 17032                                  ;***
 17033                                  buf_visit	EQU	00100000B
 17034                                  ;***
 17035                                  buf_snbuf	EQU	00010000B
 17036                                  
 17037                                  buf_isDATA	EQU	00001000B
 17038                                  buf_isDIR	EQU	00000100B
 17039                                  buf_isFAT	EQU	00000010B
 17040                                  buf_type_0	EQU	11110001B	; AND sets type to "none"
 17041                                  
 17042                                  buf_NetID	EQU	bufinsiz
 17043                                  
 17044                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 17045                                  
 17046                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 17047                                  ;**	DPB - Drive Parameter Block
 17048                                  
 17049                                  ; 25/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.0, DPB.INC, 1991)
 17050                                  
 17051                                  ;	BUGBUG - this isn't authorative - it's my probably incomplete and
 17052                                  ;	possibly inaccurate deductions from code study... - jgl
 17053                                  ;
 17054                                  ;	The DPB is DOS's main structure for describing block devices.
 17055                                  ;	It contains info about the "Drive" intermingled with info about
 17056                                  ;	the FAT file system which is presumably on the drive.  I don't know
 17057                                  ;	how those fields are used if it's not the FAT file system - BUGBUG
 17058                                  ;
 17059                                  ;	The DPBs are statically allocated and chained off of DPBHead.
 17060                                  ;	Users scan this chain looking for a match on DPB_DRIVE.
 17061                                  ;	The DPBs are built at init time from info in the SYSDEV structure.
 17062                                  
 17063                                  ; 08/06/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0 (MSDOS 3.3, DPB.INC, 24/07/1987)
 17064                                  
 17065                                  ; 12/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 17066                                  
 17067                                  struc	DPB
 17068 00000000 ??                      .DRIVE:		resb 1		; Logical drive # assoc with DPB (A=0,B=1,...)
 17069 00000001 ??                      .UNIT:		resb 1		; Driver unit number of DPB
 17070 00000002 ????                    .SECTOR_SIZE:	resw 1		; Size of physical sector in bytes
 17071 00000004 ??                      .CLUSTER_MASK:	resb 1		; Sectors/cluster - 1
 17072 00000005 ??                      .CLUSTER_SHIFT:	resb 1		; Log2 of sectors/cluster
 17073 00000006 ????                    .FIRST_FAT:	resw 1		; Starting record of FATs
 17074 00000008 ??                      .FAT_COUNT:	resb 1		; Number of FATs for this drive
 17075 00000009 ????                    .ROOT_ENTRIES:	resw 1		; Number of directory entries
 17076 0000000B ????                    .FIRST_SECTOR:	resw 1		; First sector of first cluster
 17077 0000000D ????                    .MAX_CLUSTER:	resw 1		; Number of clusters on drive + 1
 17078                                  ;.FAT_SIZE:	resb 1  ; MSDOS 3.3
 17079 0000000F ????                    .FAT_SIZE:	resw 1		; Number of records occupied by FAT
 17080 00000011 ????                    .DIR_SECTOR:	resw 1		; Starting record of directory
 17081 00000013 ????????                .DRIVER_ADDR:	resd 1		; Pointer to driver
 17082 00000017 ??                      .MEDIA:		resb 1		; Media byte
 17083 00000018 ??                      .FIRST_ACCESS:	resb 1		; This is initialized to -1 to force a media
 17084                                  				; check the first time this DPB is used
 17085 00000019 ????????                .NEXT_DPB:	resd 1		; Pointer to next Drive parameter block
 17086 0000001D ????                    .NEXT_FREE:	resw 1		; Cluster # of last allocated cluster
 17087 0000001F ????                    .FREE_CNT:	resw 1		; Count of free clusters, -1 if unknown
 17088                                  .size:
 17089                                  endstruc
 17090                                  
 17091                                  DPBSIZ  EQU     DPB.size	; Size of the structure in bytes
 17092                                  
 17093                                  DSKSIZ  EQU	DPB.MAX_CLUSTER	; Size of disk (temp used during init only)
 17094

 17150                                  ; 25/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0  (MSDOS 6.0, BPB.INC, IOCTL.INC)
 17151                                  
 17152                                  ;**	BIOS PARAMETER BLOCK DEFINITION
 17153                                  ;
 17154                                  ;	The BPB contains information about the disk structure.  It dates
 17155                                  ;	back to the earliest FAT systems and so FAT information is
 17156                                  ;	intermingled with physical driver information.
 17157                                  ;
 17158                                  ;	A boot sector contains a BPB for its device; for other disks
 17159                                  ;	the driver creates a BPB.  DOS keeps copies of some of this
 17160                                  ;	information in the DPB.
 17161                                  ;
 17162                                  ;	The BDS structure contains a BPB within it.
 17163                                  
 17164                                  struc A_BPB
 17165 00000000 ????                    .BPB_BYTESPERSECTOR:	resw	1
 17166 00000002 ??                      .BPB_SECTORSPERCLUSTER:	resb	1
 17167 00000003 ????                    .BPB_RESERVEDSECTORS:	resw	1
 17168 00000005 ??                      .BPB_NUMBEROFFATS:	resb	1
 17169 00000006 ????                    .BPB_ROOTENTRIES: 	resw	1
 17170 00000008 ????                    .BPB_TOTALSECTORS:	resw	1
 17171 0000000A ??                      .BPB_MEDIADESCRIPTOR:	resb	1
 17172 0000000B ????                    .BPB_SECTORSPERFAT:	resw	1
 17173 0000000D ????                    .BPB_SECTORSPERTRACK:	resw	1
 17174 0000000F ????                    .BPB_HEADS:		resw	1
 17175 00000011 ????                    .BPB_HIDDENSECTORS:	resw	1
 17176 00000013 ????                    			resw	1
 17177 00000015 ????                    .BPB_BIGTOTALSECTORS:	resw	1
 17178 00000017 ????                    			resw	1
 17179 00000019 ????????????            			resb	6	; NOTE:  many times these
 17180                                  ;					; 	 6 bytes are omitted
 17181                                  ;					;	 when BPB manipulations
 17182                                  ;					;	 are performed!
 17183                                  .size:
 17184                                  endstruc
 17185                                  
 17186                                  struc A_DEVICEPARAMETERS
 17187 00000000 ??                      .DP_SPECIALFUNCTIONS:	resb	1
 17188 00000001 ??                      .DP_DEVICETYPE:		resb	1
 17189 00000002 ????                    .DP_DEVICEATTRIBUTES:	resw	1
 17190 00000004 ????                    .DP_CYLINDERS:		resw	1
 17191 00000006 ??                      .DP_MEDIATYPE:		resb	1
 17192 00000007 <res 1Fh>               .DP_BPB:		resb	A_BPB.size
 17193 00000026 ????                    .DP_TRACKTABLEENTRIES:	resw	1
 17194 00000028 <res FCh>               .DP_SECTORTABLE:	resb	MAX_SECTORS_IN_TRACK * A_SECTORTABLE.size
 17195                                  endstruc

 17421                                  OEM_C7				EQU 255 ; 255	 FF

 17443                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 17444                                  ; BIOSTRUC.INC (MSDOS 3.3 - 24/07/1987) 	
 17445                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 17446                                  					  ;;Rev 3.30 Modification
 17447                                  ; ROM BIOS CALL PACKET STRUCTURES					  
 17448                                  									  
 17449                                  ;*******************************					  
 17450                                  ;System Service call ( Int 15h )					  
 17451                                  ;*******************************					  
 17452                                  ;Function AH = 0C0h, Return system configuration			  
 17453                                  ;For PC and PCJR on return:						  
 17454                                  ;	(AH)	= 80h							  
 17455                                  ;	(CY)	= 1							  
 17456                                  ;For PCXT, PC PORTABLE and PCAT on return:				  
 17457                                  ;	(AH)	= 86h							  
 17458                                  ;	(CY)	= 1							  
 17459                                  ;For all others:							  
 17460                                  ;	(AH)	= 0							  
 17461                                  ;	(CY)	= 0							  
 17462                                  ;	(ES:BX) = pointer to system descriptor vector in ROS		  
 17463                                  ; System descriptor :							  
 17464                                  ;	DW	xxxx		length of descriptor in bytes,		  
 17465                                  ;				minimum length = 8			  
 17466                                  ;	DB	xx		model byte				  
 17467                                  ;				0FFh	= PC				  
 17468                                  ;				0FEh	= PC/XT, Portable		  
 17469                                  ;				0FDh	= PC/JR 			  
 17470                                  ;				0FCh	= PC/AT				  
 17471                                  ;				0F9h	= Convertable			  
 17472                                  ;				0F8h	= Model 80			  
 17473                                  ;				0E0 thru 0EFh = reserved		  
 17474                                  ;									  
 17475                                  ;	DB	xx		secondary model byte			  
 17476                                  ;				000h	= PC1				  
 17477                                  ;				000h	= PC/XT, Portable		  
 17478                                  ;				000h	= PC/JR 			  
 17479                                  ;				000h	= PC/AT 			  
 17480                                  ;				001h	= PC/AT Model 339		  
 17481                                  ;				003h	= PC/RT				  
 17482                                  ;				000h	= Convertable			  
 17483                                  ;									  
 17484                                  ;	DB	xx		bios revision level			  
 17485                                  ;				00 for first release, subsequent release  
 17486                                  ;				of code with same model byte and	  
 17487                                  ;				secondary model byte require revison level
 17488                                  ;				to increase by one.			  
 17489                                  ;									  
 17490                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 1		  
 17491                                  ;				X0000000 = 1, bios use DMA channel 3	  
 17492                                  ;					 = 0, DMA channel 3 not used	  
 17493                                  ;									  
 17494                                  ;				0X000000 = 1, 2nd Interrupt chip present  
 17495                                  ;					 = 0, 2nd Interrupt chip not present
 17496                                  ;									  
 17497                                  ;				00X00000 = 1, Real Time Clock present	  
 17498                                  ;					 = 0, Real Time Clock not present 
 17499                                  ;									  
 17500                                  ;				000X0000 = 1, Keyboard escape sequence(INT 15h)
 17501                                  ;						called in keyboard interrupt
 17502                                  ;						(Int 09h).		  
 17503                                  ;					 = 0, Keyboard escape sequence not
 17504                                  ;						called. 		  
 17505                                  ;				0000XXXX reserved			  
 17506                                  ;									  
 17507                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 2 - reserved	  
 17508                                  ;									  
 17509                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 2 - reserved	  
 17510                                  ;									  
 17511                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 2 - reserved	  
 17512                                  ;									  
 17513                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 2 - reserved	  
 17514                                  ;									  
 17515                                  
 17516                                  ; 22/03/2019									  
 17517                                  struc ROMBIOS_DESC		; BIOS_SYSTEM_DESCRIPTOR						  
 17518 00000000 ????                    .bios_sd_leng:		resw 1				  
 17519 00000002 ??                      .bios_sd_modelbyte:	resb 1					  
 17520                                  .bios_sd_scnd_modelbyte: 
 17521 00000003 ??                      			resb 1					  
 17522 00000004 ??                      			resb 1					  
 17523 00000005 ??                      .bios_sd_featurebyte1:	resb 1					  
 17524 00000006 ????????                			resb 4					  
 17525                                  endstruc					  
 17526                                  									  
 17527                                  ;FeatureByte1	bit map equates 					  
 17528                                  DMAchannel3		equ 10000000b					  
 17529                                  ScndIntController	equ 01000000b					  
 17530                                  RealTimeClock		equ 00100000b					  
 17531                                  KeyEscapeSeq		equ 00010000b					  
 17532                                  					;;End of Modification

 17634                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 17635                                  ; CURDIR.INC (MSDOS 6.0 - 1991) 	
 17636                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 17637                                  ; 22/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 17638                                  
 17639                                  ;**	CDS - Current Directory Structure
 17640                                  ;
 17641                                  ; CDS items are used bu the internal routines to store cluster numbers and
 17642                                  ; network identifiers for each logical name.  The ID field is used dually,
 17643                                  ; both as net ID and for a cluster number for local devices. In the case
 17644                                  ; of local devices, the cluster number will be -1 if there is a potential
 17645                                  ; of the disk being changed or if the path must be recracked.
 17646                                  ;
 17647                                  ;	Some pathnames have special preambles, such as
 17648                                  ;
 17649                                  ;		\\machine\sharename\...
 17650                                  ;	For these pathnames we can't allow ".." processing to back us
 17651                                  ;	up into the special front part of the name.  The CURDIR_END field
 17652                                  ;	holds the address of the seperator character which marks
 17653                                  ;	the split between the special preamble and the regular
 17654                                  ;	path list; ".." processing isn't allowed to back us up past
 17655                                  ;	(i.e., before) CURDIR_END
 17656                                  ;	For the root, it points at the leading /. For net
 17657                                  ;	assignments it points at the end (nul) of the initial assignment:
 17658                                  ;	A:/	\\foo\bar	    \\foo\bar\blech\bozo
 17659                                  ;	  ^		 ^		     ^
 17660                                  
 17661                                  DIRSTRLEN	EQU	64+3		; Max length in bytes of directory strings
 17662                                  TEMPLEN 	EQU	DIRSTRLEN*2
 17663                                  
 17664                                  struc 		curdir_list
 17665                                  ; MSDOS 3.3
 17666 00000000 <res 43h>               .cdir_text	resb	DIRSTRLEN	; text of assignment and curdir
 17667 00000043 ????                    .cdir_flags	resw	1		; various flags
 17668 00000045 ????????                .cdir_devptr	resd	1		; local pointer to DPB or net device
 17669 00000049 ????????                .cdir_ID	resw	2		; cluster of current dir (net ID)
 17670 0000004D ????                    .cdir_usr_word	resw	1
 17671 0000004F ????                    .cdir_end	resw	1		; end of assignment
 17672                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 17673 00000051 ??                      .cdir_type:	resb	1		; IFS drive (2=ifs, 4=netuse)
 17674 00000052 ????????                .cdir_ifd_hdr:	resd	1		; Ptr to File System Header
 17675 00000056 ????                    .cdir_fsda:	resb	2		; File System Dependent Data Area
 17676                                  .size:
 17677                                  endstruc
 17678                                  
 17679                                  curdirlen	EQU	curdir_list.size	; Needed for screwed up
 17680                                  						; ASM87 which doesn't allow
 17681                                  						; Size directive as a macro
 17682                                  						; argument
 17683                                  %define curdir_netID	dword [curdir_list.cdir_ID]
 17684

 17686

 17688                                  curdir_isnet	EQU	1000000000000000B
 17689                                  curdir_isifs	EQU	1000000000000000B
 17690                                  curdir_inuse	EQU	0100000000000000B
 17691                                  curdir_splice	EQU	0010000000000000B
 17692                                  curdir_local	EQU	0001000000000000B

 17694                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 17695                                  ; SF.INC (MSDOS 6.0 - 1991) 	
 17696                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 17697                                  ; 25/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 17698                                  
 17699                                  ; system file table
 17700                                  
 17701                                  ;**	System File Table SuperStructure
 17702                                  ;
 17703                                  ;	The system file table entries are allocated in contiguous groups.
 17704                                  ;	There may be more than one such groups; the SF "superstructure"
 17705                                  ;	tracks the groups.
 17706                                  
 17707                                  struc	SF
 17708 00000000 ????????                .SFLink:	resd	1
 17709 00000004 ????                    .SFCount:	resw	1		; number of entries
 17710 00000006 ????                    .SFTable:	resw	1		; beginning of array of the following
 17711                                  .size:
 17712                                  endstruc
 17713                                  
 17714                                  ;**	System file table entry
 17715                                  ;
 17716                                  ;	These are the structures which are at SFTABLE in the SF structure.
 17717                                  
 17718                                  struc	SF_ENTRY
 17719 00000000 ????                    .sf_ref_count:	resw	1		; number of processes sharing entry
 17720                                  					;   if FCB then ref count
 17721 00000002 ????                    .sf_mode: 	resw	1		; mode of access or high bit on if FCB
 17722 00000004 ??                      .sf_attr: 	resb	1		; attribute of file
 17723 00000005 ????                    .sf_flags:	resw	1		;Bits 8-15
 17724                                  					; Bit 15 = 1 if remote file
 17725                                  					;	 = 0 if local file or device
 17726                                  					; Bit 14 = 1 if date/time is not to be
 17727                                  					;   set from clock at CLOSE.  Set by
 17728                                  					;   FILETIMES and FCB_CLOSE.  Reset by
 17729                                  					;   other reseters of the dirty bit
 17730                                  					;   (WRITE)
 17731                                  					; Bit 13 = Pipe bit (reserved)
 17732                                  					;
 17733                                  					; Bits 0-7 (old FCB_devid bits)
 17734                                  					; If remote file or local file, bit
 17735                                  					; 6=0 if dirty Device ID number, bits
 17736                                  					; 0-5 if local file.
 17737                                  					; bit 7=0 for local file, bit 7
 17738                                  					;      =1 for local I/O device
 17739                                  					; If local I/O device, bit 6=0 if EOF (input)
 17740                                  					;		Bit 5=1 if Raw mode
 17741                                  					;		Bit 0=1 if console input device
 17742                                  					;		Bit 1=1 if console output device
 17743                                  					;		Bit 2=1 if null device
 17744                                  					;		Bit 3=1 if clock device
 17745 00000007 ????????                .sf_devptr:	resd	1		; Points to DPB if local file, points
 17746                                  					; to device header if local device,
 17747                                  					; points to net device header if
 17748                                  					; remote
 17749 0000000B ????                    .sf_firclus:	resw	1		; First cluster of file (bit 15 = 0)
 17750                                  ;.sf_lstclus:	resw	1 ; *	
 17751 0000000D ????                    .sf_time: 	resw	1		; Time associated with file
 17752 0000000F ????                    .sf_date: 	resw	1		; Date associated with file
 17753 00000011 ????????                .sf_size: 	resd	1		; Size associated with file
 17754 00000015 ????????                .sf_position:	resd	1		; Read/Write pointer or LRU count for FCBs
 17755                                  ;
 17756                                  ; Starting here, the next 7 bytes may be used by the file system to store an
 17757                                  ; ID
 17758                                  ;
 17759 00000019 ????                    .sf_cluspos:	resw	1		; Position of last cluster accessed
 17760 0000001B ????                    .sf_dirsec:	resw	1		; Sector number of directory sector for this file
 17761 0000001D ??                      .sf_dirpos:	resb	1		; Offset of this entry in the above
 17762                                  ;
 17763                                  ; End of 7 bytes of file-system specific info.
 17764                                  ;
 17765 0000001E <res Bh>                .sf_name:	resb	11		; 11 character name that is in the
 17766                                  					; directory entry.  This is used by
 17767                                  					; close to detect file deleted and
 17768                                  					; disk changed errors.
 17769                                  ; SHARING INFO
 17770 00000029 ????????                .sf_chain:	resd	1		; link to next SF
 17771 0000002D ????                    .sf_UID:	resw	1
 17772 0000002F ????                    .sf_PID:	resw	1
 17773 00000031 ????                    .sf_MFT:	resw	1
 17774 00000033 ????                    .sf_lstclus:	resw	1 ; *		; Last cluster accessed
 17775 00000035 ????????                .sf_IFS_HDR:	resd 	1 ; **
 17776                                  .size:
 17777                                  endstruc

 18046                                  ; SYSINITSEG	SEGMENT PUBLIC 'SYSTEM_INIT'
 18047                                  
 18048                                  SYSINIT$:
 18049                                  	;IF	STACKSW 
 18050                                  	; include MSSTACK.INC	;Main stack program and data definitions
 18051                                  	; include STKMES.INC	;Fatal stack error message
 18052                                  	;   public Endstackcode

 18055                                  
 18056                                  ; 05/07/2018
 18057                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 18058                                  ; 04/06/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 18059                                  
 18060                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 18061                                  ; 21/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT)
 18062                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 18063                                  
 18064                                  ;	MSStack.inc
 18065                                  ;
 18066                                  ;	Interrupt level 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7,(10, 11, 12, 14, 15 - AT level)
 18067                                  ;	should follow the standard Interrupt Sharing Scheme which has
 18068                                  ;	a standard header structure.
 18069                                  ;	Fyi, the following shows the relations between
 18070                                  ;	the interrupt vector and interrupt level.
 18071                                  ; VEC(Hex)    2  8  9  A  B  C	D  E  70  72  73  74  76  77
 18072                                  ; LVL(Deci)   9  0  1  2  3  4	5  6   8  10  11  12  14  15
 18073                                  ;	MSSTACK module modifies the following interrupt vectors
 18074                                  ;	to meet the standard Interrupt Sharing standard;
 18075                                  ;	  A, B, C, D, E, 72, 73, 74, 76, 77.
 18076                                  ;	Also, for interrupt level 7 and 15, the FirstFlag in a standard header
 18077                                  ;	should be initialized to indicat whether this interrupt handler is
 18078                                  ;	the first (= 80h) or not.  The FirstFlag entry of INT77h's
 18079                                  ;	program header is initialized in STKINIT.INC module.
 18080                                  ;	FirstFlag is only meaningful for interrupt level 7 and 15.
 18081                                  ;
 18082                                  
 18083                                  ;  User specifies the number of stack elements - default = 9
 18084                                  ;						 minimum = 8
 18085                                  ;						 maximum = 64
 18086                                  ;
 18087                                  ;  Intercepts Asynchronous Hardware Interrupts only
 18088                                  ;
 18089                                  ;  Picks a stack from pool of stacks and switches to it
 18090                                  ;
 18091                                  ;  Calls the previously saved interrupt vector after pushing flags
 18092                                  ;
 18093                                  ;  On return, returns the stack to the stack pool
 18094                                  ;
 18095                                  
 18096                                  ; This is a modification of STACKS:
 18097                                  ; 1. To fix a bug which was causing the program to take up too much space.
 18098                                  ; 2. To dispense stack space from hi-mem first rather than low-mem first.
 18099                                  ;    . Clobbers the stack that got too big instead of innocent stack
 18100                                  ;    . Allows system to work if the only stack that got too big was the most
 18101                                  ;      deeply nested one
 18102                                  ; 3. Disables NMI interrupts while setting the NMI vector.
 18103                                  ; 4. Does not intercept any interupts on a PCjr.
 18104                                  ; 5. Double checks that a nested interrupt didn't get the same stack.
 18105                                  ; 6. Intercepts Ints 70, 72-77 for PC-ATs and other future products
 18106                                  
 18107                                  		;EVEN
 18108                                  ;align 2
 18109                                  		; 21/10/2022
 18110                                  
 18111 00000000 0000                    		dw	0	; spare field but leave these in order
 18112 00000002 0000                    stackcount:	dw	0
 18113 00000004 0000                    stackat: 	dw	0
 18114 00000006 0000                    stacksize:	dw	0
 18115 00000008 0000                    stacks:		dw	0
 18116 0000000A 0000                    		dw	0
 18117                                  
 18118 0000000C [0800]                  firstentry:	dw	stacks
 18119 0000000E [4800]                  lastentry:	dw	stacks+(defaultcount*entrysize)-entrysize
 18120 00000010 [4800]                  nextentry:	dw	stacks+(defaultcount*entrysize)-entrysize
 18121                                  
 18122                                  ;***********************************************************************
 18123                                  ; THESE ARE THE INDIVIDUAL INTERRUPT HANDLERS
 18124                                  
 18125                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 18126                                  
 18127 00000012 00000000                old02:	dd	0
 18128                                  
 18129                                  int02:
 18130                                  
 18131                                  ; *********************************************************************
 18132                                  ;
 18133                                  ; this is special support for the pc convertible / nmi handler
 18134                                  ;
 18135                                  ;	on the pc convertible, there is a situation where an nmi can be 
 18136                                  ;	caused by using the "out" instructions to certain ports. when this
 18137                                  ;	occurs, the pc convertible hardware *guarantees* that **nothing** 
 18138                                  ;	can stop the nmi or interfere with getting to the nmi handler. this
 18139                                  ;	includes other type of interrupts (hardware and software), and
 18140                                  ;	also includes other type of nmi's. when any nmi has occured,
 18141                                  ;	no other interrtupt (hardware, software or nmi) can occur until
 18142                                  ;	the software takes specific steps to allow further interrupting.
 18143                                  ;
 18144                                  ;	for pc convertible, the situation where the nmi is generated by the
 18145                                  ;	"out" to a control port requires "fixing-up" and re-attempting. in
 18146                                  ;	otherwords, it is actually a "restartable exception". in this
 18147                                  ;	case, the software handler must be able to get to the stack in
 18148                                  ;	order to figure out what instruction caused the problem, where
 18149                                  ;	it was "out"ing to and what value it was "out"ing.  therefore,
 18150                                  ;	we will not switch stacks in this situation. this situation is
 18151                                  ;	detected by interrogating port 62h, and checking for a bit value
 18152                                  ;	of 80h. if set, *****do not switch stacks*****.
 18153                                  ;
 18154                                  ; *********************************************************************
 18155                                  
 18156 00000016 50                      	push	ax
 18157 00000017 06                      	push	es
 18158 00000018 B800F0                  	mov	ax,0F000h
 18159 0000001B 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 18160                                  	; 02/11/2022
 18161 0000001D 26803EFEFFF9            	cmp	byte [es:0FFFEh],0F9h ; mdl_convert ; check if convertible
 18162 00000023 07                      	pop	es
 18163 00000024 750C                    	jne	short normal02
 18164                                  
 18165 00000026 E462                    	in	al,62h		; PC/XT PPI port C. Bits:
 18166                                  				; 0-3: values of DIP switches
 18167                                  				; 5: 1=Timer 2 channel out
 18168                                  				; 6: 1=I/O channel check
 18169                                  				; 7: 1=RAM parity check error occurred.
 18170 00000028 A880                    	test	al,80h
 18171 0000002A 7406                    	jz	short normal02
 18172                                  special02:
 18173 0000002C 58                      	pop	ax
 18174 0000002D 2EFF2E[1200]            	jmp	far [cs:old02]
 18175                                  normal02:
 18176 00000032 58                      	pop	ax
 18177 00000033 E81101                  	call	do_int_stacks
 18178 00000036 [1200]                  	dw	old02
 18179

 18406                                  ;********************************************************************
 18407                                  ;common routines
 18408                                  ;********************************************************************
 18409                                  
 18410                                  ; do interrupt stack switching. the fake return address holds
 18411                                  ; a pointer to the far-pointer of the actual interrupt
 18412                                  ; service routine
 18413                                  
 18414                                  ; 21/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 18415                                  ; 21/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 18416                                  
 18417                                  ;allocbyte   equ 0
 18418                                  ;intlevel    equ 1
 18419                                  ;savedsp     equ 2
 18420                                  ;savedss     equ 4

 18427 00000147 50                      	push	ax

 18429 00000149 06                      	push	es

 18431 0000014F 2E8B2E[1000]            	mov	bp,[cs:nextentry]	; get most likely candidate
 18432 00000154 B001                    	mov	al,allocated ; 1

 18501 000001AA 58                      	pop	ax			; saved on entry

 18505                                  notfree02:

 19866                                  ; code entry points will be located in low memory. Dos_segreinit is used
 19867                                  ; to tell the DOS data where the code has been placed, and to install the

 19869                                  ; must first initialize it in its present location and load the installable

 19871                                  ; relocate the DOS code into HiMem.

 19874                                  ; to install the low memory stub (this must be done before allowing any

 19876                                  ; call dos_segreinit at all, since the interrupt vector table has already 
 19877                                  ; been patched.

 20191                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 20192                                  
 20193                                  ;   Once we get to this point, the above code, which is below "retry"
 20194                                  ;   in memory, can be trashed (and in fact is -- see references to retry
 20195                                  ;   which follow....)
 20196                                  
 20197                                  retry:
 20198 00000780 BA[BC45]                	mov	dx,commnd	; now pointing to file description
 20199                                  
 20200                                  ; we are going to open the command interpreter and size it as is done in
 20201                                  ; ldfil. the reason we must do this is that sysinit is in free memory. if
 20202                                  ; there is not enough room for the command interpreter,exec will probably
 20203                                  ; overlay our stack and code so when it returns with an error sysinit won't be
 20204                                  ; here to catch it. this code is not perfect (for instance .exe command
 20205                                  ; interpreters are possible) because it does its sizing based on the
 20206                                  ; assumption that the file being loaded is a .com file. it is close enough to
 20207                                  ; correctness to be usable.
 20208                                  
 20209                                  ; first, find out where the command interpreter is going to go.
 20210                                  
 20211 00000783 52                      	push	dx		; save pointer to name
 20212 00000784 BBFFFF                  	mov	bx,0FFFFh
 20213 00000787 B448                    	mov	ah,48h	; ALLOC
 20214 00000789 CD21                            int     21h             ; get biggest piece
 20215 0000078B B448                    	mov	ah,48h	; ALLOC
 20216 0000078D CD21                    	int	21h		; second time gets it
 20217 0000078F 726B                    	jc	short memerrjx	; oooops
 20218                                  
 20219 00000791 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 20220 00000793 B449                    	mov	ah,49h	; DEALLOC
 20221 00000795 CD21                    	int	21h		; give it right back
 20222 00000797 89DD                    	mov	bp,bx
 20223                                  
 20224                                  ; es:0 points to block,and bp is the size of the block in para.
 20225                                  
 20226                                  ; we will now adjust the size in bp down by the size of sysinit.
 20227                                  ; we need to do this because exec might get upset if some of the exec
 20228                                  ; data in sysinit is overlayed during the exec.
 20229                                  
 20230                                  	; 22/10/2022
 20231                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT:083Bh)
 20232 00000799 8B1E[9402]                      mov     bx,[MEMORY_SIZE] ; get location of end of memory
 20233 0000079D 8CC8                    	mov	ax,cs		 ; get location of beginning of sysinit
 20234                                  
 20235                                  ; Note that the "config_wrkseg" environment data is a segment in
 20236                                  ; unallocated memory (as of the Dealloc of [area], above). This is ideal
 20237                                  ; in one sense, because Exec is going to make a copy of it for COMMAND.COM
 20238                                  ; anyway, and no one has responsibility for freeing "config_wrkseg". But
 20239                                  ; we need to make sure that there's no way Exec will stomp on that data
 20240                                  ; before it can copy it, and one way to do that is to make the available
 20241                                  ; memory calculation even more "paranoid", by subtracting "config_wrkseg"
 20242                                  ; from the "memory_size" segment value (which is typically A000h) instead
 20243                                  ; of the current sysinit CS....
 20244                                  ;
 20245                                  ; The reason I use the term "paranoid" is because this code should have
 20246                                  ; slid the data required by Exec up to the very top of memory, because as
 20247                                  ; it stands, you have to have sizeof(COMMAND.COM) PLUS 64K to load just
 20248                                  ; COMMAND.COM (64k is about what sysinit, and all the goop above sysinit,
 20249                                  ; consumes). Now it's just a little worse (65K or more, depending on
 20250                                  ; the size of your CONFIG.SYS, since the size of the environment workspace
 20251                                  ; is determined by the size of CONFIG.SYS.... -JTP

 20668                                  ; procedure : TryToMovDOSHi
 20669                                  ;
 20670                                  ;		This tries to move DOS into HMA.

 20673                                  ;

 20675                                  ;		the A20 switching code in the low mem stub to be installed.

 21074 00000A00 CD21                    	int	21h
 21075 00000A02 7250                    	jc	short FatalErr			; IF ERR WE ARE HOSED
 21076                                   	; 23/10/2022

 21079                                  						;  BIOS code

 21091                                  
 21092                                  ; BUGBUG -- 5 Aug 92 -- chuckst -- Allocating space for DOS
 21093                                  ;	  using DOS itself causes an arena to be generated.
 21094                                  ;	  Unfortunately, certain programs (like PROTMAN$)
 21095                                  ;	  assume that the device drivers are loaded into
 21096                                  ;	  the first arena. For this reason, MagicDrv's
 21097                                  ;	  main device driver header arena is manually
 21098                                  ;	  truncated from the arena chain, and the space
 21099                                  ;	  for DOS is allocated using the following
 21100                                  ;	  simple code, which also assumes that the
 21101                                  ;	  first arena is the free one where DOS's low
 21102                                  ;	  stub will go.
 21103                                  ;
 21104                                  ; M012 : BEGIN
 21105                                  
 21106                                  	; 23/10/2022
 21107                                  update_arena:
 21108 00000A18 1E                      	push	ds ; ds = cs
 21109 00000A19 57                      	push	di
 21110 00000A1A 51                      	push	cx
 21111 00000A1B 52                      	push	dx
 21112                                  	; 23/10/2022
 21113                                  	;lds	di,[cs:DOSINFO]			; get ptr to DOS var
 21114                                  	; 11/12/2022
 21115                                  	; ds = cs 
 21116 00000A1C C53E[6D02]              	lds	di,[DOSINFO] ; 27/03/2019	
 21117 00000A20 4F                      	dec	di
 21118 00000A21 4F                      	dec	di				; Arena head is immediately
 21119                                  						;  before sysvar
 21120 00000A22 8E05                    	mov	es,[di]				; es = arena head
 21121                                  	;mov	cx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]		; cx = total low mem size
 21122 00000A24 268B0E0300              	mov	cx,[es:3]
 21123 00000A29 39D9                    	cmp	cx,bx				; is it sufficient ?
 21124 00000A2B 7227                    	jb	short FatalErr			; no, fatal error
 21125                                  
 21126                                  	;mov	dl,[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE]
 21127 00000A2D 268A160000              	mov	dl,[es:0]
 21128 00000A32 8CC0                    	mov	ax,es
 21129 00000A34 01D8                    	add	ax,bx				; ax = new arena head
 21130 00000A36 8905                    	mov	[di],ax				; store it in DOS data area
 21131 00000A38 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 21132                                  	;mov	[ARENA.SIGNATURE],dl		; type of arena
 21133 00000A3A 88160000                	mov	[0],dl
 21134                                  	;mov	word [ARENA.OWNER],0		; free
 21135 00000A3E C70601000000            	mov	word [1],0
 21136 00000A44 29D9                    	sub	cx,bx				; size of the new block
 21137                                  	;mov	[ARENA.SIZE],cx			; store it in the arena
 21138 00000A46 890E0300                	mov	[3],cx
 21139 00000A4A 8CC0                    	mov	ax,es				; return seg to the caller
 21140                                  	; 23/10/2022
 21141                                  	;; 24/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (ORG 0)	; Take care ORG 30h of
 21142 00000A4C 83E803                  	sub	ax,3				;  BIOS code
 21143 00000A4F 5A                      	pop	dx
 21144 00000A50 59                      	pop	cx
 21145 00000A51 5F                      	pop	di
 21146 00000A52 1F                      	pop	ds ; ds = cs
 21147 00000A53 C3                      	retn
 21148                                  ;
 21149                                  ; M012 : END
 21150                                  ;
 21151                                  FatalErr:
 21152 00000A54 0E                      	push	cs

 21154 00000A56 BA[2009]                	mov	dx,FEmsg
 21155 00000A59 B409                    	mov	ah,9
 21156 00000A5B CD21                    	int	21h 		; DOS - PRINT STRING
 21157                                  				; DS:DX -> string terminated by "$"
 21158                                  	; 30/12/2022 (MSDOS 6.21 SYSINIT)
 21159 00000A5D E92C07                  	jmp	stall

 21161                                  	;cli
 21162                                  	;hlt

 21166                                  ; 25/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 21167                                  
 21168                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21169                                  ;
 21170                                  ; procedure : AllocHMA
 21171                                  ;
 21172                                  ;	grab_the_hma tries to enable a20 and make sure there is memory
 21173                                  ;	  up there. If it gets any sort of error, it will return with
 21174                                  ;	  carry set so that we can resort to running low.
 21175                                  ;
 21176                                  ;	It also returns ES: -> 0ffffh if it returns success
 21177                                  ;
 21178                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21179                                  
 21180                                  AllocHMA:
 21181                                  ;	cas note:  The pre-286 check is no longer needed here since the
 21182                                  ;		   presence of XMS is sufficient. However, this code hasn't
 21183                                  ;		   been deleted because it can be recycled for skipping the
 21184                                  ;		   extra pass of CONFIG.SYS and assuming we're running low
 21185                                  ;		   in the case of a pre-286.
 21186                                  
 21187                                  ;;	see if we're running on a pre-286. If not, force low.
 21188                                  ;
 21189                                  ;	xor	ax,ax
 21190                                  ;	pushf			; save flags (like int)
 21191                                  ;	push	ax
 21192                                  ;	popf
 21193                                  ;	pushf
 21194                                  ;	pop	ax
 21195                                  ;	popf			; restore original flags (like int)
 21196                                  ;	and	ax,0F000h
 21197                                  ;	cmp	ax,0F000h	; 8088/8086?
 21198                                  ;	jz	short grab_hma_error
 21199                                  
 21200                                  	; 23/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 21201                                  	; (SYSINIT:0A26h)
 21202                                  
 21203 00000A60 1E                      	push	ds
 21204                                  	;;mov	ax,Bios_Data
 21205                                  	;mov	ax,KERNEL_SEGMENT
 21206                                  	; 21/10/2022
 21207 00000A61 B87000                  	mov	ax,DOSBIODATASEG
 21208 00000A64 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 21209                                  
 21210 00000A66 E84A00                  	call	IsXMSLoaded
 21211 00000A69 7545                    	jnz	short grabhma_error
 21212                                  
 21213 00000A6B B81043                  	mov	ax,4310h
 21214 00000A6E CD2F                    	int	2Fh		; get the vector into es:bx
 21215                                  		; - Multiplex - XMS - GET DRIVER ADDRESS
 21216                                  		; Return: ES:BX -> driver entry point
 21217                                  
 21218 00000A70 891E[0E00]              	mov	[xms],bx
 21219                                  	;mov	[0Eh], bx
 21220 00000A74 8C06[1000]              	mov	[xms+2],es
 21221                                  	;mov	[10h],es
 21222                                  
 21223 00000A78 B401                    	mov	ah,1		; request HMA
 21224 00000A7A BAFFFF                  	mov	dx,0FFFFh
