 21338                                  
 21339                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21340                                  ;
 21341                                  ; following piece of code will be moved into a para boundary. And the para
 21342                                  ; address posted in seg of int 19h vector. Offset of int 19h will point to
 21343                                  ; VDint19. This is to protect HMA from apps which use VDISK header method
 21344                                  ; to determine free extended memory.
 21345                                  ;
 21346                                  ; For more details read "power programming" column by Ray Duncan in the
 21347                                  ; May 30 1989 issue of PC Magazine (pp 377-388) [USING EXTENDED MEMORY,PART 1]
 21348                                  ;
 21349                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21350                                  
 21351                                  StartVDHead:
 21352                                  ;-------------- what follows is a dummy device driver header (not used by DOS)
 21353                                  
 21354 00000AD8 00000000                	dd	0		; link to next device driver
 21355 00000ADC 0080                    	dw	8000h		; device attribute
 21356 00000ADE 0000                    	dw	0		; strategy routine offset
 21357 00000AE0 0000                    	dw	0		; interrupt routine offset
 21358 00000AE2 01                      	db	1		; number of units
 21359                                  	;db	7 dup(0) 
 21360 00000AE3 00<rep 7h>              	times	7 db 0 		; reserved area
 21361                                  VDiskSig1:
 21362 00000AEA 564449534B              	db	'VDISK'
 21363                                  
 21364                                  VLEN1	equ	($-VDiskSig1)
 21365                                  
 21366 00000AEF 202056332E33            	db	'  V3.3'	; vdisk label
 21367                                  	;db	15 dup (0)	; pad
 21368 00000AF5 00<rep Fh>              	times	15 db 0
 21369 00000B04 0000                    	dw	0		; bits 0-15 of free HMA
 21370 00000B06 11                      	db	11h		; bits 16-23 of free HMA (1M + 64K)
 21371                                  VDInt19:
 21372 00000B07 EA                      	db	0EAh		; jmp to old vector
 21373                                  OldVDInt19:
 21374 00000B08 00000000                	dd	0		; Saved int 19 vector
 21375                                  
 21376                                  EndVDHead: ; label byte
 21377                                  
 21378                                  VDiskHMAHead:	
 21379 00000B0C 000000                  	db	0,0,0		; non-bootable disk
 21380                                  VDiskSig2:
 21381 00000B0F 564449534B              	db	'VDISK'
 21382                                  
 21383                                  VLEN2	equ	($-VDiskSig2)
 21384                                  
 21385 00000B14 332E33                  	db	'3.3'		; OEM - signature
 21386 00000B17 8000                    	dw	128		; number of bytes/sector
 21387 00000B19 01                      	db	1		; sectors/cluster
 21388 00000B1A 0100                    	dw	1		; reserved sectors
 21389 00000B1C 01                      	db	1		; number of FAT copies
 21390 00000B1D 4000                    	dw	64		; number of root dir entries
 21391 00000B1F 0002                    	dw	512		; number of sectors
 21392 00000B21 FE                      	db	0FEh		; media descriptor
 21393 00000B22 0600                    	dw	6		; number of sectors/FAT
 21394 00000B24 0800                    	dw	8		; sectors per track
 21395 00000B26 0100                    	dw	1		; number of heads
 21396 00000B28 0000                    	dw	0		; number of hidden sectors
 21397 00000B2A 4004                    	dw	440h		; Start of free HMA in K (1M+64K)
 21398                                  
 21399                                  EndVDiskHMAHead: ; label byte
 21400                                  
 21401                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21402                                  ;
 21403                                  ; procedure : InstVDiskHeader
 21404                                  ;
 21405                                  ;             Installs the VDISK header to reserve the 64k of HMA
 21406                                  ;	      It puts a 32 byte header at 10000:0 and
 21407                                  ;	      another header at (seg of int19):0
 21408                                  ;
 21409                                  ; Inputs : None
 21410                                  ;
 21411                                  ; Outputs : None
 21412                                  ;
 21413                                  ; USES : DS,SI,AX,CX,DX
 21414                                  ;
 21415                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21416                                  
 21417                                  	; 23/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 21418                                  
 21419                                  InstVDiskHeader:
 21420 00000B2C 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 21421 00000B2E 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax			; seg of int vect table
 21422                                  
 21423                                  ;-------------- save old int 19 vector
 21424                                  
 21425                                  	; 23/10/2022
 21426 00000B30 A16400                  	mov	ax,[19h*4]
 21427                                  	;mov	[OldVDInt19],ax
 21428 00000B33 2EA3[080B]              	mov	[cs:OldVDInt19],ax
 21429 00000B37 A16600                  	mov	ax,[19h*4+2]
 21430                                  	;mov	[OldVDInt19+2],ax
 21431 00000B3A 2EA3[0A0B]              	mov	[cs:OldVDInt19+2],ax
 21432                                  
 21433                                  ;-------------- calculate seg of new int 19 handler
 21434                                  
 21435 00000B3E B448                    	mov	ah,48h			; allocate memory
 21436                                  	;mov	bx,(EndVDHead-StartVDHead+15)>>4
 21437                                  	; 23/10/2022
 21438 00000B40 BB0400                  	mov	bx,4
 21439 00000B43 CD21                    	int	21h
 21440                                  
 21441                                  ;	if carry, fatal hanging error!!!!!
 21442                                  
 21443 00000B45 48                      	dec	ax			; point to arena
 21444 00000B46 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 21445                                  	;mov	word [es:ARENA.OWNER],8	; owner = System
 21446 00000B48 26C70601000800          	mov	word [es:1],8
 21447                                  	;mov	word [es:ARENA.NAME],'SC' ; System Code
 21448 00000B4F 26C70608005343          	mov	word [es:8],'SC'
 21449 00000B56 40                      	inc	ax
 21450 00000B57 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax			; get back to allocated memory
 21451                                  
 21452                                  ;-------------- install new int 19 vector
 21453                                  
 21454 00000B59 FA                      	cli				; no reboots at this time
 21455                                  	;mov	word [19h*4],(VDInt19-StartVDHead)
 21456 00000B5A C70664002F00            	mov	word [19h*4],47
 21457 00000B60 A36600                  	mov	[19h*4+2],ax
 21458                                  
 21459                                  ;-------------- move the code into proper place
 21460                                  
 21461                                  	;mov	cx,(EndVDHead-StartVDHead)
 21462 00000B63 B93400                  	mov	cx,52
 21463 00000B66 BE[D80A]                	mov	si,StartVDHead
 21464 00000B69 31FF                    	xor	di,di
 21465 00000B6B 0E                      	push	cs
 21466 00000B6C 1F                      	pop	ds
 21467 00000B6D FC                      	cld
 21468 00000B6E F3A4                    	rep	movsb
 21469 00000B70 FB                      	sti				; BUGBUG is sti OK now?
 21470                                  
 21471                                  ;-------------- mov the HMA VDisk head into HMA
 21472                                  
 21473                                  	; 23/10/2022
 21474 00000B71 57                      	push	di
 21475 00000B72 06                      	push	es
 21476                                  
 21477                                  	;mov	ax,0FFFFh
 21478                                  	;mov	es,ax
 21479                                  	; 03/09/2023
 21480 00000B73 49                      	dec	cx
 21481                                  	; cx = 0FFFFh
 21482 00000B74 8EC1                    	mov	es,cx
 21483                                  
 21484 00000B76 BF1000                  	mov	di,10h
 21485                                  	;mov	cx,(EndVDiskHMAHead-VDiskHMAHead)
 21486 00000B79 B92000                  	mov	cx,32
 21487 00000B7C BE[0C0B]                	mov	si,VDiskHMAHead
 21488 00000B7F F3A4                    	rep	movsb			; ds already set to cs
 21489                                  
 21490 00000B81 5F                      	pop	di
 21491 00000B82 07                      	pop	es
 21492                                  
 21493 00000B83 C3                      	retn
 21494                                  
 21495                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21496                                  ; procedure : ClrVDISKHeader
 21497                                  ;
 21498                                  ;		Clears the first 32 bytes at 1MB boundary
 21499                                  ;		So that DOS/HIMEM is not confused about the VDISK header
 21500                                  ;		left by previous DOS=HIGH session
 21501                                  ;
 21502                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21503                                  
 21504                                  struc desc
 21505 00000000 ????                     .seg_lim:	resw	1		; seg limit 64K 
 21506 00000002 ????                     .lo_word:	resw	1		; 24 bit seg physical 
 21507 00000004 ??                       .hi_byte:	resb 	1		; address
 21508 00000005 ??                       .acc_rights:	resb	1		; access rights ( CPL0 - R/W )
 21509 00000006 ????                     .reserved:	resw	1		;
 21510                                   .size:
 21511                                  endstruc
 21512                                  
 21513                                  		; 23/10/2022
 21514                                  bmove:		;label byte
 21515                                  
 21516                                  dummy:		;times desc.size db 0	; desc	<>
 21517 00000B84 00<rep 8h>              		times 8 db 0		 
 21518                                  gdt:		;times desc.size db 0	; desc	<>
 21519 00000B8C 00<rep 8h>              		times 8 db 0
 21520 00000B94 FFFF                    src_desc:	dw	0FFFFh		; desc	<0ffffh,0,0,93h,0>
 21521 00000B96 0000                    		dw	0
 21522 00000B98 00                      		db	0
 21523 00000B99 93                      		db	93h
 21524 00000B9A 0000                    		dw	0
 21525 00000B9C FFFF                    tgt_desc:	dw	0FFFFh		; desc	<0ffffh,0,10h,93h,0>  ; 1MB
 21526 00000B9E 0000                    		dw	0
 21527 00000BA0 10                      		db	10h
 21528 00000BA1 93                      		db	93h
 21529 00000BA2 0000                    		dw	0
 21530                                  
 21531                                  rombios_code:	;times desc.size db 0	; desc	<>
 21532 00000BA4 00<rep 8h>              		times 8 db 0
 21533                                  temp_stack:	;times desc.size db 0	; desc	<>
 21534 00000BAC 00<rep 8h>              		times 8 db 0
 21535                                  
 21536 00000BB4 00<rep 20h>             ClrdVDISKHead:	times 32 db 0		; db 32 dup (0)
 21537                                  
 21538                                  
 21539                                  ; 25/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, MSDOS 6.0 SYSINIT1.ASM)
 21540                                  
 21541                                  ; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 21542                                  ; (SYSINIT:0CA6h)
 21543                                  
 21544                                  ClrVDISKHeader:	; proc	near
 21545                                  
 21546                                  ;; 04/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimized)
 21547                                  ;;-----------------------------------------------------------	      ;I070
 21548                                  ;; The following workaround get around a problem with the	      ;I070
 21549                                  ;; Tortugas and PS/2 30-286 BIOS when password server mode	      ;I070
 21550                                  ;; is set. On those machines the INT 15h block move code	      ;I070
 21551                                  ;; goes through the 8042 to twiddle A20 instead of port 92h.	      ;I070
 21552                                  ;; In password server mode the 8042 is disabled so the block	      ;I070
 21553                                  ;; move crashes the system. We can do this because these	      ;I070
 21554                                  ;; systems clear all of memory on a cold boot.			      ;I070
 21555                                  ;								      ;I070
 21556                                  ;               in      al,64h         ; Test for password servr mode ;I070
 21557                                  ;               test    al,10h         ; Is keyboard inhibited?	      ;I070
 21558                                  ;               jnz     short ClrVDISKok ; No, go do block move.      ;I070
 21559                                  ;                                      ; Check for Tortugas...	      ;I070
 21560                                  ;               cmp     word [cs:sys_model_byte],19F8h                ;I070
 21561                                  ;               je      short ClrVDISKno                              ;I070
 21562                                  ;                                      ; Check for mod 30-286	      ;I070
 21563                                  ;               cmp     word [cs:sys_model_byte],09FCh                ;I070
 21564                                  ;               jne     short ClrVDISKok			      ;I070
 21565                                  ;ClrVDISKno: 	retn	               ; Return w/o block move.	      ;I070
 21566                                  ;								      ;I070
 21567                                  ;ClrVDISKok:							      ;I070
 21568                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------	      ;I070
 21569                                  
 21570                                  	; 12/12/2022
 21571                                  	; ds = cs
 21572                                  
 21573                                  	; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2
 21574                                  	; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS SYSINIT:0CBFh)
 21575                                  
 21576 00000BD4 06                      	push	es
 21577 00000BD5 8CC8                    	mov	ax,cs
 21578 00000BD7 89C2                    	mov	dx,ax
 21579 00000BD9 B10C                    	mov	cl,12
 21580 00000BDB D3EA                    	shr	dx,cl
 21581 00000BDD B104                    	mov	cl,4
 21582 00000BDF D3E0                    	shl	ax,cl
 21583 00000BE1 05[B40B]                	add	ax,ClrdVDISKHead
 21584 00000BE4 80D200                  	adc	dl,0
 21585                                  
 21586                                  	;; 23/10/2022
 21587                                  	;;mov	[cs:src_desc+desc.lo_word],ax
 21588                                  	;mov	[cs:src_desc+2],ax
 21589                                  	;;mov	[cs:src_desc+desc.hi_byte],dl
 21590                                  	;mov	[cs:src_desc+4],dl
 21591                                  	; 12/12/2022
 21592                                  	;mov	[src_desc+desc.lo_word],ax
 21593 00000BE7 A3[960B]                	mov	[src_desc+2],ax
 21594                                  	;mov	[src_desc+desc.hi_byte],dl
 21595 00000BEA 8816[980B]              	mov	[src_desc+4],dl
 21596                                  
 21597 00000BEE B91000                  	mov	cx,16	; 16 words
 21598 00000BF1 0E                      	push	cs
 21599 00000BF2 07                      	pop	es
 21600 00000BF3 BE[840B]                	mov	si,bmove
 21601 00000BF6 B487                    	mov	ah,87h
 21602 00000BF8 CD15                    	int	15h	; EXTENDED MEMORY - BLOCK MOVE (AT,XT286,PS)
 21603                                  			; CX = number of words to move 
 21604                                  			; ES:SI -> global descriptor table
 21605                                  			; Return: CF set on error, AH = status
 21606 00000BFA 07                      	pop	es
 21607 00000BFB C3                      	retn

 21611                                  ; procedure : SaveFreeHMAPtr
 21612                                  ;
 21613                                  ;		Save the Free HMA pointer in BIOS variable for later use.
 21614                                  ;		(INT 2f ax==4a01 call returns pointer to free HMA)
 21615                                  ;		Normalizes the pointer to ffff:xxxx format and stores only
 21616                                  ;		the offset.
 21617                                  ;

 21620                                  ;

 21622

 21624                                  	; 03/09/2023

 21627 00000C00 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 21628                                  	;
 21629 00000C02 8CC3                    	mov	bx,es
 21630 00000C04 B8FFFF                  	mov	ax,0FFFFh	   ; HMA segment
 21631                                  	; 03/09/2023
 21632 00000C07 A2[0D00]                	mov	[inHMA],al ; 0FFh
 21633                                  	;
 21634 00000C0A 29D8                    	sub	ax,bx
 21635 00000C0C 83C70F                  	add	di,15		   ; para round
 21636 00000C0F 83E7F0                  	and	di,0FFF0h
 21637 00000C12 B104                    	mov	cl,4
 21638 00000C14 D3E0                    	shl	ax,cl
 21639 00000C16 29C7                    	sub	di,ax
 21640                                  	;
 21641                                  	; 03/09/2023
 21642                                  	;push	ds
 21643                                  	;;mov	ax,Bios_Data ; 0070h
 21644                                  	;mov	ax,KERNEL_SEGMENT ; 0070h
 21645                                  	; 21/10/2022
 21646                                  	; 03/09/2023
 21647                                  	;mov	ax,DOSBIODATASEG ; 0070h
 21648                                  	;mov	ds,ax
 21649 00000C18 893E[FE07]              	mov	[FreeHMAPtr],di	   ; (ds:8F7h for MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 21650                                  	;mov	byte [inHMA],0FFh  ; (ds:0Dh)
 21651 00000C1C 1F                      	pop	ds
 21652 00000C1D C3                      	retn

 21657                                  ;
 21658                                  ;		Checks for the presence of VDISK header at 1MB boundary
 21659                                  ;		& INT 19 vector

 21693                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21694                                  ;
 21695                                  ; procedure : CPMHack
 21696                                  ;
 21697                                  ;		Copies the code from 0:c0 into ffff:0d0h
 21698                                  ;		for CPM compatibility
 21699                                  ;
 21700                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21701                                  
 21702                                  	; 11/12/2022
 21703                                  CPMHack:
 21704 00000C45 1E                      	push	ds
 21705 00000C46 B9FFFF                  	mov	cx,0FFFFh
 21706 00000C49 8EC1                    	mov	es,cx		; ES = FFFF
 21707                                  	;xor	cx,cx
 21708                                  	; 11/12/2022
 21709 00000C4B 41                      	inc	cx  ; cx = 0
 21710 00000C4C 8ED9                    	mov	ds,cx		; DS = 0
 21711 00000C4E BEC000                  	mov	si,0C0h
 21712 00000C51 BFD000                  	mov	di,0D0h
 21713                                  	;mov	cx,5
 21714 00000C54 B105                    	mov	cl,5

 22620                                  ;global rearm command for shared interrupt devices attached in the system;
 22621                                  ;shared interrupt attachment has some problem when it issues interrupt
 22622                                  ;during a warm reboot. once the interrupt is presented by the attachment,
 22623                                  ;no further interrupts on that level will be presented until a global rearm
 22624                                  ;is issued. by the request of the system architecture group, msbio will
 22625                                  ;issue a global rearm after every device driver is loaded.
 22626                                  ;to issue a global rearm:	;for pc1,xt,palace
 22627                                  ;
 22628                                  ;			  out 02f2h,xx  ; interrupt level 2
 22629                                  ;			  out 02f3h,xx  ; interrupt level 3
 22630                                  ;			  out 02f4h,xx  ; interrupt level 4
 22631                                  ;			  out 02f5h,xx  ; interrupt level 5
 22632                                  ;			  out 02f6h,xx  ; interrupt level 6
 22633                                  ;			  out 02f7h,xx  ; interrupt level 7
 22634                                  ;
 22635                                  ;	for pc at,in addition to the above commands,
 22636                                  ;	need to handle the secondary interrupt handler
 22637                                  ;
 22638                                  ;			  out 06f2h,xx  ; interrupt level 10
 22639                                  ;			  out 06f3h,xx  ; interrupt level 11
 22640                                  ;			  out 06f4h,xx  ; interrupt level 12
 22641                                  ;			  out 06f6h,xx  ; interrupt level 14
 22642                                  ;			  out 06f7h,xx  ; interrupt level 15
 22643                                  ;
 22644                                  ;	for round-up machine
 22645                                  ;
 22646                                  ;			  none.
 22647                                  
 22648                                  ; where xx stands for any value.
 22649                                  ;
 22650                                  ; for your information,after naples level machine,the system service bios
 22651                                  ; call (int 15h),function ah=0c0h returns the system configuration parameters
 22652                                  
 22653                                  	; 24/10/2022
 22654

 22859                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22860                                  ; Do_Install_Exec
 22861                                  ;
 22862                                  ; This procedure is used to EXEC a program being loaded via the 
 22863                                  ; "install=" mechanism in config.sys. It does this by setting up
 22864                                  ; the parameters, and then jumping to sysinit_base, which has been
 22865                                  ; setup in low memory. When complete, sysinit_base will jump back
 22866                                  ; up to this procedure (if sysinit remains uncorrupted by the installed
 22867                                  ; program).
 22868                                  
 22869                                  ;SYSINIT:10CFh:
 22870                                  
 22871                                  do_install_exec:			; now,handles install= command.
 22872                                  
 22873 000010D5 56                      	push	si			; save si for config.sys again.
 22874                                  
 22875                                  ; we are going to call load/exec function.
 22876                                  ; set es:bx to the parameter block here;;;;;;;
 22877                                  ; set ds:dx to the asciiz string. remember that we already has 0
 22878                                  ; after the filename. so parameter starts after that. if next
 22879                                  ; character is a line feed (i.e. 10),then assume that the 0
 22880                                  ; we already encountered used to be a carrage return. in this
 22881                                  ; case,let's set the length to 0 which will be followed by
 22882                                  ; carridge return.
 22883                                  
 22884                                  ; es:si -> command line in config.sys. points to the first non blank
 22885                                  ;character after =.
 22886

 22889 000010D8 07                      	pop	es

 22891 000010DA 89F2                    	mov	dx,si			; ds:dx->file name,0 in config.sys image.
 22892

 22894 000010DE FC                      	cld

 23030                                  ;**	ParaRound - Round Up length to paragraph multiple
 23031                                  ;
 23032                                  ;	ParaRound rounds a byte count up to a multiple of 16, then divides
 23033                                  ;	by 16 yielding a "length in paragraphs" value.
 23034                                  ;
 23035                                  ;	ENTRY	(ax) = byte length
 23036                                  ;	EXIT	(ax) = rounded up length in paragraphs
 23037                                  ;	USES	ax, flags
 23038                                  
 23039                                  ParaRound:
 23040 00001153 83C00F                  	add	ax,15
 23041 00001156 D1D8                    	rcr	ax,1
 23042 00001158 D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 23043 0000115A D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 23044 0000115C D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 23045 0000115E C3                      	retn
 23046                                  
 23047                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 23048                                  ; sysinit_base module.
 23049                                  ;
 23050                                  ; This module is relocated by the routine EndFile to a location in low
 23051                                  ; memory. It is then called by SYSINIT to perform the EXEC of programs
 23052                                  ; that are being loaded by the "install=" command. After the EXEC call
 23053                                  ; completes, this module performs a checksum on the SYSINIT code (at the
 23054                                  ; top of memory) to be sure that the EXECed program did not damage it.
 23055                                  ; If it did, then this module will print an error message and stop the
 23056                                  ; system. Otherwise, it returns control to SYSINIT.
 23057                                  ;
 23058                                  ;in: after relocation,
 23059                                  ;    ax = 4b00h - load and execute the program dos function.
 23060                                  ;    ds = confbot. segment of config.sys file image
 23061                                  ;    es = sysinitseg. segment of sysinit module itself.
 23062                                  ;    ds:dx = pointer to asciiz string of the path,filename to be executed.
 23063                                  ;    es:bx = pointer to a parameter block for load.
 23064                                  ;    SI_end (byte) - offset vaule of end of sysinit module label
 23065                                  ;    bigsize (word) - # of word from confbot to SI_end.
 23066                                  ;    chksum (word) - sum of every byte from confbot to SI_end in a
 23067                                  ;			word boundary moduler form.
 23068                                  ;    sysinit_ptr (dword ptr) - return address to sysinit module.
 23069                                  ;
 23070                                  ;note: sysinit should save necessary registers and when the control is back
 23071                                  
 23072                                  	; 24/10/2022
 23073                                  	; (SYSINIT:115Ch for MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 23074                                  sysinit_base:				
 23075 0000115F 2E8C166200              	mov	[cs:sysinit_base_ss],ss	; save stack
 23076 00001164 2E89266400              	mov	[cs:sysinit_base_sp],sp	
 23077 00001169 CD21                    	int	21h			; load/exec dos call.
 23078 0000116B 2E8E166200              	mov	ss,[cs:sysinit_base_ss]	; restore stack
 23079 00001170 2E8B266400              	mov	sp,[cs:sysinit_base_sp]
 23080 00001175 1F                      	pop	ds			; restore confbot seg
 23081 00001176 07                      	pop	es			; restore sysinitseg
 23082 00001177 7216                    	jc	short sysinit_base_end	; load/exec function failed.
 23083                                  					; at this time,i don't have to worry about
 23084                                  					; that sysinit module has been broken or not.
 23085 00001179 E81800                  	call	sum_up			; otherwise,check if it is good.
 23086 0000117C 263906[DA02]            	cmp	[es:checksum],ax
 23087 00001181 740C                    	je	short sysinit_base_end
 23088                                  
 23089                                  ;	memory broken. show "memory allocation error" message and stall.
 23090                                  
 23091 00001183 B409                    	mov	ah,9
 23092 00001185 0E                      	push	cs
 23093 00001186 1F                      	pop	ds
 23094                                  	; 30/12/2022
 23095                                  	; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:12B8h)
 23096                                  	;mov	dx, 102
 23097 00001187 BA6600                  	mov	dx,mem_alloc_err_msgx-sysinit_base ; 65h (for MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 23098                                  					; 66h (for MSDOS 6.21 SYSINIT)
 23099 0000118A CD21                    	int	21h
 23100                                  		; DOS - PRINT STRING
 23101                                  		; DS:DX -> string terminated by "$"
 23102                                  
 23103                                  	; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2
 23104                                  stall:
 23105                                  	; 24/10/2022
 23106                                  _stall: 
 23107                                  	; 11/12/2022
 23108 0000118C F4                      	hlt 
 23109                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 23110                                  	;hlt				;use HLT to minimize energy consumption
 23111 0000118D EBFD                            jmp	short _stall
 23112                                  
 23113                                  sysinit_base_end: 
 23114 0000118F 26FF2E[D602]            	jmp	far [es:sysinit_ptr]	;return back to sysinit module
 23115                                  
 23116                                  ;-------------------------------------
 23117                                  
 23118                                  sum_up:
 23119                                  
 23120                                  ;in:   es - sysinitseg.
 23121                                  ;out:  ax - result
 23122                                  ;
 23123                                  ;remark: since this routine will only check starting from "locstack" to the end of
 23124                                  ;	 sysinit segment,the data area, and the current stack area are not
 23125                                  ;	 coverd. in this sense,this check sum routine only gives a minimal
 23126                                  ;	 gaurantee to be safe.
 23127                                  ;
 23128                                  ;first sum up confbot seg.
 23129                                  
 23130 00001194 1E                      	push	ds
 23131                                  	; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 23132                                  	; (SYSINIT:12C6h)
 23133 00001195 26A1[A302]              	mov	ax,[es:CONFBOT]
 23134                                  	; 24/10/2022
 23135                                  	;mov	ax,[es:top_of_cdss]
 23136 00001199 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 23137 0000119B 31F6                    	xor	si,si
 23138 0000119D 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 23139 0000119F 268B0E[D002]            	mov	cx,[es:config_size]	; if config_size has been broken,then this
 23140                                  					; whole test better fail.
 23141 000011A4 D1E9                    	shr	cx,1			; make it a word count
 23142 000011A6 7406                    	jz	short sum_sys_code	; when config.sys file not exist.
 23143                                  sum1:
 23144 000011A8 0304                    	add	ax,[si]
 23145 000011AA 46                      	inc	si
 23146 000011AB 46                      	inc	si
 23147 000011AC E2FA                    	loop	sum1
 23148                                  ;now,sum up sysinit module.
 23149                                  sum_sys_code:
 23150                                  	; 24/10/2022
 23151 000011AE BEAE11                  	mov	si,locstack ; 5A6h (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 23152                                  			    ; 532h (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 23153                                  				        ; starting after the stack.  M069
 23154                                  					;  this does not cover the possible stack code!!!
 23155                                  	;;mov	cx,22688  ; for MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS
 23156                                  	; 02/11/2022
 23157                                  	;mov	cx,3D20h  ; (15648) for MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS (SYSINIT)	
 23158                                  	; 30/12/2022  
 23159 000011B1 B9[804D]                	mov	cx,SI_end ; (22688) 	; SI_end is the label at the end of sysinit
 23160 000011B4 29F1                    	sub	cx,si			;  from after_checksum to SI_end
 23161 000011B6 D1E9                    	shr	cx,1
 23162                                  sum2:
 23163 000011B8 260304                  	add	ax,[es:si]
 23164 000011BB 46                      	inc	si
 23165 000011BC 46                      	inc	si
 23166 000011BD E2F9                    	loop	sum2
 23167 000011BF 1F                      	pop	ds
 23168 000011C0 C3                      	retn
 23169                                  
 23170                                  ; 24/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 23171                                  ; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS 4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 23172                                  ; (SYSINIT:12F2h)
 23173                                  
 23174                                  sysinit_base_ss equ $-sysinit_base  ; = 61 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:115Ch)
 23175                                  ;SYSINIT:11BDh:			    ; = 62 (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:1290h) 	
 23176 000011C1 0000                    	dw	0
 23177                                  sysinit_base_sp equ $-sysinit_base  ; = 63 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:1161h)
 23178                                  ;SYSINIT:11BFh:			    ; = 64 (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:1292h)
 23179 000011C3 0000                    	dw	0	
 23180                                  
 23181                                  mem_alloc_err_msgx:
 23182                                  
 23183                                         ;include msbio.cl4		; memory allocation error message
 23184                                  
 23185                                  ;SYSINIT:12F6:  ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS SYSINIT:12F6h

 23187 000011C7 4D656D6F727920616C-     	db 	'Memory allocation error $'
 23187 000011D0 6C6F636174696F6E20-

 23193                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 23194                                  ; Set_Buffer
 23195                                  ;
 23196                                  ;function: set buffers in the real memory.				  
 23197                                  ;	   lastly set the memhi,memlo for the next available free address.
 23198                                  ;
 23199                                  ;input:    ds:bx -> buffinfo.
 23200                                  ;	   [memhi]:[memlo = 0] = available space for the hash bucket.	  
 23201                                  ;	   singlebuffersize = buffer header size + sector size		  
 23202                                  ;
 23203                                  ;output:   buffers Queue established.	       				   
 23204                                  ;	   [memhi]:[memlo] = address of the next available free space.	   
 23205                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------

 23210                                  set_buffer:
 23211 000011E0 30D2                    	xor	dl,dl				; assume buffers not in HMA
 23212 000011E2 E85500                  	call	GetBufferAddr
 23213 000011E5 7402                    	jz	short set_buff_1
 23214 000011E7 B201                    	mov	dl,1				; buffers in HMA
 23215                                  set_buff_1:
 23216                                  	; 25/10/2022
 23217                                  	;mov	[bx+BUFFINF.Buff_Queue],di	; head of Buff Q
 23218 000011E9 893F                    	mov	[bx],di
 23219                                  	;mov	[bx+BUFFINF.Buff_Queue+2],es
 23220 000011EB 8C4702                  	mov	[bx+2],es
 23221                                  	;mov	word [bx+BUFFINF.Dirty_Buff_Count],0 ;set dirty_count to 0.
 23222 000011EE C747040000              	mov	word [bx+4],0
 23223                                  
 23224 000011F3 89F8                    	mov	ax,di
 23225 000011F5 2E8B0E[9902]            	mov	cx,[cs:buffers]
 23226 000011FA 57                      	push	di				; remember first buffer
 23227                                  
 23228                                  ;	for each buffer
 23229                                  
 23230                                  nxt_buff:
 23231 000011FB E86100                  	call	set_buffer_info 		; set buf_link,buf_id...
 23232 000011FE 89C7                    	mov	di,ax
 23233 00001200 E2F9                    	loop	nxt_buff
 23234                                  
 23235 00001202 2E2B3E[9D02]            	sub	di,[cs:singlebuffersize]	; point to last buffer
 23236                                  
 23237 00001207 59                      	pop	cx				; get first buffer
 23238                                  	;mov	[es:di+buffinfo.buf_next],cx	; last->next = first
 23239 00001208 26890D                  	mov	[es:di],cx
 23240 0000120B 87CF                    	xchg	cx,di
 23241                                  	;mov	[es:di+buffinfo.buf_prev],cx	; first->prev = last
 23242                                  	; 25/10/2022
 23243 0000120D 26894D02                	mov	[es:di+2],cx
 23244                                  
 23245 00001211 08D2                    	or	dl,dl				; In HMa ?
 23246 00001213 7417                    	jz	short set_buff_2		; no
 23247                                  	;mov	byte [bx+BUFFINF.Buff_In_HMA],1
 23248 00001215 C6470C01                	mov	byte [bx+12],1
 23249 00001219 2EA1[6403]              	mov	ax,[cs:memhi]			; seg of scratch buff
 23250                                  	;mov	word [bx+BUFFINF.Lo_Mem_Buff],0	; offset of sctarch buff is 0
 23251 0000121D C7470D0000              	mov	word [bx+13],0
 23252                                  	;mov	[bx+BUFFINF.Lo_Mem_Buff+2],ax
 23253 00001222 89470F                  	mov	word [bx+15],ax
 23254 00001225 2EA1[9D02]              	mov	ax,[cs:singlebuffersize]	; size of scratch buff
 23255                                  	;; 05/09/2023
 23256                                  	;;sub	ax,24 ; bufinsiz		; (bufinsiz is 24 in PCDOS 7.1)
 23257 00001229 83E814                  	sub	ax,20
 23258                                  set_buff_2:
 23259 0000122C 2E0106[6203]            	add	[cs:memlo],ax
 23260                                  	;or	byte [cs:setdevmarkflag],for_devmark ; 2
 23261 00001231 2E800E[C514]02          	or	byte [cs:setdevmarkflag],2
 23262                                  	;call	round
 23263                                  	;retn
 23264                                  	; 12/12/2022
 23265 00001237 E94630                  	jmp	round

 23267                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 23268                                  ; procedure : GetBufferAddr
 23269                                  ;
 23270                                  ;	      Gets the buffer address either in HMA or in Lo Mem
 23271                                  ;
 23272                                  ; returns in es:di the buffer adress
 23273                                  ; returns NZ if allocated in HMA
 23274                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 23275                                  
 23276                                  	; 25/10/2022 
 23277                                  GetBufferAddr:
 23278 0000123A 53                      	push	bx
 23279 0000123B 52                      	push	dx
 23280 0000123C 2EA1[9D02]              	mov	ax, [cs:singlebuffersize]
 23281 00001240 2EF726[9902]            	mul	word [cs:buffers]
 23282                                  	;add	ax,0Fh
 23283 00001245 83C00F                  	add	ax,15 
 23284                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 23285                                  	;and	ax,~15	; 0FFF0h	; para round
 23286                                  	; 12/12/2022
 23287 00001248 24F0                    	and	al,~15	; 0F0h
 23288 0000124A 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax
 23289 0000124C B8024A                  	mov	ax,4A02h
 23290                                  	;mov	ax,((multMULT<<8)+multMULTALLOCHMA)
 23291 0000124F CD2F                    	int	2Fh
 23292 00001251 83FFFF                  	cmp	di,0FFFFh
 23293 00001254 7506                    	jne	short got_hma
 23294                                  	
 23295                                  	;mov	di,0			; dont xor di,di Z flag needed
 23296                                  	; 05/09/2023
 23297                                  	; zf=1
 23298 00001256 47                      	inc	di ; 0FFFFh -> 0
 23299                                  	; zf=1
 23300                                  	
 23301                                  	;zf=1
 23302                                  	;xor	di,di	; 25/10/2022
 23303                                  	;zf=1
 23304 00001257 2E8E06[6403]            	mov	es,[cs:memhi]
 23305                                  got_hma:
 23306 0000125C 5A                      	pop	dx
 23307 0000125D 5B                      	pop	bx
 23308 0000125E C3                      	retn

 23331 00001274 26C74504FF00            	mov	word [es:di+4],00FFh
 23332                                  	;mov	word [es:di+buffinfo.buf_sector],0   ; to compensate the masm 3 bug
 23333 0000127A 26C745060000            	mov	word [es:di+6],0

 23335 00001280 26C745080000            	mov	word [es:di+8],0
 23336 00001286 C3                      	retn

 23338                                  ; ======================================================================
 23339                                  ; MSSTACK initialization routine - MSDOS 6.0 - SYSDINIT1.ASM - 1991
 23340                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 23341                                  ; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 23342                                  
 23343                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 23344                                  ; ibmstack initialization routine.
 23345                                  ;
 23346                                  ;	to follow the standard interrupt sharing scheme, msstack.asm
 23347                                  ;	has been modified. this initialization routine also has to
 23348                                  ;	be modified because for the interrupt level 7 and 15, firstflag
 23349                                  ;	should be set to signal that this interrupt handler is the
 23350                                  ;	first handler hooked to this interrupt vector.
 23351                                  ;	we determine this by looking at the instruction pointed by
 23352                                  ;	this vector. if it is iret, then this handler should be the
 23353                                  ;	first one. in our case, only the interrupt vector 77h is the
 23354                                  ;	interrupt level 15. (we don't hook interrupt level 7.)
 23355                                  ;
 23356                                  ;	the followings are mainly due to m.r.t; ptm fix of p886 12/3/86
 23357                                  ;	some design changes are needed to the above interrupt sharing
 23358                                  ;	method. the above sharing scheme assumes that 1). interrupt
 23359                                  ;	sharing is never done on levels that have bios support. 2). "phantom"
 23360                                  ;	interrupts would only be generated on levels 7 and 15.
 23361                                  ;	these assumptions are not true any more. we have to use the firstflag
 23362                                  ;	for every level of interrupt. we will set the firstflag on the following
 23363                                  ;	conditions:
 23364                                  ;
 23365                                  ;	 a.	 if the cs portion of the vector is 0000, then "first"
 23366                                  ;	 b. else if cs:ip points to valid shared header, then not "first"
 23367                                  ;	 c. else if cs:ip points to an iret, then "first"
 23368                                  ;	 d. else if cs:ip points to dummy, then "first"
 23369                                  ;
 23370                                  ;	where dummy is - the cs portion must be f000, and the ip portion must
 23371                                  ;	be equal to the value at f000:ff01. this location is the initial value
 23372                                  ;	from vector_table for interrupt 7, one of the preserved addresses in all
 23373                                  ;	the bioses for all of the machines.
 23374                                  ;
 23375                                  ;	system design group requests bios to handle the phantom interrupts.
 23376                                  ;
 23377                                  ;	the "phantom" interrupt is an illegal interrupt such as an interrupt
 23378                                  ;	produced by the bogus adapter card even without interrupt request is
 23379                                  ;	set.  more specifically, 1). the 8259 has a feature when running in
 23380                                  ;	edge triggered mode to latch a pulse and present the interrupt when
 23381                                  ;	the processor indicates interrupt acknowledge (inta). the interrupt
 23382                                  ;	pulse was exist at the time of inta to get a "phantom" interrupt.
 23383                                  ;	2). or, this is caused by adapter cards placing a glitch on the
 23384                                  ;	interrupt line.
 23385                                  ;
 23386                                  ;	to handle those "phantom" interrupts, the main stack code will check
 23387                                  ;	the own firstflag, and if it is not "first" (which means the forward
 23388                                  ;	pointer points to the legal shared interrupt handler), then pass the
 23389                                  ;	control. if it is the first, then the following action should be
 23390                                  ;	taken. we don't have to implement skack logic in this case.
 23391                                  ;
 23392                                  ;	to implement this logic, we rather choose a simple method.
 23393                                  ;	if ont of the above "firstflag" conditions is met, we are not
 23394                                  ;	going to hook this interrupt vector. the reason is if the original
 23395                                  ;	vector points to "iret" and do nothing, we don't need
 23396                                  ;	to implement the stack logic for it. this will simplify implementation
 23397                                  ;	while maintaining compatibility with the old version of dos.
 23398                                  ;	this implies that in the main stack code, there might be a stack code
 23399                                  ;	that will never be used, a dead code.
 23400                                  ;
 23401                                  ;in - cs, ds -> sysinitseg, es -> relocated stack code & data.
 23402                                  
 23403                                  	; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 23404                                  	; (SYSINIT:1287h)
 23405                                  
 23406                                  	; 14/12/2022
 23407                                  stackinit:
 23408 00001287 50                      	push	ax
 23409 00001288 1E                      	push	ds
 23410 00001289 06                      	push	es
 23411 0000128A 53                      	push	bx
 23412 0000128B 51                      	push	cx
 23413 0000128C 52                      	push	dx
 23414 0000128D 57                      	push	di
 23415 0000128E 56                      	push	si
 23416 0000128F 55                      	push	bp
 23417                                  
 23418                                  ;currently es -> stack code area
 23419                                  
 23420                                  	; 12/12/2022
 23421                                  	; ds = cs
 23422 00001290 A1[8C02]                	mov	ax,[stack_count]
 23423 00001293 89C1                    	mov	cx,ax  ; *!*!*  
 23424                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 23425                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1290h)
 23426                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:stack_count] ; !!	;defined in cs
 23427 00001295 26A3[0200]              	mov	[es:stackcount],ax		;defined in stack code area
 23428                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1298h)
 23429 00001299 A1[8E02]                	mov	ax,[stack_size]	 ; !!		;in cs
 23430 0000129C 26A3[0600]              	mov	[es:stacksize],ax
 23431                                  	; 12/12/2022
 23432 000012A0 A1[9002]                	mov	ax,[stack_addr]			; offset
 23433                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 23434                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:129Fh)
 23435                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:stack_addr]  ; !!
 23436 000012A3 26A3[0800]              	mov	[es:stacks],ax
 23437                                  	; 12/12/2022
 23438 000012A7 89C5                    	mov	bp,ax ; *!*
 23439 000012A9 A1[9202]                	mov	ax,[stack_addr+2]
 23440                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 23441                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:129Fh)
 23442                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:stack_addr+2] ; !!	; segment
 23443 000012AC 26A3[0A00]              	mov	[es:stacks+2],ax
 23444                                  
 23445                                  ; initialize the data fields with the parameters
 23446                                  
 23447                                  ; "firstentry" will always be at stacks
 23448                                  
 23449                                  	;mov	bp,[es:stacks]			; get offset of stack
 23450                                  	; 12/12/2022
 23451                                  	; bp = [es:stacks] ; *!*
 23452 000012B0 26892E[0C00]            	mov	[es:firstentry],bp
 23453                                  
 23454                                  ; the stacks will always immediately follow the table entries
 23455                                  
 23456 000012B5 B80800                  	mov	ax,entrysize ; 8
 23457                                  	;mov	cx,[es:stackcount]
 23458                                  	; 12/12/2022
 23459                                  	; cx = [es:stackcount] ; *!*!*
 23460 000012B8 F7E1                    	mul	cx
 23461 000012BA 01E8                    	add	ax,bp
 23462 000012BC 26A3[0400]              	mov	[es:stackat],ax
 23463 000012C0 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax
 23464 000012C2 83EB02                  	sub	bx,2
 23465                                  
 23466                                  ; zero the entire stack area to start with
 23467                                  
 23468 000012C5 268B3E[0400]            	mov	di,[es:stackat]
 23469 000012CA 26A1[0600]              	mov	ax,[es:stacksize]
 23470 000012CE F7E1                    	mul	cx
 23471 000012D0 89C1                    	mov	cx,ax
 23472 000012D2 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 23473 000012D4 06                      	push	es
 23474 000012D5 1F                      	pop	ds				;ds = relocated stack code seg.
 23475                                  
 23476                                  ;now, ds -> stack code area
 23477

 24245                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 24246                                  ; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 24247                                  
 24248                                  ; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 24249                                  ; (SYSINIT:1610h)
 24250                                  
 24251                                  new_init_loop:
 24252                                  
 24253                                  ;input: si=ofset into vector table of the particular int vector being adjusted
 24254                                  ;	bx=ds:offset of oldxx, where will be saved the pointer to original owner
 24255                                  ;	dx=ds:offset of intxx, the new interrupt handler
 24256                                  ;	di=offset value of int19old&aa variable in bios.
 24257                                  ;	es=zero, segid of vector table
 24258                                  ;	ds=relocated stack code segment
 24259                                  
 24260 00001479 268B04                  	mov	ax,[es:si]		;remember offset in vector
 24261 0000147C 8907                    	mov	[bx],ax			; to original owner in ds
 24262 0000147E 268B4402                	mov	ax,[es:si+2]		;remember segid in vector
 24263 00001482 894702                  	mov	[bx+2],ax		; to original owner in ds
 24264                                  
 24265 00001485 1E                      	push	ds
 24266                                  	;;mov	ax,Bios_Data ; 70h
 24267                                  	;mov	ax,KERNEL_SEGMENT ; 70h
 24268                                  	; 21/10/2022
 24269 00001486 B87000                  	mov	ax,DOSBIODATASEG ; 0070h
 24270 00001489 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax			;set int19oldxx value in bios for
 24271 0000148B 268B04                  	mov	ax,[es:si]		;int 19 handler
 24272 0000148E 8905                    	mov	[di],ax
 24273 00001490 268B4402                	mov	ax,[es:si+2]
 24274 00001494 894502                  	mov	[di+2],ax
 24275 00001497 1F                      	pop	ds
 24276                                  
 24277 00001498 268914                  	mov	[es:si],dx  	;set vector to point to new int handler
 24278 0000149B 268C5C02                	mov	[es:si+2],ds
 24279 0000149F C3                      	retn
 24280                                  
 24281                                  ; End of STACK initialization routine
 24282                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 24283                                  
 24284                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 24285                                  ;set the devmark for mem command.
 24286                                  ;in: [memhi] - the address to place devmark
 24287                                  ;    [memlo] = 0
 24288                                  ;    al = id for devmark_id
 24289                                  ;out: devmark established.
 24290                                  ;     the address saved in cs:[devmark_addr]
 24291                                  ;     [memhi] increase by 1.
 24292                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 24293

 24305                                  	;push	cx
 24306                                  
 24307 000014A0 2E8B0E[6403]            	mov	cx,[cs:memhi]
 24308 000014A5 2E890E[C314]            	mov	[cs:devmark_addr],cx
 24309 000014AA 8EC1                    	mov	es,cx
 24310                                  	; 25/10/2022
 24311                                  	;mov	[es:devmark.id],al
 24312 000014AC 26A20000                	mov	[es:0],al
 24313 000014B0 41                      	inc	cx
 24314                                  	;mov	[es:devmark.seg],cx
 24315 000014B1 26890E0100              	mov	[es:1],cx
 24316                                  
 24317                                  	; 04/09/2023
 24318                                  	;pop	cx
 24319                                  	;pop	es
 24320                                  	
 24321 000014B6 2EFF06[6403]            	inc	word [cs:memhi]
 24322 000014BB C3                      	retn

 24561                                  ;-------------------------------- PARMSX block structure
 24562                                  struc _$P_PARMSX_Blk		;AN000;
 24563 00000000 ??                       .MinP: resb 1			;AN000; Minimum positional number
 24564 00000001 ??                       .MaxP:	resb 1			;AN000; Maximum positional number
 24565 00000002 ????                     .1st_Control: resw 1		;AN000; Address of the 1st CONTROL block
 24566                                  endstruc
 24567                                  
 24568                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24569                                  ; << Control field definition  >>
 24570                                  ;
 24571                                  ;
 24572                                  ;CONTROL   LABEL   BYTE
 24573                                  ;	   DW	   MATCH_FLAGS	   ; CONTROLS TYPE MATCHED
 24574                                  ;				   ; 8000H=NUMERIC VALUE, (VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 24575                                  ;				   ; 4000H=SIGNED NUMERIC VALUE (VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 24576                                  ;				   ; 2000H=SIMPLE STRING(VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 24577                                  ;				   ; 1000H=DATE STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 24578                                  ;				   ; 0800H=TIME STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 24579                                  ;				   ; 0400H=COMPLEX LIST (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 24580                                  ;				   ; 0200H=FILE SPEC (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 24581                                  ;				   ; 0100H=DRIVE ONLY (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 24582                                  ;				   ; 0080H=QUOTED STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 24583                                  ;				   ; 0010H=IGNORE ":" AT END IN MATCH
 24584                                  ;				   ; 0002H=REPEATS ALLOWED
 24585                                  ;				   ; 0001H=OPTIONAL
 24586                                  ;	   DW	   FUNCTION_FLAGS
 24587                                  ;				   ; 0001H=CAP RESULT BY FILE TABLE
 24588                                  ;				   ; 0002H=CAP RESULT BY CHAR TABLE
 24589                                  ;				   ; 0010H=REMOVE ":" AT END
 24590                                  ; (tm10)			   ; 0020H=colon is not necessary for switch
 24591                                  ;	   DW	   RESULT	   ; RESULT BUFFER
 24592                                  ;	   DW	   VALUES	   ; VALUE LISTS
 24593                                  ;	   DB	   nid		   ; NUMBER OF KEYWORD/SWITCH SYNONYMS IN FOLLOWING LIST
 24594                                  ;	   DB	   "...",0         ; IF n >0, KEYWORD 1
 24595                                  ;	   :
 24596                                  ;
 24597                                  ;Note:
 24598                                  ;    - The MATCH_FLAG is bit significant. You can set, for example, TIME bit and
 24599                                  ;      DATE bit simalteniously.
 24600                                  ;
 24601                                  ;      The parser examins each bit along with the following priority.
 24602                                  ;
 24603                                  ;      COMPLEX -> DATE -> TIME -> NUMERIC VAL -> SIGNED NUMERIC VAL -> DRIVE ->
 24604                                  ;      FILE SPEC -> SIMPLE STRING.
 24605                                  ;
 24606                                  ;    - When the FUNCTION_FLAG is 0001 or 0002, the STRING pointed to by a pointer
 24607                                  ;      in the result buffer is capitalized.
 24608                                  ;
 24609                                  ;    - Match_Flags 0001H and 0002H have meaning only for the positional.
 24610                                  ;
 24611                                  ;    - The "...",0 (bottom most line) does require '=' or '/'. When you need a
 24612                                  ;      switch, for example, '/A', then STRING points to;
 24613                                  ;
 24614                                  ;			DB    1 	; number of following synonyms
 24615                                  ;			DB   '/A',0
 24616                                  ;
 24617                                  ;      When you need a keyword, for example, 'CODEPAGE=', then "...",0 will be;
 24618                                  ;
 24619                                  ;			DB    1 	; number of following synonyms
 24620                                  ;			DB   'CODEPAGE=',0
 24621                                  ;
 24622                                  ;    - "..." must consist of upper case characters only because the parser
 24623                                  ;      performs pattern matching after converting input to upper case (by
 24624                                  ;      using the current country upper case table)
 24625                                  ;
 24626                                  ;    - One "..." can contain only one switch or keyword. If you need, for
 24627                                  ;      example /A and /B, the format will be;
 24628                                  ;
 24629                                  ;			DB    2 	; number of following synonyms
 24630                                  ;			DB    '/A',0
 24631                                  ;			DB    '/B',0
 24632                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24633                                  
 24634                                  ;**** Match_Flags
 24635                                  
 24636                                  _$P_Num_Val	   equ	8000h		;AN000; Numeric Value
 24637                                  _$P_SNum_Val	   equ	4000h		;AN000; Signed numeric value
 24638                                  _$P_Simple_S	   equ	2000h		;AN000; Simple string
 24639                                  _$P_Date_S	   equ	1000h		;AN000; Date string
 24640                                  _$P_Time_S	   equ	0800h		;AN000; Time string
 24641                                  _$P_Cmpx_S	   equ	0400h		;AN000; Complex string
 24642                                  _$P_File_Spc	   equ	0200h		;AN000; File Spec
 24643                                  _$P_Drv_Only	   equ	0100h		;AN000; Drive Only
 24644                                  _$P_Qu_String	   equ	0080h		;AN000; Quoted string
 24645                                  _$P_Ig_Colon	   equ	0010h		;AN000; Ignore colon at end in match
 24646                                  _$P_Repeat	   equ	0002h		;AN000; Repeat allowed
 24647                                  _$P_Optional	   equ	0001h		;AN000; Optional
 24648                                  
 24649                                  ;**** Function flags
 24650                                  
 24651                                  _$P_CAP_File	   equ	0001h		;AN000; CAP result by file table
 24652                                  _$P_CAP_Char	   equ	0002h		;AN000; CAP result by character table
 24653                                  _$P_Rm_Colon	   equ	0010h		;AN000; Remove ":" at the end
 24654                                  _$P_colon_is_not_necessary equ 0020h	;AN000;(tm10) /+10 and /+:10
 24655                                  
 24656                                  ;-------------------------------- Control block structure
 24657                                  struc _$P_Control_Blk
 24658 00000000 ????                     .Match_Flag:	 resw 1		;AN000; Controls type matched
 24659 00000002 ????                     .Function_Flag: resw 1		;AN000; Function should be taken
 24660 00000004 ????                     .Result_Buf:	 resw 1		; Result buffer address
 24661 00000006 ????                     .Value_List:	 resw 1		;AN000; Value list address
 24662 00000008 ??                       .nid:		 resb 1		;AN000; # of keyword/SW synonyms
 24663 00000009 ??                       .KEYorSW:	 resb 1		;AN000; keyword or sw
 24664                                  endstruc
 24665                                  
 24666                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24667                                  ; << Value List Definition >>
 24668                                  ;
 24669                                  ;VALUES 	LABEL	BYTE
 24670                                  ;		DB	nval			; NUMBER OF VALUE DEFINITIONS (0 - 3)
 24671                                  ;	     +-
 24672                                  ;	     |	DB	nrng			; NUMBER OF RANGES
 24673                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF RANGE MATCHED
 24674                                  ;	     | +DD	X,Y			; RANGE OF VALUES
 24675                                  ;	     |	:
 24676                                  ;	     |	DB	nnval			; NUMBER OF CHOICES
 24677                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF NUMBER CHOICE MATCHED
 24678                                  ;	     | +DD	VALUE			; SPECIFIC CHOICE IF NUMBER
 24679                                  ;	     |	:
 24680                                  ;	     |	DB	nstrval 		; NUMBER OF CHOICES
 24681                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF STRING CHOICE MATCHED
 24682                                  ;	     | +DW	STRING			; SPECIFIC CHOICE IF STING
 24683                                  ;	     +-	:
 24684                                  ;
 24685                                  ;STRING 	DB	"...",0                 ; ASCIIZ STRING IMAGE
 24686                                  ;
 24687                                  ;Note:
 24688                                  ;    - ITEM_TAG must not be 0FFH, which will be used in the result buffer
 24689                                  ;      when no choice lists are provided.
 24690                                  ;
 24691                                  ;    - STRING must consist of upper case characters only because the parser
 24692                                  ;      performs pattern matching after converting input to upper case (by
 24693                                  ;      using the current country upper case table)
 24694                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24695                                  
 24696                                  _$P_nval_None	   equ	0		;AN000; no value list ID
 24697                                  _$P_nval_Range	   equ	1		;AN000; range list ID
 24698                                  _$P_nval_Value	   equ	2		;AN000; value list ID
 24699                                  _$P_nval_String	   equ	3		;AN000; string list ID
 24700                                  _$P_Len_Range	   equ	9		;AN000; Length of a range choice(two DD plus one DB)
 24701                                  _$P_Len_Value	   equ	5		;AN000; Length of a value choice(one DD plus one DB)
 24702                                  _$P_Len_String	   equ	3		;AN000; Length of a string choice(one DW plus one DB)
 24703                                  _$P_No_nrng	   equ	0		;AN000; (tm07) no nrng. nnval must not be 0.
 24704                                  
 24705                                  struc _$P_Val_List
 24706 00000000 ??                       .NumofList: resb 1			;AN000; number of following choice
 24707 00000001 ????                     .Val_XL:    resw 1			;AN000; lower word of value
 24708 00000003 ????                     .Val_XH:    resw 1			;AN000; higher word of value
 24709 00000005 ????                     .Val_YL:    resw 1			;AN000; lower word of another value
 24710 00000007 ????                     .Val_YH:    resw 1			;AN000; higher word of another value
 24711                                  endstruc
 24712                                  
 24713                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24714                                  ; << Result Buffer Definition  >>
 24715                                  ;
 24716                                  ;RESULT 	LABEL	BYTE			; BELOW FILLED IN FOR DEFAULTS
 24717                                  ;		DB	type			; TYPE RETURNED: 0=RESERVED,
 24718                                  ;						;	1=NUMBER, 2=LIST INDEX,
 24719                                  ;						;	3=STRING, 4=COMPLEX,
 24720                                  ;						;	5=FILESPEC, 6=DRIVE
 24721                                  ;						;	7=DATE, 8=TIME
 24722                                  ;						;	9=QUOTED STRING
 24723                                  ;		DB	ITEM_TAG		; MATCHED ITEM TAG
 24724                                  ;
 24725                                  ;		dw	synonym@		; es:@ points to found SYNONYM if provided.
 24726                                  ;
 24727                                  ;            +-
 24728                                  ;	    | DD	n			; VALUE IF NUMBER
 24729                                  ;	    | or
 24730                                  ;	    |	DW	i			; INDEX (OFFSET) INTO VALUE LIST
 24731                                  ;	    |					; (ES presents Segment address)
 24732                                  ;	    | or
 24733                                  ;	    |	DD	STRING			; OFFSET OF STRING VALUE
 24734                                  ;	    | or
 24735                                  ;	    |	DB	drv			; DRIVE NUMBER (1-A, 2-B,..., 26-Z)
 24736                                  ;	    | or
 24737                                  ;	    |	DW	YEAR	   ;(1980-2099)  IN CASE OF DATE
 24738                                  ;	    |	DB	MONTH	   ;(1-12)	 Note: Range check is not performed.
 24739                                  ;	    |	DB	DATE	   ;(1-31)	       0 is filled when the corresponding field was not specified.
 24740                                  ;	    | or
 24741                                  ;	    |	DB	HOUR	   ;(0-23)	  IN CASE OF TIME
 24742                                  ;	    |	DB	MINUTES    ;(0-59)	  Note: Range check is not performed .
 24743                                  ;	    |	DB	SECONDS    ;(0-59)		0 is filled when the corresponding field was not specified .
 24744                                  ;	    |	DB	HUNDREDTHS ;(0-99)
 24745                                  ;	    +-
 24746                                  ;
 24747                                  ;
 24748                                  ;Note: ITEM_TAG is 0FFH when the caller does not specify the choice
 24749                                  ;      list.
 24750                                  ;
 24751                                  ;      YEAR: If the input value for the year is less than 100, parser
 24752                                  ;	     adds 1900 to it.  For example, when 87 is input to parser for
 24753                                  ;	     the year value, he returns 1987.
 24754                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24755

 24760 00000002 ????                     .SYNONYM_Ptr: resw 1		;AN000; pointer to Synonym list returned
 24761 00000004 ????????                 .Picked_Val:  resb 4		;AN000; value
 24762                                  endstruc

 24791                                  _$P_Not_In_Str	   equ	8		;AN000; Not in string list provided
 24792                                  _$P_Syntax	   equ	9		;AN000; Syntax error
