 24879                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24880                                  ; SysParse;
 24881                                  ;
 24882                                  ;  Function : Parser Entry
 24883                                  ;
 24884                                  ;  Input: DS:SI -> command line
 24885                                  ;	  ES:DI -> parameter block
 24886                                  ;	  cs -> psdata.inc
 24887                                  ;	  CX = operand ordinal
 24888                                  ;
 24889                                  ;	  Note:  ES is the segment containing all the control blocks defined
 24890                                  ;		 by the caller, except for the DOS COMMAND line parms, which
 24891                                  ;		 is in DS.
 24892                                  ;
 24893                                  ;  Output: CY = 1   error of caller, means invalid parameter block or
 24894                                  ;		    invalid value list. But this parser does NOT implement
 24895                                  ;		    this feature. Therefore CY always zero.
 24896                                  ;
 24897                                  ;	   CY = 0   AX = return code
 24898                                  ;		    BL = terminated delimiter code
 24899                                  ;		    CX = new operand ordinal
 24900                                  ;		    SI = set past scaned operand
 24901                                  ;		    DX = selected result buffer
 24902                                  ;
 24903                                  ; Use:	_$P_Skip_Delim, _$P_Chk_EOL, _$P_Chk_Delim, _$P_Chk_DBCS
 24904                                  ;	_$P_Chk_Swtch, _$P_Chk_Pos_Control, _$P_Chk_Key_Control
 24905                                  ;	_$P_Chk_Sw_Control, _$P_Fill_Result
 24906                                  ;
 24907                                  ; Vars: _$P_Ordinal(RW), _$P_RC(RW), _$P_SI_Save(RW), _$P_DX(R), _$P_Terminator(R)
 24908                                  ;	_$P_SaveSI_Cmpx(W), _$P_Flags(RW), _$P_Found_SYNONYM(R), _$P_Save_EOB(W)
 24909                                  ;
 24910                                  ;-------- Modification History -----------------------------------------
 24911                                  ;
 24912                                  ;  4/04/87 : Created by K. K,
 24913                                  ;  4/28/87 : _$P_Val_YH assemble error (tm01)
 24914                                  ;	   : JMP SHORT assemble error (tm02)
 24915                                  ;  5/14/87 : Someone doesn't want to include psdata (tm03)
 24916                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_Bridge is missing when TimeSw equ 0 and (CmpxSw equ 1 or
 24917                                  ;	     DateSW equ 1)	      (tm04)
 24918                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_SorD_Quote is missing when QusSw equ 0 and CmpxSW equ 1
 24919                                  ;				      (tm05) in PSDATA.INC
 24920                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_FileSp_Char and _$P_FileSP_Len are missing
 24921                                  ;	     when FileSW equ 0 and DrvSW equ 1 (tm06) in PSDATA.INC
 24922                                  ;  6/18/87 : $VAL1 and $VAL3, $VAL2 and $VAL3 can be used in the same
 24923                                  ;	     value-list block	      (tm07)
 24924                                  ;  6/20/87 : Add _$P_SW to check if there's an omiting parameter after
 24925                                  ;	     switch (keyword) or not. If there is, backup si for next call
 24926                                  ;	     (tm08)
 24927                                  ;  6/24/87 : Complex Item checking does not work correctly when CmpSW equ 1
 24928                                  ;	     and DateSW equ 0 and TimeSW equ 0 (tm09)
 24929                                  ;  6/24/87 : New function flag _$P_colon_is_not_necessary for switch
 24930                                  ;	     /+15 and /+:15 are allowed for user (tm10)
 24931                                  ;  6/29/87 : ECS call changes DS register but it causes the address problem
 24932                                  ;	     in user's routines. _$P_Chk_DBCS (tm11)
 24933                                  ;  7/10/87 : Switch with no_match flag (0x0000H) does not work correctly
 24934                                  ;					  (tm12)
 24935                                  ;  7/10/87 : Invalid switch/keyword does not work correctly
 24936                                  ;					  (tm13)
 24937                                  ;  7/10/87 : Drive_only breaks 3 bytes after the result buffer
 24938                                  ;					  (tm14)
 24939                                  ;  7/12/87 : Too_Many_Operands sets DX=0 as the PARSE result
 24940                                  ;					  (tm15)
 24941                                  ;  7/24/87 : Negative lower bound on numeric ranges cause trouble
 24942                                  
 24943                                  ;  7/24/87 : Quoted strings being returned with quotes.
 24944                                  
 24945                                  ;  7/28/87 : Kerry S (;AN018;)
 24946                                  ;	     Non optional value on switch (match flags<>0 and <>1) not flagged
 24947                                  ;	     as an error when missing.	Solution: return error 2.  Modules
 24948                                  ;	     affected: _$P_Chk_SW_Control.
 24949                                  
 24950                                  ;  7/29/87 : Kerry S (;AN019;)
 24951                                  ;	     Now allow the optional bit in match flags for switches.  This
 24952                                  ;	     allows the switch to be encountered with a value or without a
 24953                                  ;	     value and no error is returned.
 24954                                  ;
 24955                                  
 24956                                  ;  8/28/87 : Ed K, Kerry S (;AN020;)
 24957                                  ;  9/14/87   In PROC _$P_Get_DecNum, when checking for field separators
 24958                                  ;	     within a date response, instead of checking just for the one
 24959                                  ;	     character defined by the COUNTRY DEPENDENT INFO, check for
 24960                                  ;	     all three chars, "-", "/", and ".". Change _$P_Chk_Switch to allow
 24961                                  ;	     slashes in date strings when DateSw (assembler switch) is set.
 24962                                  
 24963                                  ;  9/1/87  : Kerry S (;AN021)
 24964                                  ;	     In PROC _$P_String_Comp, when comparing the switch or keyword on
 24965                                  ;	     the command line with the string in the control block the
 24966                                  ;	     comparing was stopping at a colon (switch) or equal (keyword)
 24967                                  ;	     on the command line and assuming a match.	This allowed a shorter
 24968                                  ;	     string on the command line than in the synonym list in the control
 24969                                  ;	     block.  I put in a test for a null in the control block so the
 24970                                  ;	     string in the control block must be the same length as the string
 24971                                  ;	     preceeding the colon or equal on the command line.
 24972                                  
 24973                                  ;  8/28/87 : Kerry S (;AN022;)
 24974                                  ;	     All references to data in PSDATA.INC had CS overrides.  This caused
 24975                                  ;	     problems for people who included it themselves in a segment other
 24976                                  ;	     than CS.  Added switch to allow including PSDATA.INC in any
 24977                                  ;	     segment.
 24978

 24981                                  ;	     into PUSH cs.  In _$P_Get_DecNum PROC, fix AN020
 24982                                  ;	     forced both TIME and DATE to use the delims, "-","/",".".
 24983                                  ;	     Created FLag, in _$P_time_Format PROC, to request the delim in
 24984                                  ;	     BL be used if TIME is being parsed.

 25576                                  ;***********************************************************************
 25577                                  ; _$P_Fill_Result
 25578                                  ;
 25579                                  ; Function: Fill the result buffer
 25580                                  ;
 25581                                  ; Input:    AH = Item tag
 25582                                  ;	    AL = type
 25583                                  ;		  AL = 1: CX,DX has 32bit number (CX = high)
 25584                                  ;		  AL = 2: DX has index(offset) into value list
 25585                                  ;		  AL = 6: DL has driver # (1-A, 2-B, ... , 26 - Z)
 25586                                  ;		  AL = 7: DX has year, CL has month and CH has date
 25587                                  ;		  AL = 8: DL has hours, DH has minutes, CL has seconds,
 25588                                  ;			  amd CH has hundredths
 25589                                  ;		  AL = else: cs:SI points to returned string buffer
 25590                                  ;	    ES:BX -> CONTROL block
 25591                                  ;
 25592                                  ; Output:   None
 25593                                  ;
 25594                                  ; Use:	_$P_Do_CAPS_String, _$P_Remove_Colon, _$P_Found_SYNONYM
 25595                                  ;
 25596                                  ; Vars: _$P_DX(W)
 25597                                  ;***********************************************************************
 25598                                  
 25599                                  _$P_Fill_Result:
 25600 00001783 57                      	push	di			;AN000;

 25604                                  	;mov	[es:di+_$P_Result_Blk.Type],al ;AN000; store type
 25605                                  	;mov	[es:di+_$P_Result_Blk.Item_Tag],ah ;AN000; store item tag
 25606                                  	; 07/09/2023
 25607                                  	;mov	[es:di+_$P_Result_Blk.Type], ax
 25608 0000178D 268905                  	mov	[es:di],ax		; store type (al) and item tag (ah)
 25609                                  
 25610 00001790 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;
 25611 00001791 2EA1[E014]              	mov	ax,[cs:_$P_Found_SYNONYM] ;AC034; if yes,
 25612 00001795 26894502                	mov	[es:di+_$P_Result_Blk.SYNONYM_Ptr],ax 
 25613                                  					;AN000;   then set it to the result
 25614 00001799 58                      	pop	ax			;AN000;
 25615                                  _$P_RLT04:				;AN000;
 25616 0000179A 3C01                    	cmp	al,_$P_Number		;AN000; if number
 25617 0000179C 750A                    	jne	short _$P_RLT00		;AN000;
 25618                                  
 25619                                  _$P_RLT02:				;AN000;

 25688                                  ;***********************************************************************
 25689                                  ; _$P_Check_Match_Flags
 25690                                  ;
 25691                                  ; Function:  Check the mutch_flags and make the exit code and set the
 25692                                  ;	     result buffer
 25693                                  ;
 25694                                  ;	    Check for types in this order:
 25695                                  ;		Complex
 25696                                  ;		Date
 25697                                  ;		Time
 25698                                  ;		Drive
 25699                                  ;		Filespec
 25700                                  ;		Quoted String
 25701                                  ;		Simple String
 25702                                  ;
 25703                                  ; Input:     cs:SI -> _$P_STRING_BUF
 25704                                  ;	     ES:BX -> CONTROL block
 25705                                  ;
 25706                                  ; Output:    None
 25707                                  ;
 25708                                  ; Use:	     _$P_Value, P$_SValue, _$P_Simple_String, _$P_Date_Format
 25709                                  ;	     _$P_Time_Format, _$P_Complex_Format, _$P_File_Foemat
 25710                                  ;	     _$P_Drive_Format
 25711                                  ;***********************************************************************
 25712                                  
 25713                                  	; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0
 25714                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:19CFh)
 25715

 25993                                  ;***********************************************************************
 25994                                  ; _$P_Value / _$P_SValue
 25995                                  ;
 25996                                  ; Function:  Make 32bit value from cs:SI and see value list
 25997                                  ;	     and make result buffer.
 25998                                  ;	     _$P_SValue is an entry point for the signed value
 25999                                  ;	     and this will simply call _$P_Value after the handling
 26000                                  ;	     of the sign character, "+" or "-"
 26001                                  ;
 26002                                  ; Input:     cs:SI -> _$P_STRING_BUF
 26003                                  ;	     ES:BX -> CONTROL block
 26004                                  ;
 26005                                  ; Output:    None
 26006                                  ;
 26007                                  ; Use:	_$P_Fill_Result, _$P_Check_OVF
 26008                                  ;
 26009                                  ; Vars: _$P_RC(W), _$P_Flags(RW)
 26010                                  ;***********************************************************************
 26011                                  
 26012                                  	; 26/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0
 26013                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1B0Bh)
 26014                                  
 26015                                  	; 07/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
 26016                                  	; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1C46h)  	
 26017                                  _$P_SValue:				;AN000; when signed value here
 26018 00001936 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;
 26019 00001937 2E800E[D914]80          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Signed ;AC034; indicate a signed numeric
 26020 0000193D 2E8026[D914]FD          	and	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],0FFh-_$P_Neg ;AC034; assume positive value
 26021                                  	;and	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],~_$P_Neg ; 07/07/2023 
 26022 00001943 2E8A04                  	mov	al,[cs:si]		;AN000; get sign
 26023 00001946 3C2B                    	cmp	al,_$P_Plus		;AN000; "+" ?
 26024 00001948 740A                    	je	short _$P_SVal00	;AN000;
 26025                                  
 26026 0000194A 3C2D                    	cmp	al,_$P_Minus		;AN000; "-" ?
 26027 0000194C 7507                    	jne	short _$P_Sval01	;AN000; else
 26028                                  
 26029 0000194E 2E800E[D914]02          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Neg ;AC034; set this is negative value
 26030                                  _$P_SVal00:				;AN000;
 26031 00001954 46                      	inc	si			;AN000; skip sign char
 26032                                  _$P_Sval01:				;AN000;
 26033 00001955 E80200                  	call	_$P_Value		;AN000; and process value
 26034 00001958 58                      	pop	ax			;AN000;
 26035 00001959 C3                      	retn
 26036                                  
 26037                                  ;***********************************************************************
 26038                                  
 26039                                  	; 07/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
 26040                                  	; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1C6Ah)
 26041                                  
 26042                                  	; 26/10/2022
 26043                                  _$P_Value:				;AN000;
 26044 0000195A 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;
 26045 0000195B 51                      	push	cx			;AN000;
 26046 0000195C 52                      	push	dx			;AN000;
 26047 0000195D 56                      	push	si			;AN000;
 26048 0000195E 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx			;AN000; cx = higher 16 bits
 26049 00001960 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx			;AN000; dx = lower 16 bits
 26050 00001962 53                      	push	bx			;AN000; save control pointer
 26051                                  _$P_Value_Loop:				;AN000;
 26052 00001963 2E8A04                  	mov	al,[cs:si]		;AN000; get character
 26053 00001966 08C0                    	or	al,al			;AN000; end of line ?
 26054 00001968 743C                    	jz	short _$P_Value00	;AN000;
 26055                                  
 26056 0000196A E8E000                  	call	_$P_0099 		;AN000; make asc(0..9) to bin(0..9)
 26057 0000196D 7233                    	jc	short _$P_Value_Err0	;AN000;
 26058                                  
 26059 0000196F 30E4                    	xor	ah,ah			;AN000;
 26060 00001971 89C5                    	mov	bp,ax			;AN000; save binary number
 26061                                  
 26062                                  ; 08/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
 26063                                  ; Ref: Disassembled PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM SYSINIT code
 26064                                  ;				Erdogan Tan - July 2023 
 26065                                  %if 0
 26066                                  	shl	dx,1			;AN000; to have 2*x
 26067                                  	rcl	cx,1			;AN000; shift left w/ carry
 26068                                  	call	_$P_Check_OVF		;AN000; Overflow occurred ?
 26069                                  	jc	short _$P_Value_Err0	;AN000; then error, exit
 26070                                  
 26071                                  	mov	bx,dx			;AN000; save low(2*x)
 26072                                  	mov	ax,cx			;AN000; save high(2*x)
 26073                                  	shl	dx,1			;AN000; to have 4*x
 26074                                  	rcl	cx,1			;AN000; shift left w/ carry
 26075                                  	call	_$P_Check_OVF		;AN000; Overflow occurred ?
 26076                                  	jc	short _$P_Value_Err0	;AN000; then error, exit
 26077                                  
 26078                                  	shl	dx,1			;AN000; to have 8*x
 26079                                  	rcl	cx,1			;AN000; shift left w/ carry
 26080                                  	call	_$P_Check_OVF		;AN000; Overflow occurred ?
 26081                                  	jc	short _$P_Value_Err0	;AN000; then error, exit
 26082                                  
 26083                                  	add	dx,bx			;AN000; now have 10*x
 26084                                  	adc	cx,ax			;AN000; 32bit ADD
 26085                                  	call	_$P_Check_OVF		;AN000; Overflow occurred ?
 26086                                  	jc	short _$P_Value_Err0	;AN000; then error, exit
 26087                                  
 26088                                  	add	dx,bp			;AN000; Add the current one degree decimal
 26089                                  	adc	cx,0			;AN000; if carry, add 1 to high 16bit
 26090                                  	call	_$P_Check_OVF		;AN000; Overflow occurred ?
 26091                                  	jc	short _$P_Value_Err0	;AN000; then error, exit
 26092                                  
 26093                                  	inc	si			;AN000; update pointer
 26094                                  	jmp	short _$P_Value_Loop	;AN000; loop until NULL encountered
 26095                                  ;_$P_Value_Err0:
 26096                                  %endif
 26097                                  ;****
 26098                                  %if 1
 26099                                  ; 08/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
 26100                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - SYSINIT:2130h)
 26101

 26297                                  ; _$P_Check_OVF
 26298                                  ;
 26299                                  ; Function:  Check if overflow is occurred with consideration of
 26300                                  ;	     signed or un-signed numeric value
 26301                                  ;
 26302                                  ; Input:     Flag register
 26303                                  ;
 26304                                  ; Output:    CY = 1  :	Overflow
 26305                                  ;
 26306                                  ; Vars:     _$P_Flags(R)
 26307                                  ;***********************************************************************
 26308                                  
 26309                                  	; 26/10/2022
 26310                                  _$P_Check_OVF:
 26311 00001A3B 9C                      	pushf				;AN000;
 26312 00001A3C 2EF606[D914]02          	test	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Neg ;AC034; is it negative value ?
 26313 00001A42 7502                    	jnz	short _$P_COVF 		;AN000; if no, check overflow
 26314                                  
 26315 00001A44 9D                      	popf				;AN000; by the CY bit
 26316 00001A45 C3                      	retn				;AN000;
 26317                                  
 26318                                  _$P_COVF:				;AN000;
 26319 00001A46 9D                      	popf				;AN000; else,
 26320 00001A47 7002                    	jo	short _$P_COVF00	;AN000; check overflow by the OF
 26321                                  
 26322 00001A49 F8                      	clc				;AN000; indicate it with CY bit
 26323 00001A4A C3                      	retn				;AN000; CY=0 means no overflow
 26324                                  
 26325                                  _$P_COVF00:				;AN000;
 26326 00001A4B F9                      	stc				;AN000; and CY=1 means overflow
 26327 00001A4C C3                      	retn				;AN000;

 26894                                  ;***********************************************************************
 26895                                  ; _$P_Chk_EOL;
 26896                                  ;
 26897                                  ; Function: Check if AL is one of End of Line characters.
 26898                                  ;
 26899                                  ; Input:    AL = character code
 26900                                  ;	    ES:DI -> Parameter List
 26901                                  ;
 26902                                  ; Output:   ZF = 1 if one of End of Line characters
 26903                                  ;**********************************************************************
 26904                                  
 26905                                  _$P_Chk_EOL:
 26906 00001C47 53                      	push	bx			;AN000;
 26907 00001C48 51                      	push	cx			;AN000;
 26908 00001C49 3C0D                    	cmp	al,_$P_CR		;AN000; Carriage return ?
 26909 00001C4B 742C                    	je	short _$P_Chk_EOL_Exit 	;AN000;
 26910 00001C4D 3C00                    	cmp	al,_$P_NULL		;AN000; zero ?
 26911 00001C4F 7428                    	je	short _$P_Chk_EOL_Exit 	;AN000;
 26912                                  ;IF LFEOLSW				;AN028; IF LF TO BE ACCEPTED AS EOL
 26913 00001C51 3C0A                    	cmp	al,_$P_LF		;AN000; Line feed ?
 26914 00001C53 7424                    	je	short _$P_Chk_EOL_Exit 	;AN000;
 26915                                  ;ENDIF					;AN028;
 26916 00001C55 26807D0202              	cmp	byte [es:di+_$P_PARMS_Blk.Num_Extra],_$P_I_Have_EOL 
 26917                                  					;AN000; EOL character specified ?
 26918 00001C5A 721D                    	jb	short _$P_Chk_EOL_Exit 	;AN000;
 26919 00001C5C 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx			;AN000;
 26920 00001C5E 268A5D03                	mov	bl,[es:di+_$P_PARMS_Blk.Len_Extra_Delim]
 26921                                  					;AN000; get length of delimiter list
 26922 00001C62 83C304                  	add	bx,_$P_Len_PARMS 	;AN000; skip it
 26923                                  	; 08/07/2023
 26924 00001C65 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx ; *
 26925 00001C67 26803900                	cmp	byte [es:bx+di],_$P_I_Use_Default ;AN000; No extra EOL character ?
 26926 00001C6B 740B                    	je	short _$P_Chk_EOL_NZ	;AN000;
 26927                                  	; 08/07/2023
 26928                                  	;;xor	cx,cx			;AN000; Get number of extra character
 26929                                  	;xor	ch,ch ; *
 26930 00001C6D 268A09                  	mov	cl,[es:bx+di]		;AN000; 
 26931                                  _$P_Chk_EOL_Loop:			;AN000;
 26932 00001C70 43                      	inc	bx			;AN000;
 26933 00001C71 263A01                  	cmp	al,[es:bx+di]		;AN000; Check extra EOL character
 26934 00001C74 7403                    	je	short _$P_Chk_EOL_Exit 	;AN000;
 26935 00001C76 E2F8                    	loop	_$P_Chk_EOL_Loop 	;AN000;
 26936                                  	; 08/07/2023
 26937                                  	; cx=0
 26938                                  _$P_Chk_EOL_NZ:				;AN000;
 26939                                  	;cmp	al,_$P_CR		;AN000; reset ZF
 26940                                  	; 08/07/2023
 26941 00001C78 41                      	inc	cx  ; zf=0  (cx=1) ; *
 26942                                  _$P_Chk_EOL_Exit:			;AN000;
 26943 00001C79 59                      	pop	cx			;AN000;
 26944 00001C7A 5B                      	pop	bx			;AN000;
 26945 00001C7B C3                      	retn

 26947                                  ;***********************************************************************
 26948                                  ; _$P_Chk_Delim;
 26949                                  ;
 26950                                  ; Function: Check if AL is one of delimiter characters.
 26951                                  ;	    if AL+[si] is DBCS blank, it is replaced with two SBCS
 26952                                  ;	    blanks.
 26953                                  ;
 26954                                  ; Input:    AL = character code
 26955                                  ;	    DS:SI -> Next Character
 26956                                  ;	    ES:DI -> Parameter List
 26957                                  ;
 26958                                  ; Output:   ZF = 1 if one of delimiter characters
 26959                                  ;	    SI points to the next character
 26960                                  ; Vars:  _$P_Terminator(W), _$P_Flags(W)
 26961                                  ;***********************************************************************
 26962                                  
 26963                                  	; 08/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
 26964                                  	; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1FAEh
 26965                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - SYSINIT:2451h) ; (Retro DOS v5.0)
 26966                                  
 26967                                  _$P_Chk_Delim:
 26968 00001C7C 53                      	push	bx			;AN000;
 26969 00001C7D 51                      	push	cx			;AN000;
 26970 00001C7E 2EC606[D314]20          	mov	byte [cs:_$P_Terminator],_$P_Space 
 26971                                  					;AC034; Assume terminated by space
 26972                                  	;and	byte [cs:_$P_Flags20,0DFh
 26973 00001C84 2E8026[D914]DF          	and	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],0FFh-_$P_Extra ;AC034;
 26974 00001C8A 3C20                    	cmp	al,_$P_Space ; 20h	;AN000; Space ?
 26975 00001C8C 7423                    	je	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 26976                                  
 26977 00001C8E 3C09                    	cmp	al,_$P_TAB		;AN000; TAB ?
 26978 00001C90 741F                    	je	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 26979                                  
 26980 00001C92 3C2C                    	cmp	al,_$P_Comma		;AN000; Comma ?
 26981 00001C94 741E                    	je	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit0 ;AN000;
 26982                                  
 26983                                  ; Note: _$P_Chk_Delim00 part of code is nonsense here
 26984                                  ;        because _$P_Space = _$P_DBSP1 = 20h
 26985                                  ;        Erdogan Tan - 08/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
 26986                                  ;_$P_Chk_Delim00:
 26987                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - SYSINIT:246Bh)
 26988                                  	; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1FC8h)
 26989                                  %if 0
 26990                                  	; 26/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26991                                  _$P_Chk_Delim00: 			;AN000;
 26992                                  	cmp	al,_$P_DBSP1	; 20h	;AN000; 1st byte of DBCS Space ?
 26993                                  	jne	short _$P_Chk_Delim01	;AN000;
 26994                                  
 26995                                  	cmp	byte [si],_$P_DBSP2 ; 20h ;AN000; 2nd byte of DBCS Space ?
 26996                                  	jne	short _$P_Chk_Delim01	;AN000;
 26997                                  
 26998                                  	mov	al,_$P_Space		;AN000;
 26999                                  	inc	si			;AN000; make si point to next character
 27000                                  	cmp	al,al			;AN000; Set ZF
 27001                                  	jmp	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 27002                                  %endif
 27003                                  
 27004                                  _$P_Chk_Delim01: 			;AN000;
 27005 00001C96 26807DFE01              	cmp	byte [es:di-_$P_PARMS_Blk.Num_Extra],_$P_I_Have_Delim 
 27006                                  					;AN000; delimiter character specified ?
 27007 00001C9B 7214                    	jb	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 27008                                  
 27009                                  	;xor	cx,cx			;AN000;
 27010 00001C9D 30ED                    	xor	ch,ch
 27011                                  	;mov	cl,[es:di+3]
 27012 00001C9F 268A4D03                	mov	cl,[es:di+_$P_PARMS_Blk.Len_Extra_Delim] 
 27013                                  					;AN000; get length of delimiter list
 27014                                  	;or	cx,cx			;AN000; No extra Delim character ?
 27015                                  	;jz	short _$P_Chk_Delim_NZ 	;AN000;
 27016                                  	; 08/07/2023
 27017 00001CA3 E30B                    	jcxz	_$P_Chk_Delim_NZ
 27018                                  
 27019 00001CA5 BB0300                  	mov	bx,_$P_Len_PARMS-1 ; 3	;AN000; set bx to 1st extra delimiter
 27020                                  _$P_Chk_Delim_Loop:			;AN000;
 27021 00001CA8 43                      	inc	bx			;AN000;
 27022 00001CA9 263A01                  	cmp	al,[es:bx+di]		;AN000; Check extra Delim character
 27023 00001CAC 7406                    	je	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit0 ;AN000;
 27024                                  
 27025 00001CAE E2F8                    	loop	_$P_Chk_Delim_Loop	;AN000; examine all extra delimiter
 27026                                  
 27027                                  _$P_Chk_Delim_NZ:			;AN000;
 27028                                  	;cmp	al,_$P_Space		;AN000; reset ZF
 27029                                  	; 08/07/2023
 27030                                  	; cx=0 here
 27031 00001CB0 41                      	inc	cx ; cx=1, zf=0
 27032                                  _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit:			;AN000;
 27033                                  _$P_ChkDfin:				;AN000;
 27034 00001CB1 59                      	pop	cx			;AN000;
 27035 00001CB2 5B                      	pop	bx			;AN000;
 27036 00001CB3 C3                      	retn				;AN000;
 27037                                  
 27038                                  _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit0:			;AN000;
 27039 00001CB4 2EA2[D314]              	mov	[cs:_$P_Terminator],al ;AC034; keep terminated delimiter
 27040 00001CB8 2EF606[D914]01          	test	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_equ ;AN027;AC034;; if terminating a key=
 27041 00001CBE 7506                    	jnz	short _$P_No_Set_Extra 	;AN027; then do not set the EXTRA bit
 27042                                  
 27043 00001CC0 2E800E[D914]20          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Extra 
 27044                                  					;AC034; flag terminated extra delimiter or comma
 27045                                  _$P_No_Set_Extra:			;AN027;
 27046 00001CC6 38C0                    	cmp	al,al			;AN000; set ZF

 27049                                  ;***********************************************************************
 27050                                  ; _$P_Chk_Switch;
 27051                                  ;
 27052                                  ; Function: Check if AL is the switch character not in first position of
 27053                                  ;	    _$P_STRING_BUF
 27054                                  ;
 27055                                  ; Input:    AL = character code
 27056                                  ;	    BX = current pointer within _$P_String_Buf
 27057                                  ;	    SI =>next char on command line (following the one in AL)
 27058                                  ;
 27059                                  ; Output:   CF = 1 (set)if AL is switch character, and not in first
 27060                                  ;		 position, and has no chance of being part of a date string,
 27061                                  ;		 i.e. should be treated as a delimiter.
 27062                                  
 27063                                  ;	    CF = 0 (reset, cleared) if AL is not a switch char, is in the first
 27064                                  ;		 position, or is a slash but may be part of a date string, i.e.
 27065                                  ;		 should not be treated as a delimiter.
 27066                                  ;
 27067                                  ; Vars:  _$P_Terminator(W)
 27068                                  
 27069                                  ; Use:	 _$P_0099
 27070                                  ;***********************************************************************
 27071                                  
 27072                                  _$P_Chk_Switch:
 27073                                  	;;lea	bp,[cs:_$P_STRING_BUF]	;AN020;AC034
 27074                                  	;lea	bp,[_$P_STRING_BUF]	;BP=OFFSET of _$P_String_Buf even in group addressing
 27075                                  	; 08/07/2023
 27076 00001CCA BD[E214]                	mov	bp,_$P_STRING_BUF
 27077                                  
 27078                                  ;	.IF <BX NE BP> THEN		;AN020;IF not first char THEN
 27079 00001CCD 39EB                    	cmp	bx,bp			;AN000;
 27080 00001CCF 7406                    	je	short _$P_STRUC_L2	;AN000;
 27081                                  
 27082                                  ;	.IF <AL EQ _$P_Switch> THEN	;AN020;otherwise see if a slash
 27083 00001CD1 3C2F                    	cmp	al,_$P_Switch		;AN000;
 27084 00001CD3 750C                    	jne	short _$P_STRUC_L5 	;AN000;
 27085                                  
 27086 00001CD5 F9                      	stc				;AN020;not in first position and is slash
 27087                                  	;jmp     short _$P_STRUC_L1	;AN000;
 27088                                  	; 12/12/2022
 27089 00001CD6 C3                      	retn
 27090                                  
 27091                                  ; 12/12/2022
 27092                                  ;_$P_STRUC_L5:				;AN000;
 27093                                  ;	CLC				;AN020;not a slash
 27094                                  ;;	    .ENDIF			;AN020;
 27095                                  ;;	.ELSE				;AN020;is first char in the buffer, ZF=0
 27096                                  ;	jmp	short _$P_STRUC_L1	;AN000;
 27097                                  
 27098                                  _$P_STRUC_L2:				;AN000;
 27099                                  ;	.IF <AL EQ _$P_Switch> THEN	;AN020;
 27100 00001CD7 3C2F                    	cmp     al,_$P_Switch		;AN000;
 27101 00001CD9 7506                    	jne	short _$P_STRUC_L12	;AN000;
 27102                                  
 27103 00001CDB 2E800E[D914]40          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_SW ;AN020 ;AC034;;could be valid switch, first char and is slash
 27104                                  ;	.ENDIF				;AN020;
 27105                                  
 27106                                  	; 12/12/2022
 27107                                  	; cf=0
 27108                                  	;retn
 27109                                  
 27110                                  _$P_STRUC_L5:
 27111                                  	; 12/12/2022
 27112                                  _$P_STRUC_L12:				;AN000;
 27113 00001CE1 F8                      	clc				;AN020;CF=0 indicating first char
 27114                                  ;	.ENDIF				;AN020;
 27115                                  _$P_STRUC_L1:				;AN000;
 27116 00001CE2 C3                      	retn				;AN000;

 27118                                  ;**************************************************************************
 27119                                  ; _$P_Chk_DBCS:
 27120                                  ;
 27121                                  ;  Function: Check if a specified byte is in ranges of the DBCS lead bytes
 27122                                  ;
 27123                                  ;  Input:
 27124                                  ;	  AL	= Code to be examineed
 27125                                  ;
 27126                                  ;  Output:
 27127                                  ;	  If CF is on then a lead byte of DBCS
 27128                                  ;
 27129                                  ; Use: INT 21h w/AH=63
 27130                                  ;
 27131                                  ; Vars:  _$P_DBCSEV_Seg(RW), _$P_DBCSEV_Off(RW)
 27132                                  ;***************************************************************************
 27133                                  
 27134                                  _$P_Chk_DBCS:
 27135 00001CE3 1E                      	push	ds			;AN000;
 27136 00001CE4 56                      	push	si			;AN000;
 27137 00001CE5 53                      	push	bx			;AN000; (tm11)
 27138                                  	;cmp	word [cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG],0 ;AC034; ALREADY SET ?
 27139                                  	;jne	short _$P_DBCS00	;AN000;
 27140                                  	; 08/07/2023
 27141 00001CE6 2E8B36[D614]            	mov	si,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG]
 27142 00001CEB 21F6                    	and	si,si ; 0 ?
 27143 00001CED 7525                    	jnz	short _$P_DBCS00 ; already set
 27144 00001CEF 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;
 27145 00001CF0 1E                      	push	ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 27146 00001CF1 51                      	push	cx			;AN000;
 27147 00001CF2 52                      	push	dx			;AN000;
 27148 00001CF3 57                      	push	di			;AN000;
 27149 00001CF4 55                      	push	bp			;AN000;
 27150 00001CF5 06                      	push	es			;AN000;
 27151                                  	; si = 0 ; 08/07/2023
 27152                                  	;xor	si,si			;AN000;
 27153 00001CF6 8EDE                    	mov	ds,si ; 0		;AN000;
 27154 00001CF8 B80063                  	mov	ax,_$P_DOS_GetEV ; 6300h ;AN000; GET DBCS EV CALL
 27155 00001CFB CD21                    	int	21h			;AN000;
 27156                                  		; DOS - 3.2+ only - GET DOUBLE BYTE CHARACTER SET LEAD TABLE
 27157 00001CFD 8CDB                    	mov	bx,ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 27158 00001CFF 09DB                    	or	bx,bx			;AN000; (tm11)
 27159 00001D01 07                      	pop	es			;AN000;
 27160 00001D02 5D                      	pop	bp			;AN000;
 27161 00001D03 5F                      	pop	di			;AN000;
 27162 00001D04 5A                      	pop	dx			;AN000;
 27163 00001D05 59                      	pop	cx			;AN000;
 27164 00001D06 1F                      	pop	ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 27165 00001D07 58                      	pop	ax			;AN000;
 27166 00001D08 7424                    	jz	short _$P_NON_DBCS	;AN000;
 27167                                  _$P_DBCS02:				;AN000;
 27168 00001D0A 2E8936[D414]            	mov	[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_OFF],si	;AC034; save EV offset
 27169 00001D0F 2E891E[D614]            	mov	[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG],bx	;AC034; save EV segment (tm11)
 27170                                  _$P_DBCS00:				;AN000;
 27171                                  	;mov	si,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_OFF]	;AC034; load EV offset
 27172                                  	;mov	ds,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG]	;AC034; and segment
 27173                                  	; 08/07/2023
 27174 00001D14 2EC536[D414]            	lds	si,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_OFF]
 27175                                  _$P_DBCS_LOOP:				;AN000;
 27176 00001D19 833C00                  	cmp	word [si],0		;AN000; zero vector ?
 27177 00001D1C 7410                    	je	short _$P_NON_DBCS	;AN000; then exit
 27178 00001D1E 3A04                    	cmp	al,[si] 		;AN000;
 27179 00001D20 7208                    	jb	short _$P_DBCS01	;AN000; Check if AL is in
 27180 00001D22 3A4401                  	cmp	al,[si+1]		;AN000;   range of
 27181 00001D25 7703                    	ja	short _$P_DBCS01	;AN000;      the vector
 27182 00001D27 F9                      	stc				;AN000; if yes, indicate DBCS and exit
 27183 00001D28 EB04                    	jmp	short _$P_DBCS_EXIT	;AN000;
 27184                                  _$P_DBCS01:				;AN000;
 27185 00001D2A 46                      	inc	si			;AC035; add '2' to
 27186 00001D2B 46                      	inc	si			;AC035;  SI reg
 27187                                  					;AN000; get next vector
 27188 00001D2C EBEB                    	jmp	short _$P_DBCS_LOOP	;AN000; loop until zero vector found
 27189                                  _$P_NON_DBCS:				;AN000;
 27190                                  	; 12/12/2022
 27191                                  	; cf=0
 27192                                  	;clc				;AN000; indicate SBCS
 27193                                  _$P_DBCS_EXIT:				;AN000;
 27194 00001D2E 5B                      	pop	bx			;AN000; (tm11)
 27195 00001D2F 5E                      	pop	si			;AN000;
 27196 00001D30 1F                      	pop	ds			;AN000;
 27197 00001D31 C3                      	retn				;AN000;

 27764                                  
 27765                                  ;   Module:   HIGHVAR.INC - Data common to LOADHIGH and DEVICEHIGH, res seg
 27766                                  ;
 27767                                  ;   Date:     May 14, 1992
 27768                                  ;
 27769                                  ;******************************************************************************
 27770                                  ;
 27771                                  ;   Modification log:
 27772                                  ;
 27773                                  ;     DATE    WHO      DESCRIPTION
 27774                                  ;   --------  -------  --------------------------------------------------------
 27775                                  ;   05/14/92  t-richj  Original
 27776                                  ;   06/21/92  t-richj  Final revisions before check-in
 27777                                  ;
 27778                                  ;******************************************************************************
 27779                                  ;
 27780                                  ; There are two primary definitions which need to be made, selectively, before
 27781                                  ; this include file should be used.  These are:
 27782                                  ;    HV_Extern - If this has been defined, variables for this module will be
 27783                                  ;                declared as external.  Otherwise, variables will be declared
 27784                                  ;                public, as well as defined, here.  LoadHigh declares HV_Extern
 27785                                  ;                in stub.asm and loadhi.asm, and does not declare it in
 27786                                  ;                rdata.asm... DeviceHigh does not declare HV_Extern anywhere
 27787                                  ;                (as only one module, sysconf.asm, includes this file).
 27788                                  ;    HV_LoadHigh - This should be defined when this module is going into
 27789                                  ;                  command.com, for LoadHigh.  All of loadhi.asm, stub.asm and
 27790                                  ;                  rdata.asm define this, while io.sys' sysconf.asm does not.
 27791                                  ;
 27792                                  ;******************************************************************************
 27793                                  
 27794                                  ; To keep track of which UMBs were specified on the DH/LH command lines, and
 27795                                  ; to keep track of the minimum sizes given for each, there're two arrays kept
 27796                                  ; in { IO.SYS: sysinitseg / COMMAND.COM: DATARES }... each is MAXUMB elements
 27797                                  ; big.  16 should be around 14 too many for most users, so there's no expected
 27798                                  ; space problem (it's just such a nice round number, eh?).
 27799                                  
 27800                                  MAXUMB	equ	16
 27801                                  
 27802                                  ; Memory elements owned by the system are marked as PSP address 8 in both the
 27803                                  ; USA and Japan; Japanese systems also use 9 under more bizzarre conditions.
 27804                                  
 27805                                  FreePSPOwner	equ	0	; Free MCBs all have an owner PSP address of 0
 27806                                  SystemPSPOwner	equ	8
 27807                                  ;JapanPSPOwner	equ	9
 27808                                  
 27809                                  ; for LoadHigh and DeviceHigh:
 27810                                  ;
 27811                                  ;	fInHigh - Is set to 1 during HideUMBs(), and back to zero in
 27812                                  ;	          UnHideUMBs().
 27813                                  ;	fUmbTiny - Is set to 1 iff the user has specified /S on the command-
 27814                                  ;	           line.
 27815                                  ;	SegLoad - Segment address for first UMB specified; set automatically.
 27816                                  ;	UmbLoad - The load UMB number; for example, this is 3 if the user has
 27817                                  ;	          given a command-line like "/L:3,500;4"
 27818                                  ;	UmbUsed - An array of characters, each of which is 1 iff the UMB
 27819                                  ;	          matching its index number was specified on the command-line;
 27820                                  ;	          for example, after "/L:3,500;4;7", UmbUsed[3], [4] and [7]
 27821                                  ;	          will be set to 1.  All others will be set to 0.
 27822                                  ;	UmbSize - An array of words, each of which is interpereted as a size
 27823                                  ;	          specified by the user for a UMB (in the above example, all
 27824                                  ;	          elements would be zero save UmbSize[3], which would be 500.
 27825                                  ;	fm_umb - Set to the old UMB link-state (0x80 or 0x00)
 27826                                  ;	fm_strat - Set to the old memory-allocation strategy (0$00000???)
 27827                                  ;	fm_argc  - Number of arguments received by ParseVar() (see ParseVar()
 27828                                  ;	           for details).
 27829                                  
 27830 00001F31 00                      fInHigh:  db	0
 27831 00001F32 00                      fUmbTiny: db	0
 27832 00001F33 0000                    SegLoad:  dw	0
 27833 00001F35 00                      UmbLoad:  db	0
 27834 00001F36 00<rep 10h>             UmbUsed:  times MAXUMB db 0 ; times 16 db 0  ; db 16 dup(?)
 27835 00001F46 0000<rep 10h>           UmbSize:  times MAXUMB dw 0 ; times 16 dw 0  ; dw 16 dup(?)
 27836 00001F66 00                      fm_umb:   db	0
 27837 00001F67 00                      fm_strat: db	0
 27838 00001F68 00                      fm_argc:  db	0	
 27839                                  
 27840                                  ; UmbLoad is set to UNSPECIFED, below, until /L:umb is read; at which point
 27841                                  ; UmbLoad is set to the UMB number given.
 27842                                  
 27843                                  UNSPECIFIED	equ	-1
 27844                                  
 27845                                  ;%endif ; 27/10/2022
 27846

 27859 00001F6D 0000                    DevLoadEnd:	dw	0	; MaxAddr to which device can be loaded
 27860 00001F6F 00000000                DevEntry:	dd	0	; Entry point to the device driver

 27865                                  ;

 27867 00001F79 0000                    DevUMBAddr:	dw	0	; cuurent UMB used fro loading devices (paras)

 27930 00001FB2 F9                      	stc				;in case of int 24

 27932 00001FB5 7309                    	jnc	short noprob		; brif opened okay

 27948 00001FC9 CD21                    	int	21h

 27950                                  					; 08/09/2023 - Erdogan Tan - Note:
 27951 00001FCE 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx			; dx already must be 0 here ; 08/09/2023
 27952                                  					; I am not removing 'xor dx,dx' here
 27953                                  					; for MSDOS compatibility.

 27964                                  	;mov	dx,[top_of_cdss]

 27967 00001FDC A3[D002]                	mov	[config_size],ax	;save the size of config.sys file.
 27968 00001FDF E871F1                  	call	ParaRound
 27969 00001FE2 29C2                    	sub	dx,ax
 27970                                  
 27971                                  ; 31/12/2022
 27972                                  ; 27/10/2022
 27973                                  ;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 27974                                  ;
 27975                                  ;  The size of the CONFIG.SYS workspace (for recreating the in-memory
 27976                                  ;  CONFIG.SYS image, and later for building the initial environment) need
 27977                                  ;  not be any larger than CONFIG.SYS itself, EXCEPT for the fact that
 27978                                  ;  we (may) add a variable to the environment that does not explicity appear
 27979                                  ;  in CONFIG.SYS, and that variable is CONFIG (as in CONFIG=COMMON).
 27980                                  ;  The default setting for CONFIG cannot result in more than 1 paragraph
 27981                                  ;  of extra space, so here we account for it (the worst case of course is
 27982                                  ;  when CONFIG.SYS is some very small size, like 0 -JTP)
 27983                                  ;
 27984 00001FE4 4A                      	dec	dx                      ;reserve 1 additional paragraph
 27985 00001FE5 8916[BE14]              	mov	[config_wrkseg],dx      ;this is the segment to be used for
 27986 00001FE9 29C2                    	sub	dx,ax                   ;rebuilding the config.sys memory image
 27987                                  ;;endif	;MULTI_CONFIG

 27990                                  	
 27991                                  	; 31/12/2022

 27993 00001FF2 8916[A302]              	mov	[CONFBOT],dx
 27994                                  	
 27995                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 27996                                  	;mov	[top_of_cdss],dx
 27997                                  	;call    TempCDS

 27999                                  	; 11/12/2022
 28000                                  	; ds <> cs 
 28001                                  	;mov	dx,[cs:top_of_cdss]
 28002                                  
 28003                                  	; 08/09/2023
 28004                                  	; ds = cs
 28005 00001FF6 8B0E[5603]              	mov	cx,[count]
 28006                                  	
 28007 00001FFA 8EDA                    	mov	ds,dx
 28008 00001FFC 8EC2                    	mov	es,dx
 28009                                  
 28010 00001FFE 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx
 28011                                  	; 08/09/2023
 28012                                  	;mov	cx,[cs:count]
 28013 00002000 B43F                    	mov	ah,3Fh
 28014                                  	;mov	ah,READ  ; 3Fh

 28016 00002003 CD21                    	int	21h			;function request
 28017 00002005 9C                      	pushf
 28018                                  
 28019                                  ; find the eof mark in the file. if present,then trim length.
 28020                                  
 28021 00002006 50                      	push	ax
 28022 00002007 57                      	push	di
 28023 00002008 51                      	push	cx
 28024 00002009 B01A                    	mov	al,1Ah			; eof mark
 28025 0000200B 89D7                    	mov	di,dx			; point to buffer
 28026 0000200D E305                    	jcxz	puteol			; no chars
 28027 0000200F F2AE                    	repnz	scasb			; find end
 28028 00002011 7501                    	jnz	short puteol		; none found and count exhausted
 28029                                  
 28030                                  ; we found a 1a. back up
 28031                                  
 28032 00002013 4F                      	dec	di			; backup past 1Ah
 28033                                  
 28034                                  ;  just for the halibut, stick in an extra eol
 28035                                  
 28036                                  puteol:
 28037 00002014 B00D                    	mov	al,cr ; 0Dh
 28038 00002016 AA                      	stosb
 28039 00002017 B00A                    	mov	al,lf  ;0Ah
 28040 00002019 AA                      	stosb
 28041 0000201A 29D7                    	sub	di,dx			; difference moved
 28042                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 28043                                  	;mov	[cs:count],di		; new count
 28044                                  
 28045                                  	; 11/12/2022	
 28046                                  	; 31/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 28047 0000201C 0E                      	push	cs
 28048 0000201D 1F                      	pop	ds
 28049                                  
 28050 0000201E 893E[5603]              	mov	[count],di		; new count
 28051                                  
 28052 00002022 59                      	pop	cx
 28053 00002023 5F                      	pop	di
 28054 00002024 58                      	pop	ax
 28055                                  
 28056                                  	; 11/12/2022
 28057                                  	; 27/10/2022
 28058                                  	;push	cs
 28059                                  	;pop	ds
 28060                                  
 28061 00002025 50                      	push	ax
 28062                                  	;mov	ah,CLOSE
 28063 00002026 B43E                    	mov	ah,3Eh
 28064 00002028 CD21                    	int	21h
 28065 0000202A 58                      	pop	ax
 28066 0000202B 9D                      	popf
 28067 0000202C 7204                    	jc	short conferr 		;if not we've got a problem
 28068 0000202E 39C1                    	cmp	cx,ax
 28069 00002030 742D                    	jz	short getcom		;couldn't read the file
 28070                                  conferr:
 28071 00002032 BA[6045]                	mov	dx,config		;want to print config error
 28072 00002035 E87E24                  	call	badfil
 28073                                  ;endconv:	; 01/01/2023
 28074 00002038 C3                      	retn

 28078                                  ; entry : multi_pass

 28089 0000203B 803E[CD02]0A            	cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],10
 28090                                  ;jae_endconv:
 28091 00002040 731C                    	jae	short endconv 		; do nothing. just return.
 28092                                  
 28093                                  	; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 28094 00002042 FF36[A302]              	push	word [CONFBOT]

 28096                                  	;push	word [top_of_cdss]
 28097 00002046 07                      	pop	es			; es -> confbot
 28098                                  
 28099 00002047 8B36[5803]              	mov	si,[org_count]
 28100 0000204B 8936[5603]              	mov	[count],si		; set count
 28101 0000204F 31F6                    	xor	si,si ; 0
 28102 00002051 8936[5A03]                      mov     [chrptr],si		; reset chrptr
 28103 00002055 8936[AF02]                      mov     [linecount],si		; reset linecount
 28104                                  
 28105 00002059 E8E121                  	call	getchr
 28106 0000205C EB07                    	jmp	short conflp
 28107

 28109                                  endconv:
 28110 0000205E C3                      	retn	
 28111                                  
 28112                                  getcom:
 28113                                  	; 03/01/2023
 28114                                  	; ds = cs
 28115 0000205F E81816                          call    organize                ; organize the file
 28116 00002062 E8D821                  	call	getchr
 28117                                  conflp: 
 28118 00002065 72F7                    	jc	short endconv
 28119                                  
 28120 00002067 FF06[AF02]                      inc     word [linecount]	; increase linecount
 28121                                  
 28122                                  	; 08/09/2023
 28123 0000206B 30E4                    	xor	ah,ah ; 0
 28124                                  	;mov	byte [multdeviceflag],0	; reset multdeviceflag.
 28125                                  	;mov	byte [setdevmarkflag],0	; reset setdevmarkflag.
 28126 0000206D 8826[C214]              	mov	[multdeviceflag],ah ; 0
 28127 00002071 8826[C514]              	mov	[setdevmarkflag],ah ; 0
 28128                                  
 28129 00002075 3C0A                    	cmp	al,lf			; linefeed?
 28130 00002077 7448                    	je	short blank_line	;  then ignore this line.
 28131                                  
 28132                                  ; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 28133                                  ; (SYSINIT:23CCh)
 28134                                  ; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 28135                                  ;%if 0
 28136                                  
 28137                                  ;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 28138                                  
 28139                                  ;   If this is a genuine CONFIG.SYS command, then there should be a line
 28140                                  ;   number immediately following it....
 28141                                  
 28142 00002079 A2[C014]                        mov     [config_cmd],al         ; save original command code
 28143                                  	;and	al,NOT CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY
 28144 0000207C 247F                    	and	al,~CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY ; and al,7Fh
 28145                                  
 28146                                  	; 08/09/2023
 28147 0000207E 3826[C114]              	cmp	[config_multi],ah ; 0
 28148                                  	;cmp	byte [config_multi],0	; is this a multi-config config.sys?
 28149 00002082 7427                            je      short not_final		; no, line number is not embedded
 28150                                  
 28151 00002084 50                              push    ax                      ;
 28152 00002085 E8B521                          call    getchr                  ; ignore end-of-image errors,
 28153 00002088 88C4                            mov     ah,al                   ; because if there's an error
 28154 0000208A E8B021                          call    getchr                  ; fetching the line number that's
 28155 0000208D 86C4                            xchg    al,ah                   ; supposed to be there, the next
 28156 0000208F A3[AF02]                        mov     [linecount],ax          ; getchr call will get the same error
 28157 00002092 58                              pop     ax
 28158                                  ;
 28159                                  ;   HACK: when 4DOS.COM is the shell and it doesn't have an environment from
 28160                                  ;   which to obtain its original program name, it grovels through all of
 28161                                  ;   memory to find the filename that was used to exec it; it wants to find
 28162                                  ;   the SHELL= line in the in-memory copy of CONFIG.SYS, and it knows that
 28163                                  ;   sysinit converts the SHELL= keyword to an 'S', so it expects to find an 'S'
 28164                                  ;   immediately before the filename, but since we are now storing line # info
 28165                                  ;   in the config.sys memory image, 4DOS fails to find the 'S' in the right
 28166                                  ;   spot.
 28167                                  ;
 28168                                  ;   So, on the final pass of CONFIG.SYS, copy the command code (eg, 'S')
 28169                                  ;   over the line number info, since we no longer need that info anyway. This
 28170                                  ;   relies on the fact that getchr leaves ES:SI pointing to the last byte
 28171                                  ;   retrieved.
 28172                                  ;
 28173 00002093 803E[CD02]02                    cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],2	; final pass?
 28174 00002098 7211                            jb	short not_final		; no
 28175                                          ;test	word [install_flag],have_install_cmd
 28176 0000209A F606[CE02]01            	test	byte [install_flag],have_install_cmd ; 1
 28177 0000209F 7407                            jz	short final		; no install cmds, so yes it is
 28178 000020A1 803E[CD02]03                    cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],3	; final pass?
 28179 000020A6 7203                            jb	short not_final		; no
 28180                                  final:                                  ;
 28181 000020A8 268804                  	mov	[es:si],al		; save backward-compatible command code
 28182                                  not_final:                              ;
 28183                                  ;endif
 28184                                  
 28185                                  ; 31/12/2022
 28186                                  ;%endif ; 27/10/2022
 28187                                  
 28188 000020AB 88C4                    	mov	ah,al
 28189 000020AD E88D21                  	call	getchr
 28190 000020B0 7314                    	jnc	short tryi
 28191                                  
 28192 000020B2 803E[CD02]02            	cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],2
 28193                                  	;jae	short jae_endconv	; do not show badop again for multi_pass.
 28194                                  	; 27/10/2022
 28195 000020B7 73A5                    	jnb	short endconv	
 28196 000020B9 E95608                  	jmp	badop
 28197                                  	
 28198                                  coff:	
 28199                                  	; 11/12/2022
 28200                                  	; ds = cs
 28201                                  	;push	cs
 28202                                  	;pop	ds
 28203 000020BC E87521                  	call	newline
 28204 000020BF EBA4                    	jmp	short conflp	; 13/05/2019
 28205                                  
 28206                                  blank_line:
 28207 000020C1 E87921                  	call	getchr
 28208 000020C4 EB9F                    	jmp	short conflp
 28209                                  
 28210                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 28211                                  ; 11/12/2022
 28212                                  ; (there is not a jump or call to here from anywhere!)
 28213                                  ;coff_p:
 28214                                  	;push	cs
 28215                                  	;pop	ds
 28216                                  
 28217                                  ;to handle install= commands,we are going to use multi-pass.
 28218                                  ;the first pass handles the other commands and only set install_flag when
 28219                                  ;it finds any install command. the second pass will only handle the
 28220                                  ;install= command.
 28221                                  
 28222                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28223                                  ;install command
 28224                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28225                                  
 28226                                  	; 27/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 28227                                  	; (SYSINIT:2250h)
 28228                                  tryi:
 28229 000020C6 803E[CD02]00            	cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],0	; the initial pass for DOS=HI

 28238                                  	;je	short multi_pass_coff

 28240                                  					; we want do some config.sys process
 28241                                  					; after device drivers are loaded
 28242                                  					; and before install= commands
 28243                                  					; are processed

 28245 000020D7 803E[CD02]03            	cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],3	; the third pass for install= ?
 28246 000020DC 741D                    	je	short multi_try_i
 28247 000020DE 80FC48                          cmp     ah, CONFIG_DOS  ; 'H'
 28248                                  	; 11/12/2022
 28249                                  	;je	short multi_pass_coff2

 28252                                  	;je	short multi_pass_coff

 28254                                  ;       make note of any INSTALL= or INSTALLHIGH= commands we find,
 28255                                  ;       but don't process them now.        
 28256                                          
 28257 000020E3 80FC49                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_INSTALL ; 'I'	; install= command?

 28268                                  ; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)

 28271                                  ;%if 0
 28272                                  precheck_installhigh:

 28275                                  	;or	word [install_flag],have_install_cmd
 28276 000020F4 800E[CE02]01            	or	byte [install_flag],have_install_cmd ; 1

 28279                                  
 28280                                  multi_try_i:

 28285                                  	;jne	short multi_pass_filter

 28312                                  ;endif

 28315                                  ;       the standard calls to set the alloc strategy for loading high

 28372                                  ;******************************************************************************
 28373                                  ;									      *
 28374                                  ; function: parse the parameters of buffers= command.			      *
 28375                                  ;									      *
 28376                                  ; input :								      *
 28377                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				      *
 28378                                  ; output:								      *
 28379                                  ;	buffers set							      *
 28380                                  ;	buffer_slash_x	flag set if /x option chosen.			      *
 28381                                  ;	h_buffers set if secondary buffer cache specified.		      *
 28382                                  ;									      *
 28383                                  ; subroutines to be called:						      *
 28384                                  ;	sysinit_parse							      *
 28385                                  ; logic:								      *
 28386                                  ; {									      *
 28387                                  ;	set di points to buf_parms;  /*parse control definition*/	      *
 28388                                  ;	set dx,cx to 0; 						      *
 28389                                  ;	reset buffer_slash_x;						      *
 28390                                  ;	while (end of command line)					      *
 28391                                  ;	{ sysinit_parse;						      *
 28392                                  ;	  if (no error) then						      *
 28393                                  ;	       if (result_val._$P_synonym_ptr == slash_e) then /*not a switch *
 28394                                  ;		    buffer_slash_x = 1					      *
 28395                                  ;	       else if	 (cx == 1) then 	    /* first positional */    *
 28396                                  ;			  buffers = result_val._$P_picked_val;		      *
 28397                                  ;		    else  h_buffers = result_val._$P_picked_val; 	      *
 28398                                  ;	  else	{show error message;error exit} 			      *
 28399                                  ;	};								      *
 28400                                  ;	if (buffer_slash_x is off & buffers > 99) then show_error;	      *
 28401                                  ; };									      *
 28402                                  ;									      *
 28403                                  ;******************************************************************************
 28404                                  
 28405                                  	; 27/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)

 28444                                  	;cmp	word [result_val_swoff],switch_x

 28495                                  ; break command
 28496                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28497                                  
 28498                                  ;****************************************************************************
 28499                                  ;									    *
 28500                                  ; function: parse the parameters of break = command.			    *
 28501                                  ;									    *
 28502                                  ; input :								    *
 28503                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				    *
 28504                                  ; output:								    *
 28505                                  ;	turn the control-c check on or off.				    *
 28506                                  ;									    *
 28507                                  ; subroutines to be called:						    *
 28508                                  ;	sysinit_parse							    *
 28509                                  ; logic:								    *
 28510                                  ; {									    *
 28511                                  ;	set di to brk_parms;						    *
 28512                                  ;	set dx,cx to 0; 						    *
 28513                                  ;	while (end of command line)					    *
 28514                                  ;	{ sysinit_parse;						    *
 28515                                  ;	  if (no error) then						    *
 28516                                  ;	       if (result_val._$P_item_tag == 1) then	  /*on		 */ *
 28517                                  ;		   set p_ctrl_break,on;					    *
 28518                                  ;	       else					  /*off 	 */ *
 28519                                  ;		   set p_ctrl_break,off;				    *
 28520                                  ;	  else {show message;error_exit};				    *
 28521                                  ;	};								    *
 28522                                  ;	if (no error) then						    *
 28523                                  ;	   dos function call to set ctrl_break check according to	    *
 28524                                  ; };									    *
 28525                                  ;									    *
 28526                                  ;****************************************************************************
 28527                                  
 28528                                  	; 27/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 28529                                  	; (SYSINIT:22FFh)
 28530                                  tryc:
 28531 000021C0 80FC43                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_BREAK ; 'C'
 28532 000021C3 7539                    	jne	short trym
 28533                                  
 28534                                  ; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 28535                                  ; (SYSINIT:2527h)
 28536                                  ; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 28537                                  ;%if 0
 28538                                  ;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 28539 000021C5 E8E21E                  	call	query_user              ; query the user if config_cmd
 28540 000021C8 7234                    	jc	short trym		; has the CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY bit set
 28541                                  ;endif
 28542                                  ;%endif ; 27/10/2022
 28543                                  
 28544 000021CA BF[831D]                	mov	di,brk_parms
 28545 000021CD 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx
 28546                                  	; 03/01/2023
 28547                                  	;mov	dx,cx
 28548                                  do22:
 28549 000021CF E82107                  	call	sysinit_parse
 28550 000021D2 7303                    	jnc	short if22		; parse error
 28551                                  	;call	badparm_p		;  show message and end the search loop.
 28552                                  	;;jmp	short sr22
 28553                                  	; 31/12/2022
 28554                                  ;sr22:
 28555                                  	;jmp	coff
 28556                                  	; 03/01/2023
 28557 000021D4 E94B06                  	jmp	badparm_p_coff
 28558                                  if22:
 28559 000021D7 83F8FF                  	cmp	ax,_$P_RC_EOL		; end of line?
 28560 000021DA 7415                    	je	short en22		; then end the $endloop
 28561                                  
 28562                                  	;cmp	byte [result_val_itag],1
 28563 000021DC 803E[7C1D]01            	cmp	byte [result_val+_$P_Result_Blk.Item_Tag],1
 28564 000021E1 7507                    	jne	short if26
 28565

 29170                                  ;	be assigned to. Because some naughty device drivers (like
 29171                                  ;	interlnk) look at the internal DOS variable instead of the
 29172                                  ;	value we pass it, we'll temporarily stick our value into
