 30108                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30109                                  ; setting internal stack parameters
 30110                                  ; stacks=m,n where
 30111                                  ;	m is the number of stacks (range 8 to 64,default 9)
 30112                                  ;	n is the stack size (range 32 to 512 bytes,default 128)
 30113                                  ; j.k. 5/5/86: stacks=0,0 implies no stack installation.
 30114                                  ;	any combinations that are not within the specified limits will
 30115                                  ;	result in "unrecognized command" error.
 30116                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30117                                  
 30118                                  ;**************************************************************************
 30119                                  ;									  *
 30120                                  ; function: parse the parameters of stacks= command.			  *
 30121                                  ;	    the minimum value for "number of stacks" and "stack size" is  *
 30122                                  ;	    8 and 32 each.  in the definition of sysparse value list,they *
 30123                                  ;	    are set to 0.  this is for accepting the exceptional case of  *
 30124                                  ;	    stacks=0,0 case (,which means do not install the stack.)	  *
 30125                                  ;	    so,after sysparse is done,we have to check if the entered	  *
 30126                                  ;	    values (stack_count,stack_size) are within the actual range,  *
 30127                                  ;	    (or if "0,0" pair has been entered.)			  *
 30128                                  ; input :								  *
 30129                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				  *
 30130                                  ; output:								  *
 30131                                  ;	set the variables stack_count,stack_size.			  *
 30132                                  ;									  *
 30133                                  ; subroutines to be called:						  *
 30134                                  ;	sysinit_parse							  *
 30135                                  ; logic:								  *
 30136                                  ; {									  *
 30137                                  ;	set di points to stks_parms;					  *
 30138                                  ;	set dx,cx to 0; 						  *
 30139                                  ;	while (end of command line)					  *
 30140                                  ;	{ sysinit_parse;						  *
 30141                                  ;	  if (no error) then						  *
 30142                                  ;	     { if (cx == 1) then /* first positional = stack count */	  *
 30143                                  ;		   p_stack_count = result_val._$P_picked_val;		  *
 30144                                  ;	       if (cx == 2) then /* second positional = stack size */	  *
 30145                                  ;		   p_stack_size = result_val._$P_picked_val;		  *
 30146                                  ;	     }								  *
 30147                                  ;	  else	/*error exit*/						  *
 30148                                  ;	     error exit;						  *
 30149                                  ;	};								  *
 30150                                  ;	here check p_stack_count,p_stack_size if it meets the condition;  *
 30151                                  ;	if o.k.,then set stack_count,stack_size;			  *
 30152                                  ;	 else error_exit;						  *
 30153                                  ; };									  *
 30154                                  ;**************************************************************************

 30900                                  
 30901                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30902                                  ;set up registers for sysparse
 30903                                  ;in)	es:si -> command line in confbot
 30904                                  ;	di -> offset of the parse control definition.
 30905                                  ;
 30906                                  ;out)	calls sysparse.
 30907                                  ;	carry will set if parse error.
 30908                                  ;	*** the caller should check the eol condition by looking at ax
 30909                                  ;	*** after each call.
 30910                                  ;	*** if no parameters are found,then ax will contain a error code.
 30911                                  ;	*** if the caller needs to look at the synomym@ of the result,
 30912                                  ;	***  the caller should use cs:@ instead of es:@.
 30913                                  ;	cx register should be set to 0 at the first time the caller calls this
 30914                                  ;	 procedure.
 30915                                  ;	ax - exit code
 30916                                  ;	bl - terminated delimeter code
 30917                                  ;	cx - new positional ordinal
 30918                                  ;	si - set to pase scanned operand
 30919                                  ;	dx - selected result buffer
 30920                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------

 31265                                  ; procedure : LieInt12Mem
 31266                                  ;

 31268                                  ;		alloclim set to the limit of low memory.
 31269                                  ;
 31270                                  ;	Output : none
 31271                                  ;
 31272                                  ;	Changes the ROM BIOS variable which stores the total low memory
 31273                                  ;	If a 3com device driver (any character device with name 'PROTMAN$')
 31274                                  ;	is being loaded alloclim is converted into Ks and stored in 40:13h
 31275                                  ;	Else if a device driver being loaded into UMB the DevLoadEnd is
 31276                                  ;	converted into Ks and stored in 40:13h

 31287 0000299E 740A                    	jz	short lim_set		; yes, lie to him differently
 31288                                  	; 13/05/2019
 31289                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:DeviceHi],0	; Is the DD being loaded in UMB
 31290                                  	;je	short limx		; no, don't lie

 31306                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31307                                  ;
 31308                                  ; procedure : SetInt12Mem
 31309                                  ;
 31310                                  ;	Input : AX = Memory size to be set (in paras)
 31311                                  ;	Output : none
 31312                                  ;
 31313                                  ;	Sets the variable 40:13 to the memory size passed in AX
 31314                                  ;	It saves the old value in 40:13 in OldInt12Mem,
 31315                                  ;	It also sets a flag Int12Lied to 0ffh, which is checked before
 31316                                  ;	restoring the value of 40:13
 31317                                  ;
 31318                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31319                                  
 31320                                  	; 01/11/2022
 31321                                  SetInt12Mem:
 31322 000029AA 1E                      	push	ds
 31323 000029AB BB4000                  	mov	bx,40h
 31324 000029AE 8EDB                    	mov	ds,bx			; ROM BIOS Data Segment
 31325 000029B0 8B1E1300                	mov	bx,[13h]		; INT 12 memory variable
 31326 000029B4 2E891E[8B1F]            	mov	[cs:OldInt12Mem],bx	; save it
 31327 000029B9 B106                    	mov	cl,6
 31328 000029BB D3E8                    	shr	ax,cl			; convert paras into Ks
 31329 000029BD A31300                  	mov	[13h],ax		; Lie
 31330 000029C0 2EC606[8A1F]FF          	mov	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0FFh ; mark that we are lying
 31331 000029C6 1F                      	pop	ds
 31332                                  ;limx:
 31333 000029C7 C3                      	retn
 31334                                  
 31335                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31336                                  ;
 31337                                  ; procedure : TrueInt12Mem
 31338                                  ;
 31339                                  ;	Input : Int12Lied = 0 if we are not lying currently
 31340                                  ;			  = 0ffh if we are lying
 31341                                  ;		OldInt12Mem = Saved value of 40:13h
 31342                                  ;
 31343                                  ;	Output : none
 31344                                  ;
 31345                                  ;	Resets the INT 12 Memory variable if we were lying about int 12
 31346                                  ;	and resets the flag which indicates that we were lying
 31347                                  ;
 31348                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31349                                  
 31350                                  TrueInt12Mem:
 31351                                  	; 11/12/2022
 31352                                  	; ds = cs
 31353 000029C8 803E[8A1F]00            	cmp	byte [Int12Lied],0
 31354                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0	; were we lying so far?
 31355                                  	; 01/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYS.INIT:2B1Dh)
 31356                                  	;mov	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0	; reset it anyway
 31357 000029CD 7412                    	je	short timx		; no, we weren't
 31358                                  	; 18/12/2022
 31359 000029CF B84000                  	mov	ax,40h
 31360 000029D2 8826[8A1F]              	mov	[Int12Lied],ah ; 0
 31361                                  	;mov	byte [Int12Lied],0
 31362                                  	;mov	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0
 31363 000029D6 1E                      	push	ds
 31364                                  	;mov	ax,40h
 31365 000029D7 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 31366 000029D9 2EA1[8B1F]              	mov	ax,[cs:OldInt12Mem]
 31367 000029DD A31300                  	mov	[13h],ax		; restore INT 12 memory
 31368 000029E0 1F                      	pop	ds
 31369                                  timx:
 31370 000029E1 C3                      	retn

 31423                                  ; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)

 31426                                  ;include highload.inc	; Routines for devicehigh parsing, control of HIDDEN
 31427                                  ;include highexit.inc	; umb's, etc
 31428                                  
 31429                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 31430                                  ; HIGHLOAD.INC (MSDOS 6.0 - 1991) 	
 31431                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 31432                                  ; 07/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 31433                                  
 31434                                  ;******************************************************************************
 31435                                  ;
 31436                                  ; This file contains routines needed to parse and implement user-given
 31437                                  ; command-line options of the form "/S/L:3,0x500;2;7,127;0x0BE4". InitVar()
 31438                                  ; and Parsevar() are used to parse this data and place it in encoded form into
 31439                                  ; the variables in highvar.inc, for use by the rest of the routines.
 31440                                  ;
 31441                                  ; DeviceHigh accepts this command-line (handled in sysconf.asm, not here):
 31442                                  ;    DEVICEHIGH SIZE=hhhhhh module opts
 31443                                  ; Or, DeviceHigh and LoadHigh accept any of the following:
 31444                                  ;    DH/LH module opts
 31445                                  ;    DH/LH [/S][/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*] module opts
 31446                                  ;    DH/LH [/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*][/S] module opts
 31447                                  ; The initial UMB,SIZE pair designates the module's load address; the remainder
 31448                                  ; of the UMB and SIZE pairs are used to indicate specific UMBs to be left
 31449                                  ; available during the load.
 31450                                  ;
 31451                                  ; When an actual load is ready to be performed, a call to HideUMBs() will
 31452                                  ; temporarily allocate (as owner 8+"HIDDEN  ") all free elements in any
 31453                                  ; upper-memory block which was not specified by the user... in addition, if
 31454                                  ; UMBs were marked to shrink (/S option) to a certain size ("umb,size"), any
 31455                                  ; elements in that umb SAVE the lower-half of the newly-shrunken one are also
 31456                                  ; allocated. After the load, the function UnHideUMBs() (in highexit.inc) will
 31457                                  ; free any UMBs so allocated.
 31458                                  ;
 31459                                  ; When a device driver loads, there is the additional problem of allocating its
 31460                                  ; initial load site; this should be restricted to the first UMB specified on
 31461                                  ; the command-line. The function FreezeUM temporarily allocates all remaining
 31462                                  ; free upper-memory elements (as owner 8+"FROZEN  "), except those in the load
 31463                                  ; UMB. Then the initial allocation may be made, and a call to UnFreeze will
 31464                                  ; return any so-allocated memory elements to FREE, for the true load. Note
 31465                                  ; that UnFreeze leaves HIDDEN elements allocated; it only frees FROZEN ones.
 31466                                  ;
 31467                                  ;******************************************************************************
 31468                                  
 31469                                  SWTCH	equ	'/'		; Switch character
 31470                                  
 31471                                  DOS_CHECK_STRATEGY  equ	5800h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 0 = check alloc strat
 31472                                  DOS_SET_STRATEGY    equ	5801h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 1 = set alloc strategy
 31473                                  DOS_CHECK_UMBLINK   equ	5802h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 2 = check link state
 31474                                  DOS_GET_UMBLINK	    equ 5802h ; 20/04/2019
 31475                                  DOS_SET_UMBLINK     equ	5803h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 3 = set link state
 31476                                  DOS_GET_DOS_LISTS   equ	  52h	; Int 21h, Func 52h = return list of lists
 31477                                  DOS_UMB_HEAD        equ	  8Ch	; Offset from ES (after func52h) to get UMBHead
 31478                                  
 31479                                  CR	equ	0Dh		; Carriage Return
 31480                                  LF	equ	0Ah		; Line Feed
 31481                                  TAB	equ	09h		; Tab character (^I)
 31482                                  
 31483                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31484                                  ;*** InitVar - initializes all the variables used in ParseVar and HideUMBs
 31485                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31486                                  ; ENTRY:       None
 31487                                  ; EXIT:        Variables listed in highvar.inc are initialized
 31488                                  ; ERROR EXIT:  None
 31489                                  ; USES:        Flags, variables in highvar.inc
 31490                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31491                                  ; Note that element 0 references UMB 0 (conventional), not UMB 1. Its contents
 31492                                  ; are largely ignored, but it is initialized nonetheless.
 31493                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31494                                  
 31495                                  ; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 31496                                  ; (SYSINIT:2EEEh)
 31497                                  
 31498                                  InitVar:
 31499                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31500                                  	; ds = cs

 31515                                  	;mov	[es:fInHigh],al		;Set to 1 when DH/LH has been called
 31516                                  	;mov	[es:SegLoad],ax		;Load Address (seg), used for DH only
 31517                                  	;mov	byte [es:UmbLoad],UNSPECIFIED ; 0FFh
 31518                                  	;				;Later is the # of the 1st spec'd UMB
 31519                                  	;mov	[es:fm_argc], al	;Start with zero args having been read
 31520

 31523 00002A11 A2[321F]                	mov	[fUmbTiny],al		;Shrink UMBs? (made 1 if /S given)
 31524 00002A14 A2[311F]                	mov	[fInHigh],al		;Set to 1 when DH/LH has been called
 31525 00002A17 A3[331F]                	mov	[SegLoad],ax		;Load Address (seg), used for DH only
 31526 00002A1A C606[351F]FF            	mov	byte [UmbLoad],UNSPECIFIED ; 0FFh

 31540 00002A30 F3AB                    	rep	stosw			;	Store 0

 31552                                  
 31553                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31554                                  ;*** FixMem - scans the upper memory chain and concatenates adjacent free MCBs
 31555                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31556                                  ; ENTRY   : None
 31557                                  ; EXIT    : None
 31558                                  ; ERROR   : None
 31559                                  ; USES    : Flags, fm_umb, fm_strat
 31560                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31561                                  
 31562                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 31563                                  	; (SYSINIT:2F22h)
 31564                                  FixMem:
 31565                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31566                                  	;push	ax
 31567                                  	;push	bx
 31568                                  	;push	cx
 31569                                  	;push	dx
 31570 00002A34 06                      	push	es
 31571                                  
 31572 00002A35 E84900                  	call	fm_link		; Link in UMBs
 31573                                  
 31574 00002A38 E80002                  	call	UmbHead		; Get first upper-memory MCB address (0x9FFF)
 31575 00002A3B 723F                    	jc	short fmX	; (if couldn't get it, leave now).
 31576                                  
 31577 00002A3D 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax		; It returns in AX, so move it to ES.
 31578                                  
 31579                                  ; - Walk MCB Chain ------------------------------------------------------------
 31580                                  
 31581 00002A3F 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx		; We're keeping the address of the last MCB
 31582 00002A41 89D1                    	mov 	cx,dx		; in CX... and the last owner
 31583 00002A43 42                      	inc	dx		; in dx as we go through the loop:
 31584                                  
 31585                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 31586                                  ; FM10--DX  = last MCB's owner's PSP address
 31587                                  ;       CX  = last MCB's address (segment)
 31588                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 31589                                  
 31590 00002A44 26A00000                fm10:	mov	al,[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE] ; if 'Z', don't repeat loop
 31591 00002A48 268B1E0100              	mov	bx,[es:ARENA.OWNER]	; if not zero, do nothing
 31592 00002A4D 09D3                    	or	bx,dx			; dx was owner of previous MCB
 31593 00002A4F 7516                    	jnz	short fm30		; If not both zero, don't cat.
 31594                                  
 31595                                  	; - Coalesce memory blocks at ES:00 and CX:00 -------------------------
 31596                                  
 31597 00002A51 268B1E0300              fm20:	mov	bx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]	; Grab this block's Size,
 31598 00002A56 8EC1                    	mov	es,cx			; Go back to prev MCB's address
 31599 00002A58 26A20000                	mov	[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE],al ; & move the SECOND sig here
 31600

 31696                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31697                                  ;*** ParseVar - parses [/S][/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*] and builds the table
 31698                                  ; laid out in highvar.inc
 31699                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31700                                  ; ENTRY:    ES:SI points to command tail of LoadHigh/DeviceHigh (whitespace ok)
 31701                                  ; EXIT:     ES:SI points to first character in child program name
 31702                                  ; ERROR:    ES:SI points to character which caused error, carry set, AX == code
 31703                                  ; USES:     ES:SI, AX, flags, variables in highvar.inc
 31704                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31705                                  ; Error codes (in AX if carry set on return):
 31706                                  ;
 31707                                  PV_InvArg	equ	1	; Invalid argument passed
 31708                                  PV_BadUMB	equ	2	; Bad UMB number passed (duplicate?)
 31709                                  PV_InvSwt	equ	3	; Unrecognized switch passed
 31710                                  ;
 31711                                  ; This routine exects ES:SI to point to a string much like the following:
 31712                                  ;    "/S/L:1,200;2 module options"
 31713                                  ; Optionally, the string can begin with whitespace; neither /S nor /L is
 31714                                  ; required, though that's what this routine is supposed to parse.
 31715                                  ;
 31716                                  optS		equ	'S'	; /S
 31717                                  optL		equ	'L'	; /L:...
 31718                                  ;
 31719                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31720                                  ; LoadHigh has a list of arguments, returned by cparse, which is used to create
 31721                                  ; a command-line for spawning a child process. For a typical LH command, say,
 31722                                  ;     lh /l:1,1000;2 print/d:lpt2
 31723                                  ; the arguments would look like (one per line):
 31724                                  ;     lh
 31725                                  ;     /l
 31726                                  ;     1
 31727                                  ;     1000
 31728                                  ;     2
 31729                                  ;     print
 31730                                  ;     /d
 31731                                  ;     :lpt2
 31732                                  ; In short, if "print" were, say, "43", there'd be no way to determine which
 31733                                  ; arg was the filename. So, inside this routine, we keep a running counter
 31734                                  ; of the number of arguments LH will need to skip in order to get to the
 31735                                  ; program name. The "lh" is implicit--it'll always have to skip that. So if
 31736                                  ; there's no "/l" or "/s", fm_argc will be 0 ... other than that, 1 is added
 31737                                  ; for:
 31738                                  ;    Each /L
 31739                                  ;    Each /S (there should be only one)
 31740                                  ;    Each UMB number (they follow ":" or ";")
 31741                                  ;    Each UMB size   (they follow ",")
 31742                                  ; So, in the above example, fm_argc would be 4-- and LH would skip right to
 31743                                  ; "print".  Note that InitVar initializes fm_argc to zero.
 31744                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31745                                  
 31746                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 31747                                  	; (SYSINIT:2F9Fh)
 31748                                  
 31749                                  ParseVar:
 31750                                  	;pushreg <di, ds, es>
 31751                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31752                                  	;push	di ; * ; (not required) ; 01/01/2023
 31753 00002A9E 1E                      	push	ds
 31754 00002A9F 06                      	push	es
 31755                                  
 31756 00002AA0 06                      	push	es		; Make DS:SI point to it, as well as ES:SI
 31757 00002AA1 1F                      	pop	ds		; (regardless if we're in devhigh or loadhigh)
 31758 00002AA2 FC                      	cld
 31759                                  
 31760                                  ; ------------------------------------------------
 31761                                  ; PV10--ES:SI = any whitespace on the command-line
 31762                                  ; ------------------------------------------------
 31763                                  
 31764 00002AA3 AC                      pv10:	lodsb			; here, ES:SI=="  /L..."--must eat whitespace
 31765 00002AA4 E8A200                  	call	isWhite
 31766 00002AA7 74FA                    	jz	short pv10	;       ES:SI==" /L..."--keep eating.
 31767                                  	;cmp	al,'/'
 31768 00002AA9 3C2F                    	cmp	al,SWTCH
 31769 00002AAB 7404                    	je	short pv20	;       ES:SI=="/L..."--go process a switch
 31770                                  
 31771 00002AAD 4E                      	dec	si		; Backup--it's now "odule options", and we need
 31772 00002AAE F8                      	clc			; that "m" we just read (or whatever it is).
 31773 00002AAF EB2B                    	jmp	short pvX	; Then return with carry clear == we're done.
 31774                                  
 31775 00002AB1 AC                      pv20:	lodsb			; Just read 'S' or 'L', hopefully
 31776                                  	;toUpper al		; So we make it upper-case, and...
 31777 00002AB2 24DF                    	and	al,0DFh
 31778                                  	;cmp	al,'S'
 31779 00002AB4 3C53                    	cmp	al,optS		; just read 'S'?
 31780 00002AB6 750D                    	jne	short pv30
 31781                                  
 31782                                  	;call	incArgc		; If it's /S, it's another arg for LH to skip.
 31783 00002AB8 2EFE06[681F]            	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 19/04/2019
 31784                                  
 31785                                  	;putdata fUmbTiny,1	; /S, so ES:SI=="  /L..." or " module opts", or
 31786                                  	;
 31787                                  	;push	es
 31788                                  	;push	cs
 31789                                  	;pop	es
 31790                                  	;mov	[es:fUmbTiny],1	
 31791                                  	;pop	es
 31792                                  
 31793 00002ABD 2EC606[321F]01          	mov	byte [cs:fUmbTiny],1
 31794                                  
 31795 00002AC3 EBDE                    	jmp	short pv10	; possibly even "/L...".
 31796                                  
 31797                                  pv30:	;cmp	al,'L'
 31798 00002AC5 3C4C                    	cmp	al,optL		; If it's not 'L' either, then 'tis a bad
 31799 00002AC7 750D                    	jne	short pvE1		; switch!
 31800                                  
 31801                                  	;call	incArgc		; If it's /L, it's another arg for LH to skip.
 31802 00002AC9 2EFE06[681F]            	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 19/04/2019
 31803                                  
 31804 00002ACE E80E00                  	call	parseL
 31805 00002AD1 73D0                    	jnc	short pv10	; If no carry, go back and look for more
 31806                                  
 31807 00002AD3 4E                      	dec	si		; Else, back up and exit.
 31808 00002AD4 EB03                    	jmp	short pvErr	; AX has already been set by parseL
 31809                                  
 31810                                  pvE1:	;mov	ax,3
 31811 00002AD6 B80300                  	mov	ax,PV_InvSwt	; Unrecognized switch passed
 31812 00002AD9 4E                      pvErr:	dec	si
 31813 00002ADA 4E                      	dec	si
 31814 00002ADB F9                      	stc
 31815                                  pvX:	;popreg	<es, ds, di>
 31816 00002ADC 07                      	pop	es
 31817 00002ADD 1F                      	pop	ds
 31818                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31819                                  	;pop	di ; * ; (not required) ; 01/01/2023
 31820 00002ADE C3                      	retn
 31821                                  
 31822                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31823                                  ;*** parseL - parses ":nnnn[,nnnn][;nnnn[,nnnn]]*" for ParseVar
 31824                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31825                                  ; ENTRY:    ES:SI points to colon
 31826                                  ; EXIT:     ES:SI points to first character not parsed
 31827                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set; rewind three characters and return (see ParseVar)
 31828                                  ; USES:     ES:SI, flags, AX, CX, DX, variables in highvar.inc
 31829                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31830                                  ; If the string here is terminated with anything other than whitespace or a
 31831                                  ; switchchar (perhaps it's /S or another /L:... ), then we return with carry
 31832                                  ; set, indicating that they've screwed up the syntax.  The 3-character rewind
 31833                                  ; makes sure the app /L: is reported as being the culprit.
 31834                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31835                                  
 31836                                  parseL:
 31837 00002ADF AC                      	lodsb
 31838 00002AE0 3C3A                    	cmp	al,':'		; Make sure they did /L:
 31839 00002AE2 754E                    	jne	short plE1	; If they didn't, return with carry set.
 31840                                  
 31841                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 31842                                  ; PL10--ES:SI = a UMB number, after /L: or ;
 31843                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 31844                                  
 31845 00002AE4 E8DB00                  pl10:	call	GetXNum		; After this, 'tis ",size" or ";umb" or " mod"
 31846 00002AE7 724F                    	jc	short plE2	; And error if it's a bad number.
 31847 00002AE9 E89D01                  	call	convUMB		; Convert any address to a UMB number
 31848                                  
 31849 00002AEC 88C1                    	mov	cl,al		; Remember the UMB number
 31850 00002AEE E87600                  	call	stowUMB		; Mark this UMB # as used;
 31851 00002AF1 7245                    	jc	short plE2	; If it was already marked, it'll error
 31852                                  
 31853                                  	;call	incArgc		; Each UMB number is another arg for LH to skip
 31854 00002AF3 2EFE06[681F]            	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 31855                                  
 31856 00002AF8 AC                      	lodsb
 31857 00002AF9 3C3B                    	cmp	al,';'		; Did "umb;" ?
 31858 00002AFB 74E7                    	je	short pl10	; Yep: go back and get another UMB.
 31859                                  
 31860 00002AFD E84900                  	call	isWhite		; Did "umb " ?
 31861 00002B00 743B                    	jz	short plX	; Yep: return (it'll go back to whitespace)
 31862                                  
 31863 00002B02 E83900                  	call	isEOL		; Did "umb" ?
 31864 00002B05 7435                    	jz	short plSwX	; If so, backup and exit like everything's ok
 31865                                  
 31866                                  	;cmp	al,'/'
 31867 00002B07 3C2F                    	cmp	al,SWTCH 	; Did "umb/" ? (as in, "/L:1,100;2/S")
 31868 00002B09 7431                    	je	short plSwX	; If so, back up ES:SI one character and return
 31869                                  
 31870 00002B0B 3C2C                    	cmp	al,','		; Did "umb," ?
 31871 00002B0D 7523                    	jne	short plE1	; Just what the heck DID they do? Return error.
 31872                                  
 31873                                  ; --- Read a size -------------------------------------------------------------
 31874                                  
 31875 00002B0F E8B000                  	call	GetXNum		; Stop on "size;" or "size " or anything else
 31876 00002B12 721E                    	jc	short plE1	; And error if it's a bad size.
 31877                                  
 31878 00002B14 E81601                  	call	toPara		; Convert from bytes to paragraphs
 31879                                  
 31880 00002B17 E8CE01                  	call	stowSiz		; CL still has the UMB number for this routine
 31881                                  
 31882                                  	;call	incArgc		; Each UMB size is another arg for LH to skip
 31883 00002B1A 2EFE06[681F]            	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 31884                                  
 31885 00002B1F AC                      	lodsb
 31886 00002B20 3C3B                    	cmp	al,';'		; They did "umb,size;", so get another UMB.
 31887 00002B22 74C0                    	je	short pl10	;
 31888                                  
 31889 00002B24 E82200                  	call	isWhite		; Did it end with whitespace?
 31890 00002B27 7414                    	jz	short plX	; If so, we're done here--go back.
 31891                                  
 31892 00002B29 E81200                  	call	isEOL		; Did they do "umb,size" and end??? (stupid)
 31893 00002B2C 740E                    	jz	short plSwX	; If so, backup and exit like everything's ok
 31894                                  
 31895                                  	;cmp	al,'/'
 31896 00002B2E 3C2F                    	cmp	al,SWTCH	; Did they do "umb,size/" ?
 31897 00002B30 740A                    	je	short plSwX	; If so, again, we're done here.
 31898                                  plE1:	
 31899                                  	;mov	ax,1
 31900 00002B32 B80100                  	mov	ax,PV_InvArg	; If not, we don't know WHAT they did...
 31901 00002B35 4E                      	dec	si
 31902 00002B36 F9                      	stc
 31903 00002B37 C3                      	retn
 31904                                  
 31905                                  plE2:	;mov	ax,2
 31906 00002B38 B80200                  	mov	ax,PV_BadUMB	; In this case, they've specified a UMB twice
 31907                                  	; 12/12/2022
 31908                                  	; cf=1
 31909                                  	;stc
 31910 00002B3B C3                      	retn
 31911                                  plSwX:	
 31912 00002B3C 4E                      	dec	si		; If we hit a '/' character, back up one char
 31913                                  				; so the whitespace checker will see it too.
 31914                                  plX:	; 12/12/2022
 31915                                  	; cf=0
 31916                                  	;clc			; Then just return with carry clear, so
 31917 00002B3D C3                      	retn			; ParseVar will go about its business.
 31918

 31944                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31945                                  ;*** isEOL - returns with ZF set if AL contains CR or LF, or 0
 31946                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31947                                  ; ENTRY:    AL contains character to test
 31948                                  ; EXIT:     ZF set iff AL contains CR or LF, or 0
 31949                                  ; ERROR:    None
 31950                                  ; USES:     ZF
 31951                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31952                                  
 31953                                  isEOL:
 31954 00002B3E 3C00                    	cmp	al,0		; Null-terminator
 31955 00002B40 7406                    	je	short ieX
 31956 00002B42 3C0D                    	cmp	al,CR ; 0Dh	; Carriage Return
 31957 00002B44 7402                    	je	short ieX

 31959                                  ieX:	
 31960 00002B48 C3                      	retn
 31961                                  
 31962                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31963                                  ;*** isWhite - returns with ZF set if AL contains whitespace (or "=")
 31964                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31965                                  ; ENTRY:    AL contains character to test
 31966                                  ; EXIT:     ZF set iff AL contains space, tab, or equals
 31967                                  ; ERROR:    None
 31968                                  ; USES:     ZF
 31969                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31970                                  
 31971                                  isWhite:
 31972 00002B49 3C20                    	cmp	al,' '		; Space
 31973 00002B4B 7406                    	je	short iwX

 31975 00002B4F 7402                    	je	short iwX
 31976 00002B51 3C09                    	cmp	al,tab ; 9	; Tab
 31977                                  iwX:	
 31978 00002B53 C3                      	retn

 32031                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32032                                  ;*** stowUMB - marks a given UMB as used, if it hasn't been so marked before
 32033                                  ;            -- accepts a UMB # in AL, and makes sure it hasn't yet been
 32034                                  ; listed in the /L:... chain. If it's the first one specified, it sets UmbLoad
 32035                                  ; to that UMB #... and in any case, it marks the UMB as specified.
 32036                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32037                                  ; ENTRY:    AL contains UMB number, as specified by the user
 32038                                  ; EXIT:     None
 32039                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set if UMB # is less than 0 or >= MAXUMB (see highvar.inc)
 32040                                  ; USES:     AX, Flags, variables in highvar.inc
 32041                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32042                                  
 32043                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2
 32044                                  stowUMB:
 32045 00002B67 3C10                    	cmp	al,MAXUMB ; 16
 32046 00002B69 7202                    	jb	short su10
 32047 00002B6B F9                      	stc
 32048 00002B6C C3                      	retn			; Ooops-- UMB>=MAXUMB
 32049                                  su10:	
 32050                                  	; 01/01/2023
 32051                                  	;push	bx
 32052                                  	;push	di
 32053                                  	;push	si
 32054                                  	;push	ds
 32055                                  	;push	es
 32056                                  	;push	cs
 32057                                  	;pop	es
 32058                                  	;push	cs
 32059                                  	;pop	ds
 32060                                  
 32061                                  	; 01/01/2023
 32062                                  	; ds <> cs
 32063                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:UmbLoad],0FFh

 32065                                  				; If this, we haven't been here before
 32066 00002B73 7504                    	jne	short su20
 32067 00002B75 2EA2[351F]              	mov	[cs:UmbLoad],al	; So remember this UMB as the load UMB slot.
 32068                                  
 32069                                  	;;cmp	byte [UmbLoad],0FFh
 32070                                  	;cmp	byte [UmbLoad],UNSPECIFIED ; If this, we haven't been here before
 32071                                  	;jne	short su20
 32072                                  	;mov	[UmbLoad],al	; So remember this UMB as the load UMB slot.
 32073                                  su20:	
 32074 00002B79 08C0                    	or	al,al		; If they gave UMB 0, there's really nothing
 32075 00002B7B 740E                    	jz	short su30	; that we should do here.
 32076                                  
 32077                                  	;mov	bl,al
 32078                                  	;xor	bh,bh
 32079                                  	;mov	ax,1		; Now, AX = 1, and BX = UMB Number
 32080                                  	; 01/01/2023
 32081 00002B7D 30E4                    	xor	ah,ah
 32082 00002B7F 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax
 32083 00002B81 B001                    	mov	al,1
 32084                                  
 32085                                  	;xchg	[es:bx+UmbUsed],al
 32086                                  	; 01/01/2023

 32088

 32090                                  	;jz	short su30	; means an error.

 32097                                  su30:

 32144                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32145                                  ;*** toDigit - converts a character-digit to its binary counterpart
 32146                                  ;            -- verifies that CL contains a valid character-digit; if so, it
 32147                                  ; changes CL to its counterpart binary digit ((CL-'0') or (CL-'A'+10)).
 32148                                  ; A-F are considered valid iff gnradix is 16.
 32149                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32150                                  ; ENTRY:    CL contains a digit ('0' to '9' or, if gnradix==16, 'A' to 'F')
 32151                                  ; EXIT:     CL contains digit in binary (0 to 9 or, if gnradix==16, 0 to 15)
 32152                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set indicates invalid digit; carry clear indicates good digit
 32153                                  ; USES:     CL, Flags
 32154                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32155                                  ; If the string is preceeded with "0x", the value is read as hexadecimal; else,
 32156                                  ; as decimal. After a read, you may check the radix by examining gnradix--it
 32157                                  ; will be 10 or 16.
 32158                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32159                                  
 32160                                  gnradix:
 32161 00002B8C 0000                    	dw	0		; Must be a word--16x16 multiplication
 32162                                  
 32163                                  toDigit:
 32164 00002B8E 2E833E[8C2B]10          	cmp	word [cs:gnradix],16
 32165 00002B94 751C                    	jne	short td20	; Don't check hex digits if radix isn't 16
 32166                                  
 32167                                  toDigit_hex:
 32168 00002B96 80F961                  	cmp	cl,'a'	; 61h
 32169 00002B99 7209                    	jb	short td10
 32170 00002B9B 80F966                  	cmp	cl,'f'	; 66h
 32171 00002B9E 7720                    	ja	short tdE	; Nothing valid above 'z' at all...
 32172 00002BA0 80E957                  	sub	cl,'a'-10 ; 57h	; Make 'a'==10 and return.
 32173                                  	;clc			; <- CLC is implicit from last SUB
 32174 00002BA3 C3                      	retn
 32175                                  td10:	
 32176 00002BA4 80F941                  	cmp	cl,'A'  ; 41h
 32177 00002BA7 7209                    	jb	short td20	; Below 'A'?  Not a letter...
 32178 00002BA9 80F946                  	cmp	cl,'F'	; 46h
 32179 00002BAC 7712                    	ja	short tdE	; Above 'F'?  Not a digit.
 32180 00002BAE 80E937                  	sub	cl,'A'-10 ; 37h	; Make 'A'==10 and return.
 32181                                  	;clc			; <- CLC is implicit from last SUB
 32182 00002BB1 C3                      	retn
 32183                                  toDigit_dec:
 32184                                  td20:	
 32185 00002BB2 80F930                  	cmp	cl,'0'		; If less than zero,
 32186                                  	;jb	short tdE	; Done.
 32187 00002BB5 720A                    	jb	short tdEr ; 08/04/2019
 32188 00002BB7 80F939                  	cmp	cl,'9'		; Or, if greater than nine,
 32189 00002BBA 7704                    	ja	short tdE	; Done.
 32190 00002BBC 80E930                  	sub	cl,'0'	; 30h	; Okay--make '0'==0 and return.
 32191                                  	;clc			; <- CLC is implicit from last SUB
 32192 00002BBF C3                      	retn
 32193                                  tdE:	
 32194 00002BC0 F9                      	stc
 32195                                  tdEr:		; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0	
 32196 00002BC1 C3                      	retn
 32197                                  
 32198                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32199                                  ;*** GetXNum - reads a 32-bit ASCII number at ES:SI and returns it in DX:AX
 32200                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32201                                  ; ENTRY:    ES:SI points to an ascii string to scan
 32202                                  ; EXIT:     ES:SI moved to first invalid digit, DX:AX contains value read
 32203                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set if # is too big, or has no digits (EOL possibly)
 32204                                  ; USES:     ES:SI, DX, AX, Flags, gnradix
 32205                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32206                                  ; If the string is preceeded with "0x", the value is read as hexadecimal; else,
 32207                                  ; as decimal. After a read, you may check the radix by examining gnradix--it
 32208                                  ; will be 10 or 16.
 32209                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32210                                  
 32211                                  ; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 32212                                  
 32213                                  ; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 32214                                  ; (SYSINIT:3109h)
 32215                                  
 32216                                  GetXNum:
 32217                                  	;pushreg <bx, cx, ds>
 32218                                  	; 01/01/2023
 32219                                  	;push	bx
 32220 00002BC2 51                      	push	cx ; *
 32221                                  	;push	ds
 32222                                  
 32223 00002BC3 FC                      	cld
 32224 00002BC4 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 32225 00002BC6 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx
 32226 00002BC8 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx
 32227 00002BCA 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx			; Start with 0 (makes sense)
 32228                                  
 32229 00002BCC 2EC706[8C2B]0A00        	mov	word [cs:gnradix],10	; And default to a radix of 10 (dec)
 32230                                  
 32231 00002BD3 268A0C                  	mov	cl,[es:si]		; Now AX=0, BX=0, CH=0/CL=char, DX=0
 32232                                  	;call	toDigit
 32233 00002BD6 E8D9FF                  	call	toDigit_dec
 32234                                  	;jc	short gxnE		; If it's not a digit, leave now.
 32235                                  	; 01/01/2023
 32236 00002BD9 7233                    	jc	short gxnX
 32237                                  
 32238 00002BDB 08C9                    	or	cl,cl
 32239 00002BDD 7517                    	jnz	short gxn20		; Doesn't have '0x'
 32240 00002BDF 268A4C01                	mov	cl,[es:si+1]
 32241 00002BE3 80F978                  	cmp	cl,'x'			; Either 'x'...
 32242 00002BE6 7405                    	je	short gxn10
 32243 00002BE8 80F958                  	cmp	cl,'X'			; ...or 'X' means it's hexadecimal
 32244 00002BEB 7509                    	jne	short gxn20
 32245                                  
 32246                                  gxn10:	
 32247 00002BED 2EC706[8C2B]1000        	mov	word [cs:gnradix], 16
 32248 00002BF4 46                      	inc	si			; Since we read "0x", march over it.
 32249 00002BF5 46                      	inc	si
 32250                                  
 32251                                  ; ------------------------------------------------------
 32252                                  ; GXN20--ES:SI = a digit in a number; if not, we're done
 32253                                  ;        DX:AX = current total
 32254                                  ;        BX    = 0
 32255                                  ;        CH    = 0
 32256                                  ; ------------------------------------------------------
 32257                                  
 32258                                  gxn20:	
 32259 00002BF6 268A0C                  	mov	cl,[es:si]	; Now DX:AX=current total, CH=0/CL=char
 32260 00002BF9 46                      	inc	si
 32261                                  
 32262 00002BFA E891FF                  	call	toDigit		; Accepts only valid digits, A-F -> 10-16
 32263 00002BFD 720D                    	jc	short gxnQ	; <- Ah... wasn't a digit. Stop.
 32264                                  
 32265 00002BFF E80E00                  	call	mul32		; Multiply DX:AX by gnradix
 32266 00002C02 720A                    	jc	short gxnX	; (if it's too big, error out)
 32267                                  
 32268 00002C04 01C8                    	add	ax,cx		; Add the digit
 32269 00002C06 11DA                    	adc	dx,bx		; (BX is 0!)--Adds 1 iff last add wrapped
 32270                                  	;jc	short gxnX	; If _that_ wrapped, it's too big.
 32271                                  	;jmp	short gxn20
 32272 00002C08 73EC                    	jnc	short gxn20
 32273                                  gxnE:	
 32274                                  	;stc			; In this case, we need to set the carry
 32275 00002C0A EB02                    	jmp	short gxnX	; and leave--there were no digits given.
 32276                                  gxnQ:	
 32277 00002C0C 4E                      	dec	si		; Don't read in the offensive character.
 32278 00002C0D F8                      	clc			; And clear carry, so they know it's okay.
 32279                                  gxnX:	
 32280                                  	; 01/01/2023
 32281                                  	;pop	ds
 32282 00002C0E 59                      	pop	cx ; *
 32283                                  	;pop	bx
 32284 00002C0F C3                      	retn
 32285                                  
 32286                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32287                                  ;*** mul32 - multiplies the number in DX:AX by gnradix
 32288                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32289                                  ; ENTRY:   DX:AX = the number to be multiplied, BX = 0, gnradix = multiplier
 32290                                  ; EXIT:    DX:AX has been multiplied by gnradix if carry clear; BX still 0
 32291                                  ; ERROR:   Carry set if number was too large
 32292                                  ; USES:    Flags, AX, DX
 32293                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32294                                  
 32295                                  mul32:
 32296 00002C10 50                      	push	ax		; DX=old:hi, AX=old:lo, TOS=old:lo, BX=0
 32297 00002C11 89D0                    	mov	ax,dx		; DX=old:hi, AX=old:hi, TOS=old:lo, BX=0
 32298 00002C13 2EF726[8C2B]            	mul	word [cs:gnradix] ; DX=?, AX=new:hi, TOS=old:lo, BX=0
 32299 00002C18 7211                    	jc	short m32E	; Too big?
 32300                                  
 32301 00002C1A 89C2                    	mov	dx,ax		; DX=new:hi, AX=new:hi, TOS=old:lo, BX=0
 32302 00002C1C 58                      	pop	ax		; DX=new:hi, AX=old:lo, TOS=orig, BX=0
 32303                                  
 32304 00002C1D 87D3                    	xchg	dx,bx		; DX=0, AX=old:lo, TOS=orig, BX=new:hi
 32305 00002C1F 2EF726[8C2B]            	mul	word [cs:gnradix] ; DX=carry,  AX=new:lo, TOS=orig, BX=new:hi
 32306 00002C24 87D3                    	xchg	dx,bx		; DX=new:hi, AX=new:lo, TOS=orig, BX=carry
 32307 00002C26 01DA                    	add	dx,bx		; DX=new:hi, AX=new:lo, TOS=orig, BX=carry
 32308 00002C28 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx		; DX=new:hi, AX=new:lo, TOS=orig, BX=0
 32309 00002C2A C3                      	retn
 32310                                  m32E:	
 32311 00002C2B 58                      	pop	ax
 32312 00002C2C C3                      	retn
 32313                                  
 32314                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32315                                  ;*** toPara - divides DX:AX by 16; result in AX only (discards extra DX data)
 32316                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32317                                  ; ENTRY:   DX:AX = the number to be divided
 32318                                  ; EXIT:    Interpereting DX:AX as bytes, AX=paragraph equivalent, 0xFFFF max
 32319                                  ; ERROR:   None
 32320                                  ; USES:    Flags, AX, DX
 32321                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32322                                  ; Note: The 386 has a 32-bit SHR, which would work perfectly for this... but we
 32323                                  ;       can't ensure a 386 host machine. Sorry.
 32324                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32325                                  
 32326                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2
 32327                                  toPara:
 32328 00002C2D 51                      	push	cx		; DX:AX=HHHH hhhh hhhh hhhh:LLLL llll llll llll
 32329                                  
 32330 00002C2E B104                    	mov	cl,4		;
 32331 00002C30 D3E8                    	shr	ax,cl		; DX:AX=HHHH hhhh hhhh hhhh:0000 LLLL llll llll
 32332 00002C32 92                      	xchg	ax,dx		; DX:AX=0000 LLLL llll llll:HHHH hhhh hhhh hhhh
 32333 00002C33 B10C                    	mov	cl,12
 32334 00002C35 D3E0                    	shl	ax,cl		; DX:AX=0000 LLLL llll llll:hhhh 0000 0000 0000
 32335 00002C37 09D0                    	or	ax,dx		;    AX=hhhh LLLL llll llll
 32336                                  
 32337 00002C39 59                      	pop	cx
 32338 00002C3A C3                      	retn

 32340                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32341                                  ;*** UmbHead - returns in AX the address of the first UMB block (0x9FFF)
 32342                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32343                                  ; ENTRY:  Nothing
 32344                                  ; EXIT:   AX contains 0x9FFF for most systems
 32345                                  ; ERROR:  Carry set if pointer is 0xFFFF (if not set up yet--DH runs into this)
 32346                                  ; USES:   Flags, AX
 32347                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32348                                  ; Early in the boot-cycle, the pointer used to obtain this value isn't set up;
 32349                                  ; to be precise, before a UMB provider is around. In this event, the pointer
 32350                                  ; is always set to 0xFFFF; it changes once a provider is around. On most
 32351                                  ; machines (all of 'em I've seen), it changes to 0x9FFF at that point.
 32352                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32353                                  
 32354                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 32355                                  UmbHead:
 32356                                  	; 13/05/2019 (because of callers, pushs & pops are not needed here)
 32357                                  
 32358                                  	;push	si ; ?
 32359                                  	;push	ds ; ? 
 32360                                  	;push	es
 32361                                  	;push	bx ; *	
 32362                                  
 32363                                  	; 09/04/2019
 32364                                  	; !!! No need to save es,bx,ds,si above !!! (es,bx are changed here)
 32365                                  
 32366 00002C3B B452                    	mov	ah,GET_IN_VARS		; Call int 21h, function 52h...
 32367 00002C3D CD21                    	int	21h
 32368                                  
 32369 00002C3F 26A18C00                	mov	ax,[es:DOS_UMB_HEAD]	; And read what's in ES:[008C]
 32370                                  	
 32371                                  	; 01/01/2023
 32372 00002C43 83F8FF                  	cmp	ax,0FFFFh
 32373 00002C46 F5                      	cmc
 32374                                  	; if AX=0FFFFh -> CF=1
 32375 00002C47 C3                      	retn
 32376                                  
 32377                                  ; 01/01/2023

 32385                                  ;	retn

 32397                                  ;*** isSysMCB - sets ZF if ES points to an MCB owned by "SC" + (8 or 9)
 32398                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32399                                  ; ENTRY:  ES:0 should point to a valid MCB
 32400                                  ; EXIT:   ZF set if owned by SC+8 or SC+9 (for japan)
 32401                                  ; USES:   Flags
 32402                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32403                                  
 32404                                  isSysMCB:
 32405                                  	;push	ax
 32406

 32408                                  	;cmp	ax,SystemPSPOwner	; 8 (for US OR Japan) is valid
 32409                                  	;je	short ism10
 32410                                  	;cmp	ax,JapanPSPOwner	; 9 (for Japan) is valid
 32411                                  	;;je	short ism10
 32412                                  	;;jmp	short ismX		; Anything else isn't.
 32413                                  	;jne	short ismX
 32414 00002C48 26833E010008            	cmp	word [es:ARENA.OWNER],SystemPSPOwner ; 8  ; 09/04/2019
 32415 00002C4E 7507                    	jne	short ismX 
 32416                                  ism10:	
 32417                                  	;mov	ax,[es:ARENA.NAME]	; Check the name...
 32418                                  	;cmp	ax,'SC' ; 4353h
 32419 00002C50 26813E08005343          	cmp	word [es:ARENA.NAME],'SC'
 32420                                  ismX:	
 32421                                  	;pop	ax
 32422 00002C57 C3                      	retn

 32424                                  ; 09/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 32425                                  
 32426                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32427                                  ;*** AddrToUmb - converts a segment address in AX to its appropriate UMB number
 32428                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32429                                  ; ENTRY:  AX contains a segment address
 32430                                  ; EXIT:   AX will contain the UMB number which contains the address (0==conv)
 32431                                  ; ERROR:  If the address is above UM Range, AX will return as FFFF.
 32432                                  ; USES:   Flags, AX
 32433                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32434                                  ; An address in the following areas is treated as:
 32435                                  ;    0      <-> umbhead (0x9FFF)          = Conventional memory
 32436                                  ;    0x9FFF <-> addr of first UM sys MCB  = UMB #1
 32437                                  ;      ...
 32438                                  ;    addr of last UM sys MCB <-> TOM      = invalid; returns #0xFFFF
 32439                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32440                                  
 32441                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2
 32442                                  AddrToUmb:
 32443                                  	; 01/01/2023
 32444                                  	;push	cx
 32445                                  	;push	dx
 32446 00002C58 06                      	push	es
 32447                                  
 32448 00002C59 89C2                    	mov	dx,ax		; DX = address to search for
 32449                                  
 32450 00002C5B E8DDFF                  	call	UmbHead		; AX = first segment
 32451 00002C5E 7222                    	jc	short atuE	; If it couldn't get it, error out.
 32452                                  
 32453                                  	; 22/07/2023
 32454                                  	;mov	es,ax ; *	; ES = first UMB segment
 32455 00002C60 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx ; 0	; Pretend we're on UMB 0 for now... (cx = UMB#)
 32456                                  
 32457                                  	; 22/07/2023
 32458                                  atu10:
 32459 00002C62 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax ; * ; ** ; 22/07/2023
 32460                                  ; ----------------------------------------
 32461                                  ; ATU10--ES - Current MCB address
 32462                                  ;        DX - Address given for conversion
 32463                                  ;        CX - Current UMB #
 32464                                  ; ----------------------------------------
 32465                                  
 32466                                  ;atu10:	
 32467                                  	;mov	ax,es ; * ; 18/07/2023
 32468 00002C64 39D0                            cmp	ax,dx		; Present segment >= given segment?
 32469 00002C66 731D                    	jae	short atuX	; Yep--done.
 32470                                  
 32471 00002C68 E8DDFF                  	call	isSysMCB	; Returns with ZF set if this is a system MCB
 32472 00002C6B 7501                    	jnz	short atu20
 32473                                  
 32474 00002C6D 41                      	inc	cx		; If it _was_ a system MCB, we're in a new UMB.
 32475                                  atu20:	
 32476                                  	;mov	al,[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE]
 32477                                  	;cmp	al,arena_signature_end  ; 'Z'
 32478                                  	; 22/07/2023
 32479                                  	; ax = es
 32480                                  	;mov	ax,es ; **
 32481 00002C6E 2603060300              	add	ax,[es:ARENA.SIZE]
 32482 00002C73 26803E00005A            	cmp	byte [es:ARENA.SIGNATURE],arena_signature_end
 32483 00002C79 7403                    	je	short atu30		; 'Z' means this was the last MCB... that's it.
 32484                                  
 32485                                  	;NextMCB es,ax
 32486                                  
 32487                                  	;mov	ax,es ; **
 32488                                  	;;add	ax,[es:3]
 32489                                  	;add	ax,[es:ARENA.SIZE]
 32490 00002C7B 40                      	inc	ax
 32491                                  	; 22/07/2023
 32492                                  	;mov	es,ax ; *
 32493 00002C7C EBE4                    	jmp	short atu10
 32494                                  
 32495                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32496                                  ; if we get to atu30, they specified a number that was past the last MCB.
 32497                                  ; make sure it's not _inside_ that MCB before we return an error condition.
 32498                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32499                                  
 32500                                  atu30:	
 32501                                  	; 22/07/2023
 32502                                  	; ax = es + [es:ARENA.SIZE] 
 32503                                  	;mov	ax,es ; **
 32504                                  	;add	ax,[es:ARENA.SIZE] ; **
 32505 00002C7E 39D0                    	cmp	ax,dx		; Present >= given?
 32506 00002C80 7303                    	jae	short atuX	; Yep! It _was_ inside.
 32507                                  atuE:	
 32508 00002C82 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx ; 0	; Else, fall through with UMB # == -1
 32509 00002C84 49                      	dec	cx		; (that makes it return 0xFFFF and sets CF)
 32510                                  atuX:	
 32511 00002C85 89C8                    	mov	ax,cx		; Return the UMB number in AX
 32512                                  	
 32513 00002C87 07                      	pop	es	
 32514                                  	; 01/01/2023
 32515                                  	;pop	dx
 32516                                  	;pop	cx
 32517 00002C88 C3                      	retn
 32518                                  
 32519                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32520                                  ;*** convUMB - checks after GetXNum to convert an address to a UMB number
 32521                                  ;            -- if GetXNum read a hex number, we interperete that as a segment
 32522                                  ; address rather than a UMB number... and use that address to look up a UMB.
 32523                                  ; This routine checks for that condition and calls AddrToUmb if necessary.
 32524                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32525                                  ; ENTRY:  AX contains a UMB number or segment, gnradix has been set by GetXNum
 32526                                  ; EXIT:   AX will contain a UMB number
 32527                                  ; ERROR:  None
 32528                                  ; USES:   Flags, AX
 32529                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32530                                  
 32531                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2
 32532                                  convUMB:
 32533 00002C89 2E833E[8C2B]10          	cmp	word [cs:gnradix],16
 32534 00002C8F 7507                    	jne	short cu10	; If it didn't read in hex, it's not an address
 32535 00002C91 E8C4FF                  	call	AddrToUmb	; Else, convert the address to a UMB number
 32536                                  	;cmp	ax,0FFFFh
 32537                                  	;jne	short cu10
 32538                                  	;inc	ax		; If too high, ignore it (make it conventional)

 32574                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32575                                  ;*** loadLow - returns AL==0 if UMB0 == 0, else AL==1
 32576                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32577                                  ; ENTRY:  None
 32578                                  ; EXIT:   AL==0 if mem strategy should be set to LOW_FIRST, else AL==1
 32579                                  ;         Carry set if UMB0 not specified (_NOT_ an error)
 32580                                  ; ERROR:  None
 32581                                  ; USES:   Flags, fm_strat, fm_umb
 32582                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32583                                  ; We want to set the memory strategy to LOW_FIRST if the user specified a
 32584                                  ; load UMB, and it is 0. That 0 can be either from the user having _specified_
 32585                                  ; zero (/L:0;...), or from having specified a too-big min size (/L:1,99999999)
 32586                                  ; such that the load UMB is too small, and shouldn't be used.
 32587                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32588                                  
 32589                                  loadLow:
 32590                                  	;push	ds
 32591                                  	;push	cs		; Point DS into appropriate data segment
 32592                                  	;pop	ds	
 32593                                  
 32594                                  	;mov	al,[UmbLoad]
 32595                                  	mov	al,[cs:UmbLoad]
 32596                                  	cmp	al,UNSPECIFIED ; 0FFh, -1
 32597                                  	jne	short ll10
 32598                                  
 32599                                  	stc
 32600                                  ll15:
 32601                                  	mov	al,1		; Return with AL==1 && STC if no UMBs specified
 32602                                  	;stc
 32603                                  	;jmp	short llX
 32604                                  	retn
 32605                                  ll10:	
 32606                                  	or	al,al		; AL=the load UMB: Is it == 0?
 32607                                  	;jz	short llX	; Yep... CF==0 (from OR) && AL=0, so just exit
 32608                                  
 32609                                  	jnz	short ll15	; 09/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 32610                                  	retn
 32611                                  
 32612                                  	;mov	al,1
 32613                                  	;clc
 32614                                  ;llX:
 32615                                  	;pop	ds		; Return DS to where it was
 32616                                  	;retn
 32617                                  
 32618                                  %endif
