 35324                                  ;		'C' set if arena damaged
 35325                                  ;
 35326                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35327                                  
 35328                                  	; 01/11/2022
 35329                                  get_next:
 35330 000033D9 803E00005A              	cmp	byte [0],arena_signature_end ; 'Z'
 35331 000033DE 740A                    	je	short gn_err
 35332                                  _get_next_:
 35333 000033E0 8CD8                    	mov     ax,ds                   ; ax=current block
 35334 000033E2 03060300                	add     ax,[ARENA.SIZE]		; ax=ax + current block length
 35335 000033E6 40                      	inc     ax                      ; remember that header!
 35336 000033E7 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 35337                                  	;clc
 35338                                  	; 01/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 35339                                  	; 11/12/2022
 35340                                  	; cf=0
 35341                                  	;clc
 35342 000033E9 C3                      	retn
 35343                                  gn_err:
 35344 000033EA F9                      	stc
 35345                                  	; 11/12/2022	
 35346                                  lfu_err:	 ; cf=1
 35347 000033EB C3                      	retn

 35350                                  ;
 35351                                  ; procedure : LinkFirstUMB
 35352                                  ;
 35353                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35354                                  
 35355                                  	; 01/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 35356                                  	; (SYSINIT:2F81h)
 35357                                  LinkFirstUMB:
 35358                                  	; 31/12/2022
 35359                                  	; ds = cs
 35360 000033EC E8CEFF                  	call	umb_allocate
 35361 000033EF 72FA                    	jc	short lfu_err  ; ds = cs ; 31/12/2022
 35362                                  
 35363                                  ; bx = segment of allocated UMB
 35364                                  ; dx = size of UMB
 35365                                  
 35366                                  	; 31/12/2022
 35367                                  	; ds = cs
 35368                                  
 35369 000033F1 CD12                    	int	12h			; ax = size of memory
 35370 000033F3 B106                    	mov	cl,6
 35371 000033F5 D3E0                    	shl	ax,cl			; ax = size in paragraphs
 35372                                  
 35373 000033F7 89C1                    	mov	cx,ax			; cx = size in paras
 35374 000033F9 29D8                    	sub	ax,bx			; ax = - size of unused block
 35375                                  
 35376 000033FB F7D8                    	neg	ax
 35377                                  
 35378                                  	;sub	cx,1			; cx = first umb_arena
 35379                                  	; 09/09/2023
 35380 000033FD 49                      	dec	cx
 35381 000033FE 8EC1                    	mov	es,cx			; es = first umb_arena
 35382                                  	
 35383 00003400 26C60600004D            	mov	byte [es:ARENA.SIGNATURE],arena_signature_normal ; 'M'
 35384 00003406 26C70601000800          	mov	word [es:ARENA.OWNER],8	; mark as system owned
 35385                                  					
 35386 0000340D 26A30300                	mov	[es:ARENA.SIZE],ax	
 35387 00003411 26C70608005343          	mov	word [es:ARENA.NAME],'SC' ; 4353h
 35388                                  
 35389                                  ; put in the arena for the first UMB
 35390                                  
 35391 00003418 8EC3                    	mov	es,bx			; es has first free umb seg
 35392 0000341A 26C60600005A            	mov	byte [es:ARENA.SIGNATURE],arena_signature_end ; 'Z'
 35393 00003420 26C70601000000          	mov	word [es:ARENA.OWNER],arena_owner_system ; 0	
 35394                                  					; mark as free 
 35395 00003427 4A                      	dec	dx			; make room for arena
 35396 00003428 2689160300              	mov	[es:ARENA.SIZE],dx	
 35397                                  
 35398                                  	;mov	es,[cs:DevDOSData]
 35399                                  	; 31/12/2022
 35400 0000342D 8E06[961F]              	mov	es,[DevDOSData] ; ds = cs
 35401 00003431 BF8C00                  	mov	di,UMB_ARENA ; 8Ch
 35402 00003434 26890D                  	mov	[es:di],cx		; initialize umb_head in DOS
 35403                                  					;  data segment with the arena
 35404                                  					;  just below Top of Mem
 35405                                  
 35406                                  ; we must now scan the arena chain and update the size of the last arena
 35407                                  
 35408 00003437 BF2400                  	mov	di,DOS_ARENA ; 24h
 35409 0000343A 268E05                  	mov	es,[es:di]		; es = start arena
 35410 0000343D 31FF                    	xor	di,di
 35411                                  ;scan_next
 35412                                  ; 09/12/2022
 35413                                  scannext:
 35414 0000343F 26803D5A                	cmp	byte [es:di],arena_signature_end  ; 'Z'
 35415 00003443 740C                    	je	short got_last
 35416                                  	
 35417 00003445 8CC0                    	mov	ax,es
 35418 00003447 2603060300              	add	ax,[es:ARENA.SIZE]
 35419 0000344C 40                      	inc	ax
 35420 0000344D 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 35421                                  	;jmp	short scan_next
 35422                                  	; 09/12/2022
 35423 0000344F EBEE                    	jmp	short scannext
 35424                                  got_last:
 35425                                  	;sub	word [es:ARENA.SIZE],1
 35426                                  	; 09/09/2023
 35427 00003451 26FF0E0300              	dec	word [es:ARENA.SIZE]
 35428                                  
 35429 00003456 26C60600004D            	mov	byte [es:ARENA.SIGNATURE],arena_signature_normal ; 'M'
 35430                                  	;clc
 35431                                  	; 01/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 35432                                  	; 11/12/2022
 35433                                  	; cf=0
 35434                                  	;clc
 35435 0000345C C3                      	retn
 35436                                  
 35437                                  ; 11/12/2022
 35438                                  ;;lfu_err:
 35439                                  ;	;stc
 35440                                  ;	; 01/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 35441                                  ;	; 11/12/2022
 35442                                  ;	; cf=1
 35443                                  ;	;stc
 35444                                  ;	retn

 35447                                  ;
 35448                                  ; procedure : ShrinkUMB
 35449                                  ;
 35450                                  ;	Shrinks the current UMB in use, so that the unused portions
 35451                                  ;	of the UMB is given back to the DOS free mem pool
 35452                                  ;
 35453                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35454                                  
 35455                                  ShrinkUMB:
 35456                                  	; 12/12/2022
 35457                                  	; ds = cs
 35458 0000345D 833E[791F]00            	cmp	word [DevUMBAddr],0
 35459                                  	;cmp	word [cs:DevUMBAddr],0
 35460 00003462 741F                    	je	short su_exit
 35461 00003464 06                      	push	es
 35462                                  	; 01/01/2023
 35463                                  	;push	bx
 35464                                  	; 12/12/2022
 35465                                  	;mov	bx,[cs:DevUMBFree]
 35466                                  	;sub	bx,[cs:DevUMBAddr]
 35467                                  	;mov	es,[cs:DevUMBAddr]
 35468 00003465 8B1E[7D1F]              	mov	bx,[DevUMBFree]
 35469 00003469 2B1E[791F]              	sub	bx,[DevUMBAddr]
 35470 0000346D 8E06[791F]              	mov	es,[DevUMBAddr]
 35471                                  	
 35472 00003471 B8004A                  	mov	ax,4A00h
 35473 00003474 CD21                    	int	21h
 35474                                  		; DOS - 2+ - ADJUST MEMORY BLOCK SIZE (SETBLOCK)
 35475                                  		; ES = segment address of block to change
 35476                                  		; BX = new size in paragraphs
 35477 00003476 8CC0                    	mov	ax,es
 35478 00003478 48                      	dec	ax
 35479 00003479 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 35480 0000347B 26C70601000800          	mov	word [es:ARENA.OWNER],8
 35481                                  	; 01/01/2023
 35482                                  	;pop	bx
 35483 00003482 07                      	pop	es
 35484                                  su_exit:

 35495                                  UnlinkUMB:

 35497                                  	; ds = cs
 35498 00003484 1E                      	push	ds

 35501 00003486 803E[951F]00            	cmp	byte [FirstUMBLinked],0
 35502                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:FirstUMBLinked],0
 35503 0000348B 7420                    	je	short ulu_x		; nothing to unlink
 35504                                  	; 12/12/2022
 35505 0000348D 8E06[961F]              	mov	es,[DevDOSData]
 35506                                  	;mov	es,[cs:DevDOSData]	; get DOS data seg
 35507 00003491 268E1E2400              	mov	ds,[es:DOS_ARENA]
 35508 00003496 268B3E8C00              	mov	di,[es:UMB_ARENA]
 35509                                  ulu_next:
 35510 0000349B E83BFF                  	call	get_next
 35511 0000349E 720D                    	jc	short ulu_x
 35512 000034A0 39C7                    	cmp	di,ax			; is the next one UMB ?
 35513 000034A2 7404                    	je	short ulu_found
 35514 000034A4 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 35515 000034A6 EBF3                    	jmp	short ulu_next
 35516                                  ulu_found:
 35517                                  	;mov	byte [0],'Z'
 35518 000034A8 C60600005A              	mov     byte [ARENA.SIGNATURE],arena_signature_end ; 'Z'
 35519                                  ulu_x:
 35520 000034AD 07                      	pop	es
 35521 000034AE 1F                      	pop	ds
 35522 000034AF C3                      	retn

 35524                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 35525                                  ; SYSINIT2.ASM - MSDOS 6.0 - 1991
 35526                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 35527                                  ; 14/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 35528                                  
 35529                                  ; Multiple configuration block support  Created 16-Mar-1992 by JeffPar
 35530                                  ;
 35531                                  ; Summary:
 35532                                  ;
 35533                                  ;   The procedure "organize" crunches the in-memory copy of config.sys
 35534                                  ;   into lines delimited by CR/LF (sometimes no CR, but *always* an LF)
 35535                                  ;   with the leading "keyword=" replaced by single character codes (eg, B
 35536                                  ;   for BUFFERS, D for DEVICE, Z for any unrecognized keyword); see comtab
 35537                                  ;   and/or config.inc for the full list.
 35538                                  ;
 35539                                  ;   [blockname] and INCLUDE are the major syntactical additions for multi-
 35540                                  ;   configuration support. blockname is either MENU, which contains one
 35541                                  ;   or more MENUITEM lines, an optional MENUDEFAULT (which includes optional
 35542                                  ;   time-out), or any user-defined keyword, such as NETWORK, CD-ROM, etc.
 35543                                  ;   INCLUDE allows the current block to name another block for inclusion
 35544                                  ;   during the processing phase of CONFIG.SYS. An INCLUDE is only honored
 35545                                  ;   once, precluding nasty infinite-loop scenarios. If blocks are present
 35546                                  ;   without a MENU block, then only lines inside COMMON blocks are processed.
 35547                                  ;
 35548                                  ; Example:
 35549                                  ;
 35550                                  ;   [menu]
 35551                                  ;   menuitem=misc,Miscellaneous
 35552                                  ;   menuitem=network,Network Configuration
 35553                                  ;   menudefault=network,15
 35554                                  ;
 35555                                  ;   [network]
 35556                                  ;   include misc
 35557                                  ;   device=foo
 35558                                  ;
 35559                                  ;   [misc]
 35560                                  ;   device=bar
 35561                                  ;   include alternate
 35562                                  ;
 35563                                  ;   [alternate]
 35564                                  ;   device=tar
 35565                                  ;
 35566                                  ;
 35567                                  ;   When the menu is displayed
 35568                                  ;
 35569                                  ;    1. Miscellaneous
 35570                                  ;    2. Network Configuration
 35571                                  ;
 35572                                  ;   #2 is highlighted as the default option, and will be automatically
 35573                                  ;   selected after 15 seconds. It will invoke the following lines in the
 35574                                  ;   following order:
 35575                                  ;
 35576                                  ;       DEVICE=BAR
 35577                                  ;       DEVICE=TAR
 35578                                  ;       DEVICE=FOO
 35579                                  ;
 35580                                  
 35581                                  ;MULTI_CONFIG equ 1
 35582                                  
 35583                                  ; the following depend on the positions of the various letters in switchlist
 35584                                  
 35585                                  switchnum	equ 11111000b ; 0F8h	; which switches require number
 35586                                  
 35587                                  flagec35	equ 00000100b ; 4	; electrically compatible 3.5 inch disk drive
 35588                                  flagdrive	equ 00001000b ; 8 
 35589                                  flagcyln	equ 00010000b ; 16
 35590                                  flagseclim	equ 00100000b ; 32
 35591                                  flagheads	equ 01000000b ; 64
 35592                                  flagff		equ 10000000b ; 128
 35593                                  
 35594                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35595                                  ; 19/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 35596                                  
 35597                                  ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:3E78h
 35598                                  
 35599                                  ; 01/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 35600                                  ; MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:3054h
 35601                                  
 35602 000034B0 00                      insert_blank:	db 	0
 35603                                  
 35604                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35605                                  ;
 35606                                  ; procedure : setparms
 35607                                  ;
 35608                                  ; the following set of routines is used to parse the drivparm = command in
 35609                                  ; the config.sys file to change the default drive parameters.
 35610                                  ;
 35611                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35612

 35752                                  	; 03/01/2023
 35753                                  	; ds = cs ; *
 35754                                  
 35755                                  	;push	ds ; *
 35756                                  
 35757                                  	;push	cs ; *
 35758                                  	;pop	ds ; *
 35759                                  
 35760                                  nextswtch:
 35761                                  	cmp	al,cr			; carriage return?
 35762                                  	je	short done_line
 35763                                  	cmp	al,lf			; linefeed?
 35764                                  	je	short put_back		; put it back and done
 35765                                  
 35766                                  ; anything less or equal to a space is ignored.
 35767

 35774                                  	; 03/01/2023

 35776                                  	retn
 35777

 35828                                  ; procedure : check_switch
 35829                                  ;
 35830                                  ; processes a switch in the input. it ensures that the switch is valid, and
 35831                                  ; gets the number, if any required, following the switch. the switch and the
 35832                                  ; number *must* be separated by a colon. carry is set if there is any kind of
 35833                                  ; error.

 35842 00003514 F9                      	stc
 35843                                  err_chk:
 35844                                  done_swtch:	; 09/09/2023 (cf=0)
 35845 00003515 C3                      	retn

 35926                                  ; procedure : process_num
 35927                                  ;
 35928                                  ; this routine takes the switch just input, and the number following (if any),
 35929                                  ; and sets the value in the appropriate variable. if the number input is zero
 35930                                  ; then it does nothing - it assumes the default value that is present in the
 35931                                  ; variable at the beginning. zero is ok for form factor and drive, however.
 35932                                  ;
 35933                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------

 35952 00003570 F6C180                  	test	cl,flagff ; 80h
 35953                                  	;test	cx,flagff ; 80h
 35954 00003573 7404                    	jz	short try_t
 35955                                  
 35956                                  ; ensure that we do not get bogus form factors that are not supported
 35957                                  
 35958                                  	;mov	[deviceparameters+1],al
 35959 00003575 A2[4548]                	mov	[deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_DEVICETYPE],al
 35960                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 35961                                  	;jmp	short done_ret
 35962                                  	; 12/12/2022
 35963                                  	; cf=0
 35964 00003578 C3                      	retn	; 13/05/2019
 35965                                  try_t:
 35966 00003579 09C0                    	or	ax,ax
 35967 0000357B 7415                    	jz	short done_ret		; if number entered was 0, assume default value
 35968                                  	; 12/12/2022
 35969 0000357D F6C110                  	test	cl,flagcyln ; 10h

 35971 00003580 7404                    	jz	short try_s
 35972

 35974 00003582 A3[4848]                	mov	[deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_CYLINDERS],ax
 35975                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 35976                                  	;jmp	short done_ret

 35978                                  	; cf=0

 35985 0000358B A3[6A49]                	mov	[slim],ax
 35986                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)

 36102                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36103                                  ;
 36104                                  ; procedure : setdeviceparameters
 36105                                  ;
 36106                                  ; setdeviceparameters sets up the recommended bpb in each bds in the
 36107                                  ; system based on the form factor. it is assumed that the bpbs for the
 36108                                  ; various form factors are present in the bpbtable. for hard files,
 36109                                  ; the recommended bpb is the same as the bpb on the drive.
 36110                                  ; no attempt is made to preserve registers since we are going to jump to
 36111                                  ; sysinit straight after this routine.
 36112                                  ;
 36113                                  ;	if we return carry, the DRIVPARM will be aborted, but presently
 36114                                  ;	  we always return no carry
 36115                                  ;
 36116                                  ;	note:  there is a routine by the same name in msdioctl.asm
 36117                                  ;
 36118                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36119                                  
 36120                                  ; 15/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 36121                                  
 36122                                  	; 02/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 36123                                  
 36124                                  	; 03/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 36125                                  	; (SYSINIT:3FC4h)

 36209                                  
 36210                                  ;	two head drives will use the mediadescriptor from the bpb
 36211                                  
 36212 00003627 88FB                    	mov	bl,bh			; get mediadescriptor from bpb
 36213                                  
 36214                                  ;	two sided drives have two special cases to look for. One is
 36215                                  ;	   a 320K diskette (40 tracks, 8 secs per track). It uses
 36216                                  ;	   a mediaid of 0fch. The other is 1.44M, which uses only
 36217                                  ;	   one sector/cluster.
 36218                                  
 36219                                  ;	any drive with 18secs/trk, 2 heads, 80 tracks, will be assumed
 36220                                  ;	   to be a 1.44M and use only 1 sector per cluster. Any other
 36221                                  ;	   type of 2 headed drive is all set.
 36222                                  
 36223 00003629 833E[5848]12            	cmp	word [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.BPB_SECTORSPERTRACK],18
 36224 0000362E 7509                    	jne	short not_144m
 36225 00003630 833E[4848]50            	cmp	word [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_CYLINDERS],80
 36226 00003635 7502                    	jne	short not_144m
 36227                                  
 36228                                  ;	We've got cyl=80, heads=2, secpertrack=18. Set cluster size to 1.
 36229                                  
 36230 00003637 EB24                    	jmp	short got_one_secperclus_drive
 36231                                  
 36232                                  ;	check for 320K
 36233                                  
 36234                                  not_144m:
 36235 00003639 833E[4848]28            	cmp	word [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_CYLINDERS],40
 36236 0000363E 7521                    	jne	short got_correct_mediad
 36237 00003640 833E[5848]08            	cmp	word [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.BPB_SECTORSPERTRACK],8
 36238 00003645 751A                    	jne	short got_correct_mediad
 36239

 36241 00003649 EB16                    	jmp	short got_correct_mediad
 36242                                  
 36243                                  only_one_head:
 36244                                  
 36245                                  ;	if we don't have a 360K drive, then just go use 0f0h as media descr.
 36246                                  
 36247 0000364B 803E[4548]00            	cmp	byte [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_DEVICETYPE],DEV_5INCH ; 0
 36248 00003650 740B                    	je	short got_one_secperclus_drive
 36249                                  
 36250                                  ;	single sided 360K drive uses either 0fch or 0feh, depending on
 36251                                  ;	  whether sectorspertrack is 8 or 9. For our purposes, anything
 36252                                  ;	  besides 8 will be considered 0fch
 36253                                  
 36254 00003652 B3FC                    	mov	bl,0FCh			; single sided 9 sector media id
 36255 00003654 833E[5848]08            	cmp	word [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.BPB_SECTORSPERTRACK],8
 36256                                  	; 12/12/2022
 36257 00003659 7502                    	jne	short got_one_secperclus_drive ; okay if anything besides 8
 36258                                  
 36259 0000365B B3FE                    	mov	bl,0FEh			; 160K mediaid
 36260                                  
 36261                                  ;	we've either got a one sided drive, or a 1.44M drive
 36262                                  ;	  either case we'll use 1 sector per cluster instead of 2
 36263                                  
 36264                                  got_one_secperclus_drive:
 36265                                  	; 03/01/2023
 36266                                  	; ax = 2
 36267 0000365D 48                      	dec	ax  ; ax = 1
 36268 0000365E A2[4D48]                	mov	[deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.BPB_SECTORSPERCLUSTER],al ; 1
 36269                                  	;mov	byte [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.BPB_SECTORSPERCLUSTER],1
 36270                                  
 36271                                  got_correct_mediad:
 36272 00003661 881E[5548]              	mov	[deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.BPB_MEDIADESCRIPTOR],bl

 36791                                  	;mov	al, [es:si]
 36792                                  	;inc	si

 36795 00003868 C3                      	retn
 36796                                  noget:
 36797 00003869 59                      	pop	cx

 36799                                  	; ds = cs

 36817                                  ;   of returning to doconf, we now want to check config.sys BEGIN/END blocks
 36818                                  ;   and the new boot menu stuff...
 36819

 36828                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36829                                  ;
 36830                                  ; procedure : skip_comment
 36831                                  ;
 36832                                  ;skip the commented string until lf, if current es:si-> a comment string.
 36833                                  ;in) es:si-> string
 36834                                  ;	 cx -> length.
 36835                                  ;out) zero flag not set if not found a comment string.
 36836                                  ;	  zero flag set if found a comment string and skipped it. al will contain
 36837                                  ;	  the line feed character at this moment when return.
 36838                                  ;	  ax register destroyed.
 36839                                  ;	  if found, si, cx register adjusted accordingly.
 36840                                  ;
 36841                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36842                                  
 36843                                  	; 03/01/2023 - Retrodos v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 36844                                  	; (SYSINIT:428Dh)
 36845                                  
 36846                                  skip_comment:
 36847 0000387D E3EA                    	jcxz	noget		; get out of the organize routine.
 36848                                  
 36849                                  	; 03/01/2023
 36850                                  	; ds = cs	
 36851                                  
 36852 0000387F 803E[5003]00            	cmp	byte [com_level],0
 36853                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:com_level],0 ; only check it if parameter level is 0.
 36854 00003884 752C                    	jne	short no_commt	 ; (not inside quotations)
 36855                                  
 36856 00003886 803E[5103]01            	cmp	byte [cmmt],1
 36857                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:cmmt],1
 36858 0000388B 7225                    	jb	short no_commt
 36859                                  
 36860 0000388D 268A04                  	mov	al,[es:si]
 36861                                  	
 36862 00003890 3806[5203]              	cmp	[cmmt1],al
 36863                                  	;cmp	[cs:cmmt1],al
 36864 00003894 751C                    	jne	short no_commt
 36865                                  
 36866 00003896 803E[5103]02            	cmp	byte [cmmt],2
 36867                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:cmmt],2
 36868 0000389B 750A                    	jne	short skip_cmmt
 36869                                  
 36870 0000389D 268A4401                	mov	al,[es:si+1]
 36871                                  	
 36872 000038A1 3806[5303]              	cmp	[cmmt2],al
 36873                                  	;cmp	[cs:cmmt2],al
 36874 000038A5 750B                    	jne	short no_commt
 36875                                  skip_cmmt:
 36876 000038A7 E3C0                    	jcxz	noget		; get out of organize routine.
 36877 000038A9 268A04                  	mov	al,[es:si]
 36878 000038AC 46                      	inc	si
 36879 000038AD 49                      	dec	cx
 36880 000038AE 3C0A                    	cmp	al,lf		; line feed?
 36881 000038B0 75F5                    	jne	short skip_cmmt
 36882                                  no_commt:
 36883 000038B2 C3                      	retn

 36893                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36894                                  ;
 36895                                  ;   kbd_read: wait for keystroke
 36896                                  ;
 36897                                  ;   INPUT
 36898                                  ;       DS == CS == sysinitseg
 36899                                  ;
 36900                                  ;   OUTPUT
 36901                                  ;       Carry SET to clean boot, CLEAR otherwise
 36902                                  ;
 36903                                  ;   OTHER REGS USED
 36904                                  ;       All
 36905                                  ;
 36906                                  ;   HISTORY
 36907                                  ;       Created 16-Nov-1992 by JeffPar
 36908                                  ;
 36909                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36910                                  
 36911                                  kbd_read:
 36912 000038B3 F606[1047]02                    test    byte [bDisableUI],2
 36913 000038B8 7520                            jnz     short kbd_nodelay
 36914                                  
 36915 000038BA 1E                              push    ds              ; the bios timer tick count is incremented
 36916 000038BB 29C0                            sub     ax,ax           ; 18.2 times per second;
 36917 000038BD 8ED8                            mov     ds,ax           ; watch the timer tick count for 37 transitions
 36918                                  	;mov	dx,[046Ch]	; get initial value
 36919                                  kbd_loop:
 36920 000038BF B401                            mov     ah,1            ;
 36921 000038C1 CD16                            int     16h             ; peek the keyboard
 36922 000038C3 7514                            jnz	short kbd_loopdone ; something's there, get out
 36923 000038C5 B402                            mov     ah,2            ; peek the shift states
 36924 000038C7 CD16                            int     16h             ;
 36925 000038C9 A803                            test    al,03h          ; either right or left shift key bits set?
 36926 000038CB 750C                            jnz	short kbd_loopdone ; yes
 36927 000038CD A16C04                          mov     ax,[046Ch]	;
 36928                                  	;sub	ax,dx           ; get difference
 36929                                  	; 15/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 36930 000038D0 2E2B06[8603]            	sub	ax,[cs:_timer_lw_] ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:42E5h        
 36931                                  
 36932 000038D5 3C25                    	cmp     al,37           ; reached limit?  ; (2 seconds)
 36933 000038D7 72E6                            jb	short kbd_loop	; not yet
 36934                                  kbd_loopdone:
 36935 000038D9 1F                              pop     ds              ; delay complete!
 36936                                  kbd_nodelay:
 36937 000038DA 29DB                            sub     bx,bx           ; assume clean boot
 36938 000038DC B402                            mov     ah,2            ; peek the shift states
 36939 000038DE CD16                            int     16h             ;
 36940 000038E0 A803                            test    al,03h          ; either right or left shift key bits set?
 36941 000038E2 7407                            jz      short kbd_notshift ; no
 36942 000038E4 43                              inc     bx              ; yes
 36943 000038E5 43                              inc     bx
 36944                                  	; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:4301h
 36945 000038E6 800E[1447]04            	or	byte [bQueryOpt],4
 36946                                  kbd_notshift:                   ;
 36947 000038EB B401                            mov     ah,1            ; peek the keyboard
 36948 000038ED CD16                            int     16h             ;
 36949 000038EF 743E                            jz	short kbd_test	; no key present
 36950 000038F1 08C0                            or      al,al           ; is it a function key?
 36951 000038F3 753A                            jnz	short kbd_test	; no
 36952                                  
 36953                                  	; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:430Bh
 36954 000038F5 80FC62                          cmp     ah,62h          ; CTRL F5
 36955 000038F8 7405                            je	short kbd_cfg_bypass
 36956                                  	
 36957 000038FA 80FC3F                          cmp     ah,3Fh          ; F5 function key?
 36958 000038FD 750D                            jne	short kbd_notf5	; no
 36959                                  kbd_cfg_bypass:
 36960 000038FF BA[A74B]                        mov     dx,_$CleanMsg
 36961 00003902 E8DD0B                          call    print
 36962                                  	; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:431Bh
 36963 00003905 800E[1447]04            	or	byte [bQueryOpt],4 
 36964 0000390A EB16                            jmp     short kbd_eat   ; yes, clean boot selected
 36965                                  kbd_notf5:
 36966                                  	; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:4322h
 36967 0000390C 80FC65                          cmp     ah,65h          ; CTRL F8
 36968 0000390F 7405                            je	short kbd_cfg_confirm
 36969                                  
 36970 00003911 80FC42                          cmp     ah,42h          ; F8 function key?
 36971 00003914 7523                            jne	short kbd_exit	; no
 36972                                  kbd_cfg_confirm:
 36973 00003916 BA[E54B]                        mov     dx,_$InterMsg
 36974 00003919 E8C60B                          call    print           ;
 36975 0000391C B301                            mov     bl,1            ; yes, interactive-boot option enabled
 36976 0000391E 881E[1447]                      mov     [bQueryOpt],bl  ; change default setting
 36977                                  kbd_eat:                        ;
 36978 00003922 B400                            mov     ah,0            ;
 36979 00003924 CD16                            int     16h             ; eat the key we assumed was a signal
 36980 00003926 C606[1A47]FF                    mov	byte [secElapsed],-1
 36981 0000392B 09DB                            or      bx,bx           ;
 36982 0000392D 7405                            jz	short kbd_clean	;
 36983                                  kbd_test:                       ;
 36984 0000392F 80FB02                          cmp     bl,2            ;
 36985 00003932 7205                            jb	short kbd_exit	;
 36986                                  kbd_clean:                      ;
 36987 00003934 E86E08                          call    disable_autoexec; yes, tell COMMAND to skip autoexec.bat
 36988 00003937 F9                              stc                     ; set carry to indicate abort
 36989 00003938 C3                              retn			;
 36990                                  kbd_exit:                       ;
 36991 00003939 F8                              clc                     ; clear carry to indicate success
 36992 0000393A C3                              retn			;
 36993                                  
 36994                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36995                                  ;
 36996                                  ;   set_numlock: set numlock LED
 36997                                  ;
 36998                                  ;   INPUT
 36999                                  ;       ES:SI -> numlock setting (ie, "ON" or "OFF")
 37000                                  ;
 37001                                  ;   OUTPUT
 37002                                  ;       None
 37003                                  ;
 37004                                  ;   OTHER REGS USED
 37005                                  ;       None
 37006                                  ;
 37007                                  ;   HISTORY
 37008                                  ;       Created 16-Nov-1992 by JeffPar
 37009                                  ;
 37010                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37011                                  
 37012                                  	; 04/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2
 37013                                  
 37014                                  set_numlock:
 37015                                          ; 04/01/2023
 37016                                  	;push	ax
 37017 0000393B 1E                              push    ds
 37018 0000393C 29C0                            sub     ax,ax
 37019 0000393E 8ED8                            mov     ds,ax
 37020 00003940 268B04                          mov     ax,[es:si]      ; get 1st 2 bytes of value (ON or OF)
 37021 00003943 2E3B06[824B]                    cmp     ax,[cs:OnOff+2]	; should we turn it off?
 37022 00003948 7507                            jne	short not_off	; no
 37023 0000394A 80261704DF                      and     byte [0417h],~20h ; 0DFh
 37024 0000394F EB0D                            jmp     short set_done
 37025                                  not_off:
 37026 00003951 2E3B06[804B]                    cmp     ax,[cs:OnOff]	; should we turn it on?
 37027 00003956 F9                              stc
 37028 00003957 7505                            jne	short set_done	; no
 37029 00003959 800E170420                      or      byte [0417h],20h
 37030                                  set_done:
 37031 0000395E 1F                              pop     ds
 37032                                  	; 04/01/2023
 37033                                  	;pop	ax
 37034 0000395F C3                              retn
 37035                                  
 37036                                  ; 16/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 37037                                  
 37038                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37039                                  ;
 37040                                  ;   menu_check:  check for presence of menu (and other) configuration blocks
 37041                                  ;
 37042                                  ;   INPUT
 37043                                  ;       CX == "organized" config.sys memory image length
 37044                                  ;    ES:SI -> "organized" config.sys memory image
 37045                                  ;       DS == CS == sysinitseg
 37046                                  ;
 37047                                  ;   OUTPUT
 37048                                  ;       Same as above; the idea is that menu_check simply transforms
 37049                                  ;       a block-structured config.sys image into a conventional image,
 37050                                  ;       based on the user's block selection and any other boot-time options
 37051                                  ;       the user may have employed...
 37052                                  ;
 37053                                  ;   OTHER REGS USED
 37054                                  ;       All
 37055                                  ;
 37056                                  ;   NOTES
 37057                                  ;       [count] and [org_count] are set to the new config.sys image length
 37058                                  ;
 37059                                  ;   HISTORY
 37060                                  ;       Created 16-Mar-1992 by JeffPar
 37061                                  ;
 37062                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37063                                  
 37064                                  	; 04/01/2023 - Retrodos v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 37065                                  	; (SYSINIT:4378h)
 37066                                  
 37067                                  menu_check:
 37068                                  
 37069                                  ;   Search for SWITCHES, determine if /N or /F are present; if so, then
 37070                                  ;   disable clean/interactive boot options
 37071                                  
 37072 00003960 51                              push    cx              ;
 37073 00003961 56                              push    si              ;
 37074 00003962 29DB                            sub     bx,bx           ; remains ZERO until first block
 37075                                  swchk_loop:                     ;
 37076 00003964 E83507                          call    get_char        ; get first char of current line
 37077 00003967 724C                            jc	short swchk_end	; hit eof
 37078 00003969 3C5B                            cmp     al,CONFIG_BEGIN ; '['
 37079 0000396B 7503                            jne	short swchk_next1 ;
 37080 0000396D 43                              inc     bx              ; remember that we've seen a block
 37081 0000396E EB40                            jmp     short swchk_nextline
 37082                                  swchk_next1:                    ;
 37083 00003970 3C4E                            cmp     al,CONFIG_NUMLOCK
 37084 00003972 750E                            jne	short swchk_next2 ;
 37085 00003974 09DB                            or      bx,bx           ; only do NUMLOCK commands that exist
 37086 00003976 7538                            jnz	short swchk_nextline ; before the first block
 37087 00003978 E8C0FF                          call    set_numlock     ; REM it out so we don't act on it later, too
 37088 0000397B 26C644FF30                      mov     byte [es:si-1],CONFIG_REM
 37089 00003980 EB2E                            jmp     short swchk_nextline
 37090                                  swchk_next2:                    ;
 37091 00003982 3C31                            cmp     al,CONFIG_SWITCHES
 37092 00003984 752A                            jne	short swchk_nextline ; this line ain't it
 37093                                  swchk_scan:                     ;
 37094 00003986 E81307                          call    get_char        ; look for /N or /F
 37095                                  swchk_scan1:                    ;
 37096 00003989 3C0A                            cmp     al,LF           ; end of line?
 37097 0000398B 7423                            je	short swchk_nextline ; yes
 37098 0000398D 3C2F                            cmp     al,'/'          ; switch-char?
 37099 0000398F 75F5                            jne	short swchk_scan ; no
 37100 00003991 E80807                          call    get_char        ;
 37101 00003994 24DF                            and     al,~20h ; 0DFh	; convert to upper case
 37102 00003996 3A06[C51E]                      cmp     al,[swit_n+1]	; 'N'
 37103 0000399A 7507                            jne	short swchk_scan2 ; no
 37104 0000399C 800E[1047]01                    or      byte [bDisableUI],1
 37105 000039A1 EBE3                            jmp	short swchk_scan ; continue looking for switches of interest
 37106                                  swchk_scan2:                    ;
 37107 000039A3 3A06[D11E]                      cmp     al,[swit_f+1]	; 'F'
 37108 000039A7 75E0                            jne	short swchk_scan1 ; no
 37109 000039A9 800E[1047]02                    or      byte [bDisableUI],2
 37110 000039AE EBD6                            jmp     short swchk_scan ; continue looking for switches of interest
 37111                                  swchk_nextline:                 ;
 37112 000039B0 E8C306                          call    skip_opt_line   ;
 37113 000039B3 EBAF                            jmp     short swchk_loop ;
 37114                                  swchk_end:                      ;
 37115 000039B5 5E                              pop     si              ;
 37116 000039B6 59                              pop     cx              ;
 37117                                  
 37118                                  ;   Do the keyboard tests for clean/interactive boot now, but only if
 37119                                  ;   the DisableUI flag is still clear
 37120                                  
 37121 000039B7 F606[1047]01                    test    byte [bDisableUI],1
 37122 000039BC 7508                            jnz	short menu_search
 37123                                  ;
 37124                                  ;   Wait for 2 seconds first, UNLESS the /F bit was set in bDisableUI, or
 37125                                  ;   there is anything at all in the keyboard buffer
 37126                                  ;
 37127 000039BE E8F2FE                          call    kbd_read
 37128 000039C1 7303                            jnc	short menu_search
 37129 000039C3 E9EE01                          jmp	menu_abort
 37130                                  
 37131                                  ;   Search for MENU block; it is allowed to be anywhere in config.sys
 37132                                  
 37133                                  menu_search:
 37134 000039C6 29DB                            sub     bx,bx           ; if no MENU, default to zero for no_selection
 37135 000039C8 BF[5547]                        mov     di,szMenu	;
 37136 000039CB E80304                          call    find_block      ; find the MENU block
 37137 000039CE 7337                            jnc	short menu_found ;
 37138 000039D0 C606[4D47]00                    mov     byte [szBoot],0
 37139 000039D5 E90C02                          jmp	no_selection ; not found
 37140                                  
 37141                                  ;   Process the requested menu color(s)
 37142                                  
 37143                                  menu_color:
 37144 000039D8 51                      	push	cx              ;
 37145 000039D9 52                      	push	dx              ;
 37146                                  	;;mov	dx,0007h        ; default color setting
 37147                                  	; 10/09/2023
 37148                                  	;mov	dl,7 ; !*!
 37149 000039DA E89E06                  	call	get_number	; get first number
 37150 000039DD 80E30F                  	and	bl,0Fh  ; !**!	; first # is foreground color (for low nibble)
 37151 000039E0 88DD                    	mov	ch,bl           ; save it in CH
 37152                                  	; 01/08/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization) by Erdogan Tan 
 37153                                  	; (high nibble of dl is 0)
 37154                                  	;and	dl,0F0h	; !*!	; (low nibble of dl would be zero)
 37155                                  	;or	dl,bl		; (low nibble of dl is 7) ! 14/08/2023
 37156 000039E2 88DA                    	mov	dl,bl	; 14/08/2023
 37157 000039E4 E83108                  	call	delim           ; did we hit a delimiter
 37158 000039E7 750E                    	jne	short check_color ; no, all done
 37159 000039E9 E88F06                  	call	get_number	; get next number
 37160 000039EC 80E30F                  	and	bl,0Fh		; second # is background color (for high nibble)
 37161 000039EF 88DE                    	mov	dh,bl           ; save it in DH
 37162                                  	; 10/09/2023
 37163                                  	;and	dl,0Fh	; !**!	;
 37164 000039F1 B104                    	mov	cl,4            ;
 37165 000039F3 D2E3                    	shl	bl,cl           ;
 37166 000039F5 08DA                    	or	dl,bl           ;
 37167                                  check_color:
 37168 000039F7 38F5                    	cmp	ch,dh           ; are foreground/background the same?
 37169 000039F9 7503                    	jne	short set_color	; no
 37170 000039FB 80F208                  	xor	dl,08h          ; yes, so modify the fgnd intensity
 37171                                  set_color:
 37172 000039FE 8816[0B47]              	mov	[bMenuColor],dl ;
 37173 00003A02 5A                      	pop	dx              ;
 37174 00003A03 59                      	pop	cx              ;
 37175 00003A04 E9A900                  	jmp	menu_nextitem
 37176                                  
 37177                                  ;   Back to our regularly scheduled program (the COLOR and other goop
 37178                                  ;   above is there simply to alleviate short jump problems)
 37179                                  
 37180                                  menu_found:
 37181 00003A07 C606[1547]01                    mov     byte [bDefBlock],1
 37182                                          ;mov	word [offDefBlock],0
 37183 00003A0C C606[1947]FF                    mov     byte [secTimeOut],-1
 37184 00003A11 8026[1447]FD                    and     byte [bQueryOpt],~2 ; 0FDh
 37185                                  	; 10/09/2023
 37186 00003A16 29D2                    	sub	dx,dx
 37187 00003A18 8916[1747]              	mov	[offDefBlock],dx ; 0
 37188                                  
 37189 00003A1C E85706                          call    skip_opt_line   ; skip to next line
 37190                                  	; 10/09/2023
 37191                                  	;sub	dx,dx		; initialize total block count (0 => none yet)
 37192                                  
 37193                                  ;   Process the menu block now
 37194                                  
 37195                                  menu_process:
 37196 00003A1F E87A06                          call    get_char        ; get first char of current line
 37197 00003A22 722E                            jc	short to_menu_getdefault ; could happen if menu block at end (rare)
 37198 00003A24 247F                            and     al,~CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY ; 7Fh
 37199 00003A26 3C5B                            cmp     al,CONFIG_BEGIN ; BEGIN implies END
 37200 00003A28 7428                            je	short to_menu_getdefault
 37201 00003A2A 3C4F                            cmp     al,CONFIG_SUBMENU
 37202 00003A2C 744D                            je	short menu_item	; go process sub-menu
 37203 00003A2E 3C45                            cmp     al,CONFIG_MENUITEM
 37204 00003A30 7449                            je	short menu_item	; go process menu item
 37205 00003A32 3C41                            cmp     al,CONFIG_MENUDEFAULT
 37206 00003A34 741E                            je	short menu_default ; go process menu default
 37207 00003A36 3C52                            cmp     al,CONFIG_MENUCOLOR
 37208 00003A38 749E                            je	short menu_color ; go process menu color
 37209 00003A3A 3C4E                            cmp     al,CONFIG_NUMLOCK
 37210 00003A3C 740F                            je	short menu_numlock ;
 37211 00003A3E 3C30                            cmp     al,CONFIG_REM   ; allow remarks in menu block
 37212 00003A40 746E                            je	short menu_nextitem ;
 37213 00003A42 E8C307                          call    any_delim       ; allow blank lines and such
 37214 00003A45 7469                            je	short menu_nextitem ;
 37215 00003A47 F9                              stc                     ;
 37216 00003A48 E82607                          call    print_error     ; non-MENU command!
 37217 00003A4B EB63                            jmp     short menu_nextitem
 37218                                  menu_numlock:
 37219 00003A4D E8EBFE                          call    set_numlock
 37220 00003A50 EB5E                            jmp     short menu_nextitem
 37221                                  to_menu_getdefault:
 37222 00003A52 EB62                            jmp     short menu_getdefault
 37223                                  
 37224                                  ;   Save the offset of the default block name, we'll need it later
 37225                                  
 37226                                  menu_default:
 37227 00003A54 8936[1747]                      mov     [offDefBlock],si; save address of default block name
 37228 00003A58 803E[1A47]00                    cmp     byte [secElapsed],0
 37229 00003A5D 751A                            jne	short timeout_skip ; secElapsed is only zero for the FIRST menu,
 37230 00003A5F E8EA05                          call    skip_token      ; and for subsequent menus IF nothing was typed;
 37231 00003A62 724C                            jc	short menu_nextitem ; secElapsed becomes -1 forever as soon as
 37232 00003A64 E8FB05                          call    skip_delim      ; something is typed
 37233 00003A67 7247                            jc	short menu_nextitem ;
 37234 00003A69 89DE                            mov     si,bx           ;
 37235 00003A6B E80D06                          call    get_number      ; get number (of seconds for timeout)
 37236 00003A6E 80FB5A                          cmp     bl,90           ; limit it to a reasonable number
 37237                                  	;jb	short timeout_ok ; (besides, 99 is the largest # my simple
 37238 00003A71 7602                            jna	short timeout_ok ; 01/08/2023
 37239 00003A73 B35A                    	mov     bl,90           ;  display function can handle)
 37240                                  timeout_ok:                    ;
 37241 00003A75 881E[1947]                      mov     [secTimeOut],bl ;
 37242                                  timeout_skip:
 37243 00003A79 EB35                            jmp     short menu_nextitem
 37244                                  
 37245                                  ;   Verify that this is a valid menu item by searching for the named block
 37246                                  
 37247                                  menu_item:
 37248                                  	;cmp	dl,9	; 04/01/2023
 37249 00003A7B 80FA09                          cmp     dl,MAX_MULTI_CONFIG ; have we reached the max # of items yet?
 37250 00003A7E 7330                            jae	short menu_nextitem ;
 37251 00003A80 89F7                            mov     di,si           ; DS:DI -> block name to search for
 37252 00003A82 E83303                          call    srch_block      ;
 37253 00003A85 7406                            je	short menu_itemfound ;
 37254 00003A87 F9                              stc                     ;
 37255 00003A88 E8E606                          call    print_error     ; print error and pause
 37256 00003A8B EB23                            jmp     short menu_nextitem ; if not found, ignore this menu item
 37257                                  
 37258                                  ;   srch_block, having succeeded, returns DI -> past the token that it
 37259                                  ;   just matched, which in this case should be a descriptive string; ES:SI
 37260                                  ;   and CX are unmodified
 37261                                  
 37262                                  menu_itemfound:
 37263 00003A8D 42                              inc     dx              ; otherwise, increment total block count
 37264 00003A8E 89D3                            mov     bx,dx           ; and use it to index the arrays of offsets
 37265 00003A90 8887[1B47]                      mov	[abBlockType+bx],al
 37266 00003A94 01DB                            add     bx,bx           ; of recorded block names and descriptions
 37267                                  
 37268                                  ;   There should be a description immediately following the block name on
 37269                                  ;   MENUITEM line; failing that, we'll just use the block name as the
 37270                                  ;   description...
 37271                                  
 37272 00003A96 89B7[2547]                      mov     [aoffBlockName+bx],si
 37273 00003A9A 89B7[3947]                      mov     [aoffBlockDesc+bx],si
 37274 00003A9E 89DF                            mov     di,bx           ; skip_delim modifies BX, so stash it in DI
 37275 00003AA0 E8A905                          call    skip_token      ;
 37276 00003AA3 720B                            jc	short menu_nextitem ; hit eol/eof
 37277 00003AA5 E8BA05                          call    skip_delim      ;
 37278 00003AA8 7206                            jc	short menu_nextitem ; hit eol/eof
 37279 00003AAA 87DF                            xchg    bx,di           ;
 37280 00003AAC 89BF[3947]                      mov     [aoffBlockDesc+bx],di
 37281                                  
 37282                                  menu_nextitem:
 37283 00003AB0 E8C305                          call    skip_opt_line   ;
 37284 00003AB3 E969FF                          jmp     menu_process    ; go back for more lines
 37285                                  
 37286                                  ;   Display menu items now, after determining which one is default
 37287                                  
 37288                                  menu_getdefault:
 37289 00003AB6 08D2                            or      dl,dl           ; where there any valid blocks at all?
 37290 00003AB8 7505                            jnz	short menu_valid ; yes
 37291 00003ABA 29DB                            sub     bx,bx           ; no, so force autoselect of 0
 37292 00003ABC E9ED00                          jmp     menu_autoselect ; (meaning: process common blocks only)
 37293                                  menu_valid:
 37294 00003ABF 29DB                            sub     bx,bx           ;
 37295 00003AC1 8816[1647]                      mov     [bMaxBlock],dl  ; first, record how many blocks we found
 37296 00003AC5 8B3E[1747]                      mov     di,[offDefBlock];
 37297 00003AC9 09FF                            or      di,di           ; does a default block exist?
 37298 00003ACB 741C                            jz	short menu_nodefault ; no
 37299 00003ACD 43                              inc     bx              ; yes, walk name table, looking for default
 37300                                  menu_chkdefault:
 37301 00003ACE 53                              push    bx              ;
 37302 00003ACF 01DB                            add     bx,bx           ;
 37303 00003AD1 8BB7[2547]                      mov     si,[aoffBlockName+bx]
 37304 00003AD5 B98000                          mov     cx,128          ; arbitrary maximum length of a name
 37305 00003AD8 1E                              push    ds              ;
 37306 00003AD9 06                              push    es              ;
 37307 00003ADA 1F                              pop     ds              ;
 37308 00003ADB E81A03                          call    comp_names      ; is this block the same as the default?
 37309 00003ADE 1F                              pop     ds              ;
 37310 00003ADF 5B                              pop     bx              ;
 37311 00003AE0 7409                            je	short menu_setdefault ; yes
 37312 00003AE2 43                              inc     bx              ;
 37313 00003AE3 3A1E[1647]                      cmp     bl,[bMaxBlock]  ; all done searching?
 37314 00003AE7 76E5                            jbe	short menu_chkdefault ; not yet
 37315                                  menu_nodefault:
 37316 00003AE9 B301                            mov     bl,1            ; if no default, force default to #1
 37317                                  menu_setdefault:
 37318 00003AEB 881E[1547]                      mov     [bDefBlock],bl  ; yes, this will be the initial current block
 37319                                  
 37320                                  ;   If the timeout was explicitly set to 0 (or technically, anything that
 37321                                  ;   failed to resolve to a number, like "NONE" or "EAT POTATOES"), then we're
 37322                                  ;   supposed to skip menu display and run with the specified default block;
 37323                                  ;   however, if the user hit Enter prior to boot, thereby requesting fully
 37324                                  ;   INTERACTIVE boot, then we shall display the menu block anyway (though still
 37325                                  ;   with no timeout)
 37326                                  
 37327 00003AEF 803E[1947]00                    cmp     byte [secTimeOut],0 ; is timeout zero? (ie, assume default)
 37328 00003AF4 750A                            jne	short menu_display ; no
 37329 00003AF6 F606[1447]01                    test    byte [bQueryOpt],1 ; yes, but was INTERACTIVE requested?
 37330 00003AFB 7503                            jnz	short menu_display ; yes, so *don't* assume default after all
 37331 00003AFD E9C700                          jmp     not_topmenu	;
 37332                                  
 37333                                  ;   Reset the mode, so that we know screen is clean and cursor is home
 37334                                  
 37335                                  menu_display:
 37336 00003B00 B40F                            mov     ah,0Fh          ; get current video mode
 37337 00003B02 CD10                            int     10h             ;
 37338 00003B04 B400                            mov     ah,00h          ; just re-select that mode
 37339 00003B06 CD10                            int     10h             ;
 37340 00003B08 06                              push    es              ;
 37341 00003B09 B84000                          mov     ax,40h          ; reach down into the ROM BIOS data area
 37342 00003B0C 8EC0                            mov     es,ax           ; and save the current (default) video page
 37343 00003B0E 26A14E00                        mov     ax,[es:004Eh]   ; start address and page #, in case the
 37344 00003B12 A3[1247]                        mov     [wCRTStart],ax  ; undocumented QUIET option was enabled
 37345 00003B15 26A06200                        mov     al,[es:0062h]   ;
 37346 00003B19 A2[1147]                        mov     [bCRTPage],al   ;
 37347 00003B1C A1[0C47]                        mov     ax,[bMenuPage]	; select new page for menu
 37348 00003B1F CD10                            int     10h             ;
 37349 00003B21 B80006                          mov     ax,0600h        ; clear entire screen
 37350 00003B24 8A3E[0B47]                      mov     bh,[bMenuColor] ; using this color
 37351 00003B28 29C9                            sub     cx,cx           ; upper left row/col
 37352                                          ;mov	dl,[es:CRT_Cols] 
 37353 00003B2A 268A164A00                      mov	dl,[es:4Ah]
 37354 00003B2F FECA                    	dec     dl              ;
 37355                                          ;mov	dh,[es:CRT_Rows];
 37356 00003B31 268A368400                      mov	dh,[es:84h]
 37357 00003B36 08F6                    	or      dh,dh           ; # of rows valid?
 37358 00003B38 7504                            jnz	short menu_clear ; hopefully
 37359 00003B3A 8A36[0F47]                      mov     dh,[bLastRow]   ; no, use a default
 37360                                  menu_clear:
 37361 00003B3E CD10                            int     10h             ; clear the screen using the req. attribute
 37362 00003B40 07                              pop     es              ;
 37363 00003B41 8836[0F47]                      mov     [bLastRow],dh   ; save DH
 37364 00003B45 BA[224C]                        mov     dx,_$MenuHeader
 37365 00003B48 E89709                          call    print           ; cursor now on row 3 (numbered from 0)
 37366                                  
 37367 00003B4B F606[1047]01                    test    byte [bDisableUI],1
 37368 00003B50 751F                            jnz     short menu_nostatus
 37369 00003B52 8A3E[0C47]                      mov     bh,[bMenuPage]  ;
 37370 00003B56 8A36[0F47]                      mov     dh,[bLastRow]   ; restore DH
 37371 00003B5A B200                            mov     dl,0            ; print the status line on row DH, col 0,
 37372 00003B5C B402                            mov     ah,02h          ; now that we can trash the cursor position
 37373 00003B5E CD10                            int     10h             ;
 37374 00003B60 BA[6E4C]                        mov     dx,_$StatusLine
 37375 00003B63 E87C09                          call    print           ;
 37376 00003B66 B403                            mov     ah,3            ; get cursor position
 37377 00003B68 CD10                            int     10h             ;
 37378 00003B6A 80EA02                          sub     dl,2            ;
 37379 00003B6D 8816[0E47]                      mov     [bLastCol],dl   ; save column where status char will go
 37380                                  
 37381                                  menu_nostatus:
 37382 00003B71 BB0100                          mov     bx,1            ; now prepare to display all the menu items
 37383                                  menu_disploop:
 37384 00003B74 E8B002                          call    print_item	; print item #BL
 37385 00003B77 43                              inc     bx              ; why "inc bx"? because it's a 1-byte opcode
 37386 00003B78 3A1E[1647]                      cmp     bl,[bMaxBlock]  ; all done?
 37387 00003B7C 76F6                            jbe	short menu_disploop ; not yet
 37388                                  
 37389                                  ;   Set cursor position to just below the menu items
 37390                                  
 37391 00003B7E B200                            mov     dl,0            ; select column
 37392 00003B80 88DE                            mov     dh,bl           ;
 37393 00003B82 80C604                          add     dh,4            ; select row below menu
 37394 00003B85 8A3E[0C47]                      mov     bh,[bMenuPage]  ;
 37395 00003B89 B402                            mov     ah,02h          ; set cursor position beneath the block list
 37396 00003B8B CD10                            int     10h             ;
 37397                                  
 37398 00003B8D BA[5B4C]                        mov     dx,_$MenuPrmpt
 37399 00003B90 E84F09                          call    print           ;
 37400 00003B93 E82903                          call    select_item     ; make a selection, return # in BX
 37401 00003B96 BA[2E4A]                        mov     dx,crlfm	
 37402 00003B99 E84609                          call    print           ;
 37403 00003B9C FF36[1047]                      push    word [bDisableUI]
 37404 00003BA0 800E[1047]01                    or      byte [bDisableUI],1
 37405 00003BA5 E86704                          call    show_status     ; clear the status line now
 37406 00003BA8 8F06[1047]                      pop     word [bDisableUI]
 37407                                  
 37408                                  ;   Now begins the "re-organization" process...
 37409                                  
 37410                                  menu_autoselect:
 37411 00003BAC 83FBFF                          cmp     bx,-1 ; 0FFFFh	; clean boot requested?
 37412 00003BAF 7508                            jne	short normal_boot ; no
 37413 00003BB1 E8F105                          call    disable_autoexec; basically, add a /D to the command.com line
 37414                                  menu_abort:
 37415 00003BB4 29C9                            sub     cx,cx           ; then immediately exit with 0 config.sys image
 37416 00003BB6 E9E400                          jmp	menu_exit	;
 37417                                  
 37418                                  normal_boot:
 37419 00003BB9 83FBFE                          cmp     bx,-2 ; 0FFFEh	; back to top-level menu?
 37420 00003BBC 7509                            jne	short not_topmenu ; no
 37421 00003BBE 8B0E[5603]                      mov     cx,[count]      ; yes, start all over
 37422 00003BC2 29F6                            sub     si,si           ;
 37423 00003BC4 E9FFFD                          jmp     menu_search
 37424                                  
 37425                                  not_topmenu:
 37426 00003BC7 80BF[1B47]4F                    cmp     byte [abBlockType+bx],CONFIG_SUBMENU
 37427 00003BCC 7510                            jne	short not_submenu
 37428 00003BCE 01DB                            add     bx,bx           ;
 37429 00003BD0 8BBF[2547]                      mov     di,[aoffBlockName+bx]
 37430 00003BD4 E8E101                          call    srch_block      ; THIS CANNOT FAIL!
 37431 00003BD7 89FE                            mov     si,di           ;
 37432 00003BD9 89D9                            mov     cx,bx           ; ES:SI and CX are ready for another round
 37433 00003BDB E929FE                          jmp     menu_found
 37434                                  
 37435                                  not_submenu:
 37436 00003BDE 01DB                            add     bx,bx           ; get BX -> name of selected block
 37437 00003BE0 8B9F[2547]                      mov     bx,[aoffBlockName+bx]
 37438                                  
 37439                                  ;   BX should now either be ZERO (meaning no block has been selected) or
 37440                                  ;   the offset relative to ES of the block name to be processed (along with
 37441                                  ;   all the "common" lines of course)
 37442                                  
 37443                                  no_selection:
 37444 00003BE4 891E[1747]                      mov     [offDefBlock],bx; save selection
 37445 00003BE8 8B0E[5603]                      mov     cx,[count]      ; reset ES:SI and CX for reprocessing
 37446 00003BEC 29F6                            sub     si,si           ;
 37447 00003BEE 1E                              push    ds              ;
 37448 00003BEF 8E1E[BE14]                      mov     ds,[config_wrkseg]; this is where we'll store new config.sys image
 37449 00003BF3 29FF                            sub     di,di           ;
 37450                                  
 37451                                  ;   ES:SI-> config.sys, DS:DI -> new config.sys workspace
 37452                                  ;
 37453                                  ;   Work our way through the config.sys image again, this time copying
 37454                                  ;   all lines that are (A) "common" lines outside any block or (B) lines
 37455                                  ;   within the requested block. Lines inside INCLUDEd blocks are transparently
 37456                                  ;   copied by copy_block in a recursive fashion; the amount of recursion is
 37457                                  ;   limited by the fact INCLUDE statements are REMed by copy_block as they are
 37458                                  ;   processed and by the number of unique INCLUDE stmts in config.sys...
 37459                                  ;
 37460                                  ;   BUGBUG 20-Mar-1992 JeffPar: If we can figure out the lower bound of the
 37461                                  ;   stack we're running on, then we should check it inside copy_block
 37462                                  
 37463                                  copyblock_loop:
 37464 00003BF5 53                              push    bx              ; save selected block name
 37465 00003BF6 E82F01                          call    copy_block      ; process (named or common) block
 37466 00003BF9 5B                              pop     bx              ;
 37467 00003BFA 7232                            jc	short move_config ; hit eof
 37468                                  
 37469                                  ;   copy_block can only return for two reasons: it hit eof or a new block
 37470                                  
 37471                                  copyblock_begin:
 37472                                  
 37473                                  ; 10/09/2023
 37474                                  %if 0
 37475                                          push    ax              ;
 37476                                          push    cx              ;
 37477                                          push    si              ;
 37478                                          push    di              ; always do "common" blocks
 37479                                          mov     di,szCommon
 37480                                          push    ds              ;
 37481                                          push    cs              ;
 37482                                          pop     ds              ;
 37483                                          call    comp_names      ;
 37484                                          pop     ds              ;
 37485                                          pop     di              ;
 37486                                          pop     si              ;
 37487                                          pop     cx              ;
 37488                                          pop     ax              ;
 37489                                          je	short copyblock_check
 37490                                  %endif
 37491                                  	; 10/09/2023
 37492 00003BFC 57                      	push	di
 37493 00003BFD BF[5A47]                	mov	di,szCommon	; always do "common" blocks
 37494 00003C00 E81602                  	call	comp_names_x	; (comp_names_safe)
 37495 00003C03 5F                      	pop	di
 37496 00003C04 740F                    	je	short copyblock_check
 37497                                  
 37498 00003C06 09DB                            or      bx,bx           ; is there a block name to check?
 37499 00003C08 7414                            jz	short copyblock_skip ; no
 37500 00003C0A 57                              push    di              ;
 37501 00003C0B 89DF                            mov     di,bx           ; check block against given block name
 37502 00003C0D 1E                              push    ds              ;
 37503 00003C0E 06                              push    es              ;
